title: Worth Every Penny If You Fly Responsibly
text:
First off, this product arrived on time and undamaged.

Overall Impression:
This Quadcopter is a great little R/C "toy" for it's price.

History (What I Use It For):
I bought this product for my father (a retired pilot) who has Parkinson's Disease and Heart complications (replaced aortic valve, etc), so you can imagine he is not the most mobile or coordinated anymore. However, that being stated, he has no problem flying this in our fields. My reasoning for buying him this product is that he use to be heavily into R/C flying and had a workshop specifically built for building planes (both R/C and real planes). Before his health started to fade, he flew his R/C planes daily (weather permitting of course) and frequently built models for local clubs and aviation museums. However, after his first surgery, he no longer was able to accurately fly and he sold all of his planes (which you could tell broke his heart). Recently, I found this product and thought, what the heck, it seems stable…and indeed it is if there is no wind and the trim is adjusted properly. He was originally opposed to trying it, since he feared crashing it via his health symptoms, but after I finally made him take the controls, he fell in love with it. You could see the spark reignite his R/C aviation flame. As such, for the price, it is a wonderful and stable product. To top it off, I pressed the down button for him to record his flight and he was very impressed to see the farm from such a vantage point later on the computer. He always wanted to do that with his R/C planes, but never got around to it.

Pros:
1) This Quad is very stable in calm winds (no wind is best) and with proper trims set, which is easy to do (check your manual).
2) Very light weight and the blades have a protective guard to reduce injury potentials.
3) Flies accurately with good control handling.
4) LED lights aid in dawn and dusk flights in terms of directionality (not so much during the daylight though).
5) Comes with propeller blade replacements in case of damage (4 total).
6) The camera is actually quite good in daylight conditions, not excellent, but still impressive. Not worth attempting though in darker conditions.
7) Decent Battery Life. The Quadcopter's internal battery, which you charge via USB connections (unless you buy a different adapter which we didn't), lasts about 7-14 minutes pending the amount of torture you put it through (attitudes, speed variations, maneuvers, camera utilization, winds you are fighting, etc).
8) Accessories are easy to come buy. I also bought, separately of course, four extra batteries, an extra 4 USB battery charger (buy one, you won't regret it), spare parts, and a carrying case with foam inserts specifically fit for it. Since I wanted a tighter fit for the chargers, batteries, and spare parts, I simply heated a screwdriver tip with a lighter and then melted smooth segments in the foam case to fit each piece perfectly (be care if you decide to do this and do it in a well ventilated area). Now my father has everything he needs in one light weight case... which is ideal.
9) The batteries recharge quickly, about 60 minutes total with both chargers in use (the single one it came with and the extra one I bought with four charger docks). If you choose to buy a separate 4 battery charger like we did, you can spend your day flying the Quad longer with all 5 batteries (the one it comes with and the four separate dock one we bought extra), and then have them all recharge again in about an hour to go out flying again. It averages out to be about 35-70 minutes of flight time (usage dependent according to each battery's specs.) to only one hour of charge time. We personally average about 60 minutes each time we went out (with all five batteries) with a one hour charge duration. I assume if you so desired, you could bring a computer along and charge during flights too, but I wouldn't recommend it since the little motors should have some time to cool down between flights (to extend their life and not burn them out).

Cons:
1) It is difficult identifying directionality when it gets further away or higher in elevation. As you can imagine, since it is completely symmetrical, any directional cues vanish as it travels any distance. It does have LED lights to show directionality, which is great at dusk and/or dawn flights, but the lights are not clearly visible in daylight. It takes some practice to learn and might have been better if the product had been painted in two separate bright colors to easily address such a concern. However, for the price, that is truly not a flaw of the product, just personal preference.
2) The Quad can be touchy in terms of synchronizing with the controller. Basically, make sure the Quad is level when starting of, otherwise, it tends to just blink like crazy (from the LEDs) and does nothing. This is once again not a true product issue, but a personal method we had to learn. Also, if the Quad starts drifting abnormally in flight where the trim isn't helping (and wind is not the issue), just land it, turn both it and the controller off, then turn them back on and re-sync it again. It took us a bit of time to figure that out, but it is not so difficult with practice. This is a product issue that more expensive Quads usually don't have, but for the price, it really isn't an issue.

Special Safety Notes:
1) PLEASE fly responsibly. Even though this Quad is an inexpensive "toy," its blades can cut you our injury spectators.
2) Keep all spectators at a safe distance.
3) Only fly this in an open area. Since this product is so light, the higher you go, the more the wind picks up and carries it away. Therefore, make sure you have enough space to account for that incase it is not powerful enough to deal with it. For example, we have a few large fields with neighboring tree lines. During one particular flight, when the Quad flew above the tree line height, the winds increased drastically. So much that in 5 seconds the quad drifted 500 yards in the opposite direct we were flying it with the controls peaked. This is important to consider since we had very little wind in the field region itself. It was only when we reach higher altitudes when the winds picked up (in that particular case). Therefore, if we had not had enough land to safety bring it down, it might have crashed. If you were not flying in a safe region and the same thing happened, you too might have crashed and/or injured someone if the reception was ever lost (via distance).
4) Anyone new to flying should not fly this indoors nor at any extreme heights until you learn how to fly it fluently. Once again, directionality becomes and issue since it is painted one white tone and since it is so symmetrical. As such, unless the lighting is dim enough to see the LEDs, it might prove difficult for a newbie to know what direction they are flying before it becomes too late.
5) Before Flying The Quad to maximum heights and in ruff conditions, you should always break-in any R/C motors. I do not know if they already do this in the factory prior to delivery for this model, but a safe bet is to spend one battery spinning the propellers at slower speeds to break-in the motors. It is too simple of a process not to do if it means not burning out your motors on their initial flight.
6) Have Fun, just be smart doing it.

Conclusion:
This product is worth every penny and was able to re-spark an elderly man's old passion for R/C aviation. I fully recommend this product to any R/C hobbits, both veterans to the hobby and/or newbies, who have the common sense to fly this safely and responsibly. It is truly a blast to fly.

I've included 3 photos to present the camera's quality: One of a deer in a field during the onset of dusk, and 2 just above the same field's tree line during the day.

I hope this review helps.

title: Not happy at all
text: Purchased as a gift, opened July 11.  This morning one of the motors burned out.  Not happy at all.  Just messaged the seller regarding the warranty information for this gadget.  Waiting to hear so we can decide how to move forward.  It was a very cheap one, purposely bought as a beginners, but I expected it to last longer than this, we were very careful with it.  The smallest gust of wind blew it off course and crashed it.  I suggest something that weighs more to anyone out there considering.  The camera had excellent quality photos.  I will up my review when I hear back from them.

title: One of the best value in Quadcoper
text: One of the best value in Quadcoper. I highly recommend removing the camera to improve agility and makes it more fun to fly.  I do wish the motors would last a bit longer. After a week of daily flying, one of the motor died. Fortunately replacement parts are readily available from Amazon. You will need a soldering iron to remove and install new motor and about 1-2 hours of work.

title: Best Father's Day gift EVER!
text: I've been wanting a drone / quadcopter for months and I finally received this as a Father's Day gift. For approx $40 you can't beat it. It's asy to set up by just screwing on the blade guards. It comes with one battery and a single charger. Charge time is just over an hour and I've got up to 10 mins flight time out of it. I would recommend also buying the extra batteries, especially as they come with a 4 port charger. I'm still figuring out how to fly this thing but it's a lot of fun. The camera and video functions are ok. Good enough qaulity to show friends and family, but you're not gonna win any awards. Worth noting, as it's so light, it doesn't really work well in windy conditions. Mine took off in a shot so had to kill the power.

title: it's good and cute looking drone

title: The Best Impulse Purchase I've Made!
text:
I bought this product when it was on the Amazon Treasure Truck. I will admit it was a mostly impulse purchase, although I had been considering getting one for some time. Absolutely no regrets for buying!! love this quadcopter! It it highly durable and I have found that the battery life is better than advertised in the manual (granted I have not used the camera while flying yet). It takes some practice to get moving and I would advise using outside until you have mastered it a bit. I have crashed it many times and has virtually no damage (my last one broke after 48 hours...) and I've already had this a few months.

Great for teens and older!

I brought it to the beach not thinking it would be a problem (lots of open space to learn) but on my first (not so smooth) crashlanding sand got into the perpella gears and bound it up. So my advice, don't use it on the beach. Quality of images are very good too.

It takes decent video but just as a toy and sometimes my computer cannot read the video files.  Unfortunately, our dog loves it too and attacks it when in range.  It was safer stuck in the tree.

title: Designed to fly
text:
Engineered/designed to fly, not like other over weight brands that are designed to withstand crashes and need 7.4V batteries/motors just to get them airborne. Of six quad-copters I have this is my 2nd favorite after the Syma X11.
The only negative for me is the camera switch which is right next to the power switch and my fat thumb (1"/25mm wide) will contact both switches at the same time. down is "video" on one switch & power "off" on the other.

title: This is really a lot of fun. It is very well made and flies great
text: This is really a lot of fun. It is very well made and flies great. It is very light and the plastic is flexible which makes it very durable. It is great for learning to fly a drone. I've crashed it into many things while learning and it just keeps going. The camera isn't very good but it is useable. Replacement parts are readily available. Extra propellers and batteries are a good idea.

title: The most fun for $40!
text:
I'm 72 years old. I bought this because I thought it would be fun, and was pretty inexpensive. When I first got it, I had problems flying it. I'm a little impatient, so I crashed a lot. But it didn't break. Then when my 11-year old grandson visited me, I let him fly it, and he did great. And watching him do it gave me more confidence. So I gave it to him (he was thrilled!) and bought another one for me. I did much better after watching him and watching several videos on YouTube. Then I want to visit my other younger grandchildren, and while they couldn't fly it, they had fun watching it. So I gave it to my son (their father). He loved it. So I bought another one, and did even better. So I have gotten it down pretty well, but flew it at night and it ran into a tree, so I have to replace one of the engines. I bought the repair kit, so I'm going to fix it this weekend. Also the kit had a couple of extra batteries. They don't last more than 6 minutes, so I make sure that all three of mine are charged before going out for a flight.

The only thing you have to watch out for is over-compensating with the controls. And, again, the online videos really helped. Just make sure you learn on a big grassy field, because it takes a lot to destroy it..

title: I can't say that I love this thing
text:
I can't say that I love this thing, but for the price? you can crash this thing over and over and over and it keeps going! I must say I was in the drone market for awhile. I was afraid to spend 600-1K for one. so I was trying out these cheap ones. its VERY hard to fly despite what people may say. its not stable at all and maybe if you are a very skilled drone pilot you can fly this easy?

Personally, I used it to basically learn the ins and outs before I bought my DJI spark. its def worth the money. it gets great range despite some reviews. You can watch some youtube stuff, which is what I did and it will make your life easier.

title: Surpisingly fun for such a cheap item.  A good test of coordination.
text:
I gave it five stars because it's a cheap quadcopter with a camera. It's fun to operate, and not too hard once you get the hang of it. The camera is not super-high quality and takes grainy video (AVI- huge files) in low light. But it came with a 4GB SD card. I was surprised at that. Also included are 4 spare rotor blades and 4 bumpers, a charging cable, and a small Phillips screwdriver to remove the battery cover on the remote. Not included are the 4 AA batteries needed for the remote.

I learned to hover (indoors) just before the battery went low. It takes a fine touch, and Newton's first law of motion, and second are demonstrated quite readily. What I learned is that when this thing is moving forward, backward or sideways, it continues, even with the direction control in the center, until you null it out with some (very very brief) opposite input. So if you start it moving forward (in the direction of the red lights on it), it will continue until you put in some backward tilt, just for 100mSec or so to provide an opposing force. Trying to move the controls smoothly doesn't do it, except to begin a maneuver. Then a sudden input in the opposite direction is needed to stop.

Still photos are even worse than the video in low light. Probably fine in the daylight... We'll soon see.

The manual takes some interpretation. It was evidently translated from Chinese.

title: Great size, seems like very solid and easy to ...
text: Great size, seems like very solid and easy to fly drone. The only problem I have  that it keeps drifting to one side. Processed re calibration few times,  but to no use.

title: Good beginning drone for kids

title: Three Stars

title: The Ultimate Drone! I Can Not Recommend Highly Enough!!
text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend in hopes that it would be better than the several other drones that I have bought him the past several Christmases. As it turns out it is totally much better in all aspect than any other drone I have given him and i have given him about 6 over the years. The protective guards around the propellers help them to last longer so it is not as frustrating when you have to go through so many propellers in a short amount of time when it takes weeks for the replacements to arrive from overseas. The HD camera works like a charm and shoots very clear video, it is not bouncy, not grainy or cloudy. Two weeks after Christmas we were up the road at a small park above our home in Atlanta, GA and he was flying is really high, it goes really high up and you can get awesome video from above the treeline. Well, the wind blew and caught it and blew it into a tree about 60 feet up from the ground. There was nothing we could do except stand there and stare at it willing it to come down like two stupid dogs. Of course people as the obligatory stupid question, "did you get it stuck in the tree"? No dummy, we landed it there to load passengers!. So, we left and were a bit sad because we just knew that if it came down someone would immediately pounce on it and say "oh, look a drone, a free drone". From tine to time we would go by and see if it was still in the tree and it still was. We stopped going after a week or so because some really heavy rains, wind and cold moved in and we figured that it if it fell it would not be there in the first place and if it was it would not work after 6 inches of rain. Well, one evening about 4 weeks after he got it stuck in the tree we just decided to go check to see if it was still in the tree. It was dusk and we could tell that it was no longer in the tree. We looked around on the ground and then at one another, made sad faces and said, "well, it's gone" and turned to walk back to our truck. I decided to look a little further around the concrete wall that surrounds the walkway and I saw something strange sitting on the top of the concrete wall. I looked hard, walked forward real quick and shouted to my partner"here it is!, it's here". You would think I had found a mountain of gold!! He came over and said "wow, i can't believe that it's still here"! It was wet and a little muddy, i shook it off and we took it home. we were certain that it would not work after being in all the rain. my partner put it in the sun to dry out, charged the battery and when it was charged, it flew like it did when it was flown the first time! i was totally amazed! This to me proved this is the ultimate drone and that if you like drones you should most definitely have one of these in your collection. I could not recommend highly enough!

title: Spent 6 months stuck in a tree and still works
text: This drone is cheap to buy, easy to fly, and quite survivable. I lost my drone in some trees in June, luckily I put my phone number on it and when someone found it in November they called me and I got it back. After spending almost 6 months exposed in the elements, all I had to do was put a fresh battery in and it still worked. My mind was blown. I would definitely recommend this drone for beginners or anyone looking for a low cost setup. Just be careful when outdoors, the wind can take this drone pretty easily.

title: Very good drone for the price
text: Very good drone for the price.  I'd highly recommend getting the extra battries.  Like most drones, having 1 battery will only last you a short time.

title: Five Stars
text: so cool

title: Cheap knock off
text: I looked at the reviews before ordering and there was no "disclaimer" until AFTER I ordered this for an Xmas present. Could not believe this thing when I unboxed it. It doesn't match the description but more than that it's made of really cheap parts, especially the controller. It's like a really bad kid's toy you buy off the street. It doesn't fly. Heck, It doesn't even charge! Doesn't respond to batteries. The controller is made of the cheapest plastic. Really unfortunate Christmas purchase.

title: Great deal for durable, camera included drone that does trick an 8-yr-old can manage
text:
Bought two, for a 8 yr old and 10 yr old. They have been mainly playing with them on hard icy snow or wet mush snow, and they bring them in we wipe them a little and allow to dry. Limited experience with other drones did not stop them from mastering these relatively quickly. They do play video games a couple hours a week, so familiar with controllers, and have had other remote control cars etc over years.
These are fantastic, and we recently started using the camera and video camera more (they got used to basic controls first). It flys very well and can recover well. We bought the extra pieces set for about US$5 extra to have extra bumpers (what we call the 4 protecting frames off each wing), and have gone through probably 10-12 in total for both drones. Many falls from the sky in the first few weeks, and one very hard fall from high up, hit the garage, gutter, and then hit the cement driveway and only still 2.5 bumpers were damaged and no drone damage at all.
Very hardy - 10/10 would buy again for my kids or me, especially at Christmas the price was a little lower, but for around $US50 these are A GREAT DEAL!

title: Great fun.
text: Great fun .... great entry level drone.  Practically indestructible.  Handles the wind well.  I've now bought The X5C for myself, my brother-in-law & my son-in-law.  Buy extra batteries.

title: Loved It.
text: This is awesome. no complaints. i helped set it up initially but after fixing the trim, it is easy to pilot (we're novices). my 8 and 12 year old have to be supervised so we don't run into the street - but then so do I. My kids said this is the best Christmas gift EVER. I'd get some extra batteries because you don't want to stop playing with it. It flies HIGH!

title: Awesome little quad
text: Awesome little quad.  Even beginner flyers can make this work with a little practice.  Since it's a bit larger than all the micro/mini ones, it's actually a lot easier to control and learn on.  There are also lost of very inexpensive replacement parts when you crash.  You can also get inexpensive batteries as well.  Recommend however getting a good charger.

title: EXCELLENT drone - very tough and reliable - still amazed ...
text: EXCELLENT drone - very tough and reliable - still amazed at how light and strong this is - very precise and flies well! you can take the camera off with a couple of screws to reduce the weight. the camera is so - so and records to a card, but for the money this is an excellent buy! very nice drone.

title: BEST DRONE EVER
text: I bought this drone for my brother for Christmas.  It responds very well to the remote.  It is easy to manoeuvre, to fly, and to get around obstacles.  It flies great outside!! It's so much fun to hit the recording button.  My brother has a gopro, and puts together a lot of HD videos for different groups that he is a part of, so we didn't expect this camera to be very good.  However, to our surprise, the camera was way better than we expected. We flew the drone at a high altitude around our neighbourhood, plugged it in the laptop and the recording was awesome! We saw the our house, our yard, it was really cool.  The battery life is great, it flies high, it flies outside, and inside.  It's easy to use! YOU SHOULD BUY IT!!! My friends all bought drones for Christmas.. my brother's is better... and i'm not just saying that.. It was very evident that the quality of this was higher.

title: One Star

text: First time I flew this thing it kept going higher and higher then eventually I lost control of it. It fell on top of some building and I can no longer get it. Would not buy again.

title: This was recommended as a good 'trainer' before buying an expensive quad-copter
text: This was recommended as a good 'trainer' before buying an expensive quad-copter. I have to agree. It is very light weight and so far in my flying it(in other words, crashing it a lot) nothing has broken. It comes with a spare set of propellers and I bought an extra set and so far have not had a need for any of them. I haven't tried the camera function yet as I am still learning control of the copter itself. It is kind of tricky to fly and should be good training to a step up to a more sophisticated model. For now, it is just fun!

title: New chew toy maybe?
text: Do not buy this quadcopter. Save your money and bug one that is at least $150. This thing worked at first, then the motors just stopped working. Barely flew the thing. Its really not worth buying. The design is cheesy, the rotors are exposed, and if you lose the thing, good luck getting it back because you can't view the video while you're flying it. The only way to view vid is to take the sd card out and plug it into your computer. Save your pennies and but a quadcopter that has hd video and isn't pixelated like this sad attempt to make a quadcopter. Things worst than something you buy from Wal-Mart and that's saying a lot.

title: Great product
text: Great product and nice price.

title: Four Stars
text: My son was thrilled with this. Each charge only yields about 7 minutes of run time though.

title: Cheap, but fun while it lasted.
text: This is a cheap, fun quadcopter, but one of the motors quit working within a few days of normal use, so I had to send it back. The quality of the built in camera reminded me of cheap cameras from the early 2000's, but it was enough to impress my 9 year old. What impressed me what the stability of this quad for how cheap the price tag is. As a long time RC guy, I had a lot of fun flying this quadcopter until one of the motors decided to quit after a few flights. It's best suited for indoor flying.

title: More fun than you should be allowed to have!
text: My Boyfriend bought me one for my birthday and I loved it. We had previously been into flying romote controlled airplanes, but this is soo much better. This "drone" is easy to fly, takes pretty good pictures and is just a lot of fun. YOu can buy replacement parts for a cheap price and run this thing forever. It's pretty durabe ( I have wrekced many planes but this little guy has come through with flying colors). I  oved mine so much that my boyfeind and I bought one for all his brothers and his dad for Christmas. They love flying them They are small enough to fly in the house and large enough that they are easy to manuver outside.  And for the price you can't beat this quadcopter!!  I recommend it highly! If you are the tpe of person who likes to mod everything out, then this is your copter also. It is pretty easy andiinexpensive to more powerful motors, paint the body, etc.

title: Easy to fly unless it's breezy out

Easy to fly unless it's breezy out.. then it takes some practice..
Decent pictures for a low resolution camera with video capabilities..
Do need extra batteries , with a fully charged battery you can expect 10-15 minuets of flight time..
Good starter drone..

title: Great product!  The kids and I are hooked.

title: Great quad for the price. A must have for your collection
text: I purchased another one vs spare parts for my existing X5C.  I received the latest version promptly via 2nd day air and with no problems. After opening and inspecting everything I ran 4 charged batteries with it, but at low hovering speed. That was to properly break in the new brushed motors. This unit came with a version 6 receiver inside it, and I notice the plastic body has been updated as well. Everything including the camera, microSD, USB adapter and Transmitter worked fine. Overall this is a great quad that performs well and is tons of fun to fly for the price. I highly recommend getting one of these, and also a Hubsan X4. You can't go wrong (ALWAYS REMEMBER TO PROPERLY BREAK IN NEW MOTORS)

title: Good luck
text: I bought this quadcopter because I wanted a drone but I wanted to stay on budget. It flies great if you can keep track of it..... I took it for my first flight yesterday and that was it's only flight....... do NOT take it high into the air..... you WILL lose it! I found out the hard way.... no sooner had I put it in the air.... a gentle breeze came and took it away. I lost radio signal and couldn't do anything about it... I have no idea where it is. I searched for it. BELIEVE ME I DID.. I did 4 very detailed sweeps in the vicinity. My clothes are ruined from the cuts scrapes and nettle burns from the surrounding woods.... also have a ton of burs stuck to my clothes and they number in the hundreds. On top of that I have no drone to show for it. The only reason I'm giving this four stars is because I called amazon and told them what happened and they were kind enough to send me a replacement free of charge. I am grateful for such a great company. Also the drone was very fun to fly while I had it. I recommend this drone to any beginner but please remember to fly it in a huge open space with NO TREES. Thanks

title: great with extra batteries
text:
To follow is a review written by my son:
I am 12 years old and my dad purchased 2 drones and extra batteries for me and my siblings for Christmas. We love them and it’s hard not to go outside in the freezing weather and play with these drones!

This drone is absolutely great! You can replace almost every piece of it; even if you break the motherboard you can replace it. It flies very smoothly and is really easy to get the hang of flying. There are lots of controls to mess with like flips and trimming. this is a way to perfect your drone if it is tilting/flying. in a direction even when you're not pressing the controls. There is a high and low speed for flying i would recommend not using the fast speed if you are just starting to fly because it’s very hard to control. Another great feature of this drone is that when the battery goes dead it doesn't just fall from the sky; it slowly decelerates to the ground, then lands.

There are things of which you should be aware. If it is your first time flying you should stay away from trees and houses. If you get it on top of something high there is a good chance it's going to stay up there. We have gotten one stuck in a very tall tree and it has gone through tough winds and thunderstorms and it still is stuck on a branch.

Pros
-lots of replacement parts if something gets damaged
-the ability to get extra batteries is awesome
-very durable
-really good for the price
Cons
-batteries take a long time to charge
-LED covers come off easily
-guards snap easily

I would definitely recommend this drone. The number of replacement parts and the ability to get extra batteries makes it a great drone! Although without the extra batteries it would be less enjoyable because the batteries; last for a while, but take an extremely long time to charge. It doesn't take to long to change batteries it has instructions to guide you through step by step. Its quality is amazing! It still does have some problems, but they are common problems for drones like wind and other circumstances in which you can't fly it. Overall it's an awesome drone and if you want a good drone for a good price this is the one to get!

title: Be prepared
text: Overall this is a good starter drone . It is very difficult to fly if you are a first timer. The battery hardly holds charge , so make sure you have backups because if it dies in air it falls whenever it is. Ours was hit by a car about 20mph and miraculously survived. The camera is a cool add on to it, but the quality isn't very clear so expect that . Recommend getting replacement propellors for it because they can get bent if you crash alot, also multiple battery packs if you are going to take it out somewhere because it will die. Be careful where you get the battery packs , some don't fit right in our case and we had to force them in. Also , one of the little light covers came off from crashing as well and cannot locate replacement light covers online.

title: Disappointed, The drone itself is fine
text:
Disappointed, The drone itself is fine, however it doesn't tell you that the flying time is only 7 minutes. I gave this to my 14 year old grandson who really liked it until we took it outside. Seven minutes, and then it had to recharged which took more than an hour. It has sat in his room since then, never used again.
After some research I found that I should have bought the battery pack for another $!9.00, which I would have done at the time had I known about it.

title: Good for beginners.
text:
I'm a first time drone owner, unless you count the helicopter I had 5 years ago. This is much easier to fly than the helicopter. After a week it got taken away by the wind and hung up in a tree. Trim off the little 3mm side hooks on the prop guards, that's the main reason it got hung up. We ended up taping together 5 stiff wooden poles 50ft long and got it down. Whew!

I think I'll stick to wide open parks without wind from now on.

To take a still picture, push one of the buttons up. To turn on video, push the same button down. To stop taking video, push the same button down again. Comes with SD card. Video resolution cannot be changed.

title: "Come Fly with me"
text:
This was my first venture into the fun filled world of "Quads" and what a fun filled adventure it is. I started growing up 75 years ago and not finished yet. This is so easy to fly, hover and dip de do I can't believe it. I purchased another more expensive one but always go to this one if there's a little breeze. I just sit back in my lawn chair with this on my knee and off we go. Usually fly with someone else and the laughs begin. Oh yea, I've crashed a few times resulting in no damage and off again. Five batteries keeps me in the air for a good long time.

If your new to this fast growing entertainment go for this one. If I can fly this, anyone can. A word of warning. Watch for wind gusts. This bird is light and could get caught up in a tree.

It's pretty much open the box, insert battery and off you go. I enjoy my time in the air and I'm sure you will.

Amazon delivers again. Thanks for the quick shipping, damage proof packing and bringing on the fun.

title: Great little starter drone to learn how to fly
text:
Great starter drone! The only bummer is the camera is not a live camera, but this drone taught me a lot about piloting. I knew I wanted to learn on a cheaper on. I would be seriously sad face if I bought an awesome (and expensive) one but did something stupid to crash it and break it.

I bought extra propellers and keenstone 6Pcs 720mAh 20C battery with 6-Port Quick Charger for Syma. I think the batteries and charger were a good investment, but because I installed the included propeller guards, I have yet to even break 1 propeller. The package already comes with 4 replacement ones so I don't think you really need to buy any out the gate if you don't want to. The camera can take pictures, record sound and video.

Regarding the camera, let's just make it completely clear - the video quality is seriously lacking. Lack of stabilization will make any longer video clips unwatchable without editing to clear up the camera shake. The image quality will absolutely not be the same as go pro or similar cameras.

Considering I got this drone for less than three average eat out lunches, I think it's a good deal for learning. Consider this a gateway drone. If you get hooked, this one will make you buy more :)

I attached a still image from the camera. It was taken in a park a little before the sun started to go down and the light was still good. I took several other photos at other times. They are all similar quality, so if you want something high res, look at the Parrot Bebop 2 or something a lot higher end.

title: If you’re thinking about getting into drones, this is a great introductory product
text:
Wow, a really good drone for the price. I got this for my nephew’s 8th birthday so he could get into flying drones, and it is perfect for that age group...or even beginners. It’s easy to fly and our first time out flying, my nephew was already doing barrel rolls and other tricks.

The camera on the drone actually does decent video for being so affordable. We watched some footage after our first run, and we’re surprised to see how smooth it was.

The controller is very budget though...there are no indicators to tell you what mode you are on for filming (photo, video) and you never know if the camera is actually on or not, you just have to remember whether you pushed the button or not. It was also sometimes difficult to know which way the drone was facing, but that just took more practice. The battery also goes quick, so I would purchase some spares to extend your flying time.

***Pros:
- great for beginners
- affordable
- easy to start flying
- includes a decent camera for video footage on a budget model

***Cons:
- the controller is very basic
- batteries drain quick

text: My first quadcopter. Took a couple of days to get used to the controls but now i'm pretty good with it. I use for fun flying and not really interested in videos. I suggest changing controller to mode 2 putting forward/backward and yaw control both on the right joystick. Copter without cam only weighs 3 oz so is well under the limit required for registration.

title: Two thumbs up, buy one!
text: What a great value! I've been very pleased with the X5C and highly recommend one. It's easy to fly right out of the box and performance is pretty good. You definitely need calm winds to fly this outdoors. Anything over 5mph and you'll have a hard time controlling the direction if you put any height under it. I fly it about 50ft high and could not keep 4-5mph wind from taking it away. It's built pretty tough. I've run it into walls, ceilings, light fixtures, ceiling fans, nothing broken yet. (thank you blade guards). Crashing on grass fields has been forgiving as well. The camera is ok and I don't expect any better in this price range. It's a great starter drone to learn the ins n outs and get flying practice and familiarity with quad-copter controls. I've already ordered a spare battery since it's fun to fly and waiting around for the battery to charge again is no fun. I would guess about 7-8 minutes with the included battery. It comes with a 500mah capacity battery and spares can be bought with 600-700mah range. Two thumbs up, buy one :o)

title: Lets start off by saying that this is a great first quad to learn on
text: Lets start off by saying that this is a great first quad to learn on. I have been flying this indoors and out for the last few months just overall learning what the quad characteristics are. It is totally fun and really anybody can learn to fly it. Several things people should know this is not a toy quad but a nice beginner practice quad and also it is totally modifiable. I have replaced the rotors for different color ones for easier operation at high altitude. bought here on amazon. Also replaced the motors for the ones with brass gears. Extended the antenna on the quad and replaced the antenna from a used 2.4ghz router I had lying around. ALSO all of these upgrades have already been done by other people who posted videos explaining in detail how to do all of the mods. Now i just cant wait for the snow to pass so i can do ultimate altitude test, hoping to get above the mountain range at my friends farm. Last time was very close probably around 600 feet. So all in all if you want to have fun at a decent price BUY BUY BUY this thing.  Last thing buy the bundle of batteries for this thing, like twenty bucks here on amazon and it will totally beat the 6 minutes of flight on factory bat.

title: Out of the box fun!
text:
Ok, after some minor assembly! ;) I could hardly stand the wait for the battery to charge. I ordered a six-pack of additional batteries, but they arrived just today (several days later than the quad), and are on the charger now. I wasn't about to fly this the first time outside; I played with the controls in the house. Just up and down, up and down ... then tilting and turning. My carpet and furniture is a little easier on hard landings. :) After I felt at least a little comfortable with the controls, I took it outside just to see it go straight up from me as high as I dared, which was about 50 feet over the house. I was able to slowly learn how to hover it directly in front of me at a specific height, and then rotate the quad in its space 360°. 7 minutes of charge doesn't last long on the battery, and my time was quickly up.
The new batteries are all charging, so I will be learning to fly more again today. Thanks for the tip I saw on a prior comment about putting your phone number on it. I have a Dymo label maker I will use for that! (and my address!)
The dropped star rating is due to the poor instructions (non-English-speaking person who wrote it for sure!). There is an 8GB storage card that was included, already inside the camera! Bonus! There is also an orange memory card adapter, perhaps, with a USB port on one end, and perhaps the other end is to insert the memory card to view it? However, there are no directions, and there is no mention of it in the included "manual". Also the slot for the supposed memory card is too big/wide for this small micro card.
As a very novice flyer of this quad, I am taking my time to LEARN before I just willy-nilly go outside and fly it off into the trees or onto the roof of the house, or someone else's! My first 7 minutes was FUN!
Lastly, as I came here to write this review today, 6 days after buying mine here on Amazon, the price has gone from 37.99 to 45.99 in six days! :O

title: Awesome Drone/Quadcopter For The Money
text:
[[VIDEOID:921d398e8cade6c833d889f341196dff]] I am not really sure what some of the reviewers here expect from a $60 quadcopter, but this thing is really one of the best deals out there. Remember, you are buying a $60 TOY, not a professional/commercial grade drone that delivers super clear, super stable HD video designed for your 50" TV. That being said, I feel that it delivers more than $60 worth of features.

This is my first "drone", so that is my point of view. I did own one of those small helicopters though. The quadcopter handles 10 times better than that though.

Most notably, the little copters seem to be nearly unflyable if there is even the slightest breeze. The X5C, on the other hand, seems to fly relatively well, even if there is a small breeze. Obviously you need to compensate for the wind, but it still can be used. You definitely should be careful though if you fly it high and there is some wind. It can get caught in a gust and start getting away from you. Furthermore, when it is that high up, you can lose track of its orientation and this can make it difficult to correct its course. Someone mentioned putting your phone number on it in case it does get away from you. I will be doing that before my next flight...just in case.

One of the CONS of the X5C is the lack of a RETURN or HOME button that brings the copter back if it starts getting away. That being said, only a couple times has mine gotten further away than I was comfortable with. Both times I immediately cut power and just let it fall to the ground. Once it landed safely in a neighbors yard. Once in a tree. I had to get the football out and knock it free. The copter is light enough that even when it free falls, it doesn't pick up a ton of speed. This allows for safer "crash" landings.

That brings me to the next point. While the blade protectors do a good job protecting the blades and absorbing some of the impact from crashing, they will also get caught in branches a lot easier. And please note that you (or your kid or dad or your buddy) WILL get this caught in a tree at least once, if you are flying anywhere near them. So bear that in mind when selecting a flight area. Until you become really adept at controlling the X5C, I would recommend an open field of some sort. I would also keep it within 20 feet of the ground until you get the hang of it. If you are near trees, make sure you have a football or similar object you can use to dislodge the copter if it becomes stuck in a tree. Alternately, a trained monkey can be used to retrieve your copter from a tree (if you have access to one).

I am actually quite impressed by the durability of this little thing. It has been crashed by myself and other operators dozens and dozens of times. The only damage has been one of the blade protectors has cracked. I am ordering spares now, before it completely breaks off. I highly recommend spending the $7 to order the spare part set on line. You will likely need them somewhere along the line. $7 is cheap insurance and allows you the piece of mind that you already have the spare parts if something does break, and you don't have to end your fun on that day.

I would also suggest spare batteries and a charger. 7 minutes of flight goes pretty quick, and the recharge is NOT quick. I bought a 6 pack of batteries and a 6-way charger. This gives me and any companions an hour of flight time, perhaps more if the first battery has recharged by the time the last goes dead.

Another reviewer mentioned marking the "front" of the quad so you can identify it from the ground. This is an excellent idea. I spray painted the front two blade protectors red. It definitely helps me to know which way the quad is oriented. And that is key to successfully flying the X5C.

I do like the two different optional controller modes. I prefer to have "rotate" on the same stick as my "forward/reverse", rather than having "strafe right/left" on the "forward/reverse" stick. This controller has the option for either setup. Perhaps if I was videoing a moving object it may be more usable in the opposite mode? Furthermore, the controller also has two different speed modes. The standard mode is definitely responsive and quick, but there is also an expert mode for even more responsiveness and speed. I haven't really found the need for the expert mode yet.

As for the camera, this is a $60 drone. How much of that do you think goes into the camera? For $60 you shouldn't set your expectations too high. You will get relatively clear video and photos, just don't expect it to look like something you would see on TV. TV shows spend A LOT more on their drones. With this quad, you will get a nice look at your neighborhood and all of your neighbors backyards. You will get a nice video of yourself flying the quad or videos of people you are flying the X5C into. Please be aware though that the camera is fixed and it points pretty much to the front. It does have some downward projection, but it is more forwards than down. When videoing anything you will pick up the sound of the quad buzzing more than anything. The sound is all but useless. The video will likely be a little shaky as when you rock the X5C when controlling it, you will also be rocking the camera. When you fly forwards you will get more of a downward shot, but when you "brake" or fly backwards you will get the sky. When you flip (using the flip button on the controller), you will not be able to make out much of anything. It is nice that you can snap pics and turn the video ON/Off from your controller.

All in all, this is an awesome $60 drone! It is a great investment for hours of fun.

I am really curious as to what would make the UDI 818A selling for double the price worth the extra dough. From what I can tell, the only missing feature (other than the HOME button) would be the HEADLESS MODE / Intelligent Orientation Control (IOC) System which allows for simpler navigation (orientation of copter doesn't matter). I am not sure that feature is worth another $60. With a little practice, this thing is easy enough to fly without that feature. Furthermore, from the reviews I read, there seems to be more complaints about the UDI 818A being affected by wind than the X5C.

If you are thinking about a quadcopter in the $50-$150 range, I highly recommend this one!

Note: The X5C is light enough that it does not require registration with the FAA.

I attached a video I took with it shortly after learning to fly it. It gives a good example of the video you will get. Not sure how much Amazon distorts the video.

title: Poor manual, short battery life, but still a great toy for the price
text:
[[VIDEOID:c270bbf2c30f9b64f076af1d155c5e42]] All considered, this is an excellent buy. The user's guide is poorly translated from probably Chinese..really hard to decipher but with some patience my kids and I figured it all out. Lots of features. The battery takes 75 minutes to charge but flies only 7 minutes and much less if you have the camera on. The camera btw takes 1280x720 30fps video WITH SOUND (but motor noise drowns out other sounds-- see my video clip), at an average of 2.4MBps or about 142-143 MB per minute. A generic 4GB microSD card is already included so that gives you a total of 3810/143= 25 to 28 minutes of video time. Video quality is surprisingly sharp and clear with good contrast. Of course watching too much of it can make you feel motion sick.. LOL.. Still pic resolution is 2560x1440 but very highly compressed so not good for looking at.

Btw the included 4GB SD card wasn't reliable in my case, gave me file errors the first time I tried to download the files. (There's no streaming from the camera or FPV flying). I switched to a Sony microSD and have been error free since even tho we've crashed this a million times.

This makes a great starter quad. Its handling is middle of the road of the ones I've played with. At least the copter is responsive when within range. You do need to do some trimming each time which is kind of painful at the start but manageable eventually. Once trimmed try not to crash the chopper too much.LOL.. You'll probably crash a lot if you're new. This thing stands up to crashes pretty good except the battery door keeps on comign off upon crash. I'm ordering a 2nd one so my kids can keep on practicign flying this. They want an FPV eventually.. Lots of powerlines and big trees where we live. So this is just perfect for practicing like I said. Happy flying!!

title: The drone is a good one for the budget

title: A great stepping stone for aspiring drone enthusiasts
text:
The Syma X5C quadcopter is an affordable model that offers an opportunity to get your feet wet piloting a drone without the fear of trashing or losing a thousand dollar drone and camera kit. For $50, it offers plenty of fun and practice at very low risk.

I have flown the DJI Phantom and several toy single- and multi-rotor copters. This fits somewhere in between. It feels very much like a toy with the cheap, plastic body; however, it flies like a more serious quadcopter.

Because the X5C is purely radio controlled with no input from GPS, altitude control is completely manual. That makes the X5C harder to fly than the DJI Phantom. So if you are aspiring to buy a Phantom or a 3DR Solo, the X5C will certainly prep you for the piloting aspect of it.

What the X5C won’t prepare you for is the complexity of the setup and preparation process for flying more advanced drones. And that’s a good thing if this is your first quadcopter.

There is no compass calibration or linking to GPS satellites. The X5C’s transmitter is linked to the quadcopter and there is no relink process after firmware upgrades. You just pull it out of the box, put batteries in it and go fly.

Perhaps one of the best things about the X5C is that it is small and light enough to fly inside. Of course, you can’t really get crazy with maneuvering indoors but learning to control the throttle under ceilings that are only nine feet high helps you get a good feel of the drone.

The X5C is equipped with a built-in camera. I use the term “camera” loosely though. If you frequent this site, there is really nothing about the camera that will be satisfactory to you. The resolution is 1280 x 720 for the video using a Motion JPEG codec in .AVI file format. The photos are 3.6MP. The sharpness in both formats is abysmal.

While it is easy to capture photos or video via the transmitter controls, unless lighting is just perfect, the photos will just look like terrible. If the lighting is sufficient and the X5C isn’t vibrating too bad at the moment of capture, it can be an okay result.

The Syma X5C delivers somewhere between 6-10 minutes flight time, depending on the conditions. The good thing though is that batteries for the X5C are cheap and pretty simple to replace.

The remote has trim controls on it to keep it hovering pretty evenly. I haven’t quite been able to get it to hold without any drift. However, it is pretty close and good enough to maintain control and hover indoors with just a little input from me.

Outside, the X5C does okay in conditions up to a light breeze. It is extremely lightweight, so that plastic body will really catch the wind if you get much of a gust. This is not something you want to fly in tight spaces outside.

The X5C also seems to be pretty robust. I’ve crashed it from 8-feet or so indoors and probably close to 25-feet outdoors (onto grass) without so much as a broken rotor yet.

In sum, the Syma X5C is a great little quadcopter that borders between toy and hobbyist-level drones. It has enough features to whet your appetite for a more advanced and more expensive package without the risk of breaking your heart if you crash it or lose it.

My wife and kids were able to fly it pretty quickly, too. I've taken it outdoors and flown high enough for it to get out of range of the controller (seems like 140-200 feet or so); once it does that, it just comes back down. If it gets back in range, quickly enough, you can regain control of it. The camera takes surprisingly good videos (with audio) though sometimes the videos don't seem to save properly. Batteries last about 6-7 minutes of flying depending on how much maneuvering you do, so buy a few extra. title: Great Drone For Beginners
text:
With so many drones out there I wasn't sure which kind to get but came across this one and liked the features and price so I figured I would give it a shot. Boy am I glad I did. This was a gift for my almost 12 year old son (and husband). They have been playing with it everyday since receiving it and it has held up GREAT.

I would also suggest that you fly this drone in a very open area because it goes really high and can get stuck on top of roofs. We live right across the street from a grocery store and the drone flew right on top of the roof. It happened on Christmas morning so we had to wait until the next day to contact the manager to get on the roof and get it. They thought it was pretty funny! The drone is really easy to fly and maneuver. It only took my son a few flights to get the hang of it.

I also want to say how durable this drone is. It has seen it's fair share of crashes and it has held up nicely.

CON: The battery does not last long and takes forever to recharge. I would suggest investing in a few extra batteries so that you can play for longer than 7 minutes at a time. It's such a bummer to be flying the plane and then have to stop because your battery dies. We also haven't been able to download the video shot from the Drone because it's not compatible with the computers we have. Not sure if this is something that is an ongoing problem with other people or just the fact we don't have the right software. But either way it's a bummer we haven't figured out how to see the photo and video footage.

Overall this is a great drone for beginners or people used to flying drones. It goes much higher and farther than I had thought, which is great.

title: Great but SD slot messed up.
text:
It worked great but the camera slot for the sd card was messed up. We took several pictures and videos. Took out the SD card and when returning it, it wouldn’t go back in. Will increase stars if they refund my money.

**update. Money was refunded. Overall it was a nice drone and it’s good for the amount. My son really enjoyed it and it navigated easy. If only the SD card slot didn’t mess up.

title: Awesome for the price!
text:
I recieved my package on time, and it was beautiful. The actual box was inside a amazon box (I loved this because it delivered when I was not home & USPS left it outside...not happy about that but at least no one could see what it was) and it was super protected with stuffing and paper all over and I was very happy about this as it's a Christmas gift for my boyfriend. (He bought a nano drone about a month ago & fell in love, he has way too much fun. & our dog loves to chase it around the yard) I would've been very upset if it was all banged up like I've read on some reviews. I also saw some reviews claiming that they recieved a "fake" or "dupe" of the actual SYMA brand drone. That was not my case, thank God. I opened up the box and peeked and it was beautiful.

I'll have to wait until after Christmas to give a review about the drone itself and the quality. But I just wanted to let anyone know of how I recieved it and how excited I am to see him open it up on Christmas.

title: MISCHIEVOUS FUN AT ITS BEST!
text:
This thing is way too much fun and pretty tough too. I took it to the office/aircraft hangar I work in and at first we just buzzed the crap out of some co-workers in the next office cubicle, got it stuck in the ceiling tile track. Took it out into the hangar after clocking out and that is where it shined! Almost hit a real plane, thing is light and would not have done any damage but it will get going pretty fast! Responds and recovers very quickly and nicely, have to be very gentle on the controls. Too bad we only had one battery. Watch getting to close to walls and ceilings as this disrupts the airflow and the copter behaves erratically, loses lift on the side to close and that side drops into whatever caused the airflow disruption.
MISCHIEVOUS FUN AT ITS BEST!
Totally happy. Got to figure out how to drop a tiny payload with it.....mwu ha ha ha ha. *Evil grin*

title: Quad is junk but has a good camera!
text: I can't recommend this since it doesn't fly very well no matter what the fan boys and paid reviewers say.  It is easier to control than the Hubson X4 that can't be controlled at all but that seems to be because it's bigger and slower so it can't get away as fast. The best I can do with it is to barely keep it in my yard but I have to stay on the sticks all the time since it tends to dart to the left or right or zoom way up into the air or dive to the ground by itself.  The camera takes good videos but they will be pretty jerky since the quad can't hover or stay still enough.  It does stay level by itself, something the Pixhawk can't do, but that's about all.  A lot of reviews say it can hover and one on YouTube even says it can hover hands free but don't believe it, they are just making that up and were probably paid to say it since the craft doesn't have that capability.  The Parrot can sort of hover since it has an altimeter and downward facing camera to find it's position but the X5C doesn't have anything like that.  It wasn't a total loss though because I figured out how to take the camera off and use it by itself.

title: Absolute BEST budget/beginner quad on the market, hands down.
text: Best bang for your buck quad on the market, IMO. I received the X5C-1 version, as others have noted... where the flip is the top right shoulder button and the camera is operated with the trim button on the left stick. Flies great, an excellent beginner quad. Camera quality is better than I expected. Obviously, in low light/indoors it's pretty awful, but outside in the daylight it provides some surprisingly good video. It's not production quality video, by any means, but it's excellent for just playing around and getting some aerial views. Again, best budget/beginner friendly quad out there, period.

title: Love it!
text: Great product! Performs beautifully!

title: Durable and super fun!
text:
[[VIDEOID:dee26fb89e208c619822d3fe8ddad1f1]] While I'm saving up for a proper quad/drone I decided to buy this relatively inexpensive one to start learning how they fly, to get the feel for them etc. This thing is tons of fun for the entry-level toy that it is. I read the manual and had the controls figured out within a few minutes. It's pretty durable. I've crashed it more times than I can count and our border collie snatched it out of the air once and raced around the yard with it. No damage, but a few scuffs from crashing into pavement. I do have the prop guards installed, at least until I become a quad jedi master.

Battery life is better than I expected. I haven't timed it, but it seems like I have a good amount of time on a charge, even with video. I've got the five battery pack on order though because it does take a long time for the battery to recharge once it's depleted. It handles a good breeze without any trouble.

UPDATE: Got this stuck about 40 feet up a honey maple tree (1.5 inch thorns) and had no way to get it down. I wrote it off as lost forever and went on with my life. This was in the summer. Months later, after going through nasty thunderstorms, rain, snow, ice storms, and freezing weather.... it fell out of the tree. I recovered it, put a fresh battery in it and... it works perfectly. Impressive.

Photo and video quality is a lot better than I anticipated on a quad at this price. It's not going to film any weddings, but for messing around and getting aerial photos of your house or your neighborhood, this will work.

This would be a great toy for a kid who's into this kind of thing, or for an adult who's still able to tap into that kid kind of fun. Great product!

EDIT: The attached video demonstrates that it goes pretty high up. The quality of that video was degraded when it was uploaded. Video quality is actually better than what you see on this review.

title: Great Basic Quadcopter
text:
I've been practicing with this quadcopter for the past two weeks and I'm impressed with what I got for just $50. Because of winter conditions, I'm flying in my basement which is limiting, but seems to be teaching me a lot. I've run into walls a number of times and so far, it's not damaged. I also bought this model for my son, but one of the motors was damaged so I returned it to Amazon. I'd be sure to buy from Amazon and not a third party. I haven't tried the video function yet. I plan on practicing until it crashes hard and needs a repair. At that point I'll buy a more expensive model which has more features.
From what I read, these cheaper quadcopters are harder to fly. When you get into the $120 range you will get a model which is easier to control and you will get a better camera. For now, this is a great copter to practice with.

title: Love the Syma X5C
text:
[[VIDEOID:c7e4dbad0f631cd9cd974b8cdbf9e2b8]] The concept of toy and amateur drones piqued my curiosity and after a bit of research decided to buy the Syma X5C Quadcopter. Certainly in the toy category but for the price it is an amazing little machine. It comes equipped with a very decent HD camera that shoots video in AVi format and also takes still pictures. I had never even held a drone let alone fly one until this unit arrived. And at first I was crashing repeatedly. But after a couple of days and some reading about navigation I was able to pilot the X5C very easily. It has an easy to use control unit and drone responds rapidly to changes in course or height. It's also a very resiliant drone and hasn't shown the slightest bit of damage from many crash landings. The worst that has happened is losing a few blade guards but replacements are cheap and easy to put on. The flight time is about 7 or 8 minutes. Spare batteries swap out easily to keep it going. I think the video quality is good considering the price of this unit.

Flying the X5C has become a new found pleasure for me. I'm 61 years old and new to this concept but I have to fly it everyday and thoroughly enjoy it. It's fun to watch the videos, including the crashes!

I suggest investing in some spare parts upfront, including blade guards and extra batteries all of which are cheap.

This unit is great for beginners or if you are on a budget. If you are looking for a starter drone I highly recommend the X5C.

title: I'm a novice flyer and I love this quad
text: I'm a novice flyer and I love this quad.  Its fairly large but can be pretty fast and maneuvers well.  It seems to be built well, I've had no functional issues and it has survived its share of crashes with no damage.  The controller has a very nice feel, the sticks are smooth and easy to handle and you can do some very fine movement with practice.  It also holds trim settings, which is a nice feature.  The camera is nothing special but is fun to play around with.  It takes decent pics / vids and seems to be better than a lot of others in this class, but almost any modern smartphone has a better camera.  Great price and tons of fun.  Buy extra batteries so you can keep flying!

title: after crashing or making hard landings it still works so I changed my rating to 5 stars.  order the 3.7v 850 ma batteries though
text:
Mode 1-
Doesn't seem like the correction adjustments work. I have did my best and have gone through three charges of batteries trying to get the drone to hover. Looks like I'll have to just wing it. It also seems like the battery simply goes dead without warning although I'll see if there is something I missed about low voltage warning.
For the price it is okay but don't expect to have this drone long and if your reading this presently I would suggest spending more and making sure you have one that has better controls. I have noticed that one of the motors stops spinning long before the others so it could be a bad motor that is causing this. Since I have no way to test the motors I do not know what else to do but try and correct while in flight with the controls.

Mode 2
Fourth charge of batteries and it hovered fairly good but I accidentally got it in Mode 2 and although I do not like the lever setup I'm not going to complain since it is acting much better now. I'll simply have to change my thinking on the controls.
Battery does not last long (7 min with camera running) although I did not time it (time is from video) and my mini mac does not seem to play the avi files. Looking for a program for the mini that will.
---
Suggestion, if you get this unit also look for 3.5v - 800ma batteries, with charger- you will really want more than the 7 min. Even though I did't get too far yet I know that much.
I received my 3.7 v 850 ma batteries today and flight time with camera is 10:30 and without the camera is 11:30.
Other reviews from people that have flown other drones seem to think this is a great drone. Maybe I just don't know how good of a drone I have in my hands.
I have seen how a $500.00 dollar drone flies, okay, for the money this is a great Drone.

title: Three Days of Awesome! Then, not so awesome...
text:
If I were to review the first three days of owning the X5C, I would give it 6 stars out of 5. My 12yo son loved it, and couldn't get enough of it. It was pretty easy to learn to fly, the camera worked great, and it provided hours of outdoor enjoyment.

However, if I were to review the X5C AFTER the first 3 days, I would have to give it zero stars (thus the 3-star rating above). Why? Because the motor on one of the four blades began to rotate slower than the other three, and now it is basically unflyable. Note that there were no major crashes before this occurred, and in fact it appears in good shape overall. I am going to try to fix it, but it is pretty lame that it only worked for three days before being worn out. I recognize that this is a low-priced model, but I still thought we would still get at least a few weeks of enjoyment out of it.

He just pushed a button and it went up and disappeared even though the battery was very low. Did not know it did not contain a fly back to you status or GPS tracking.

title: Best to search youtube for accurate instructions

title: Plastic Heroin :)
text: I first saw a quad (DJI Phantom) in action about 3 months ago and was immediately hooked. I got an iPhone app to practice on, then bought one of these entry-level babies along with some spare batteries. Started flying it, trial and error, eventually lost it when I let it get caught in the wind and taken too high and far away and out of range of the controller. UNDAUNTED, I discovered that you can buy JUST THE QUAD with no controller for under $30 a pop--apparently I'm not the first guy to lose or wreck one of these. SO, I bought 3 more. So far, I've gotten one irretrievably stuck in a tree but still have two left AND am becoming a better drone pilot. Total cost of addiction so far--$160. Cost of new Phantom--$1K. I'll wait until I crash the last two Symas.

title: It flies nice too.
text: Well I was skeptical for the $48 price but the camera actually looks decent!  It flies nice too.....Sorry my review isnt that detailed but after 5 minutes in my backyard and getting caught in the trees, I took it to a high school football field.  Got it up a good 150' and a nice gust of wind put it in its new home on top of the school....My own fault and lesson learned but if its just a slight breeze be careful about letting it get away from you.  The replacement arrived the next day thanks prime :)

title: Strongly recommend that you learn to use it far from trees ...
text: Gave this to my son as a birthday gift. After charging the batteries, it took him about 20 minutes to connect a few pieces and it was soon aloft. As the drone is small and light, don't be tempted to fly it anywhere near trees as the wind will almost certainly overtake your controls and land it in a tree. Strongly recommend that you learn to use it far from trees and, needless-to-say, airports and powerlines! BTW, found the quality of the video to be quite good given the item's price. Definitely buy some extra batteries and props.

title: Broken within 10 minutes with no response after contacting manufacturer multiple times!!
text: Not happy with this.  I bought it for my son for Christmas but did not get to use it until March due to the wonderful Indiana weather.  When we did finally get to use it, we flew for about 10 minutes then it stopped working.  I could tell the rotor for one of the propeller was not working.  I had also purchased the repair kit with it.  But when repair by 2 different people it still did not work.  We believe it to be a problems with the control board.  Since it was past the return time for amazon I contacted the company multiple times with no response as of yet!  Would not buy it again based on this.  Too bad it looks as though we could have had a lot of fun with this.  A disappointed child is never a good thing either!!

title: Amazing Little Quad
text:
Amazing beginner quad especially for the price!
I received one of these Syma X5C as a holiday gift 2 years ago. Mine still flies to this day. They are amazingly durable. We got one stuck in a tree about 3 days after we got it. With the battery plugged in; it sat on the highest branch for at least 48hrs in the frost sub 30 degree weather. We got it down by throwing a ball at it, charged the battery and it was flying like nothing happened. They are extremely easy to learn to fly and set up as well. Very agile, fast and records decent video for the price.

title: Compared to the New X5SW Wi Fi
text:
Like all the other reviews written, I'll start off by repeating what you already know: This is probably one of the most stable and easy to fly drones you can buy. I only wrote this review because of the one glaring flaw, no Wi Fi and no possibility of it. Syma has just come out with a new version called the X5SW Explorer, it has Wi Fi and it's the nuts. It's black, so you can't get confused. Otherwise, it's the same exact drone as the X5C with the exception of the camera pod. The new model is nicer as it just pops on and off, no screw. But, the drawback with the SW is it can't take stills on board as the X5C can. You take the pictures or videos from the phone or tablet itself, not just view them. The controller switch for the camera doesn't do anything. Too bad, the controller is by far, the easiest way to take pictures and videos. So it's a mixed bag and that's why I have both.

I keep both of mine in padded hard cases. I highly recommend them for maximum protection and very good looks doing it.

title: Five Stars

title: Five Stars
text: Great price. Great product. Fast shipping. Excellent service.  Thanks

title: Not impressed
text: Bought 2 for my son and son in law one is ok the other is cracked/broken and missing pieces,  these were xmas presents so now theres nothing i can do

title: Five Stars
text: I can't believe they can sell this drone so cheaply, but they do, and it works.

title: Great trainer drone.
text: Bought it for my daughter to fly and it flys actually nice. Would be nice if it an ATT mode. This really is the best way to learn to fly a quad. A lot of people by Phantoms or other GPS quads and end up having fly-a-ways because when the gps signal is lost they don't know how to fly it in manual or ATT mode. Great way to learn. The biggest issues are with the camera. The lights should be bigger so you can tell when its filming. It can take a crash if you remember to cut the power once you know when your going to crash. I would recommend it.

title: I love it, but don't let your uncle fly it ...
text: I love it, but don't let your uncle fly it or you risk putting it 100 feet up in a tree.

title: Worthless Pile of Garbage
text: This thing is a piece of garbage. While I've never tried any other drones out there, 7 minutes of flight time for 100 minutes of charge time is a joke. Prepare to buy ten batteries with this thing because the battery that came with mine DOES NOT charge. EVER. Multiple attempts to fly this thing have resulted in fewer and fewer seconds of flight time. My first attempt; maybe 60 seconds. My second attempt 10 seconds. My third attempt less than a single second of fly time. Total Chinese piece of garbage. I'm sending mine back because I'm not going to risk replacing just the battery when assuredly the whole thing is a piece of crap. It's a shame that the entire drone industry is bookended by best-selling steaming piles like this Sym, and then many hundreds of dollars for mystery products on the other end. God I'd love to just smash this thing to pieces, because that's all it's really meant to be, a bunch of pieces of plastic trash swept up into a dusty corner somewhere in my kitchen.

title: Tons of fun!
text: Awesome little drone to learn with.  Great inexpensive drone which flies superbly and is crazy durable.  I've crashed this thing countless times and haven't even needed to change a blade.  I also crashed it over water on a houseboat trip and it was 15 feet underwater for about 10 minutes.  I thought we'd lost it until diving and seeing the lights were STILL FLASHING underwater.  We retrieved it, and it was flying like new in the morning.  The video is nothing to be dazzled by with its low resolution, but it's a fantastic first drone to get the hang of flying and getting some interesting video or stills.  You cannot go wrong with this quadcopter.

title: WOW
text: The drone got caught up in a HUGE tree for 2 months. It was way too high up to retrieve so I hoped it would eventually fall, but didn't have much hope for it to be in working condition after several winter storms and below freezing weather. However, after finally getting it back, it works like it did the first time out of the package! Just WOW!

title: Not happy at all.
text: Not happy with this product. It has rave reviews but we ended up with with a defective remote controller for the item. This was a Christmas gift and I felt awful that it didn't work.

title: Great quad
text: Great quad!  11 year old grandson needed no instructions and began to fly immediately.  As others have said the instructions , but you can figure it out without too many attempts.  Mostly trial and error, without many errors.  The quad has amazing range.  The only issue is when it gets out of range you have zero control (dumb statement, but everyone understands!).  The last time we had it out it was almost out of view going straight up on a cloudless sky - now that is range for this priced model.  It also was out of range on the horizon and landed in some trees.  We searched for about 20 minutes continuing to power up hoping the blades would turn and make noise - it worked.  Again, no damage.  These little quads taking a lot of abuse.  We have not replaced any blades.  We have replaced a motor.  If ordering the quad purchase some extra motors.  It is had waiting for 2-3 weeks for a replacement and the local hobby shops do not carry spares. We have three of these units.  The -1 and this one appear to have no differences in performances for us.

title: Best deal! I have tried all kind of quadracopters and this is the best for the $40-$100 price range
text: This drone is a GREAT deal! I have tried 4 drones now, and this one is by far the easiest to control. The others I have tried have all been more expensive, but none as good as this one! It is very sensitive to the wind so be careful not the fly it too high so it picks up drafts. Also be careful not to fly it too far because the range isn't too big. I love that I can just turn it off at any time and then quickly turn it back on, it's an easy way to drop the drones elevation, and it is the only drone that I have came across that does this the others are SO hard to land! Not this one! I have dropped it maybe 4 times now and it has still held up. Another feature I enjoy is the lights on the bottom, they help you see which side is left and right when steering. It also is easy to see at night. My only complaint is that there is not tracking on it, because sadly I got mine caught in a draft and lost it. It is so cheap, I will probably just order another.

text: Well, I had to replace one motor already on this quad.It could have been from a hard crash that was my fault. But what has me concerned is something I found while replacing the motor. The manual and all the pictures I've seen...show the top cover as 5 separate pieces. Mine is all one piece which requires you to take all the screws for the motors out to get to the board. Is anyone familiar with this enough to give me a definitive answer, I'm starting to think this is a knock off.
