title: Five Stars
text: great

title: Great first step into camera Quadcopters.
text:
Great first step into the Quadcoptoer world with camera. My first step with a quad came with the Husban X4 and loved it. Decided after seeing a deal pop up on a slightly larger quad with a camera to give it a shot. Jumping up in size slightly from the X4 was very easy as the controls are the same for the most part outside of a few additional buttons.

As with most Quads, be patient and get comfortable with the controls before just throwing these things into advanced mode. It is very responsive when in this mode.

I did knock one star for camera quality, but I did know this going in that it was not GoPro quality. Don't expect movie quality images in 1080. Best description i can say is think of this as a camera phone from around 2008 or 2009. Maybe even compare it to an early 2000's webcam.

There is no return mode or headless mode. Once this thing is out of range it will input remember the last input and use that for a few seconds before just dropping out of the sky.

Edit- 12-14-15
After some flying and trying to get a feel for the camera angle, it is definitely angled a little to far down. simple fix is wedging a very slim piece of light packing foam between the battery door and battery. I then used a very thin piece of Velcro to wrap around the body and secure the door shut aiming the camera more forward. Doing this allows a more straight forward view while recording. The addition does not appear to add any noticable weight to the quad copter and does not hamper the controls in any way.

title: Keep Your Friends Close, and Your Quadcopter Closer
text:
For the money, it's amazing! Hard to believe you can get a still and video camera in the sky for this cheap.

That being said, I'll advise anyone who buys one to keep it pretty low to the ground since the range is not very far. I went out in dead calm wind and decided to get some pictures from above the treetops. It was dusk, so I could see the LED lights on the bottom of the craft. Right up above my head, about 200 feet and the thing started blinking (indicating loss of signal). Then it spun and went off in a random direction, and started coming down (still under power). Luckily a connection was re-established, and I was able gain orientation and fly it back from over some trees. But unless you're a pretty good pilot, that would have been the end of your play time since when it gets out of range, it will spin, changing orientation and then it's up to the pilot to figure out the orientation and begin corrections to keep it from going in the wrong place.

title: Even dad loves it
text: Its hard to believe the price of this thing after playing with it. I originally bought it for my son for Christmas now I find myself playing with it more than he does. This thing is a blast to play with. I wish the battery lasted longer but who can complain for this money. The camera is OK definitely not HD but for the money it's perfect. I already bought 2 more just in case the original one breaks and another for me to play with.

title: Amazing. For the price it is unbeatable.
text: Amazing product for the price. This is the first quadcopter I've ever flown or owned. If you want to learn how to use a camera quadcopter/drone before buying a bigger more expensive version get this to start. It does take some practice to fly but was quite easy once I learned how. Fly it indoors to start and keep it a couple inches off the ground until you get the hang of it. Use the trim buttons on the remote to zero it in. The first time I flew this outdoors I got it caught in a tree because my piloting skills weren't good enough yet. I had to duct tape a 20 foot painters pole to a 16 foot tree saw pole to get high enough to get it down. Even after falling through the tree branches all the way to the ground it was completely undamaged. It feels cheap but it is remarkably tough. Today I flew it in an open park area and even with some strong breezes I was able to control it. It takes some concentration but this copter is precise enough that you can hover and land on a platform that is 6 inches square or even on your own hand. For the price I paid I have zero complaints. The battery life is not very long but for less than 9 bucks you can buy these two extra batteries like I did. Mudder Upgraded 680mAh 3.7V Lipo Rechargeable Battery for Syma X5 X5C Quadcopter. I would also recommend putting a rubber band around the middle of the copter to hold the battery door/camera on better. If you bump the ground too hard it could pop the battery door open. Easy fix. Video quality is not crystal clear and not stabilized so don't expect professional footage but for the price you can't beat it. It also records sound but likely you will only hear the propellers and wind noise. Still, it is pretty cool that it even has sound. This thing is great! Go get one. I might even buy a second one.

title: Comes with all you need
text: [[VIDEOID:65d43ba7edd62c7b6309bac1f2aea55c]] This Drone is amazing for the price it fly's great outside and is easy to fly. I am a beginner and have flown it several times and crashed it a few and it still works fine. I strongly recommend this quad-copter for anyone looking to get into this. I posted a video of my 4th flight.

title: Almost easy enough for an adult to fly it!
text: This drone far surpasses previous flying toys we have owned. We have gone through several helicopters only to be disappointed very quickly with their performance and durability.  I purchased this for me as my toy and wouldn't let me near adult kids play with it until I had a chance first. Of course both of them are better skillled flying it than I am. Today's youth who play video games will take to the controls like a natural, for me, I need time. BUT I was able to get it staight off the ground on the first try and was able to easier retrieve it out of nearby trees before the short-lived battery ran out of juice.  I should purchase another battery because I need more practice to learn how to fly this drone. Great deal for the price. Very pleased with my purchase.

title: Totally awesome
text:
This is an excellent budget drone. The micro-drones out there are junk; this is not.

Of course it's not as user-friendly as a $500 drone, but it's still easy to fly, a total novice can get the hang of it quickly.

And it's REALLY durable. The material is pretty flexible so it absorbs a lot of crashes without breaking. Parts will eventually wear out, but replacement parts are cheap and plentiful. The only complaint is it has so many screws to remove to replace parts.

I've been using it for several months and, even though they're pretty beat up now, I'm still on my first set of blades. All I've had to do was replace one LED cover that came off when it got stuck in a rain gutter, and I just had to replace one motor - it still worked but when it heated up the performance would drop and destabilize the drone. Aside from all the screws, replacing the motor was cheap and easy.

In summary, if you want to get into drone flying without a big investment, this is an excellent choice. Pick up some spare batteries while you're at it.

EDIT - Last winter I was flying this thing in the backyard and it got seriously stuck up in a tree way too high to get at. It was up there for months, heavy sun and numerous thunderstorms. I was planning on replacing it but just hadn't gotten around to it; expected corrosion to the board and/or motors from all that weather exposure to have killed it.

Finally, after maybe four months, one day it fell out of the tree. On a whim I put in a new battery and tried it out. Worked flawlessly. I was impressed...

title: Excellent beginner quadcopter before purchasing a Phantom or a quadcopter to just mess around and fly for fun
text:
Pros: fast, symmetric, very light, very agile, not too expensive comparing to most quadcopters, this one came with 2 sets of rotors, white set installed, and another white set as an extra spare. Has a 2mp camera with an SD card, SD card reader, one battery with a charger and a remote. A lot of fun to fly, very durable. Screw driver to mount the rotor protectors/bump guards.

Cons: did not come with batteries for the remote, camera quality is equivalent to an old school flip phone camera.

Overall: I love flying this quadcopter, this is my one of my two x5c editions so my review is very much similar to the other one. My other one is the X5C-1 and the only difference that I have noticed between X5C and X5C-1 is the packaging difference. X5C came in a bigger box with a plastic insert comparing to X5C-1 that came with a styrofoam insert and a smaller box.

The quadcopter is very agile, has two modes for the speeds, high and low. High speed is great for outdoor flying, sharp turns and great angles of attack. Low speed is great for the house or for more accurate precision. Flying it is a lot of fun and I would definitely suggest this as beginner quadcopter to practice and learn the flying techniques. This quadcopter is missing the headless mode and the auto-return feature but I believe that is not too much of a bad thing. Flying in regular mode will allow you to become better at flying in general. You should not fly the quadcopter farther than you can see it. Definitely purchase a couple of extra batteries to enjoy your flying sessions. One battery lasts approximately 10 minutes and takes approximately 60 minutes to charge. I overdid it and purchased 15 additional batteries (good for when my friends fly the other one). Should give me more than enough flight time, just got to make sure to allow for the motors to cool down in between sessions as they are brushed motors and are somewhat fragile to high heat conditions.

The remote is very easy to figure out. Direction booklet explains all of the controls and buttons so there's no need to review that. I can tell you that remote to quad communication is awesome and pretty long distance. I have not yet found an area where I can max out the quadcopter distance without running into obstacles or losing the sight of it. It did not come with batteries but so far I have a couple of hours of flight time and the battery indicator still says full. Might want to consider getting some rechargeable batteries.

I've crashed this quadcopter several times now, a couple of times into the wall, a couple of times into the ceiling, have dropped it a couple of times while panicking during flight and shutting down the throttle. It has held up to all of the crashes, has minor scratches on the plastic but no significant damage. The other day I was trying to test the flight range in a retail store parking lot and ended up accidentally flying into the concrete wall of the store due to misjudging how close I was to it. The quad fell straight to the ground and hit the pavement, I thought that was it. Gave it some throttle and it came right back up and continued to fly like nothing ever happened. Flying inside and outside are completely different experiences so if you start to get frustrated with indoor flights, don't give up. The lower temperature higher density air outside makes flying a completely different experience. You need half the throttle outside to get up to the same altitude as you would need indoors.

A buddy of mine purchased the Skyviper from a local retail store because he liked my quadcopter. It cost him almost 3x the price I paid for my X5C and it was no near as accurate or fun to fly as the Syma is. He ended up returning it back to the retail store. I played with it as well and was very disappointed in it but at the same time very impressed with the quality of the X5C quad.

The camera is no good. I took mine off to save on the battery power and weight to get more flight time. It's okay to mess around but the quality of video and images is pretty poor. It does have sound though comparing to the camera that came on my buddy's Skyviper. If you're interested in aerial photography, this could be your stepping stone to learn with to avoid possibly crashing a more expensive piece of equipment.

Thanks for reading my review and if you have any questions feel free to ask as I personally very much enjoy this product and will try my best to help get anyone else's questions answered for them to get the best experience out of it.

I earlier mentioned that I own a couple of quadcopters, others being Syma X8 and DJI Phantom 4. The x5c was my learning, stepping stone to the other ones. I highly recommend flying it before purchasing a bigger version: x8 and definitely before purchasing an expensive aircraft like P4.

title: A great starter drone and a really fun toy
text:
I bought this for my brother for Christmas, and he LOVES it. He works in a building with a large bay with high ceilings, he takes it to work with him half the time to play with after hours. I've also had a chance to fly it outside, and it's pretty fun. I also got him some extra 600mAh batteries, I should have gone with the 700mAh ones. This drone can fly in a light wind, and it's very manageable as long as it's steady, but any sort of gusting wind will make it very hard to control. It's also surprisingly tough, it's been dropped quite a few times onto both grass/dirt and concrete and it's still in one piece, even using the props that came with it.

That said, don't expect it to lift pretty much anything. I was hoping to use it to lift a small cell phone, either a Samsung Mesmerize or Moto Droid Mini, for a poor man's FPV, but it simply doesn't have enough power to do it, even with the prop guards removed. Also, the prop guards don't stay on very well, they really need longer screws.

Of course, now I want a quadcopter for myself, and I seriously considered buying one of these, possibly the X5W or X5SC model, or an X8*, but in the end I decided to spring for a Cheerson CX-20 instead. The larger motors, GPS capabilities, and auto-return features are what mainly sold me on the more expensive model.

title: Total Junk.  Transmitter Range Awful!!
text: Complete junk.  Flew about 20 meters high and it lost signal and flew away.  I have read that a lot of people do antenna mods because it has a fake antenna, but I figured I could get at least 20 meters out of it.  I was wrong.  Love my Syma x11 though, great range and fun to fly.

title: Loads of Fun! Excellent for beginners! Easy to use!
text: This is was first quadcopter and it was lots of fun to fly. The controls are very easy to learn and the trimming is also easy to do for fine tuning. Battery life is reasonable. This is very light and gusts of wind will ruin your accuracy when controlling it. I crash landed it many times due to going too high and losing signal and in one of those it no longer worked. I opened it and found one soldered cable separated from the board so I soldered it back again and it was good. I was careless and even let my son play/crash it as well as others who have never used a quadcopter. Eventually it stopped working after leaving it outside overnight on a foggy night, I imagine that dew damaged it but I am not sure. It was so much fun while it lasted and put a smile on other people's faces. My second quadcopter was the UDI and it was nowhere near as fun. Get some extra batteries, its worth it.

title: Great buy, flys ease, and handled some crash and still going.  Great company also
text: This thing Flys great and easy. If there is no wind to very light wind this thing hover very nice. Break it in slowly like all quads and this thing is solid built. Crash couple of times to practice some moves and it still solid. Have to remember this thing is super light. So a nice strong wind will take it. Video is decent for this type of device. Will not compare to my DJI but it does the job. Actually happy I got this. Battery about 6 to 10 min depending on what you doing and if your using the camera. This was also the update model. Plus I ask the seller and told me they only have the newer model. I would buy from this company again.

title: Great copter.
text: I love this copter.  It flies well and looks good  too.  I would buy the wifi camera version if I had it to do over.  I would like to have the real time feedback from the camera.  It would be more money but I think worth it.  I would encourage you to get spare parts since you are going to crash some learning to fly it.  I does not take long to learn to fly it either.  If you do not care about the real time feedback then get this one .  You will like it  I feel sure. Update to review: Flew this afternoon and this thing is stable as a rock.  Hovers great easy to control with just a little practice.  I am blown away with the camera quality.  It is fantastic in daylight.  Takes beautiful videos.  Dusk video is a little grainy but still not bad.  Buy this.  You will love it.  Wish I had one when I was a kid.

Update: After 3 weeks im the tree a huge windstorm brought it down with the branch it was caught in. Keep in mind it has been out side in the rain and the snow all that time. Checked to make sure it was dry, cleaned the caked dirt out of the gears, replaced the broke prop guard, put in a new battery, and turned it on. Turn on the controller, "beep, beep, vvrrrrrr" worked perfectly. This is a TOUGH little drone. Altitude control would be nice but very very tough.

title: So impressed
text:
I am beyond impressed by this drone. This is so much fun! My 9 year old can fly it pretty adeptly after a short learning curve. He can make it flip with ease. The controls look daunting to start but really, it is easier to fly than the little helicopters. This is our second Syma product (first one was a helicopter which was also very well constructed and lasted a long time).

Highlights:
Amazing video quality, surprisingly clear and crisp. (Picture quality wasn't as great as the video quality though.)
Durable. It fell a couple of times while flying and just keeps on running!
Battery life is supposed to be 7 minutes but it went for more like 10.
Optional bumper guards around the propellers are very useful but also nice to have the option to remove them.
White is a great color as it is visible from the ground - moreso than black would be - and if it falls in a field it is easy to spot.

title: Happy son Happy Mom!
text: This was the BEST present I gave this Christmas. I was SO pleased with this product! My son (12 years old) is obsessed with it and it has held up to many crashes while he learned how to fly it. The pictures and video are great quality. Many of his friends got different drones for Christmas and they all complained of them not working and/or breaking within minutes of first use. NOT THIS ONE!!! It even has lights for night time flying! His comes with one battery a set of replacement blades and a 4gb micro SD card. I ordered as someone suggested the extra batteries which ended up being perfect. One battery only lasts for about 7 minutes of flying but with 4 back up batteries he can just come back inside switch the battery and go right back out. I didn't realize that it came with a micro SD card so I had bought him one as well that was bigger. Also, I ordered an extra set of blades but it comes with an extra set and he has not even broken/ damaged the first set yet. I can't say enough good things about this product!

title: Awesome toy.  Abused and keeps on ticking.
text:
This is a lot of fun, awesome and well built toy. I purchased one for my wife/kids as well.
I burn out 2 motors by flying too often. (You should wait 15 minutes between flights with different batteries.)
Replacement motors were cheap and I had the know how to change them out.
A few weeks ago I got distracted and lost track of the drone. I cut power hoping the drone would not go too far.
Finally found the drone today. (I think it was up in a tree and the winds finally blew it to the ground.)
Put a different battery in and took it for a spin.
I have crash landed in the grass many times and it survived each time.
Just amazed that something this inexpensive can work/last so long.
This is an awesome training drone. I am going to be moving up to a fancier drone since I like the hobby so much.

text: I got two of these (one for my husband and one for my father) as Christmas gifts and they were greatly appreciated. My husband got his stuck in several trees and had to leave it hanging overnight a couple of times before he could get it down, and my father flew his right into a river, and both of them performed much better than I had anticipated. Sadly, after about a month, both of them started having some motor issues. For the price, this is a great beginner drone. It is very lightweight, so the wind can really knock it around, but it also can take a good crash landing without any damage. I recommend ordering some spare batteries, though, because seven minutes passes quick when you're having fun. The camera is the best feature. It takes surprisingly high quality video--much better than I had anticipated. It records sound, but that doesn't do you much good because it's really overwhelmed by the sound of the thing flying.

title: Hours of enjoyment (a few minutes at a time)
text:
If you want to spend fifty bucks on a toy that is easy and fun to fly then this is for you!

It is truly a blast to fly! It is easy enough to fly that you can pass the controls around at a party and almost anyone can quickly get the hang of it.

Flying in a stiff breeze is more tricky but that's part of the fun. Be careful of getting it up too high unless you have a lot of open space. The winds a few hundred feet up can be a lot stronger than they are on the ground. I got it up above the tree line and the wind took it away and even with full control input it couldn't make it back! Fortunately it survived the inevitable plummet to earth and I found it over a block away.

It is sturdy enough that it was survived every encounter with tree limbs, walls, and the ground. I haven't even had to use the spare props yet. The grass in a lawn or field seems to be enough to cushion most falls. Don't fly it into something at full speed though. The plastic isn't that thick.

The camera adds more fun, though the quality is only fair. Don't expect IMAX, but it is more than good enough for capturing scenes from up high in a way that you otherwise can't. The camera looks in a fixed forward direction so every twitch of the controls leads to camera shake and direction change. I find a slow 360 degree rotation (camera pan) a hundred feet or so over the house is quite satisfying. At first the camera controls are a bit confusing (more than once I turned off the power instead of the camera) and you must remember starting and stopping video recording. If the battery gives out while recording you often end up with a 0 length file and your video is lost.

Stock battery life is short enough that it leaves you wanting more. You get about 3 seconds between realizing that the battery is giving out and when it falls like a rock. Keep it close when you think time is almost up. A spare battery (or two) are needed if you are going to fly this away from a charger or want to pass it around at a park.

So if you are not expecting all of the features that you have read about or seen in drones costing several hundred dollars (GPS fence, return to home, gimbal cameras, etc.) and just want some good fun on the cheap, the X5C can't be beat!

title: it's a great gift for anyone who wants something to start with
text: My other drone fanatic family members couldn't believe that this thing was $35. Seriously, it's a great gift for anyone who wants something to start with. The controls are a little confusing, the camera has surprisingly good quality but is difficult to manipulate, and the battery life is poor. It has a lot of speed and goes really high. The quality is pretty cheap but it does work well so you can't argue with that! It has also taken a couple of crashes and kept on whirring! You can always buy additional batteries (very cheap) and have a lot of flying fun! Buy this before you drop any amount of serious money into a drone. It is a great way to figure out what you want!

title: My first drone!
text: You have no idea how many reviews and YouTube videos I watched before buying the Syma and I was not disappointed!  For the price you can't go wrong.  Get the extra blades and batteries, since battery life is about 8 minutes.  This drone is great for a beginner. It takes a beating and keeps going.  The camera is pretty good as well.  Be sure to download the app from iTunes so you can see what the drone sees.  Once I master flying this I'll graduate to a phantom.

title: Great first drone to learn on
text:
I run a video production company and had clients constantly bugging me to start offering drone footage, but I had literally zero experience flying one. A good friend of mine who races drones convinced me to to get one of these to learn to fly on before investing on a professional grade drone. This one was the one he learned on, and I definitely can't complain about the price! Still haven't tried the camera this one comes with, but I didn't really buy this model to use the camera, which I am guessing would not pass my quality standards, but this so far is perfect for learning.

Really glad I got this as a practice drone! First flight and I needed to get out a ladder to retrieve it. This one seems decently heavy duty as I lightly crashed it a few times with no issues before starting to get the hang of it. From what I can tell this is going to be a great first drone, and already has me wanting to master flying it to get more into this as a hobby. Already saving for a DJI Phantom 3 4k for after I finish mastering this little guy!

When doing video, it does take quite a bit of coordination to have it pointed in the right direction, buy hey, it is like I said, entry level.  The video is actually quite good, though as others have said, pretty much outdoor only, as it doesn't do well in low light.  Maybe because I'm a novice at this, I did find that it's too hard for me to fly in anything over @5mph wind. However, when it's calm out, it does great! This little guy has me hooked and will be looking to step up to one of the "big boys" in the near future.

title: Good indoor/outdoor toy quad
text: Excellent little quad with surprisingly good camera. The only drawbacks are it is so light that small amounts of wind affect it and can make it uncontrollable. Secondly the range is very short for a 2.4 ghz RC. When the quad loses signal it lowers the speed on the props for a slow descent till it can reacquire signal. If you lose signal by flying too high on a breezy day the wind can carry the quad out of control range laterally before it can descend into range.

title: Easy to setup / Cam not working
text: Great product so far.  I got the thing running without reading the manual and have it all calibrated.  Tomorrow i will try it outside if its not raining or windy.  The only bad thing is the battery doesn't last to long that's why i bought the  extra batteries with the higher amps because it takes little over an hour to charge. Now i can charge 6 at a time.  Flew it today but really windy so I stayed low.  I did notice the camera not working. The light stays green after pushing switch to turn on video or pic.  I took out the pin connector on cam and noticed the yellow wire pin was pushed down into the connector.  I know i can fix this, I don't really want to return it i'm afraid i'll have other problems with motors not working or the same issue.  I will drop 3 stars for them not testing there product. because that's the main reason i bought this.

title: Tons of fun
text: Buy extra batteries and a charger with multiple ports. It takes some practice to fly but the learning curve is not bad at all. I was able to fly mine for an hour while cycling the batteries through the multiple port battery charger. It is light and doesn't do too well in winds stronger than 10 MPH. Not my first drone flyer but it's by far my most favorite. The  I didn't give it 5 stars because the battery life was horrible. But the extra batteries to cycle through made this a worthwhile investment. The lithium batteries do get hot after they run out in the drone. Not sure if it will do more than get really hot but I fly my drone in my yard.

title: Its a very good starter drone
text: Its a very good starter drone. It is very cheap and will help you learn to get the feel and the experience of flying a drone. It does not break easily and is good for many, many hours of practice. It is also very durable, so after a couple of small crashes it wont break. That does not mean that if you fly it as high as it can go, and just let it drop it wont break; but if you accidentally thing run it in to a wall it wont be completely ruined. I would definitely  recommend this for someone who has never had a drone before and wants to get into it.

title: Great quad for the money
text:
Its great for the money. Don't fly it inside. When you take it out of the box write your name and cell number with a sharpie on the helicopter. DO NOT USE the blade guards- they will get you stuck in a tree for eternity. ALSO use some tape to keep the battery compartment shut- the vibration may cause it to open. STAY AWAY FROM TREES, HIGHWAYS, AND WATER!
Best $50 toy I have ever had- and I have had a lot of $50 dollar toys.
I lost mine since I wanted to go real high and see how far it could go. I have searched now for 3 days and used Google satellite to narrow down a wreckage field. I have had no luck. I just purchased another one.
I thought about the x8c ($120 with new batteries), the DJI 3 ($450 and is awesome), and the X5c-1 ($55)
I bought the X5C-1 since it was so awesome already. If I lose another I will simply forego the bar that night and buy another one!

text: I bought this for my 12 year old grandson and he loved it!  Unfortunately, he flew it a bit too high and it landed in a very tall tree the day after he got it.  A little over a month later, the tree lost its leaves and the strong winds blew the Syma out of the tree.  My grandson found it, and amazingly it still worked and looked as good as new.  He is still flying it, crashing it, and loving it, and it is still working!!  It survived the rain, wind and snow, and my grandson!!  Great product!!

title: He thinks its easy to fly after some practice

text: Well, love the size and power, but it was only about 5 weeks before parts of it broke and it can't be used anymore. Just really disappointed that we wasted our money and that our son can't even use his bday gift anymore.

title: ... my grandsons birthday and he said the camera worked great and the drone its self flew very smooth
text: i got this drone for my grandsons birthday and he said the camera worked great and the drone its self flew very smooth. i recommend this product if you are a beginner. dont listen to the 14+ in age if this is my product i will say 10+.

title: Lot of fun for not a lot of dough.
text:
First "drone" for me. They looked like fun but too pricey. This one has the right price and fills the fun factor. I'm sure it'll be a lot more fun as soon as I learn to fly it and that task looks simple enough so far. I fly over a dirt area and have crashed more than many times. Not one problem other than some dirt getting in the gearing now and then.

My biggest 'complaint' is it doesn't come with 6 extra batts. Haha! Buy extras! I haven't tried the cam yet - waiting on the batts I ordered.

Mine came with the extra blades (under the plastic package tray) and an 8G SD card in the camera. Only thing I needed to do was pop on the blade guards and I was off and running. The batt charges nicely thru my phone's USB wall charger. My extra batts will arrive tomorrow.

Like I said, I'm new to this game but this feels like a great choice for a noob like me. Lot of fun for not a lot of dough.

title: Best $50 you can spend
text: Best $50 you can spend; so much fun and an excellent intro to the exciting world of drones for very little money.  Don't buy extra props, it comes with extras and they never break.  Buy many extra batteries so the fun can keep going.  The Male plug on the battery barely fits into the female plug, so use a razor blade to trim the tiny bumps on both sides of the male plug and you will have better contact.  Be careful of flying too far or too high, it will get out of range and fly pretty far before it falls from the sky.  Don't use the prop guards at all; they will hang it in a tree! They also make it sluggish and consume the batteries too fast.  Mine hung in a tree for over 2 weeks, through many big spring rains, and when I got it down, it still worked!  Amazing.

title: Fun drone!
text: Works well. Controlling it takes practice. About 10 min play per battery charge. Fun drone!

title: Short time battery
text: Easy to operate and ready to use.  Battery doesn't last very long.

title: Great Value
text:
I understand complaints if it fails to operate, but complaints about the video quality, that it is difficult to control, or that the wind took it away are really unwarranted. What kind of quality of pictures did you expect a $25 drone to be able to take? You bought the cheapest drone on the market... you get what you pay for.

If you have difficulty controlling it, you just need experience. It will drift, it can be touchy, but again... you get what you pay for.

I believe you get a ton of value out of this drone and would recommend it to anyone wanting to try out the drone craze. Just know that it is not going to compete with more expensive drones.

title: His first flight was fairly successful but short as the battery life is not great, so while it was charging we looked at ...
text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas , he was so excited and charged it right away eager to use it. We soon found out there is definitely a learning curve to flying these things. His first flight was fairly successful but short as the battery life is not great, so while it was charging we looked at the video we had taken and were fairly impressed with the quality(remember this is not an expensive drone so for a cheap camera it wasn't bad.) Second flight did not go well, and it got stuck way up in a tree and there it stayed for 2 days in the rain until finally it was blown down to a lower branch and we were able to retrieve it. It was missing one of the propeller guards but otherwise worked perfectly, we were even able to watch the video it getting stuck in the tree. I would not recommend flying them if its windy as they take of on you and are difficult to control as they are so light weight. Overall a fun little drone for the price. We even bought a second one so we can both fly them together.

title: So much fun!
text:
I cannot get over how fun this is! It took a few flights for me to get a hang of it, but I am not confident in my flying skills! It has survived a few hard landings, even on my neighbor's driveway.

The assembly is easy and comes with extra propellers, which is great. I haven't had to use them yet, but if I try and let someone fly it, I may need them.

Charging is easy, but it does take a while. However, you can purchase additional batteries to swap out instead of waiting 75 minutes for it to recharge.

The memory card that comes with it may need to be formatted before you can use it, so check on your computer first.

In addition, it saves the videos in a .mov file, which my MAC converts in order for me to view. I cannot import it directly on my iPad, but that isn't the worst thing in the world.

I do think that there should be more options of a status that shows whether you are recording or not. Maybe a light or information on the remote. However, for the price it cannot be beat!

title: Best of the inexpensive drones.  Surprisingly stable.
text:
I picked this up mostly because it was on sale at a great price and seemed to have pretty decent reviews.

Having flown many inexpensive drones in the past, I was really pleasantly surprised with this unit. I found it to be far superior to most of teh others in its class. Indoors first where it is easily controlled and keeps a nice locked hoover in position. Took it outside where there was a bit of a breeze and where many similar units would not do well at all. While alot of the power was being used to maintain stability, it did just that.

If you have not played with an inexpensive drone in the last year or so, because most of them are indeed junk, you might want to give this one a try. While certainly not a DJI Phantom, and not nearly as costly either, you may be pleasantly surprised.

title: Best Christmas present ever
text: Best Christmas present ever! Been flying and crashing this for almost a year now, indoors and outdoors. My flying skills have come a long way after countless crashes. I've only broken one prop, which simply astounds me. I'm so confident in the durability of the thing I'm quite happy to let complete strangers have a go and crash it all over the place. Having had a chance to fly a 'proper' quad-copter a few months back (the Typhoon 4K) I have to say, yes... one of these will provide you with way more skill than you need to get one of those off of the ground... but you will have a LOT more fun flying your Syma. Sure, the camera is pretty crappy and the novelty of buzzy aerial shots wears off quick, but you'll likely be removing the camera, prop guards and landing struts before you know it anyway to squeeze a few extra minutes of flight time / speed out of it. Only spend a lot of money on a fancy quad if you want to do serious filming. If you're in it for the thrill, just get one of these!

If the company gets it fixed for us, I'll update this review to five stars for sure.

text: Great little drone. Sturdy, but light. Can take it up real high and let it drop down without problem. Sometimes, video files on the card cannot be viewed due to errors, but overall, it's a fun drone.

title: The easiest toy quad to fly out of the box-period!
text: This small rc quad is so ridiculously easy to fly, that it almost seems wrong! I have the larger drones of 300 & 500 size, but this quad is just so easy to throw a battery in it, take it about anywhere & fly it. It comes with a small camera mounted on it that takes either still or video shots, and surprisingly decent for the price quality of pics/video. The only drawback is the 3.7 volt battery run time- approx. 5-7 minutes depending on wind conditions.  Also, keep in mind, when the battery gets below a preset voltage, it drops without any warning.. Buy a half dozen or more 600-650 mah spare batteries & good multi battery charger and you'll have a ton of fun with it. Also a side note- write your name & phone number on it with a black fine tip Sharpie in case you lose sight of it & can't locate it. With any luck, somebody might just give you a call.

title: Will buy again!
text: Bought this for my boyfriend for Valentine's Day and he loved it!  We got a lot of fun out of it, flying in the backyard and even took it to the local park.  Unfortunately, we got it stuck in a very, very tall tree, but that's not the drone's fault!  Definitely will be ordering another one.

title: Great starter quad copter.
text: Bought this quad copter as a trainer before I invest in the expensive one. It is easy to fly and it takes some practice and user calibration until you get it right. It has stood up to several crashes without noticeable damage. I got it for $10 during some crazy Amazon sale, but I'd spend the $50-$60 easily for this unit. It doesn't take long to figure it out.

title: Four Stars
text: Works very good.

title: Really a great deal to learn to fly a drone.
text:
What a great deal.
Everyone was correct in their reviews. My 16 year old nephew was very satisfied. Unbelievable starter drone. Flew well outside even in a slight breeze. Good stability. Great lights on the bottom for flying in the evening and for orientation. AND a camera with a SIM card for recording!!! The quality was amazing for the price we paid.
I will say that you have to catch on a little quickly to be able to fly it well.
We crashed it a few times and it was undamaged each time.
We ordered 2. One had a problem with the easy USB charger but Amazon made it a breeze to exchange!! Thank you very much Amazon you have a wonderful exchange policy!!!!

title: Save Your Money
text: Illegible instructions, poor performance, not durable at all. An engine burned out within two hours of receipt. I was unable to decipher the manual I received and was forced to learn what I could online. The copter never truly was stable and the remote had a very limited range. I would not purchase again.

title: Very nice starter but it for my girlfriends son to evaluate ...
text: Very nice starter but it for my girlfriends son to evaluate his interest works great and has held up very well.

title: Very good "first" quad copter
text:
Ordered on 7-13-15, received on 7-15-15. Preface: I have never flown a quad copter before but I have a few hours in "real" turbine helicopters. I bought this to train with prior to upgrading to a larger, more capable quad.
The box arrived in good shape and the quad was well packaged. The camera was already attached as were the landing legs. The only assembly required was to add the propeller (rookie) guards which took about 2 minutes using the included screwdriver. A set of 4 spare props was included.
The 1st thing I did was to remove the camera which I knew I wouldn't be using for awhile. I then took out the battery and began charging it using the included USB cable which I plugged into the wall socket for my I-phone. The plug for the battery is tiny- if you can't grab it with your fingers, use needle-nose pliers carefully. If you pull on the wires, they might come out of the plug, and then you are fubar.
While the copter battery was charging I put 4 new AA batteries in the transmitter. Don't skimp here, lousy batteries might affect the performance of the transmitter. When you turn it on you will hear a loud beep and the green light above the switch will come on and flash and the LCD screen will light up- that's good. After about 10 mins of charging I put the copter battery back in so I could see if everything was working.
To bind or "pair" the transmitter to the copter, turn the copter switch to "ON" while it is on a level surface. All of the LED's should flash. Then turn the transmitter on and push the left stick all the way forward- it should beep. Then pull all the way back and it should beep again and the green light should stay solid green. The copter LED's should stop flashing and remain on if you were successful. If you did this while the copter was not level, it won't fly correctly.
I then went out to my back patio to see what this thing would do. I pushed the throttle (left) stick forward slightly and all props came on instantly. I advanced farther until the quad was just above the ground a few inches. It immediately began to drift forward so I set it back down and pushed the "forward/backward" trim switch in the opposite direction of the drift. (It's the chrome switch between the right stick and ON-OFF switch). On the right side of the LCD screen you will see 2 vertical lines. As you repeatedly push the trim switch you will see small boxes appear between the lines to show you where you have the trim set. The same applies for the two horizontal lines at the bottom of the LCD screen. The pair on the right indicate the left/right bank trim, set by the switch underneath the right stick.
I lifted off again and it was now drifting to the right. I repeated the process for the left/right trim. The objective of trimming is to get the quad to hover by itself in calm wind with the least pilot input. I took off again and practiced hovering for a little while and then moved into the yard to see how it flew forwards and backwards, left and right. I tried to stay no more than about 5 feet off the ground. I was quite surprised how easy it was to control but I did have a few minor crashes. Clearly it will take more time to master but I was able to keep it in the backyard and out of the trees.
When I get better, I'll take off the rookie guards, and try out the camera. So far everything seems to work as it should so I have no complaints and am very happy. As others have said, this thing is really fun and addictive and a good value for the price. I recommend that you mark the front and rear with colored tape or paint so you can tell which end is the front. I'll post more as time goes by.
UPDATE: 7-24-15: After a few more minor crashes, one of the wires came off the on/off switch on the copter. I opened it and discovered it was due to a cold solder joint. I re soldered it and it works fine! Also, the receptacle plug that the battery plugs into came loose so I epoxied it in place.
Gotta take a star off for those manufacturing defects. However, even after lots of crashes it still flys fine. The only "flying" issue I have with it is that it's impossible to maintain a hover at a constant altitude. No matter how still the copter remains it constantly wants to climb or descend. I'm just chalking it up to being a cheap quadcopter- I don't expect DJI 3 performance from it.
I installed the camera and it works just like it should. The video quality is amazing for such a tiny camera! It's not GoPro quality but its great if you just want to inspect your roof, neighborhood from the air or play around. Of course without a gimbal the video is only as steady as your flying but for the price it's a great value.

BUT I purchased two more batteries for 6.99 so I can just plug another one in and get going again. Only thing I recommend is to not go really high at first until you get the hang of it. Because you can't see which is the front of the drone so you try to figure it out while it's 100s of feet in the air. It's kinda difficult for first time flyers at the height. Great product, highly recommended by me. Plus the lights are pretty cool at night as well. Hope this helps.

title: Great drone for beginners
text:
After reading most of the reviews I reluctantly purchased the Symantec X5C. I am so glad I did. The instructions are in horrible English but there are many good YouTube videos about setup and flying. The camera did not work initially so I decided to fly it without the camera making it lighter and more maneuverable. To my surprise the camera started working (probably newbie user error). It takes very good pictures and videos but is definitely not HD.

I have experimented with RC planes and helicopters but am not a veteran flyer. I found the Symantec X5C easier to fly than RC planes or helicopters. If you are a newbie keep the drone properly oriented (camera facing away from you) and the controls will be very intuitive. Start practicing in a small space and graduate to large fields. This craft is very light so don't fly on windy days. Excellent drone for beginners. Well worth the price ($48 July 2015) for a drone, camera, battery, charger, micro SD card, some spare parts and a small screwdriver. Wouldn't hesitate to buy the Symantec X5C as a gift for someone interested in learning to fly drones.

title: Received X5C-1
text:
I requested and received this as a Christmas gift and can confirm that, at least in my case, I received the X5C-1 (upgraded) model.

I have personally owned, built and sold, flown, and crashed DJI Phantoms, scratch-built 3D printed Hoverships (250mm), several Blade Nanos, and scratch-built micro (150mm) rigs with and without FPV.

I've had the most fun with this little Syma simply due to the price point: I don't mind losing or destroying a $50 quad! With bigger or more expensive quads, I've always had a bit of anxiety while flying due to the fear of a crash or flyoff. When I fly the X5, I just have fun!

The video is surprisingly good, and the flight characteristics are much better than similarly priced Hubsans. I wouldn't say it maneuvers as well as a Blade Nano, but I honestly have no complaints!

title: Great value for your first drone.
text:
I was able to get it flying right out of the box. If you know Xbox or ps3/4 controls you will be fine. The camera comes with a 4mb micro SD card and the video is ok.

The only two negatives...
1. The instructions are poorly written. If you need help go to youtube.
2. It's very light, a wind gust will take it a couple of hundred meters

title: Awesome Flying Machine!
text: This is a great little drone for people with no experience flying anything. I am terrible at video-games, but I have been able to fly this little drone with only a few practices. One thing I would recommend it to wait for a day that is not windy. It can get carried away in a snap. Also, fly it low for a while until you get used to it. Taking pictures and video is super easy, just push the C button up for photos and down for videos. The videos come out in avi files so I had to download a VLC player on my MAC. But that's no big deal. Photos and videos are very clear! The reviewers say there are no instructions. Mine came with a pretty detailed booklet actually that explains it all. Also, a lot of reviewers seem to by flying it in their yards. I would recommend you go to an open field where the grass is cut because on my first solo flight I just about got it stuck in a very tall tree. Thankfully, I was ably to fly it out of there and get it back down. Some of the reviewers say it's a toy. But be careful to let children use it. It clearly says on the box that it's for 14 and up. My 4 year old grandson flew it way up into the sky on a windy day. Well, good thing it got caught by  hill. So my recommendation is: Easy does it! Fly low for a while. Also, before you buy, realize that the flying time is 7-10 minutes and the recharging takes an hour or so. I am a teacher and am now thinking about how to use this with my students.

title: Indestructible

title: Early Disappointment - 2 minutes out of the box and a motor failed!
text: Did not get more than 2 minutes use out of the Syma X5C quadcopter when one electric motor stopped working.  Never got the product more than 12 inches off the floor inside the house while attempting to learn controls and adjust the trim for forward/backward and left/right. (which was not easy to accomplish and I never did) I have experience with several other RC helicopters so I was not overly aggressive with the controls.  It did not sustain any outward physical damage after dropping approximately 6-8 inches while I was attempting to make trim adjustments so I can only assume that some internal wiring disconnected.  Also could not find any information or instructions in the manual on how the camera operated .  Also noticed that the price dropped $3.00 since I ordered two days ago.  It will be returned.

title: Awesome
text:
Been flying RC helis and fixed wing for years. Got this today, charged the batteries, read the instructions, launched it.....all I can say is it was amazing. First flight had to tweek the settings, second flight a pure joy.
I received the upgraded version although it did not state the -1 model.
Buy it, you will be glad you did.

But even under calm wind conditions it just doesn't perform well at all.  Also, the camera is lousy.  The colors are unpredictable and look washed out.  I wish I had paid a little more and gotten something I could be happy with.

But one of the white plastic rib is already broken.  As a result, it can no longer hold balance, therefore can not be flying anymore.  A real disappointment.

title: came missing a part and mostly cannot be used, it's going in the trash eventually.
text: mine arrived missing a screw for one of the blade protectors which means it will not fly straight. I am experimenting with putting tiny pieces of tape on that arm to balance the unit out but so far all it does is fly towards the side of the missing screw. I guess the balance of this gyro is very very critical to be able to fly it at all. I dont think trim can fix the weight imbalance and the screw is too tiny to find at the local hardware store, it's a little bigger than one in your glasses hinges.

found it still in one piece. Somehow it survived the combine. gave it a good cleaning and it still works like new. great fun! I would recommend this quad copter to anyone wanting to play.
Signed 26 years in RC

title: It's okay for a beginner. But, I'd rather ...
text: It's okay for a beginner. But, I'd rather spend a little more for more stability. BTW, it has a lousy camera. I don't think the reviewers are posting the real pictures unless SYMA changed the cameras.

title: Good for beginners
text: I bought two of these, one for my husband and one for my son.  These things can range in price and with my husband and son being beginners at flying drones I felt this drone was a decent price-not the cheapest, but not the most expensive either.  There are many buttons on the remotes, which means they need to play with it to figure out how to fly it because given they are men they are not going to read the directions.  The battery does not last very long, 10 minutes at the most.  My husband took it outside for the first time yesterday and he said he does know how others keep them stabilized in the wind because he kind of went anywhere when the wind blew.  However, as I stated above, they will have to play with them to figure them out ;-).

Only downside is battery lasts about 7 minutes each flight - so be prepared to buy extra batts so you don't have to put this bad boy down.

title: This quad is a great and durable
text:
I bought the for my son for his birthday, works great, very durable. I don't know about some of the reviews on here, I'm an Amazon Prime customer, so this is a "REAL REVIEW" Small quads can't be used with high winds, it is very light, common sence. Stay away from trees, down drafts can land your quad in the tree, as my son found out. It was stuck in an 80 foot Ash tree, it was stuck there for 3 days. Needless to say, thanks to our neighbor (ex tree service guy), he cut the main limb that it was stuck and as it fell, the quad glided out of tree to the ground. NO Damage at all. By the way the weather was cold, 27° and it also rained for 24 hours, cold and water didn't hurt it.
You can also get all the repair parts and extra batteries you need to keep this toy going for very good prices. My son is 16 and can fly this like a pro. So teach younger kids to fly inside first, it bounces so it doesn't break things in your house. The camera works great, and has sound, but all you hear is the drone. This is a great TRAINING DRONE

title: Four Stars

title: So much fun!
text:
Let me start off by saying that we've only owned this drone for one evening but it's already proved it's worth. After attaching the rotor guards and inserting a fresh battery we were ready to go. Began in the large living room just trying to get a feel for the thing. It's very responsive and easy to contol, but far more advanced than the basic RC helicopters we've flown in the past. The fact this this drone can rotate and turn adds a new degree of difficulty, but it's fine once you get the hang of it.
Take time to read the manual. The remote has a bunch of functions that are not clearly marked.
Once the wind died down we took it outside for a dusk flight. This is where the fast mode really shines. As long as you keep it within thirty yards of the remote you are good to go. Push it to 50 and you may lose it. I have a nice half acre hill on the back of my property and it was perfect.
The camera on the drone flashes to indicate if it's recording which is nice. If you take the camera off, which is pretty easy, the drone can do flips with the push of a button. Very impressive and cool.
We bought an external charger which came with five 700mha batteries. I can't recommend this enough. If tonight is any indication then this thing is going to be getting a lot of use in the future.
I'll be sure to post a follow up review, but for $40 I don't see how you can go wrong. Spend an extra $20 on batteries and you'll have a very nice flight system that will bring you a good hours worth of entertainment.
Tip. If flying outside, make sure the wind is very calm and you have lots of open space. Always take off into the wind and orient yourself to the drone so that the flight control is natural. Don't go full throttle either. Good flight is all about balance and small movements until you gain confidence and control. Happy flying!

title: I'm having so much fun flying this toy
text:
This is my 2nd X5C, the first one flew out of range then dropped onto one of my neighbors trees never to be seen again.

I'm having so much fun flying this toy, the video quality is surprising good and has sound which is a waste as all you hear is the motors.

I found it's best to fly this toy outside as hard knocks against furniture seems to break the motors yet they survive falling 100 feet out of the sky. If you have a soldering iron it's quick and easy to replace the motors.

Also it's best to fly when there's little or no wind since it's very light and once you're above 20 feet in anything over 15mph you'll just be fighting the wind.

I crashed this into my pool and had to fish it out from the botton with a net, after drying it off it flew perfectly again but the camera has moisture in it still and is a bit cloudy but for $50 I'm impressed

title: Fun, sturdy, a good buy!
text:
So, I saw a brief article somewhere mentioning how much fun this was. Having never owned a RC aircraft of any kind, I ordered it and it arrived quickly and intact. First couple of flights resulted in some substantial crashes but the Syma survived OK. Subsequent flights also included crashes, a recovery from a tree among them, but it survives still. After ordering I thought about trying it out and possibly getting one for my 8yo grandson as well as he loves RC toys. Well, I won't be doing that. It does take some considerable finesse on the controls to keep the craft going where you want it to go, especially the throttle. Beyond the abilities of most 8yo I suspect. It is very light so any amount of wind really blows it around. But, it will handle some wind if the pilot is sufficiently skilled. I haven't quite arrived at that level yet :-) In summary, if you want to try out a quadcopter, this is a good place to start, especially at the price. The camera works OK but don't really expect HD. Vids are pretty grainy but it's fun to see what your piloting looks like from the craft's perspective. Now, I'm thinking of what quad to get next!

Quick update... After a dozen flights or so, one of the motors failed. Apparently they are easily damaged if a prop is prevented from spinning with power on, for example in event of a crash landing. So, if you crash it, immediately move throttle to OFF position. And, buy a couple of replacement motors. Giantex is going to replace my quadcopter bit I'll be prepared to make future repairs as needed!

title: I lost two of these to flyaways because the transmitter's range wasn't up to spec.
text:
Don't even think about flying this any distance from you, unless you are in a huge wide open field. On two occasions, with the original drone and then again with a replacement, at about 100' (2/3 of the stated range of 50m) I watched as my drone flew up and far away never to be seen again.

I've since discovered that the antenna for the transmitter has been underdesigned and that simply soldering on an extension can double it's range. Why Syma chose not to spend the extra 2¢ is a mystery, but it is what it is.

Were it not for this fatal flaw, I would be giving this five stars.

title: Drone was fun until it took off

title: Fun.  But a toy so don't expect too much.
text:
Fun for a while - not really a serious "drone". I got one and so did my brother and sister. You certainly need to buy some extra batteries to make sure you can fly them uninterrupted. These are easy to crash and the engines burn up quickly if you get them stuck and try to spin them too much. I was able to get a replacement engine and then solder it in but my brother didn't know how so his is now useless.

Warning: These are cheap Chinese electronics -- my first order came with a remote that immediately started overheating (even when off) and probably could have done some serious damage if I didn't notice it right away. Seller replaced it with no hassle. Be careful though.

title: Great FIRST inexpensive drone, but fly it in an open field! I lost mine very quickly in the wind.
text:
My four star rating is based on an item price of under fifty bucks.

Great first inexpensive drone, but fly it in a large open field! I lost mine after a few flights and it's stuck in a tree with no way for me to get it down. Runs about 7-8 mins on a battery. Buy more batteries. Camera is OK, not great, but at this pricepoint I had no complaints. It worked well with a 32GB class 10 micro SD card as well. Sometimes it would need to take a break, even though I had more batteries ready. Maybe it was overheating?

My biggest gripe is that it was very easily blown away in the wind, to a degree that the engines could not compensate adequately. This isn't surprising since it only weighs a few ounces, so don't even bother flying unless the air is still.

Overall, it's a great starter drone, but I will probably try something a little nicer the next time around.

title: Flew off on it's own!

title: *THE* Starter quad. Very glad I picked this one.
text:
This has been one of my best Amazon purchases. It has been said many, many times, but if you are looking to get into QuadCopter flying, this is a fantastic unit.

The Good:
Power - This little unit can fly as quickly and aggressively as I would expect any beginner would want it to go. The ability to change between precise and fast flying modes is not a gimmick; I've found it quite useful.
Durability - Except for my note below, this unit has held up well to several medium (3-5 meter) crashes. Pick it up, set it flat, and keep flying. I purchased spare blades but haven't needed to replace them yet.
Camera - The quality of the camera itself is pretty decent, considering the price of this unit. The pictures are rather high-resolution and the video is on par with a low-end cellphone.

The not-so-good:
Card Reader - Throw this thing away. It looks like a spare piece of plastic, but I was surprised to find out that it's actually USB reader for the included flash card. It does actually work. Or it did, for about 10 pictures. Fly all day, plug this card into your computer: Bam! All photos on the card are now corrupted. If you actually want to use the camera and card included in this kit, get something like [[ASIN:B009D79VH4 Transcend Information USB 3.0 Card Reader (TS-RDF5K)]] which works like a charm.
Video - This tiny camera is mounted on a tiny copter, and by very nature of the way this unit flies and requires adjustments, the camera footage ends up being very jerky and erratic. Also, the sound is pretty much just "the sound of the 4 motors," which, while it adds to the ambiance and excitement of the video, doesn't really let you hear anything else.
Camera Mount - You can fly this unit without the camera to make it more agile, have battery life, and even unlock special flight maneuvers that are disabled when the camera is connected. The camera is connected to the battery cover with screws (tiny, tiny little screws) that you will probably not want to mess with in the field, if at all. Fortunately, the camera can be disconnected in about 3 seconds by just removing the battery cover. Unfortunately, now there is nothing holding the battery in place (and yes, it will fly out). If this unit came with a spare battery cover, it would make adding and removing the camera much easier.

******
This unit took a crash from about 5-6 meters onto a grassy field and has started experiencing a problem with one of its rotors. It will not level itself out, but the unit appears to be capable of sending full power to that rotor if the accelerometer is activated. My brother has an identical unit and, after letting little kids fly (and crash) it at the park, it is experiencing nearly identical symptoms. I have not yet opened this unit up or done much more than a cursory field diagnosis; I will update this ticket when I have more information.

title: Did not work for us

title: Love this toy.
text: This quadcopter is very nice. Great quality all around. Very durable and takes an awesome pic.

title: So easy to fly!  So difficult to master
text:
I have previously only flown a guadrocopter I bought for my dad a while back. The thing was impossible to fly and we couldn't even start to calibrate or adjust before it would crash. The X5C made me feel like a pilot master. It flies very steady and I was easily able to control it to fly around inside of my house, even performing flips. Of course, it's taking me some time to familiarize myself when the copter is oriented differently than my body. The battery lasts for 7-10 minutes, but unless you're constantly flying, it feels like plenty of time to give it a few good crashes. I would recommend an extra battery or two to swap out when having fun.

Leaving off the blade guards and removing the camera saves battery life and makes the copter much zippier. Enabling the fast (high) mode with these off makes it very responsive and fast!

title: Not bad for the price
text: Easy to fly right out of the box. Being a beginner I was nervous, but on a calm day anyone can fly this. Battery life is short, camera is ok and the quad can take a good beating. I wish the camera was not angled down, but oh well, for the price I can't complain.  One last note, the camera function is a little tricky but once you get it figured out its fine. Sometimes when trying to review the video I get error messages saying invalid format. Not sure what that is all about. Overall it is fun at a cheap price.

title: Lots of Fun at Cheap Price - Not a Toy
text:
Ready to fly right out of the box. This is not a toy that will break after a few flights. Easy for a beginner to fly yet challenging for a more advanced drone pilot. Comes with memory card battery even a a screwdriver. Add your own AA batteries for the transmitter. With the blade guards attached (recommended), it can withstand most bumps and crashes. Two modes - high and low sensitivity. LCD screen showing trim points. Camera mode is not his res as advertised but still works well enough.

I gave them away for new clients at a trade show. The quad is on top of the boxes with it's lights flashing. Great attention getter!

title: Great fun - highly recommend!
text:
At just over $40, I'm super impressed. This is my first drone. Had the trim worked out and was able to hover indoors pretty quickly. Got cocky and took it outside on a windy day - flew it way up and over my head, got completely disorientated, panicked and turned throttle off, and it fell in a tree (see the video, lol). Climbed the tree and retrieved it - no damage. This thing is tough! Now I'm able to fly, record mediocre but adequate video, do loops - I've got a long way to go, but so far so good!

Highly recommend upgrading the batteries to 700mAh. I got one of the 5 way chargers with 5 batteries for $20. It flies for 10 minutes or so with these, up from 7-8 with the original battery.

title: Great little toy...worth the purchase!
text: Great little entry level drone.  The camera is not the greatest but I bought it mostly to get used to flying a drone.  It comes with a remote control.  I found the key is most new drone owners move the controls too much.  Make small movements until you get used to the drone and then maybe you can race your neighbor.  The batters allow for about 6 to 8 minutes...if you are going to fly it any distance I would be heading back to the take off spot after about 5 minutes. The camera is not great but I mostly wanted this low end drone to practice flying.  I have found that the extra (and I do recommend extras) batteries you can buy for this unit don't all give you the same amount of time.  I highly recommend this drone as a starter.
