title: A definite must buy for new pilots and great fun for experienced ones.
text:
I had to take a moment and write a review for this drone. I learned to fly with this quad and have had it for a year now. I've crashed it dozens of times and it keeps going. It flies GREAT (except in the wind of course). The flip option it is great too.

If you are new to drones this is the one you want. And, if you are an experienced drone pilot this will be like the old friend that you enjoyo being with.

title: Great sturdy drone
text: Bought this for my 12 yr old daughter for Christmas. She loves it and it took some time to learn how to control it but she has got the hang of it within a few hrs. Not sure of the camera quality as we have not looked at that part yet. Over all a great buy and sturdy drone.

title: Great indoor/outdoor copter for beginners
text: Great indoor/outdoor copter for beginners. It can take a while to learn so be careful when you fly it indoors. This product is very light so if you do fly it outdoors, be careful not to fly it in windy or even breezy conditions. The control on this thing is amazing, I was able to fly it through my house after I learned to control it. The instructions are clear and you can learn how to do a 360 degree flip in any direction.

title: Great first quadcopter.  But need to learn control.
text: New to flying, first 5 mins, it was great then I flew it up, up, and it went away.  Landed in top of a tree 30ft.  Gone for now, but bought another one.  Luckily for me this is not that expensive.  It was fun while it lasted.  Now can't wait for my new order to arrive.

title: Perfect for the Price; Buy Better Batteries
text: I got this as a starter just to try my hand at the quadcopter game. I have to say, I'm very impressed with this machine at this price point. Response is agile, range is more than adequate (I haven't had it go out of range yet) and the stock camera is surprising for this price range. I added different colored tape on the front and back of this copter because I had difficulty distinguishing the direction of the quadcopter at a distance; with the tape, I was able to orient myself in relation to the quadcopter's direction. I once flew this copter so high that I "lost" it (quickly found it a few streets over), but the video shows the controls remained active throughout the flight--which was impressive, considering how far the copter was away from the controller. This little copter is fast and durable: I've crashed it into street lamps at full strafing speed and it's been ok. It came with extra blades, but after 6+ months of rough amateur use, I haven't been forced to replace any blades yet. I would highly suggest buying extra capacity battery packs for this copter as the stock battery leaves more to be desired and you'll want to fly this thing until its dead over and over.

title: Five Stars
text: this is the perfect drone for beginners and the camera takes good pictures and videos

title: Five Stars
text: the best low coast drone out there. great trainer... for the money, its the way to go....

title: The video is decent and gives a good quality picture
text: The picture does not do the X5C justice it comes with Prop protectors and an extra set of 4 props! The video is decent and gives a good quality picture... I wasn't expecting a Hollywood pic clarity either.. we were looking for a starter quad just to quench our appetite as to what all the fuss is all about when it comes to drones... OMG it has opened a brave new world... the X5C is just a toy but it teaches fundamentals that have real world applications.... we are hooked and will continue to expand our drone knowledge who knows we may just bump into a new business!

title: Flies well, video quality is meh.
text: It works well for a very basic drone with camera. My son really enjoys it. Don't expect good quality video.

title: Very good value
text: Arrived on time and in excellent condition. My grandson has been using it and tells me it is easy to fly and that the pictures/video is fairly good. The overall value was very good.

title: Five Stars
text: Awesome. Can't beat the performance for $35.

title: He enjoys building things and found this a lot of fun to put together
text: We bought this for our 13-year old son and he loves it.  It takes some time to get used to flying it.  He enjoys building things and found this a lot of fun to put together.

title: Very fun, simple to fly, and worth every penny
text:
This is great. Got this for Christmas. I fly this thing all the time and it's very fun. I had an issue with my home gutters and used this to take video of the problem on my 2nd story roof. That right there made it worth every penny. I did buy some extra batteries though.
Have fun!!!

title: Fun
text: Works quite well. Took a few adjustments to make it fly the way it should but all of that was described in the directions. Comes with one battery that doesn't last but about 10 minutes, so go ahead and get extra batteries. You're going to want them.

title: Get your soldering iron ready.
text:
After 15 batteries worth of flight one motor failed. I soldered a new one on to PCB and called it a day. I purchased two more shortly after. It is extremely responsive and with my unique modifications I'm able to control it even when out of sight.
Edit: After 3 batteries of flight time a motor failed in the most recent one purchased. Lowering to 4 stars. One needs to be able to repair these or know someone who is capable of.

title: He said it's not as fun because the fly time is so short because you ...
text: Bought as a gift for our 10 year old son. He takes it out once in awhile and is getting the hang of it. He said it's not as fun because the fly time is so short because you have to stop and charge it again. Will need to buy additional batteries for this. Hopefully when the weather gets a little nicer, he will play with it more.

title: Great Value
text: Excellent for the money and very durable. My seven loves it.

title: For the price thus maybe a good one to get started and figure out if drones ...
text:
Very wobbly. Does not hover straight. Harder to control than some other more expensive ones. For the price thus maybe a good one to get started and figure out if drones is going to be a hobby for you or not. but you will not get good video feed from it, and you can not keep it straight and stable long enough to do any real flying. It.has a mind of its own. Fun to go play around with young kids who don't have much longer than a 7 minute attention span, which is the battery life anway between charges.
But if you think you want an easy to control drone then you need to spend 2to3 times this for a good one with better calibrated parts.

title: Great
text: Great

title: Well worth it.
text: Surprisingly, an excellent buy. I was super skeptical but my 12 year old son didn't crash or break it in 3 minutes (or at all so far) so that's pretty amazing! We have flown a friend's drown that was extremely difficult to maneuver and cost tripple. Everyone that sees or plays with it can't believe the cost when I tell them. Too bad there isn't a referral program, lol.

title: Great fun toy
text: Great fun toy. It is difficult if there is any wind. I have broke two of these, so need to be careful of who uses it, and avoid windy days. Otherwise it takes surprisingly great photos and video.

title: JUNK be careful
text: You get what you pay for flew it carefully about 6 times. Rotor motor burned up. I even bought extra batteries. Carefully consider this purchase. Cause honestly for a few bucks more you may find a better beginner drone. It may be a best seller but buyer beware. I was going to take it apart but there aren't parts available other than blades and batteries. This was a big disappointment. Even for a veggie drone not worth it.

title: Let the fun begin
text: What a hoot!! Takes a bit to get used to controller, then yahoo and have fun. Battery life is pretty poor, only about 8 mins on a charge. For the money and an entry level drone, is great.

title: Five Stars
text: Lots of fun! Light so it used very little battery and hard to break!

title: A ton of fun!
text: I purchased this as a gift for Christmas, but I think I've played with it more than enough to provide a review!  First, I received the X5C as advertised, not the updated version.  Second, I don't think that really matters for the purpose in which it's being used.  For someone brand new to the quadcopter world, this is great.  It flies even, steady and is very controllable.  My first time flying it was a success without crashing into all the obstructions around me.  I've flown the smaller micro quadcopters and those things are out of control.  This is much more responsive in its handling, and feels like it's built to take a little abuse.  The camera on the one I flew was removed to increase flight time (around 8-9 minutes), but with the camera it was around 7.  Comes with 1 battery and a 2GB micro SD card, 8 propellers, blade guards, remote, copter, and some instructions.  If the instructions aren't clear, youtube some instructional videos, they're helpful.  Would definitely recommend, can't wait to get one of my own now!

title: Best best best start drone
text: I literally dropped this drone 50+ times and never did anything break. Beat beginner drone everrr. Buy now!!! The price is u beatable man. Get it!

title: An absolute blast!
text:
FUN.
I bought two of these for birthday gifts. Both recipients were eager to try out and couldn't wait until done charging.
The price point was perfect for an entry level drone.
Video image quality is impressive.
I just wish there were instructions provided on calibrating and taking the first flight. Very easy to crash over and over...but thankfully it's incredibly durable! Googled instructions...both seems to be getting the hang of it. However, since it has limited amount of flight time (~7 minutes), it's hard to learn to fly in that short amount of time.
One trick: tie a long piece of fishing line to the bottom of the drone...helps so it doesn't fly too high, and if you get it stuck in the tree, it's easy to retrieve :)

title: This Thing's A Blast!
text: For the price, this drone is awesome.  My kids and I had been flying it everyday and having a blast with it...but then I had to go out of town on business and mysteriously, the thing crashed and broke and no one seems to know what happened  :)  I've ordered some new propellers for it and hopefully can get it in the air again.  Even if I can't, for the price I'm no complaining.  My kids can be really rough on things, especially when dad isn't there to supervise them.  If you're on the fence about ordering one of these, you really can't go wrong.  It's a great entry level drone that's lots of fun.  Oh, the video quality is really decent on this thing too.  It's not top quality, but then again, I didn't pay top quality prices.

title: This is the best I've run across
text: There are a lot of inferior and/or overpriced quadcopters and other planes out there. This is the best I've run across. It's stable, responsive, takes good pics and vids and spare parts are readily and inexpensively available. Flight times are around 7 minutes on the stock 500mah battery. I just got some Floureon 680mah batts and flight time is 9-10 minutes. The charger that comes with the plane overcharges the batts unless you monitor charging and stop it when your voltmeter reads about 4.2 volts. It's a good idea to get a better charger that won't overcharge, but instead bring your batts up to 4.2 volts and keep them there. A good charger like that can be had for about 3 bucks from China (WSX brand green charger), or available as part of a batt and charger combo order. Other similar chargers are likely available.

title: This is an easy to fly drone
text:
This is an easy to fly drone. It is about 1 ft sq. Not Huge but a bigger than some.
The camera video resolution is 720p(12808x720) -30 fps and the camera takes very good video considering the price.
The drone is fun to fly and is one of the best beginner drone available.

title: A good, inexpensive starter drone
text: A good, inexpensive starter drone.  My son had fun learning to fly it and watching the videos. Definitely a learning curve to controlling it.  Camera didn't last too long and there's not a replacement camera - that I can find.  It's pretty sturdy for as many times as he crashed it, no outer damage and still flies.

title: As described, shipping was fast!
text: As described , shipping was fast! Thanks Takes quite some time to learn to fly

title: Great trainer for the money
text: The camera is okay. This is a good vehicle to learn the basics of drone photography. The videos will look jerky until you learn to fly it smoothly. Practice in a large grassy area with little or no wind until you get used to it. Grab a couple of extra batteries, you are going to want them. I added a sample photo that I took at the park today.

title: Great copter, bad manual.
text: This quad copter is very stable, easy to use and the controller works great as does the camera. My only complaint is the really, really bad Chinese to English translation for the manual.  Misspelled words, awkward sentences and overuse of seldom used words like "sideward"

text: I didn't receive the charger, blade guards or screw driver, it says it comes with it and I'm royally pissed.

title: Awesome
text: Awesome

title: Great for a basic or beginner hobbyist
text: My husband loves it, and the price (for the quadcopter and replacement everything) is right. Great for a basic or beginner hobbyist.

title: Great Quadcopter
text: My grandson is crazy about this drone. I bought it for him on his 10th birthday when I visited him this summer. He never put it down the whole time I was there. He especially liked the camera feature. After flying the remote control gyro copter, he eagerly downloaded the video on his computer. I like the fact that it is very sturdy and withstands damage during the learning process. Until one becomes proficient in flying the copter, I recommend practicing in an open field. My son had to rescue the quad from a neighbor's roof once and from another's back yard. I highly recommend this product to folks of all ages.

title: Love It!
text: I Love it!  Very durable for a beginner, I have not been able to get the camera working to attest to the quality.  However, it's the Best Christmas Gift I received!

title: Five Stars
text: my husband s new toy

title: Beginner Quad X6C
text: This is a nice quad for beginners and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to try to fly a nice sized quad. It handles crashes well, and flys very high. I would recommend getting some extra parts such as the motor cases and extra batteries as it takes almost a month to get these from china.

title: Five Stars
text: My son in law likes it.

title: Fun
text: I bought this for my 52 yr old son-in-law.  He has a lot of fun with it.

title: Fun for the whole family.
text: My fiancé started out with one of these. Very quickly I realized it was no fun to sit outside and watch him fly it, so I ordered my own. After some family visited from out of town we had the best time playing with them! So this year everyone is getting one of these for Christmas. One drawback is that the batteries die very quickly. I recommend buying back up batteries. Charge them ahead of time and then just swap them out during your flying sessions. We did have one bad situation we now call the "great drone disaster of 2015", where a drone flew too high and caught a wind current. The wind took it over the tree line never to be seen again. We searched all afternoon and then again in the dark hoping we would see the flashing lights. No luck. To avoid this, you could get one of those Tile gps locator things to attach to it.

title: Great value!!!
text: It came on time and is used a lot!

title: Nice
text: Not bad

title: Five Stars
text: Tons of fun and a great price...

title: Lots of fun till i landed it on the beach sand which ...
text: Lots of fun till i landed it on the beach sand which got into the gears and stopped it from working again....

title: Delighted with this quadcopter
text: I bought this item to practice flying for my much larger quadrotor.  I am very happy with the X5C - it flies very well, is stable, and well behaved.  I was able to fly through the entire battery without crashing (an accomplishment, believe me) the first time.  I am also quite satisfied with the pictures and video given the price of the item.  This is a great introductory quadcopter that is small enough to fly indoors. Very happy with the purchase.  Other suggest flying without the camera, prop guards, and landing gear for a more nimble experience. There are lots of good youtube videos on operation if you need help.  I'm already thinking about more batteries, and I did buy more props - I replaced the forward white propellers with red ones to aid in flying.

title: Great fun for my kids!
text: I have a $1200 quadcopter, and make no mistake....this isn't on par with that.  I bought it so my kids could fly with me, and they absolutely love it!  These are way more stable than the "micro" ones, way more durable as well.  The kids have a great time with them, 100% kid tested and approved.  My kids are 9 and 11, one boy and one girl....both were really excited about these as Christmas presents and 2 months later they are still flying!

title: Great Product. Really fun to fly. Don't expect much from the camera.
text: Awesome product. My 10, 12, and 14 year old boys love flying it. The camera is not the best. But that is to be expected with the price. It holds a charge much longer than expected. Plus, it is really fun to fly at night with its bright flashing lights.

title: Great Drone!
text: I've had this Multicopter for a couple of weeks now and love it.  I've taken out quite a few times and have already beat the hell out of it.  The only signs of damage it shows are the rotors being a bit scratched up.  I've dropped it from 30 feet up onto pavement multiple times and ran it into the side of my garage going very fast and all the parts are still intact.  The controls are very responsive and after only a little practice I was able to get it to hover and fly it around avoiding obstacles.  The image quality on the camera was much better than I was expecting and is great for the price.  The battery only gives about 10 minutes of flight time but they clearly stated this on the ad and spare ones are cheap so I don't really consider this an issue. This was exactly what I was looking for to start out with and I could not be happier.

title: Excellent value and great quad.
text:
This is my second quad. My first was the very inexpensive Estes Proto X. So that's the basis for my comparison.

This quad is very stable and easy to fly using the low speed mode which you will want to do if you are taking pictures or video. The quality of the images isn't great, but it is fine for a hobbyist like myself. The flight time is good, but if you want more I would recommend buying a couple of extra batteries (I bought these: [[ASIN:B01581AVTA Keenstone® 6 Pcs 3.7V 720mAh 20C Lipo Battery Pack for Syma X5C X5C-1 X5SW X5SC X5A X5 Cheerson CW-20 Quadcopters-longer flying time and overcharge protection]]). I have crashed it a couple of times into branches and the ground and I have had no damage yet.

Once you are confident in your piloting skills there are mods and upgrades you can do such as motors or FPV camera upgrades. I haven't done these, but I intend to do an FPV upgrade when I have the time and money.

TLDR - Great quad for the money and perfect for the hobbyist.

title: Worked great for 10 minutes!
text: Against my wishes, my husband decided to fly this right outside our home and within 10 minutes, had it stuck in a tree. We tried our best to get it out of the tree but my husband basicly had to climb the tree and knock it out. The batteries lasted the entire time, but the machine won't fly anymore. I have ordered a bunch of new gears and new motors and my husband will have to rebuild it and hopefully avoid trees next time. He's on his own if he trees it again. This gets four stars because it worked really well for the whole 10 minutes before it got stuck. Never even tried out the camera. lol

title: Four Stars
text: My husband loves his new toy!

title: Nice Gyro
text: Hubby was so happy to receive this.  It's really awesome to use out side at night since it has lights on it.  Just don't fly to far away since it does have a very short battery life.  Also not recommended for inside use it will cause damage to items in your house.  We won't talk about I know this.. Men will be boys.. Groan.

title: Amazing Buy!
text:
WHAT A GREAT PURCHASE! Perfect for beginners or even intermediate level enthusiast. Recommend getting a bigger Micro SD card as the one that comes with is not very big. Very durable. Takes a beating. My only knock is the blade guards are a bit too soft. After a few crashes (Pilot caused not product caused) the guards bend in a bit, which the blades hit, so they need to be bent out often. Blades themselves hold up very well. I personally am looking to find alternatives for the blade guards. Something more durable but light. The drone flies very high and a pretty far distance horizontally. I would definitely buy again to just have another one.

Far exceeds my expectations of the price point. I do recommend getting (Keenstone 3.7V 720mAh 20C battery with 6-Port Quick Charger for Syma X5, X5C, X5SC, X5SW and Cheerson CX-30W Quadcopters (Pack of 6)). You'll be able to quickly switch out the batteries and enjoy flying for longer when you have batteries fully charged and ready for a rotating installation use. I believe they're $20 and ship in 3-5 days. The batteries are higher in mAh which allow for a bit longer run time.

title: I'm pretty good at flying but these things will get away ...
text:
Do not buy unless, A you want to spend ,,$30.00 an hour on your hobby. B, you have a football field for a back yard..
Lost 2 of. Them in the trees. Have 2 other small quads for in the house. I'm pretty good at flying but these things will get away from you in an instant. Then they are gone ...

text: so so

text: I got this for christmas as a gift for my son. He has mastered the skill to fly it now but only 1 thing is not working on this.  The camera is not working at all.  I tried different SD card versions but still it does not capture or turn on.

title: Five Stars
text: My hubby loves this drone.

title: Best out of the box beginners drone with camera I've ...
text: Best out of the box beginners drone with camera I've had. Flight time is good and it's easy to use. Parts are fairly durable but replacement kits are cheap and easy to find. Kids love it!

title: Great
text: Got for my nephew n he loves it

title: Five Stars
text: Nephew loves it.

title: Perfect for first time pilot or younger person.
text: Look, I run the local FPV Meetup, we race quadcopters and such along with the larger video platform drones. When asked what a new pilot that is not sure if they want to really get into the hobby or not should get, I always say Syma X5C-1 this is the best starter quad you can get. There are a few mods to do to get even better range and use but, this is the perfect start. Is low price and gental low rate ability make it perfect to learn on.

title: Excellent product for the money
text: Excellent product for the money.  It can take a beating.  Really impressed with the quality of pictures from the camera.

title: No good for video
text: Flies well but issues trying to record video or take pics. Followed instructions to the letter every time. Disappointing for video.

title: Aweful control on fly direction
text: Bought this for my 5 year old son for his Christmas gift. It is hard to control so I had to fly for him. This thing flies pretty high but the control of direction is unpredictable. I had to let it fly for few seconds before I can get a feel where the plane will go if I push the lever . Now the plane gets stuck in a tall tree because of loosing connection with the controller. If you have one, make sure you do not fly it too high or you will loose it.

title: Happy Flyer
text: Arrived 2 days late but Amazon promptly refunded postage before inquiry-paid extra to rush.  I'm very pleased with the Syma X5C. I bought 4 extra batteries so I have enough for 1 hour of flying.  The X5C preformed better than expected.  Have flown it 15+ times, several crashes, no damages to date. Started low & slow, a bit tricky at first.  Great starter drone.  Great price. Manual is a hoot, filled with grammatical errors.

title: Great value but...
text:
Great value! I can't believe how light it is. Even when the wind is blowing, it is useable. It came with a San Disk micro SD card and SD card to USB adapter.

Charging is kind of a pain as you have to unplug the battery in order to charge it. It doesn't come unplugged easily. It takes awhile to fully charge, but it fly's for good amount of time.

title: Battery life less than expected
text: Not so easy to fly. Battery is short lived, battery take forever to charge. Durable little drone.

title: Great fun. Don't throw out the replacement propellers!
text:
Bought this for my son for Christmas. It's his (our) first foray into drones. Couldn't be happier. He was able to get it up and hovering right away without reading the manual. Figuring out how to much more took a little reading, but still, it's easy-peasy to fly. As others have noted, the camera is pretty low quality, but what do you expect for $40?

There are tons of other reviews out there, many of which are pretty detailed, so I'll save my breath, with two exceptions. Be sure and buy extra batteries right away (I bought these... [[ASIN:B00MF3SAF2 Teenitor 3.7V 680mAh 20C Batteries with 5 in 1 X5 Battery Charger for Syma X5C-1 X5C X5A]] ), as the single included battery is only good for 7 minutes of flight. Second, while you may want to buy replacement propellers, there ARE spares included. They are taped to the bottom of the matching white plastic insert. Easy to overlook and throw out.

All in all, a great introduction to RC flight. Earns my official seal of approval.

title: Very Disappointed
text: My son purchased this but is unable to fly it. It will not fly in any sort of wind and just goes in the direction the wind is blowing. I can see it being a problem with high winds but this thing will not work even in a small breeze. It is a little fun to fly inside but is very difficult to control because it is all over the place. I have been able to keep it a little steady inside but only for a few moments. Needless to say, my son is very disappointed with his purchase.

title: Five Stars
text: Works great! Camera is especially good for the money.

title: (nearly) Indestructable!
text:
My god this thing is a BEAST! I've just spent the past 30 days watching it from across the street, stuck 50 feet up in a neighbors tree. Well, an uncountable numbers of tropical storms later, the thing finally fell to the earth in some ~70MPH winds. I replaced the melted gearbox (from trying to fly it free and getting it more tangled) with parts from this $6 kit: http://www.amazon.com/Quadcopter-Propellers-Landing-Protectors-Protector/dp/B00TJSJWQ2/ref=sr_1_8?s=toys-and-games&ie=UTF8&qid=1456168366&sr=1-8&keywords=syma+x5c - put in a fresh battery, and the thing flies like it's new! I am shocked.

That's not even including the 3 or 4 ~300+ foot crashes at terminal velocity, onto hard pavement. I have done the mod here: [...] (using a huge old ubiquiti 2.4Ghz antenna) which seems to get me to around ~400 or so feet before starting to lose connectivity - just remember to always keep it well upwind, and avoid trees!

title: Cool toy...when it works!
text: My son was delighted at first.  Copter flew well indoors in tight spaces, and outdoors in the backyard.  Took some cool videos with the onboard camera. Unfortunately, after the first few recharge cycles, it refused to fly for more than 5 seconds before running out of power. The battery indicated that it was properly charged, but somehow the power wasn't getting through. Tried a different battery, same result. It was not crashed or treated roughly in any way. We did get a refund, so no harm done.  But it was a disappointment.

title: Great drone - short battery life
text: Great drone, but the battery only last for a few min. and takes a long time to charge.

title: Fun!
text: Loads of fun for even a beginner!  This drone is easy to use and very very durable.

title: Great gift

text: Fun drone, but hard to callibrate. I tried to set it straight for hours and was unable to get it to function properly. Should have returned it.

title: I've really enjoyed this. I bought this to get an intro ...
text: I've really enjoyed this. I bought this to get an intro into quadcopters before thinking of buying a more expensive one. This is easy to fly and alot of fun. A tip would be to buy one of the multicharger's with extra batteries.

title: This little thing is fun. For the price
text: I've had this for about a year now.  This little thing is fun.  For the price, its a great way to learn to fly.  The camera is great.  Mine got ripped off on a tree though.  The drone itself is lightweight plastic and doesn't always take too well to crashes.  I bought a few extra batteries as each battery only lasts about 7-8 minutes.  To increase flight time I took the extra weight off of the blade protectors.  Be aware that the drone itself is very light weight and any wind will easily take it off into no where.  I've had mine stranded in my neighbors tree for a few months.

title: This worked great for about a week
text: This worked great for about a week. Then it stopped working and we've tried re-syncng SEVERAL times and can't get them to connect. My son loved it but I wish it had worked longer.

title: not happy
text: I bought this for my 8yr old nephew and it broke the same day he used it.

title: Five Stars
text: great

title: Awesome drone
text: This thing is fast, can take abuse, has a good camera and is a lot of fun. Highly recommended.

title: Five Stars
text: Hubby loves it.

title: Leave this hunk of junk right where it is......Fun for two and a half months....
text: bought this for my daughters birthday because she wanted to move up from her helicopter to a small drone. Your not buying this for the camera, because it's not going to give you the best footage out there. i don't know where that one guy got that footage from that he left is his review because our drone never had any footage like that and never ever got that high without losing the signal and freefalling back toward earth. It was fun for two and a half months. it's not real stable even after you make the adjustments so it's better to use it outdoors and it doesn't have a lot of range of it. Well after owning it for two months all of a sudden the motors started going bad. So now you have a drone that can't fly because the rotors are not at the same power setting anymore.  It's just not worth it.

title: A lot of fun, great gift idea
text:
Birthday present for my 13yo son. Was easy to assemble. Instructions are a tad sketchy because they've obviously been poorly translated into english but for someone that is mechanically minded, the pictures were definitely enough to go by. Flies great and seems to be very durable which is good for a 13yo and his 46yo father that are just learning to fly one of these things.

Had some trouble on occasion getting the remote to 'sync' with the quadcopter but discovered it was because we were doing it wrong. Apparently, you need to set the QC flat on a surface and then turn both the remote and QC on to have it 'sync' correctly. I'm assuming this is due to there being some kind of gyro in the QC that needs to be calibrated before it can fly properly but could be totally wrong.

Wind is a challenge with the QC simply because it is so light.

The camera works pretty good is bright sunshine and very grainy indoors. For the price, I was not expecting much. If you aren't expecting HD video that is completely stable then you should be satisfied. If you want non-vibrating HD video, then go spend your thousands of dollars to get it. It was fun for us.

The 360 inversion trick had my son exclaiming "That is sick!" which I took to mean "Cool!"

Pros:
1. Actually flies very well and is pretty stable in non-windy conditions
2. Seems to be very durable. Came with extra propellers (haven't used them yet thankfully). Also, the manual has every part of the QC listed with a part number so you can order replacement parts if necessary. To me, that is a sign of a good company and gives me confidence in the QC.
3. Very fun
4. Small enough to fly indoors

Cons:
1. Flight time is about 7 minutes. Kinda guessing here since we didn't keep it in the air for one extended period of flight. This was due to our flying skills and/or choice, not a fault of the QC
2. You will want to steal it from your child. :-)

title: Great buy!
text: Cannot say enough good things about this little machine. My first quad so I was rough on it at first. I highly recommend getting different color rotors for the front. Since this is not headless, it will lessen the learning curve a bit. The parts are dirt cheap and after more than 400 hundred flights with the more powerful batteries, I had to replace a motor. Easy to do and they happened to come with the spare rotors and guards I ordered on Amazon. The parts and Syma X 5C-1 are worth the money and I am addicted. I fly every morning, weather and wife permitting.

title: I was disappointed! It was fun while we had it though
text: First one broke within a week so we returned it and the second one had a motor go out within a month. I was disappointed! It was fun while we had it though.

title: It’s been the go to drone for indoor fun. I have a mavic pro and spark for ...
text:
I have had it for about a month now and It is made of cheap plastic but that’s the advantage here.

I must have crashed it over 20-30 times flying it and it still works. You do need to fly w care because the blades can hurt someone.

I did have to replace the propeller guards as they get the brunt of any crashes.

It’s been the go to drone for fun. I have a mavic pro and spark for more serious flying.

I did buy extra tenergy battery packs which helps w continued playing since each battery only lasts about 8-10 mins of continuous flying.

title: Pretty good
text: Bought for a class I was taking at my community college just as a inexpensive learner. Worked well for what I needed. definitely buy something like this before dropping a grand on a dji

title: Four Stars
text: It's a gift; so I haven't opened it.  Seems to be what I was looking for and arrived timely.

title: Five Stars
text: For the price this is a great starter drone. Battery life is short but extra battery are inexpensive.

title: Must have first copter!  The best choice by far...
text:
What an amazing first gyro RC copter! We bought this for our 12 year old daughter for her birthday and she loves it. She was able to learn the controls very quickly. She flies it around the house and outside. She likes the easy flip mode for tricks and it moves pretty quick for her.

Pros:

-Great price
-Great value for a beginner quadcopter
-Easy to use/learn
-Decent video and pics
-comes with SD Card and reader
-fun trick flip button

Cons:

- light, so difficult to use in even mild wind
- video isn't really HD imo..it is if the copter can remain completely still, but moving around it gets grainy
- battery life is short...maybe 6 minutes...buy extra batteries!
- for the money I don't expect auto-hover or other advanced features...but doesn't come with them if you need them...

Overall it's probably the best quad RC copter available for the money...and perfect for the first copter. Don't waste your money at a local b&m this holiday season spending twice as much and not getting as good of a copter.

title: Great learning quadcopter
text: Great learning quadcopter, lots of fun and so far all three quads have been used hard and still flying great...

title: Cheap Thrills!!
text: Great little (12") drone--er quadcopter.  Takes crashes very well.  Recommend 2 extra 500mah batteries for longer fun.  2.0 camera is better than one would think, easy to use from transmitter.  This thing zooms 300ft straight up really fast!  Cut the power, and it floats to ground gently.  Very fun to fly after about a 10 minute learning curve.

title: Takes fairly good video.
text: Has held up well to lots of wrecks. Takes fairly good video.

title: Three Stars
text: Battery does not last long and gyro landed in tree

title: great starter drone!  Few tips...
text:
great little practice drone, battery life is short 10 mins and you should buy a second set of batteries
video is crappy but watchable, but for the price very good.

i highly suggest you DONT PUT THOSE GUARDS ON...if you are flying near trees. those bumper guards will get SNAG and get caught in the tree branches very easily!! if i didnt have those things on, i wouldve gotten out of the tree easily.

Also if you fly too high you will start losing control, IMMEDIATELY CUTOFF THE THROTTLE, that will have it fall slowly, then you can restart the throttle and get back into range, otherwise it will start to fly on its own!

title: Worked great,,,, for a day
text: Worked great,,,, for a day. Camera doesn't work anymore. Is there any kind of warranty on these?

title: I thought it would be fun to try one of these drones
text: I thought it would be fun to try one of these drones. I had never had one, First time I used it outside it took off, controls were very unresponsive, the drone disappeared, still waiting to find out if it's in one of the neighbors yards that's fenced in.

title: Drone failed after < 1 month
text: Successive  attempts to contact vendor failed. NO response. one drone quit 3 weeks after put in use

title: Excellent item, highly recommended.
text:
I got my X5C in the mail yesterday and spent most of the rest of the day trying it out, including the photo and video functions. I am very impressed and pleased with the simplicity and ease of use. Sure, it would be nice to have live video feed to my computer monitor, but for the money this is an incredibly good and high functioning item. After flying it for a while I went back on Amazon and purchased four more batteries (600 mah) and charger so that I don't have to wait 75 minutes to charge the battery before I can get back to flying. I did all my flying indoors yesterday just to get the balance fine tuned, make sure it can hover fairly steadily without a lot of input from me. I will take it outside today as long as there isn't much wind, and see how high it will go. The video is really pretty good, in color, with pretty good detail for such a tiny camera. I wouldn't worry about doing a time stamp for each video, as it is easier to add that to the file name after saving it to my computer. Excellent item, highly recommended.
Update as of July 22, 2015:
After several uses and various crashes it quit working, the blades on one side wouldn't go as fast, causing it to tip to one side and it wouldn't go up in the air. I replaced two motors with new ones but no dice. Same problem. Probably some problem with the speed control. So, I gave up on it and bought another one. Since then I have used the new one several times, took lots of videos and lots of hard landings, still works great.
On a secondary issue, the camera works great. I love the videos, although it does have a fairly narrow field of view. I bought the Leegoal(TM) Detachable 0.67X Wide Angle Macro Lens and stuck it on the camera to see if I could get a better view, but although it seems to have good focus, the field of view is not significantly better. Probably would need to have a fisheye lens to get a better field of view. By the way, I discovered by accident that it does also record audio along with the video. The downside of this is that about the only thing you hear is the loud whine produced by the motors and copter blades, kinda like listening to the vacuum cleaner.
As has been mentioned previously, once you get it 100 feet or more in the air, it gets hard to control as it blends in with the color of the sky. Probably would be good to paint at least one half of it a dark color to make it easier to tell which way it is headed. When it gets behind you it can be confusing which way to go. I usually just land it and start over.

title: Probably not my best
text: I am a novice. Hard to control, even the kids can't fly it. It seems to have a affinity for trees and roofs. Don't even attempt if windy. Not as amusing as I thought. Probably not my best purchase

title: Five Stars
text: This one was great. The other was a fraud.

title: great buy for the money
text: For 60 bucks u cant beat this little guy... great starter drone to learn how to fly and it can take a beating. Only draw back is the throttling up and down it is very very touchy it is either all the way up ir all the way down. Rang is ok for 60 bucks video and pics are great. But just to show how tuff it is. When i first got it i lost control because it was so high and went of of range and the wind took it. I drove around the neighborhood and could not find it. A week later a guy should up at my house with it. It landed on his roof and sat there for 3 days till a storm blow it off and he pulled the card and aay the video of were i lived. I charged the battery and it flow like a champ after all that. As well as being stuck in a tree and haveing sticks thrown at it to get it down twice. It finally became inop when my 11 year old son flow it into the house and it lost a small gear that spins on of th3 blades.  No big thou worth the 6 bucks for the parts kit from amazon to fix and let my kids keep flying. Battery time is only like 7 to 10 min tops . Dont spend money on extra batterys . Get this one as a learning tool and for kicks but if u are going to spend some real money go with the bebop 2

title: Amazing!
text: Oh my goodness - this completely exceeded my expectations.  Very easy to fly.  Still pictures are good quality.  Movies are good quality and include sound.  I love this item!

title: I love to, spoil my nephews
text: I love to,spoil my nephews....they were so excited on Christmas when they opened these up. My sister in law sent me a pix of them flying them. I'm jealous....would love to have one myself! Total hit!

title: A must own Quad. Workhorse you’ll enjoy
text: In the first 5 wks of getting back into R/C.... over 160 flights on it. Taught another newbie. Antennae mod, plug mod, larger battery fitted within this span. Just installed extra props feb 12th after all these flights. Highly recommend this one. A classic piece. Watch YouTube on numerous modifications being done. You’ll never outgrow it. Thanx

title: Love it
text: Hard to handle. Needs practice. But I'd pretty cool. The lights show bright at night and it looks like a UFO.Lol

title: Was a lot of fun the 7 minutes that it worked
text: Was a lot of fun the 7 minutes that it worked. Pulled the battery to recharge, and when I put it back in, nothing. Turn the drone on, the lights blink twice quick, then nothing at all. Resyncing doesn't work. There's no apparently way to return this or get support on it. Waste of $40.

title: but very fun and easy to use
text: My grandson used it nonstop for about 2 weeks until the wings became too damaged /bent to fly. Needs constant parts replacement, but very fun and easy to use. The batteries suggested to purchase with this take a month longer to arrive, so if it is a gift, keep that in mind.

title: Five Stars
text: awesome little entry level outdoors toy!

title: Drone for beginners
text: Great for beginners

title: Very Cool
text:
[[VIDEOID:9b0fafa3dc237ac5696fdd6ce89af0d7]] I got this on sale a couple of years ago for $23. I had a smaller one that I used to terrorize the cat with, but it died. I tried this one indoors, but it's just too big for indoors. I set it aside, and sort of forgot about it.

I finally picked it up again, and took it to my sister's house for a picnic. She has a large back yard. Powered it up, got the trim set up pretty quickly, and was flying it decently in no time. It lasted about ten minutes.

Wasn't sure what to expect from the camera, but hit 'Record' anyway. It's hard to tell if it is doing anything. I managed to take a couple of stills, and then two videos. Brought it home, and couldn't figure out how to retrieve the video at first. I thought initially I had to connect the camera directly to the computer. I then discovered the thing had a 16 GB SD card in it! It came with a USB card reader. I plugged it in, and downloaded the contents. One video was over 300 MB.

I was blown away at the quality for something so cheap. I managed to get it to do a rotation while recording video (it says that is not possible in the manual, but it worked). See attached video. The only ridiculous part is, it records audio. All you can hear is the sound of the propellors.

It's not a drone - it's a decent large quad-copter. Your neighbors might think it is a drone, though, so be cautious. It looks more purposeful than it actually is. I'm going to buy the spare battery kit. You could play with this thing for a couple of hours and get some decent video with a little practice. Not sure if it is worth full price, but the $23 I paid was well worth it.

title: Good Product At a Good Price
text: Bought one for my son and one for my son-in-law and they both love these. My son-in-law even uses his to photograph his lighting projects for his employeer. I've not seen the pictures but they must be pretty good.

title: Great but too light
text:
I bought this quadcopter because it was cheap and I have been told many times that flying a quadcopter is hard. I figured if I smash and destroy this one, at least I did not loose much.

The copter is TOUGH. I must have crashed it hard dozens of times now, and so far all I have had to replace is one of the blade guards.

The only complaint I have is that the motors are too weak to overcome wind, if you get too high up. More than once when flying high for a picture the wind took the copter away from me and I had to chase it down. One time it was stuck 50' up in a tree. Thankfully I have a friend with a climbing hunting stand and we were able to retrieve it. Since then I have kept it low, mostly below the rooftops.

Video is decent, but if you easily get motion sickness you might want to skip watching it.

title: Good for the first drone
text: Great gift and easy to setup. I am not a problem this is my first drone and my experience with it is pozitive. The battery life is a little  short so I bought another battery and some parts for replacements in the future. It very stable and flying is smooth. The led flashing can become a little annoying but after 5 6 minutes the battery is dead anyhow. I will buy it again for the good price that I paid for it

title: Disappointed, to say the least
text: Received one as a gift. Never would pair with the controller. Maybe I simply received a dud. Disappointed, to say the least.

title: best beginner drone
text: best beginner drone. always stable, easy to fly, and reliable. also, almost indestructable, have crashed mine from multiple heights and the only thing that ever broke was the green led lense came off. if your wanting to add fpv to this, i highly reccommend the Eyoyo mini fpv camera, it plugs straight in to the battery and all you have to do is simply hot glue it to the top of the syma. this makes a great fpv trainer thats easy to fly, and if you crash it in a tree, it will most likely survive, unless it gets rained on like mine did. even after being rained on, it still works, but for some reason the batteries dont last as long. speaking of batteries, flight time for me was about 8 mins long with the mini fpv camera running

title: Love it
text: Very easy to use for beginners.  Video camera was halfway decent quality.  Very durable as well.  Kids crash it almost every landing.

title: Perfect for learning, resilient, and FUN..
text:
[[VIDEOID:d855a117fc682d4dcaa5213d94c99ca1]] First time drone flyer here. This thing is amazingly fun. Pretty easy to learn how to fly and takes decent video. Definitely can't use the video for productions or anything, but fun to see what it sees.

Flight time is about 7 minutes and takes about an hour and a half to charge. So I'd recommend getting the [[ASIN:B00RSWH0K6 Holy Stone 5-In-1 Max 2.5A Current Input Fast Battery Charger and two batteries for X5C Holy Stone M68]] extra batteries and charger for $12.

I've bounced this thing into walls and crashed it more than several times and it's super resilient. For $40, you can't go wrong with this. Definitely recommend.

Seriously, this thing is crazy fun.

title: Did not come with memory card
text: I am seeing that other drones from other buyers came with an sd card.  Mine did not.  That is disappointing.  The drone is kind of chincy but it should make for a learning experience.  It has weathered some crashes so far pretty well.  Without a card I do not know about pics yet.

title: Overall great quad! Charger broke easily though...
text:
After owning the quad for 3 days now, i have enountered a major problem or two. First off, one of the props was loose and fell off after flight one, so I was forced to replace it. And the second problem is the charger refuses to charge the battery. I have purchased several accessories for this and one is another charger, which won't get here until a month from now. So I have no way to fly the quad until the middle of June :( Moving on to the actual review.
The quad is a decent one. I have been flying quads for a couple months now, and have flown everything from a hubsan to a DJI Phantom II, and this quad is almost exactly inbetween. Camera is more of a 480p than a 720p, but it still takes pretty decent pictures. Range was only about 150ft so I purchased a 2.4GHz wifi antenna and soldered it to the controllers board, bringing the range to about 500ft. which was more than exceptional for this quad. It was advertised with a 2GB Microsd card, but came with a 4GB Class 8 one, which i filled on my first day of flight. Rotor guards are mainly for indoor flight, and only add weight and lessen flight time when flying.

3/5 because the charger did not last more than 7 charges, props come off too easily, landing gear got trashed after a couple (soft) landings. Other than those details I would rate it a 4/5 quad. Very good for beginners. And for those of you who want a fast quad, i tested the speed on it, it will fly at a fastest speed of 35 Mph (56.3 Kmh) in high speed, and 12 Mph (19.3 Kmh) in low speed, (tested by flying it in front of a car with someone keeping an eye on the gauges)

title: Incredibly Durable!
text:
I'm not usually one to write reviews regularly, but this definitely deserves a review. I really liked this from the get-go. Sure it's a very budget friendly drone so I didn't expect too much but the reviews were quite good so I decided to give this one a try. As with any device like this there is a learning curve to flying it, but not so much that it seems an impossible task.
I did however get a bit too ambitious my second day out and had it up about 60-70 feet off the ground in the back parking lot at work. While I was trying to avoid power lines, I ended up in the top of a tree! It was up entirely too high to try to retrieve it so I resigned myself to the fact that it was a goner. If that wasn't enough to sink my spirits, a rain storm came and it poured for hours.
Well well well, I come to work two days later and find my drone has fallen from the tree and IS IN ONE PIECE! I take it inside, plug in a new battery and IT STILL WORKS! UNREAL! A very deserved 5 stars! Highly recommend for kids to learn on as it is very affordable to replace, and for adults who just want to act like kids but don't want to blow their paychecks on the fancy gear.

My husband used it first to make sure that it worked well before letting our grandson use it.  Well, our grandson didn't get to use it because it quit working after about 10 minutes.  Chinese junk!!!

title: I bought this plane for my son and nephew for ...
text: I bought this plane for my son and nephew for Christmas.The plane didn't work.I couldn't return it because the return window had passed.

title: Poor Reliability
text: As a beginner in the quad copter I've purchased the Syma X5C based on reviews I've heard. It is quiet easy to assemble, synchronize and you're ready to fly immediately. The reliability of the item is questionable in my opinion. after several minuets of flight the copter bumped into the wall and stopped responding immediately. at first glance I suspected it may be the battery but after fully charging the battery for an hour plus I plugged it back to the copter and it wasn't turning on. opening the quadcopter case I realized several cold soldering, unstable connection of the PCB to the copter base and that the wires that connects to the ON/OFF switch were disconnected from the switch and thus the copter couldn't turn on. I soldered the wires back to the switch and the copter turned ON and flew without any issue. Two days later one of the motors stopped working so there wasn't enough power for the copter to elevate above ground level. To summarized I would say that the copter reliability is poor and fixing can be time consuming.

title: Great starter quad
text: Great starter quad.  Easy to fly and responsive.  Surprisingly good camera.  Easy and inexpensive to repair but you'll need a soldering gun for motor replacement.  I shopped all the competitors and for the price I don't think it can be beat.

title: Great toy
text: This is a toy.  I purchased the Syma X5C for my 10 year old.  It is fun to fly, but not exactly easy.  It requires some skill to learn to fly and not crash. It will not hover in place without constant adjustment by the operator. High wind will take it away.  A tree will eat it.  The camera is just a toy, but a lot of fun.  Drone noise is very loud on video.  No video stability.  Video quality is so-so at best, but, again, fun. I wanted to share some video and photos on FB or YouTube, but I did not because of the poor quality.  We have crashed it a few times, and it survived to fly again.  For the price, this drone is an excellent introduction to drones that will make you want a better drone.  My son is thrilled with it.

title: Three Stars
text: Great toy, but difficult to control. ......lost it in a tree within the first 5 minutes of use.

title: One of Two Is Great
text:
If we're talking about this drone only focusing on the one which works, then 5 stars. If we include the other one (which was this order), then it's 3 stars.

Backstory: I ordered this quad to replace another which just didn't fly as I had hoped. This one met my expectations and was a blast. Then I got the same one as a holiday gift. "Two is better than one!" So I kept both. Not a week later, while doing some indoor flying, this quad landed softly on the couch, and that was it. Upon trying to lift off, one of the motors was dead, so it could only scamper around the couch, never gaining altitude. Amazon honored a return and I was back down to one.

The one I still have is great. It is light enough you don't need FAA registration, though I did it anyway. It's also small enough that it can be used comfortably indoors with the stability needed to go outdoors as well.

Flight: I got used to flying on the Syma X11, so this was a step up, but not entirely new. The remote for this seems to work better with the larger size, though they are interchangeable. On slow mode, it is sluggish on turns and banking (pitch), but great for learning. You may have some trouble in a light to moderate breeze, since it just won't pitch enough to compensate. High speed mode makes for a fun flight. It takes an aggressive angle and can hit impressive speeds. Banking turns become an adventure. For stability, make sure to calibrate it indoors until it hovers in a single spot. Bonus: The remote remembers this setting, so each reset comes back already calibrated. For outdoor flight, I'd say you can comfortably control it up to about 12 MPH winds. Beyond that, you're at the whim of Mother Nature.

Night and dusk flying are the best. The lights on the bottom are bright and telling (red in front, green in back). You can easily track it with these and maintain orientation (no headless mode). The lights blink rapidly if the quad loses signal, and I'm not certain what it does at this point, as I'm typically running at it to re-establish connection. Which leads me to...

Range: I wasn't happy with the range, so I followed one of the many modification videos and added some length to the remote's antenna. Now, it gets about 100 meters horizontal range. That's good enough to have to squint to see it in daylight as well as fly it high enough where it looks like a dot. Since it doesn't have FPV or GPS, I wouldn't want it going much further. My main concern was losing signal in regular use. After the mod, that is a rare event.

Durability: As I said, one of them didn't fare so well, as one motor kicked the bucket after a soft landing on a couch. The other quad has taken a beating and done just fine. Once, it took a swim in some marshes after a loss of signal situation (see why I did the mod?). When I reached it, one rotor was submerged, along with the camera and battery compartment. I removed the battery, opened everything up and let it sun dry for the entire day. After reconnecting everything, it all worked. Don't drop it in a marsh. With the prop guards on, it doesn't care much about hitting things and the rotors have had their share of abrasions from flips, trees, and ceiling brushes. Just some aesthetic damage, but no change in flight characteristics.

Battery: With the stock battery, I timed an outdoor flight. It was moderately aggressive flying, with some use of the video camera. The quad landed itself with a dead battery after 9 minutes, 16 seconds. Not bad. However! Most other drones give you a low battery warning. This gives you a dead battery warning, which means it falls out of the sky as the lights blink slowly. I've noticed that about a minute before battery depletion, it starts to lose some lift performance. Consider that the time to land. Waiting can put you in a precarious position.

Camera: Another reviewer made a great point. They said that if you spent $50 on a video camera, you'd be disappointed with the quality. Well, this one also flies. So take it as you will. The quality is about equivalent to mid-late-2000s cameraphone. It is 720p resolution, but it records in Motion JPG, so you'll need to convert to do anything with it (and it takes up a ton of space as-is). The dynamic range isn't great, so if you are looking at sky, ground is dark, at ground, sky is washed out. Like I said, it's good, but not great. Don't compare to a GoPro. You know it's recording because a red light blinks on the camera module (it's green when powered and waiting).

Carrying capacity: I pulled an envelope through the house tied on with a string, and I'm sure it will do grapes, but if you're asking about a GoPro, the answer is no.

Conclusions: While I save up for a high-performance GPS-based drone, this is a great trainer and entertainment device. It flies anywhere, and once you get the hang of the controls, you can maneuver it to within centimeter precision. The camera is fun for what it is. After doing some basic modifications, range is good. For the price, I'd encourage you to get one. You'll enjoy it.

title: Best starter drone in the market!
text: This is my first drone and I'm very happy with the X5C's performance. My advice to other first timers is buy this with an additional few batteries (amazon will recommend a six pack that comes with a charger that will charge then all at once). When you first get the box, read the directions, start charging the batteries, and watch a few YouTube videos to learn how to set the trim. Your first two to three flights should be indoors. Once you're able to keep it steady, you'll be ready to take it outside.

title: Works like a way more expensive one, its great!!!
text: My grandson loves it!! I really thought that I was throwing away money on something that work for a day or two but he really wanted it so I thought give it a shot. We are into February and it still works great. Worth double the mone but be sure to get the extra batteries. He loves it!!!!

title: I did my research 1st and this model was recommended for beginners on another site

title: The drone works excellent, the manual is difficult to understand, hence 4 stars only.
text:
Comes with 4 spare blades/wings. Comes with a 4 GB micro SD card and reader that plugs into USB slot.
Comes with 1 rechargeable battery and USB charger, the battery lasts about 7 min. Comes with screwdriver.
Needs 4 AA batteries for the remote control.
To activate: move the left control lever up&down, the lights will stop blinking.
To take a picture: press the button next to the left control lever, light blinks once.
To take video: pull down the button next to the left control lever, light keeps blinking, pull down again to stop taking video.
To calibrate: use the other 3 buttons, slide them to the side the drone should go to.
Remove the camera and blade guards to improve handling and battery life.

title: Signal Interference
text: Be careful with this!!! I flew mine 3 times, and on the third flight experienced quite a bit of signal interference, which ended up in me losing the drone. It went up maybe 100 feet just fine, but the started turning without my control. I started to take it down when the control would go in and out giving me 1 to 2 second windows of control, which was not enough to fight the small amount of crosswind. It's now either in the woods or in the pond next to my neighborhood... I'll only be flying drones outside of any wifi zones and in a VERY open space from here on out. Never experienced signal interruption like that until I flew this drone.

Waiting on the additional batteries to come in so I can practice for up to about 1/2 hour at a time. Took a few minutes to figure out how to tune it. Pictures and video work. Pros
Price, Price, Price. For the money, ya cant beat it.

title: Fun for three days, now can't get it to fly at all.
text: Fun to play with but cannot recommend it to others.  Due to my own fault it got "treed" on the third day I owned it.  I flew it for a while longer after getting it down from the tree (so clearly NOT damaged by the tree incident) and I ordered replacement blades and guards to replace what I dented in the tree.  After installing these parts it won't fly any longer.  Just skitters across the floor.  Tried putting the old blades back on, still won't fly.  Fresh batteries, still won't fly.  If all it takes to damage this beyond usability is changing the blades and blade guards then it's worthless to me.

title: Excellent fun, with a steep dexterity and spacial awareness learning curve.
text:
Excellent fun, and a good spatial challenge to fly (especially when it's flying towards you and the controls are reversed, much harder for me than an R/C car!). The camera is very good for the size and weight- low light levels (such as indoors) it does have trouble with but outside in the sunshine the image is good. Think 720p TV quality. Battery door can be a bit fiddly to open but after all, it needs to snap home securely else a hard landing would jar it open (the camera is clipped to the battery door). It's had a couple of hard landings due to my incapability to fly very well and has shrugged each one off.

The camera, feet, blade guards all remove to lighten it up for better maneuverability if you so desire. Controls are easy to use and the range is good. Controls have low and high sensitivity setting, great for beginners. The manual is slightly unclear and includes a gray box as a bit of an afterthought for the initial switch-on, not that clear on the procedure. Switch on the controller handset, have the copter sitting still and level on a flat surface then power it up with the switch- it takes a few moments to calibrate its gyroscopes before it's ready to go. If you hold it in your hand it'll either not calibrate or take a very long time then need to be trimmed on the controller to fly level. It does do very well to keep itself upright. The 360 degree flip is very rapid!

Good fun. Very good, can't fault it.

title: Best Drone for the money......IF you start slow and practice low.(I made that up myself)
text:
Lost 3 SYMA X5C-1 drones so far and just got my forth one. That tells you how much fun they are to fly and how frustrated I am with losing control of them. I had wanted a drone for a long time but just waiting to "pull the trigger". Saw they were on sale for $23.99 so I couldn't pass that up after reading many good reviews. The price has gone up since then from 23.99 to 28.99 and now 36.99. Dont know the reason for the increase in prices but still as good a drone as I have seen even at that price EXCEPT for one problem. As many many reviews point out they can be difficult to control especially in 5+ mile an hour winds which is most of the time once you get 50-100 feet off the ground. It's really hard to tell if it's because they fly out of range of controller or the wind takes them out of range or even a combination of factors including variability in the way the drone performs randomly beyond of your control.
The first one I know I started too fast going up near the limit of range available. I tried to really limit what I did and how high I went on the next two but one of the main reasons I got a drone was to take video from above trees of scenes otherwise out of sight. I don't even use the prop guards and have multiple crashes and no broken props which they come with spares for anyway. Lack of guards may be related to "burning out" motors (which are not brush-less) but so far have not had any drones long enough to burnout a motor and replacement parts seem cheap enough.
The best tip I have learned is to not be afraid to take the throttle stick straight down and kill props anytime you are getting close to trees or other potential problems. You can push the stick right back before it hits the ground in free fall and go up again or just let crash as I have many times with no damage(Sometimes it will knock the battery door loose or the Micro SD card loose but easily solved if you just check it each time you fly it. The next best tip is just PRACTICE as much as you can at low altitude before going up higher. I will follow up this review if I find the "loss of control" is not just my inexperience or a random flaw in product. I would have given 5 stars except for that one issue. Overall for the money and for a beginner like me I don't think you can beat it.

title: Incredible for all levels. And the price? Get outta here!
text:
This thing never ceases to amaze me. It was my first toy quad and I received it for Christmas from my girl. It's been wrecked several times inside and out and hasn't broken anything yet. Once it took a tumble for getting out of range from about 100 feet up and even then, nothing broke. Beginners and semi advanced pilots will both have a great time with this one. I also fly a DJI P3. Obviously this is nothing like that. The camera is lacking severely, but not why I got it. In fact, I took my camera off and just plug the battery in with no cover. I also removed the landing gear since there are already guards under the props. I recently picked up a LaTrax Alias clone as well and while it is also a fun and more advanced acrobatic flyer, this X5C is really just as fun. I am in no way affiliated with Syma, I just like to give credit where credit is due. Now I'm off to research my next quad. Perhaps another Syma?

Pick up some extra batteries and buy it now, you won't regret it.

title: Budget quadcopter with easy manoverability

text: This is a perfect drone.  Great value.  My son loves it.  He can already do tricks (flips) with it.  The camera is fun too.

title: Have had a few initial setup problems getting the drone ...
text: Have had a few initial setup problems getting the drone to operate.  I have found that starting the drone on a level surface seems to be critical.  Also it appears that the instructions are incorrect.  Start the drone first on a level surface.  Then when the lights begin to blink more slowly, start the control unit and push the left control all the way forward, then backwards, and the lights come on permanently.  Then the motors and blades will turn.

title: Great introductory  quad to learn to fly on.
text:
This was a replacement since the first one had to be sent back due to it being used and missing the battery charger cable. When I opened this one it was quite obvious the last one had been opened and used just by the packaging alone. This one was neatly packaged and secured with zip ties and the screw driver and card reader were taped to the packaging neatly under the transmitter. The spare blades were taped to the bottom of the package . The SD card wasnot under the transmitter and was found in the camera which was connected unlike the first product I received.

Other than being sent a used product with missing parts the product has exceeded my expectations. It is well worth buying to learn how to fly quadcopters.
I do suggest buying some upgraded battery packs such as 3.7v 720 ma, The longer flight times are well worth it. Also buying a charger that can charge more than one battery pack at a time will also make your flight time more enjoyable.
The lights on it are bright enough for night flying and do help with orientation but I did paint the prop guards and props up front yellow to help me out.
While I didn't buy this for the camera I was pleasantly surprised by the picture and video quality. I'll be honest though the camera will spend more time off of the quad than on it.
The transmitter is a a bit too small for my hands but not uncomfortable however I am coming from a full size RC transmitter for aircraft.
It does have enough power to penetrate light wind and what I mean by this is if you are hovering and the wind is pushing the quad you can angle the craft and return it to you.
Its a nice size for playing in confined areas like flying through carports around dumpsters, trees and around second storey porch supports and under lifted 4x4 trucks.

title: I am surprised it hasn't broken but it is in great shape!

text: Very unsatisfied customer here. I bought this for my son's birthday (today). I even paid for speedier shipping ..hoping it would arrive before his birthday. Well, the package arrived by Friday, which was great. The look on his face upon opening it today was priceless. However, the look that followed the assembly and battery insertion was devastating. That's because after the setup process, pressing the joystick resulted in ONLY 3 of the 4 propellers spinning. Needless to say, it did not even make it off the ground. This drone was to be the crown jewel of his gifts today. Unfortunately, it was the biggest letdown of the day. Now for the return process, YAY!!!

title: Absolutely awesome.  Takes practice, but tons of fun.
text:
Bought it for my daughter, and lost it in a 45 foot tree in the first 60 seconds!!! This thing goes up fast! Luckily, the wind from a thunderstorm blew in and it plinko'ed down to a lower branch where I could grab it with a ladder before the rain came. It was completely fine, and flew perfectly once we charged it back up... only this time, inside with much more care. It takes a few flights to get controls down, you really need to practice them a lot so you can react quickly when things happen during flight. We practiced hovering a lot, flying through doorways, and landing on tables/books/etc. Control is really good once you get the hang of it. I've read the X5C-1 is even better, so I *may* need to get one for myself. It taken a few hard crashes and it's been fine. A few times I thought the propellers would break, but it's been fine. It comes with 4 extra props. It also does NOT need registration as it's only about 55g and you need to be over 250g to register with the FAA.

But it's AWESOME! Needs more batteries, we already bought an additional 5-pack and charger. We'll let the motors cool a bit between flights, but now we don't have to wait an hour for a 7 minute flight.

text:
If you're looking at this, have $50, and like RC stuff - buy this. For the money, it's lots of fun, pretty easy to fly, and gets decent fly time on the supplied batter - pictures and video arent bad either.

Advice - buy extra batteries and a multi battery charger...keeps the fun going. Watch it in the wind, it can get away from you pretty quick and when you're 50+ feet up who knows where it will go.

If I had to say any negatives about this I'd say that the horizontal range seems to be lacking. Maybe it's mine, but It seems like it can go 100' up and still have radio contact, but 40' horizontal (and probably 20' vertical) it seems to lose contact much easier and much more often.

Still a lot of fun - buy it!

title: Great for a beginner, like me
text:
I received this quadcopter as a present for Christmas, and so far have been very happy. It comes with everything you need to get flying, which is great. The extra blades will likely come in handy, as well, since I'm just learning to fly the thing.

Pros:
Stable flying indoors and outdoors.
Easy to trim the quadcopter to mostly eliminate drift when hovering.
Able to remotely take video and photos from onboard camera.
Easy to use controls.

Cons:
Short range of control. I lose signal with the quadcopter at a few hundred feet, which is annoying. I've heard of modifications to the antenna on the controller, which might be worth looking into.
Camera is not very impressive. Shoots AVI videos at 1280x720 with MJPEG compression at 30fps, and with sound, for some reason. All you can hear is the sound of the props, but there is sound.
Be ready to buy more batteries and a multi-port charger. It takes 75min to charge the battery (plus time for it to cool down from the last flight before charging) for a 6ish minute flight per battery.

I'm happy with it, and hope to get lots of flight time in the coming year.

title: Always wanted one of these but didn't want to spend big bucks!
text:
We have had this quad-copter drone for a while now and for the price, you can't beat it. It's easy, yet a little tricky to fly at first. With practice it gets much easier. We have sent this so high that we could barely see it, and captured some great video.

Speaking of the video - it's not HD, but for fifty bucks or so you can't really expect it to be. If you're ok with non stabilized and sometimes shaky or blurry video, you'll love this thing! Still images are so low res that they look like the oil painting effect you can do in Photoshop.

Shortly after we got this we also purchased a set of 5 batteries and a 5-battery charger here on Amazon. This makes for much more satisfying flying since you don't have to be done after such a short time.

Some minor issues we have had were after flying through several batteries and getting what we thought was going to be some amazing videos we found that nothing was recorded on the included micro SD card. Bummer! It may have not been seated good for some reason because it worked during subsequent flights. Flying in windy conditions is especially challenging since it doesn't have all the location sensors and computing power of the big birds, but as long as you're not flying among trees you should still be ok.

For outside use we took the blade protectors off - they're like little hooks and get you stuck in trees very easily! We have made many hard landings, clipped tree trunks and branches, but we haven't broken a blade yet. It comes with a spare set of 4 for when that does happen though.

When you get higher up in the sky it's sometimes difficult to tell which way it's facing - even with the colored LEDs. We plan on painting half of ours a bright color to make it more obvious. Otherwise you start pushing and pulling the sticks every which way to try to figure it out and can lose control of where you're going. It would be nice to have a "Home" button for this reason, but again - at this price that's not possible.

The controller is kind of a joke with many fake buttons on it. It also has an LCD screen that shows you in real time how far and which direction you're pressing the control sticks. While flying, you certainly don't have time be looking down at the screen! You'll know by feel and by watching the drone for instant feedback.

Overall, it's a great source of entertainment for a small investment.

title: One tough drone! Dismount the camera if you are a newbie or want more flying time!
text:
This is a cute, well made drone. With the battery charged, I was able to fly it indoors, in limited space. It crashed many number of times but the little flyer held up pretty well without breaking a single blade, blade guards or landing gear!

Ok, so why the 4 stars? Here are the reasons:

1. The supplied battery will give you only 5-7 minutes of flight time - You're out of playtime by the time you get into the groove!
2. The battery gets real hot - so don't plug it in to be charged as soon as you pull it out of the flyer!!!!!
3. With the camera mounted, the battery compartment has very little area where you can get your fingers around to slide the cover off to install or remove the battery
4. As a result, you may not have secured the battery cover back in correctly - Consequently for me, when the drone landed a bit heavy, the battery cover swung open exposing the battery - Make sure that you secure the cover properly
5. Grammatically poor instruction manual - It is complete, just poorly worded!

OK, but why still 4 stars? Why not 3?
Reason is that most of these issues (except the manual) have workarounds. I don't think it's fair to bash this awesome little flyer for any of the reasons above.
1. You can *almost* triple the flying time by dismounting the camera - I was surprised how much difference this made.
2. This makes dealing with the battery compartment cover easy
3. Upgrade your batteries - I have ordered a set of 3 with a corresponding charger that allows you to charge multiple batteries simultaneously
