title: The quality and the video is amazing. NO JELLO right out of the box
text:
The quality and the video is amazing. NO JELLO right out of the box. Almost indestructible. Fly it with no wind and it hovers like it has gps. I have a high dollar Quad and camera that stresses me out every time i go up worrying about losing it. This is a blast to fly without stress.

UPDATE - Lost my X5C by flying to high, with too much wind. Caution. These are awesome in a light wind, but the X5C is so light that it can keep going if it gets up high and out of range of the transmitter. Cutting the throttle and even turning off the tx didn't stop mine from flying off into the sunset. Very BAD not knowing where it came down or might have hit. The range of these little quads is shortened if your flying in your neighborhood surrounded by houses. And the wind is a bit stronger above. Pick a very large open area and you can get almost 3/4 the length of a football field in range. Beyond 50 yrds, anything could happen.
Just received my replacement and i still highly recommend as a starter quad. Just have to remember that these are NOT the high dollar quads doing arial photography on youtube. LOL. Have fun.

title: Super fun starter drone!
text:
Seeing more and more drones around, I wanted to try flying one but not spend hundreds of dollars. There have been occasional panic landings, a couple of bumps into tree trunks, and so forth but the drone just takes the punishment and keeps on going. Definitely recommend starting out in a big open field and using the prop guards while you learn! Be gentle with the controls and mindful of which way the drone is pointed, try to keep the green lights facing you. With practice you can fly pretty fast, circle around trees, do flips, or just hover really high, whatever you like. It has enough power to handle at least light wind. Not surprisingly, it is more responsive without the camera. The camera comes with a micro sd card installed and takes fair pictures. It's fixed in place and no FPV so there's some guesswork and luck involved, plus color rendition seems a little off; still, it's good enough to have fun with. And you'll want more batteries. I bought one extra 500mAh with it but that's still not enough flying time - I should have gotten an additional kit with multiple batteries and charger right off the bat.
Five stars doesn't mean it's the world's best drone, but for the price I am really pleased with the X5C.

title: The camera takes clear picture/video in good lighting, and with the camera removed can do ...
text: Whoever made this product really thought of everything. I had owned a hubsan before buying this sums model, and my experience with each have been very different. With the Hubsan ($60 on Amazon I might add) I had to purchase my own external memory card, and since it was smaller flights only lasted 3-5 minutes. With the Syma, it came with its own memory card and screwdriver to attach the rotor guards/remove the camera. It also includes a micro SD to Usb converter. The camera takes clear picture/video in good lighting, and with the camera removed can do preprogrammed flips and stunts. Would definitely recommend to beginners looking for a solid and inexpensive drone.

title: Solid Product for the Price
text: Bought this for fun to pass the time after hours while working in USA. I have flown RC choppers before, and that cost me a fortune in repair costs as the flight of a chopper is similar to a pendulum motion. Have to say that this little unit is damn robust. I have been flying it in the hotel room with several clashes with the ceiling, walls and other obstacles. This little unit takes the pummeling pretty well and just carries on. The video works fine, and as more than adequate. If they could put a return/land/takeoff feature it would have 5 stars I think. Otherwise good training quad.

title: Excellent first drone!
text:
This toy drone exceeded my expectations given the price. I highly recommend this as a first drone.

Some negatives that you should be aware of:
- it, strangely, does not fly against low speed winds. It hovers and flies in the wind, just not directly against it. Seems like a software bug because the drone seems to be powerful enough. And if you take it close enough to ground (may be because wind breaks so close to ground), it will fly against the wind. In that, its not a very powerful outdoors drone.
- camera gives poor quality pictures. Most likely you will not find pics worth printing or displaying in a digital frame. You might feel better about the video though as most of us are accustomed to lower quality web video! I'm currently looking for camera upgrade and found 808 No. 16 V3 480p camera recommended at some websites/chat forums. Haven't tried the upgrade yet.

Despite the negatives I give this drone 5 stars because it is a fun drone!

I fly it with blade guards on. The guards have been damaged during numerous falls and crashes but I scotch tape the spokes back to original strength and it's back in action! I have flown it indoors in tight spaces and outdoors in parks. My five year old son also likes to fly it. I got a pack of four batteries so that I do not have to worry about charging batteries when we are at a neighborhood park. :)

It's an excellent first choice to get started with drones.

title: Great, cheap little introduction to the world of drones, that anyone can learn to fly.
text:
This is the first drone I flew, and for the money, it’s fantastic. If you leave the legs and prop guards in place it will run into a building or the ground and just bounce. My 11 year old flys this now and if he gets into trouble, he just cuts the power and lets it drop onto the grass, though I wouldn’t do it on concrete.

Cons - the range is garbage. You will be lucky to get it to 60 or 70 meters out without losing contact, and when it does lose contact, it keeps going.
Flight times are around 5 to 6 minutes per battery. And the batteries aren’t the easiest thing in the world to change out. I upgraded to longer flying batteries, and maybe got another 1.5 to 2 minutes per battery. Flight times (speed and maneuverability) increase if you remove the prop guards, legs and camera.
You can tell it’s cheaply made. The plastic is weak, and the plug in for the battery feels like it’s flimsy, but so far, mine is in one piece... it also means that it bounces and it inexpensive to replace if you do break it.
The camera is....ok. It takes photos and video, but honestly. With no gimbal or vibration dampener, video is shaky at best. I remove the camera, (legs and prop protectors too) and just blast it up and down the fields.

Overall, it’s a cheap little bundle of fun to introduce anyone to the world of drones. Just beware, this world will suck you in to buy a much better bird at some stage.

title: 5 Stars Isn't Enough... Best Toy Everrrr
text:
WOW. Just wow. Best purchase I have made on amazon. This drone has it all. Super fun and always draws a crowd too! Survived PLENTY of badd crashes and still hasn't lost a beat. Few tips though:

1. Only keep the camera mounted if you plan on using it. It will fly longer without it.

2. Try to fly it with absolutely minimal wind as possible when you start to learn how to control it. L mode is recommended. The H mode will make it more nimble, but also easier to crash initially.

3. Don't be afraid to fly it hard. I flew it on a windy day and it got away from me and smacked on the concrete hard. Damage? A tinyyy scratch. Have some fun ;)

4. Careful about letting it cool down before you charge it again. The charger/battery will overheat if you are using it back to back.

Once again... Best purchase on Amazon. You will not regret it.

title: Five Stars

title: Excellent For The Price!
text: My expectations were low for $60, but this quadcopter definitely exceeded my expectations. Great choice for a first drone. Video quality is decent at best. You won't be shooting any wedding videos with this drone. Here's a video I shot using the Syma X5C: http://youtu.be/19aOLb6WLGc

title: Hardy, fun little copter...  It survived three months, outside, in the winter, and still works!
text:
My son and I got one for Christmas. We had a lot of fun with it for a few days, until my son accidentally turned the transmitter off while the quadcopter was pretty high in the air. The copter dropped, and was carried by the wind. We looked for it for a couple of days, but never could find it. Today -- three months later! -- we found it in a tree in a neighboring cul-de-sac. It was about 12' up, hanging. It was missing a single rotor guard, but looked otherwise intact. We took it home, charged it up -- and it worked perfectly! It's been out in sub-freezing temps, and has been through several torrential rains. That the unit is still working is nothing short of astounding.

It's not the easiest-flying copter, and the video quality is marginal. For longevity, and for sheer fun at the price, you can't beat it.

title: Fun for an adult to play with
text:
Bought this for my 30 something son for Christmas. He really likes it and thought it was alot more expensive than it was (so did my husband who paid for it but was pleasantly surprised to find out the real price). My son took to it right away and is still having fun with it. I did think that the materials were a little flimsy and was weary when I noticed so many spare propellars but so far he hasn't need to use them. He says it's better to practise inside the house first than to let it get away from him outside the first few times. My husband was truly surprised that the camera came with this model and said he might want to try one.
I think that I might by this for another adult but wouldn't trust my grandkids with it.

title: First time flyer
text:
Wow, this guy is a lot of fun. First time flyer and I'm not very good. The X5C can take a beating. I've hit everything; walls, couches, ceilings, fans, people, and this drone keeps flying! Easy to get started and learn - although, it took me a few days to get acquainted with controls.

I have a hard time taking pictures and video since you need to use a switch, but I'm sure I'll get better with time.

The battery life is 7 mins, so I'd recommend buying additional batteries to have on hand.

The guards work very well and I'm amazed by how resilient it is. It's really light, but well built.

title: Five Stars
text: lots of fun

title: Advice from a CERTIFIED DRONE KILLER 😄
text: This thing is TOUGH! Don't let the light weight fool you. We've crashed this thing into walls, cars, windows, sidewalks, roads you name it. Still hovers as stable as the day we bought it with the same propellers it arrived with. The camera footage is so so as you'd expect from a low megapixel but as a calm day flier this thing can't be beat for the price! I would and do HIGHLY RECOMMEND this drone to anyone.

title: Pretty fast, very lightweight
text: This thing is a blast to fly. Purchased it to practice before I bought a large drone. Pretty fast, very lightweight, great feature with the low/high rates with the controller. The camera actually isn't that terrible. I did have a motor burnout within about 15 flights but very easy to replace. Transmitter is decent quality. Only complaint is that the sticks are very loose and move around freely, which is good and bad. Great for the price

title: Five Stars
text: Granddaughter loved it...that's all that counts.

title: Very light...for the price it's good.
text: Very lightweight and won't last forever but the kids like it. After a few months a couple pieces are missing on the ends but two boys aren't the most gentle.

title: X5C is known as a great beginner quadcopter
text: We bought this for my 14 yo son for xmas. He loves it. We've flown it both in the house and outside. It's not great to fly on a windy day. I had to get it off the roof when a gust of wind came in and carried it. Luckily he listened and didn't take it up high. The camera quality is so so... it works but that's about all I can say about it. We took it and the landing gear off for longer flight times and better performance. Once he gets use to it we will take the prop guards off too. They work well in the house, although we cracked one on a crash already, didn't bend a prop though!

title: but not before we spun the engines up one more time-enough for those couple grains of sand to foul the gears (plastic) and ruin
text: A soft landing on a small patch of sandy-like ground on a high school soccer field was enough to through a couple grains of sand into one of the propellers.  I realized the potential problem right away, but not before we spun the engines up one more time-enough for those couple grains of sand to foul the gears (plastic) and ruin the drone.  Disappointing.

If I get some advice from the seller, I'll review this as excellent, since it's a very cool toy for the 2 hours my son and I used it.

title: A good craft and a toy for my 6 year old ...
text:
Pro:
A good craft and a toy for my 6 year old and my 40-year old self. Images and videos are not exactly HD grade but sufficient to be fun for the price. Accuracy and responsiveness of the device to RC takes a bit of practice, but is very nice - I was able to take very detailed images for a roof contractor, just hovering the craft over problem areas. As far as legal issues, not sure if this needs to be registered under the new US KGB (pun intended) legislation, we fly it over the neighborhood of 7 households where everybody is friendly and does the same, and low enough not to interfere with anything airborne, other than the sparrows.
Con:
An electrical insulation tape wrapped lithium ion battery with no overcharge protection or any indication of amperage, that goes hot in 10 min of charging from a standard laptop USB port... Seriously... Are you asking for a lawsuit when that s*** catches fire or blows up injuring someone or causing a fire?

title: On the product we received, one arm of the ...

We will update once it arrives and we set it up,
Received our second one and it works great. Do not use on a windy day, otherwise it works fine.

title: Best quadcopter for the money.
text: These are a so easy to fly took me about 5 mins to get the hang of it. I would definitely recommend you order some more batteries of Amazon I got 4 for $20.00. Be aware that you need to let the quad cool down after each flight I flew mine back to back 3 times in a row and one of the motors over heated on my first one. It was my fault that it broke so besides that the durability of the over all quad is outstanding my goofy pitbull was chasing it around the yard and he jumped up and caught it one time only a few bite marks didn't impact the quads flying characteristics at all. Best Beginner quad/drone IMO.

title: very fun
text: Price+features+quality of features+durability= 5 stars.  This isn't a $500 to $1000 fpv quadcopter, so flying takes a little more skill than one of those (no return to operator or auto wind correction, or fpv to keep from getting disoriented).  The video quality is really pretty decent (720p), and mostly just suffers from all the movement taking place.  I didn't expect it to have audio, but it does, but all you can really hear are the props.  Durability is very good.  We used the prop guards, and with plenty of crashes and a free fall from 300 ft or so, no problems.  Although, I would imagine pavement would be hard on it with a full speed crash.  Grass = no problem.  We used it to see our ranch in a unique way and to take fun aerial shots of a new pond that the nephews were driving an rc boat in.  The controls are laid out well like a fps game, so it came naturally, unlike my other syma quad.

title: Perfect Entry Level Quadcopter with Picture/Video Capability and Durability
text:
The SYMA X5C was my first real quadcopter that I could fly outdoors, my only previous RC experience was with a small indoor helicopter and a super micro quadcopter that would only fly inside. First off the controls are incredibly easy, I was able to get the hang of it right away. Picture/Video quality is decent for this price, its definitely not professional level, but great to try to see if this is a hobby you want to pursue. I have flown it 10 times now, and only crashed once, got a little too bold with how high I was flying, lost signal, and it veered in the wrong direction. It feel from three stories high, hit a shed roof and slid on the ground and was perfectly fine, not even a scratch. I attached two sample pictures I took and here is a link to some sample video footage of one of my flights : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lomn98WQvko

Pros:
Easy to handle
Durability
Price
Included 4GB Memory Card

Cons:
Charge time (thats pretty much the same with any quad on the market)
Controller Range (though I have seen a bunch of videos on Youtube on how to mod controller to double range)

I am already looking for a more advanced quad to replace this one (want something that does FPV and has GPS) because its really turned into a fun hobby for me.

title: we have both been into RC flying for years and thought this would be a great way to try out a Quad

title: Worked great for a couple weeks
text:
Worked great for a couple weeks, now it looses connection randomly and sticks with your last remote command.

I.E. On take off I gave full throttle. From 10 feet away my remote lost connection and my drone went up, up, up, and away.... It came down in my neighbors yard so I got it back. This thing is durable if nothing else and image quality is decent, amazing for the price I'd say, but the connection issue is a big deal. It's fun for a while, but I'm on the fence about recommending it. I am not super happy with it, but I also don't not recommend it.

title: Well.....
text: I got this for a 7yr old's birthday who REALLY wanted a drone. It's cheap so my expectations were not much. It worked the day we got it out and we had fun flying it for a while, then it got I think too far from the controls and flew further away on it's own and quit responding. It got snagged and landed in a treetop, there is where it sat for months through wind, rain, storms, and sun. Months later, another parent returned the drone as it had finally fallen out of the tree. Charged up the now dry battery, and remarkably it worked again, although one of the propellers had been damaged from the fall. The camera chip showed some pictures, however, I guess we could never really figure out the video. That's my user error though I think. Overall, good fun toy for a kiddo. Don't let it get too far from your remote.

title: Not a toy!  And so much fun!
text: This little quadcopter is stable and easy to fly.  The trim adjustments work well to dial in a very stable hover.  The green and orange led lights are great for knowing the orientation of the copter. However user beware it can climb high and become easy to loose orientation and fly out of range of the remote.  My first outdoor I lost it once and found it very far away in the cemetery i was navigating.  Btw, its now stuck in a tree behind my house, but I'll get it back or by another, it is so much fun because its challenging if you want it to be.  The video camera works well and the quality in daylight is decent, similar to an older cell phone.  Can't wait to get flying again.  Only complaint is the range of the remote, while it works as advertised at 30m, I wish it was stronger.

title: It was fun. Then it flew away.
text:
This drone was a ton of fun and it was surprisingly responsive and it had better than expected video quality. But, during a normal flight, it just kept climbing and climbing, it was responding to my controller inputs, its lights started flashing, and it flew off. I'm not so much angry as I am disappointed. I just wish it would have better control range. That simple issue is causing a lot of problems for a lot of people.

But don't let this dissuade you from buying one... if you buy one, just keep it at a low altitude and it will probably work better. Unless it gets caught in an updraft. Then all bets are off.

title: great purchase! read review.....
text:
I was new to flying drones, and really wanted to try after seeing my cousin fly his... so I didn't wanna go out and buy a $1000 drone and then have it break on me after 2 days of crashing it.. let's face the truth, if you haven't tried flying these before there is definitely a learning curve.
so I decided on this syma x5c after reading many reviews...
let me tell you, I was so pleasantly surprised at the quality of the flying this syma x5c has!
I also purchased a 4 pack of extra batteries and was able to fly it around in an open field for like an hour! easy to learn, took decent falls and kept on flying, and parts are cheap to replace if need be..
honestly, after having this, I can't imagine buying a dji drone (can cost up to to $2000), as long as these stay in production, ESPECIALLY for beginners.
go ahead and buy this, you won't be disappointed!

title: Its a lot more fun. Took me a while to find answers on ...
text: Once you figure out how to fly it. Its a lot more fun . Took me a while to find answers on the web. The book that comes with it does not tell you half of how to fly and get it so you can control the thing. I found this video online that help me finally get it where i had control...https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hhLMbq3LkrM  .So if this is your first drone..I would do a lot of homework and look up anything you can on this..Also learn to start off on low not high..Learn all the buttons and mode 1 and 2. Still learning I just got this a week ago and just now got it in control. Took some pictures and video they were very good . Still learning about that too. So more homework for me....Over all not bad would give 5 stars if they would had more information in the book ...also do order extra batteries, They just last about 7 mins before you have to charge it. They did come with extra blades found mine 3 days later on the bottom of package after ordering more..but so far did not have to change them even after 20 crashes and stuck in trees. This thing is very durable...Have fun good luck..

title: This is a great starter quad
text: This is a great starter quad, very easy to control, for the price this is one hard quad to beat. I have flown this quad in all kinds of weather since ive had it, hot weather, cold weather, windy weather with zero problems. The camera is 2MP witch isn't bad for the price of this quad, the quality isn't bad on a scale of 1 to 10 id give it an 8. Replacement parts are readily available all over the internet. The only negative I can think of is the battery life, its short so extra batteries are a must, I've ordered 680mah and im getting longer flight times even while recording video, when ordering batteries be sure to check that the seller isn't in china or your going to wait about a month for them.

title: great quad''
text: i ordered X5C but to my suprise i received the X5C1 the upgraded version real happy right off the bat so i read the reviews and the common problem seems to be distance it losses communication at short distances so after some research learned that the antenna is to short so while i was waiting for the battery to charge i took the back off the controller and low an behold the antenna wire was only an inch i added just over 3 inches to it and took it for it's first flight it worked perfectly it hovered flawlessly no adjustments had to be done it was trimmed perfectly i live in Oregon in the Forrest i took it over the trees a good 200 feet and no problems it flies great and the video is actually really good i formatted the card it came with and it works fine no problems in getting 7min 40sec on the stock battery and that's with the guards on and the video cam on and my charge time is between 20 to 30 min not the 90min i have read so i fly it all day every day no problems works great very happy with it for 50 bucks cant beat it.. and it's the luck of the draw when these things are mass produced there will be a hand full that will just be duds as goes for all electronics so i got lucky with this one as i read reviews about motors not working camera not working' yanks to the left or right or it's turned on and nothing the duds are out there just return for new one as there not all bad''  so my experience  has been good happy flying..

title: This is a great place to start if think you might be interested in quadcopters
text:
Let me start this review by saying that if you have never owned a quadcopter before, please do yourself a favor and start off with something like this rather than a DJI Phantom or other expensive drone. This is a great way to learn the basics of flying something like this without risking hundreds or thousands of dollars every time you take flight. You will crash when you're first starting out. You will get it stuck in a tree at some point. If you're flying a copter that costs 45 bucks, you can easily replace it or buy cheap replacement parts and be back in the air without it costing hundreds or thousands of dollars. When you feel like you've mastered something like this, then you can starting thinking about something bigger and fancier.

This is a very easy to fly quad, stable and fun. You can get a 4 pack of additional batteries for about 20 bucks (highly recommended, you only get 5-7 min of flight out of a charge). It's also quite durable, I've crashed it a couple of times and got it stuck in a tree once, with no noticeable damage. The addition of the camera is nice too, just keep your expectations reasonable, you can get this for under fifty bucks so the camera is nothing amazing. You are not going to get the beautiful, stable, panoramic shots that you see some people posting on youtube. Those are taken by drones starting at about 600 bucks. This camera is not stabilized at all, every adjustment you make in flight will cause the camera to shake. Filming also cuts your flight time way down, probably only four minutes or so. The range on this quad is also going to be a lot more limited, it starts getting less responsive around 150 feet away, so I wouldn't fly it a whole lot further than that.

In a nutshell, if you're interested in getting into quads/drones, this is a great place to start. It's a stable, good flying quad with a camera on it for some added fun. It does everything that it says it'll do, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone who is just getting started with the hobby.

title: Overall a Good Deal
text: I received this quadcopter for Christmas. It is easy to fly. The camera works, but it's not impressive. If you want to see a picture of the top of your house it will work. But if you're trying to take an impressive aerial photo, this is not what you're looking for. My main difficulty in flying it is the fact that all four sections look identical except for the lights. During the day you can't see the lights so it's hard to keep track of which direction it will go. I might try marking them with colored tape. I also wish it could fly more than seven minutes. In general I think it's a pretty good deal.

title: Great entry level quadcopter!!
text: Great entry level quadcopter, very responsive and just a blast to play with. I bought it for my little brother Christmas this year. It takes OK pictures but what so you expect out of a 2MP camera? If you have to change the blades out remember which direction they came off because they need to go back on the exact same way other wise it wont lift off the ground and you'll be scratching your head trying to figure it out best thing to do is keep the box around and line up the warning labels exactly like they are on the box picture. This thing will get up pretty far in the air and in a hurry but be advised it only weighs about 3oz (this also means it is not required to be registered with the FAA only 8oz or more have to be) so if a gust of wind happens at say 75ft off the ground it will quickly disappear into the distance. if this does happen don't try to recover as it normally will keep pushing farther away just kill the throttle and go look in the area where you think it landed. You might also want to look into a TILE which you can then attach to the copter and it will help you locate via Bluetooth on your phone. Hope this helps out! And fly safe!

title: Great beginner copter
text: I got this as a cheap test quad copter. I didn't want to spend hundreds of dollars if I decided I didn't want to build them as a permanent hobby. This is a great copter. Extremely easy to fly. I would have happily paid a little more for this guy.

title: More than twice as good as the X11C
text:
I got the X11C as a gift. It was a decent copter that was fun, until I broke it. I wanted to stay with the Syma line since I was familiar with the controls, so I went one step up to the X5C. The X5C is much better in almost every way.

Stability - This this was stable from first take off. I know that I can attribute some of this to experience, but also the much wider base helps a lot. I was able to hover it in place right away. And when I brought it out to the wind, it handled much better that the X11C. Some gusts were still pushing it, but not as wildly.

Sound - The sound of this is a much lower pitched fan type sound. This is much appreciated after the higher pitch sound of the X11C.

Controls - The controls are just about the same, just a different control design but same basic buttons. This controller has an LCD which is a cool novelty, but doesn't add that much value. The one thing I wish it would show is the quad's battery level, but instead it shows the controller battery level.

Camera - I think this is the exact same camera as the X11C. At least the inside. 2MP, which produces barely useable images and video. It's fun, but nothing that will impress.

Battery life - This is about equal as the X11C. This copter uses a bigger mAh battery, which is because it draws more power, so the end result in fly time is about the same. The extra batteries I got for the X11C fit in here, but are lower capacity, so only last about 6 minutes. But I have 3 of those, plus the battery that came with this, so I have nearly a half hour of fly time before recharging.

Others - Some other nice things inlude a closed in battery compartment (not more battery wires hitting the blades), stronger blade guards (hopefully they don't break as easily), an on off switch, and landing gear for a softer touch down.

Sure, this doesn't have those fancy headless or return home type features, but I didn't really want to pay that for a toy I like to fly around a couple times per month.

End verdict, I am super happy.

title: more fun than I thought. totally satisfied.
text: I bought this for my son for christmas. I received the X5C-1 with a 4GB micro SD card, even though it says 2GB in the listing. I also bought an extra 6 x 720mAh batteries and a small 5 way charger. My son and I take turns draining batteries. It is a great father son activity. It is light enough not to require FAA registration. Flying it is easy. I recommend watching some YouTube videos on how to practice flying a quadcopter so you don't accidentally fly it away your first time out. Here's one that helped me: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8_JarhVoq1A

title: The controller and/or remote is tough to use and sensitive ...
text: The controller and/or remote is tough to use and sensitive. The controller range isn't strong enough and lost it on our first try! :( I've requested a replacement as a result....

title: So easy your Mother can fly it
text:
I've never seen a quadcopter let alone use one. I decided on this one since it was the least expensive model with an "HD" camera. The batteries and parts are cheap and accessible. Originally I put the UDI 818A in my cart but when I went to add extra props, nobody stocks these, Amazon or otherwise. The all get shipped out of China and since I saw my friend bust up a bunch I knew they had to be more accessible than 2-5 week shipping.

Got the copter at 6:30p and was flying it by 7p in my living room. It was so darn easy and stable! Took it out on my SMALL front lawn at night and let it hover there as well. Even my wife took a turn and had no problem with it. This model has to be as easy as it comes when it comes to flying.

The next morning I took in the middle of the street, got the camera to work and it was super easy to fly. Absolute joy.

Took it out to a local football field the next day. A bit windy and it was tougher to control. Not sure what the breeze was but I'd have to guess it was a good 10mph+. So it had some issues as you've no doubt seen other reviews talk about. One it hit a certain point and altitude it kind of took off on its own and by the time realized it and I cut power, it was already almost 100 yards away. My depth perception obviously sucks as I thought it was much closer. Remember, I'm on a football field so it's already premeasured.

Got it out this morning in calm air and what a joy to fly. Took it out of Low mode and put it in High mode and you could tell a nice difference. Very responsive, very quick. I measured the distance where I could have it take off from the ground. 65 yards. The joy of being on a football field! Once it's in the air I could probably give it some input another 10-20 yards before it was non responsive.

Flight time on 650mAH batteries (it comes with a 500mAH), with the camera on was probably about 7-8 minutes. With the camera attached, but not on, plus the prop guards, I'd say that time might be about 10 minutes. So the camera didn't seem to bog it down much.

Bottom line, if you're looking for an entry quadcopter, you shouldn't go wrong with this model.
[[ASIN:B00MNG37C2 Syma X5C Explorers 2.4G 4CH 6-Axis Gyro RC Quadcopter With HD Camera]]

title: IT STILL FLIES!!!!!
text:
I bought this from letgo.com and the guy bought it here. I wanted to say that I had my 6yr old flying it and she did great for the first 5 or 6 mins. Lost visual and crashed it in a tree. It sat in said tree for 8 or 9 WEEKS in the snow, cold, and rain. When I finally cut it out of the tree, I lost two of the guards and one part of the leg broke. Took the battery out to see if it would take a charge. HOLY ALMIGHTY it started charging! charged it and plugged it in not expecting the board to work. Flashing lights and paired. UNBELIEVABLE!! Well, the camera had to have gotten ruined. Nope. Took a photo in its test flight. While the controls are touchy, this toy is incredible. This might've been a fluke or a one in a million chance that it worked, but I am THROUGHLY IMPRESSED! I'm ordering parts to repair what got damaged and more batteries.

Pro: Appears to be unstoppable! Nice compact size.

Cons: Limited flight distance (compared to a DJI Phantom), short battery life (about 8 minutes of powered on).

title: So much fun, highly recommended for a beginner!
text: So much fun. I'm pretty casual when it comes to quads. I bought the x5c when it was on sale as a gift for my father, step father, and myself. It's very stable (enough for indoor flight) and user friendly to learn. When you switch into high mode and remove the blade guards and camera it's got a decent bit of speed. The motors aren't powerful enough to really hurt you if you're thick headed and like to grab it in flight or fly it near someone (though it does hurt). Flight time is about 6-12 minutes depending on your aggressiveness. Only main complaint is the range isn't very good. There's modifications online that can be made to the controller that are supposed to improve it but I haven't tried yet.

title: This is a fun quadcopter. Nice video images
text: This is a fun quadcopter. Nice video images.  My eight year old flies this expertly (better than the adults). May not be indicative of other kids his age, however.  He is really into flying.

title: Fun while it lasted..
text:
It was fun for the 3 flights that I had it... I received a far superior parrot bebop for xmas and after reading the horror stories of out of control, lost or crashed drones, I decided I wanted something cheaper for my first drone. So, it was returned and I bought the Syma X5C instead.
My first few test flights were outdoors in no wind conditions. I kept it a few feet off the ground and just tried to learn how to maneuver it around my back yard. The syma is quick and responsive. The video is shaky and the photos are about what you would expect from a cheap camera. Regardless, I wanted this for learning.
My third flight was in a minimal breeze situation. Still not sure what really happened.. but, I throttled it up to about 4 feet off the ground to hover. Then all of the sudden, it darted up about 15 feet. I let off the throttle and it didn't seem to respond. A few seconds later, I was staring at my syma drifting up and over the trees next door at about 30-40 feet. The throttle was off, I tried to turn, move forward, back and nothing was happening. I took my eyes off it for a few seconds to see if the remote still had connection. It showed connection.... That's when the sound from the props stopped. I looked backup... It vanished. I have no idea if it went higher, crashed into the tree, darted off, or what. I checked with the neighbor, checked his yard, stared up at the tree for a while, looked on his roof.. nothing. It has vanished. I am about 50% sure it is buried in that oak tree, but cannot see it.
My first emotion was total embarrassment as I had to bang on the neighbors door and tell him I lost my toy. After that, it was kind of comical that I just threw away $50+..
I am not really sure what happened and why I had no control. But I will probably not attempt to throw away $50+ on one of these again. It was a cool toy for the brief time I owned it. I doubt I will not get another one of these drones again.

title: but it's cool to play with

title: Harder to control than expected, and the battery door opens far too easily
text: Not as easy to control as we'd hoped. We had a better time controlling a Syma helicopter, in fact. So this drone hasn't gotten a lot of use. The battery compartment is always opening with the slightest crash, too, so that's annoying. We never really got around to testing the camera.

title: Great smaller quad
text: Great smaller quad!  Its about 18" x 18" when fully assembled.  My son loves it and it films and flies great.  It will fly up over 50 feet and hovers and is very easy to maneuver. This is his second one of the same kind because the first one got a bit of moisture inside.  Be aware not to get any moisture in it. Other than that, it has been terrific and fun.

title: LOST IN THE DRINK. Buyer Beware. Too heavy. Easily lost
text: My first quad, but not my last. In general, this machine seems too heavy and flies like crap. I spent tons of time practicing in a controlled environment before I ventured out. I saw a vid that warned me that if this unit goes out of range, it only recalls the last command you gave it. This means you may lose it. I was flying mine over 100 meters from a lake, the unit went out of range as it caught a gust of air, flew over the lake and went in the drink. That's after stripping it down with no blade guards, etc. The next one I get will definitely have some homing firmware. If you fly this thing in your hood trying to snap some vids, expect problems ranging from the camera not seating properly and falling loose, to squirrel-like behavior with a mind of it's own.

title: Great Toy for the Money!
text:
This little guy is pretty awesome, especially for the cost. It has its flaws, but the fun to cost ratio is off the charts.

Controls:
The controls took a bit of getting used to for me (I'm a beginner), but after playing with it for a couple of hours, I've gotten pretty good with it. The response is really quick and tight, almost overly sensitive. It seems like there a couple of different flying modes, depending on how you want to maneuver, but I'm not exactly sure what each one does because the instructions aren't especially clear on this.

Material/Quality:
The build quality is not great, but then again, I've let it drop from about 30 feet in my yard and it was just fine. It's incredibly light, and made of a semi-rigid plastic. Because it's not too brittle, it's able to take some hits without shattering. The prop blades are a bit more rigid/brittle, so the included guards are recommended. Extra blades were included with mine.

Camera:
I really wasn't expecting much from the camera, but it takes surprisingly clear photos and videos. It's not a Go Pro, but it's not bad. The memory card and USB adapter for it feel really cheap, but they've worked every time so far. I do architecture/urban design work, so I'm excited to take some site photos.

Battery:
The battery life is about 10 minutes. It charges quickly, maybe a full charge in a half hour? I'm not especially sure on this because the charging light on the USB adapter never seems to turns off. The connection between the USB adapter and the battery feels cheap, and I anticipate one part of it will break before too long. The connection between the battery and the drone seems kind of clunky and poorly designed as well. Again, this hasn't caused me any problems yet, but it seems like a potential point of failure. I will be getting a couple extra batteries soon so I can swap them out and keep flying.

All-in-all, this is a great starter drone with some really great features for the money. Don't expect a masterfully crafted feat of engineering. Instead, expect a really fun toy, and you won't be disappointed.

title: Great inexpensive quad to learn how to fly or just ...
text: Great inexpensive quad to learn how to fly or just have fun with. Very durable and takes crashes in stride. Just make sure you let it calibrate with both joysticks held all the way down and right until the rapid flashing lights slow to an even flash. Then flip the left joystick to full up and full down and the lights stop flashing and your ready to take off! The camera is what you'd expect but it works. Not what I bought it for. I bought a Phantom for that!

title: 50% chance of getting an awesome quadcopter
text:
I purchased one of these and was very impressed with the quality of the quadcopter. It had a great camera and was very responsive when flying. When the battery approached a low level, the lights on the bottom would flash and I had about 30 seconds to land the drone. I picked up a cheap micro SD card, since it did not come with one, and started capturing video. The video was very clear and smooth. Unfortunately, like most people’s experience, the drone soon ended up in the top of a tree.
Since I had such a great experience with this drone I quickly decided I would buy the same drone back. When I received my second drone, I was surprised and happy to find that there was an SD card included in this one! Unfortunately, that is the only positive I can say about it. This drone is definitely a lot less of a quality product.
- The included screwdriver would not work with the small crews. I had to use the old screwdriver from my first drone – not that big of a deal, especially for a cheap included screwdriver
- The drone does not give a warning for a low battery. It just drops out of the air. I cannot control it and as it falls to the ground, the lights start flashing. I don’t’ understand why it would behave differently than the other which was the exact same model.
- When I placed the SD card in my PC to watch the recorded video, I noticed broad lines running across the image. These lines make waves through the image when the drone is in motion. The video quality is awful compared to the first drone I had. Again that doesn’t make sense since these are the same model of drone.| see the screenshots ( the shot in the snow is the second one i recieved, the other is from the first X5C i had)
If both drones were as good as the first one I had I would easily recommend this drone to anyone. I was so happy with that drone I couldn’t see why people spend up in the hundreds for a drone, but I guess it come down to quality control. If you invest in the Syma X5C, just know you have about a 50% chance of getting a lemon.

title: This thing is awesome. In normal mode it tips a long ways ...
text: This thing is awesome. In normal mode it tips a long ways before it starts to go any direction  compared to my other brands. I'm not sure how or why it does but it makes it so much easier to fly. It's hard to mess up when you can watch it start turning for a full second before it actually moves. And that 6 axis gyro is amazing. You can reach out and punch it while it's hovering and it'll tip straight sideways and go full throttle in a slit second to hold itself in place and then level back out and don't move more than 6 inches from where it started. And the range is great too.  By far the best quad for the money.

title: Good Purchase for my 8yr old
text: My daughter cried tears of joy when she opened this package on Christmas, so I would call that a success. I purchased this, since she is 8 years old and felt that she should first figure out a "drone" like this before getting the full out real deal. I'm pretty happy with our purchase!

The lightweight power socket and battery plug are inferior in quality and are placed in a spot where they are squeezed every time the battery door latch is secured.  2 of the 3 purchased now are unflyable because the connector won't stay connected.  When it flew it was nice and easy to fly but the battery design is horrible.  Now it's junk.

title: Great great starter drone
text: Great great starter drone.  Very tough and resilient.  Mine has survived nearly a thousand crashes and I'm still using the original propellers.  If you're thinking of buying a big drone (like a DJI) BUY THIS and practice landing and flying BEFORE you purchase the DJI.

text: It's very durable, I crashed it several times and no damages. Get the extra batteries if you want to fly it more than 10 minutes

title: Killer, fun, and can take a beating!
text: Great product.  Works better than expected. For the price I wasn't expecting much. What I got was a durable agile flying machine. I was a first time flier of quadcopters and had it down pretty quickly but the first day I had more crashes than I want to admit, some so hard I expected it to be broken. Nothing but some minor scratches. I purchased numerous sets of props thinking I would break a few. I've only broken 1 blade to date and this thing still flies great. I would definitely recommend this product to anybody new to quads that wants an excellent durable quad. The camera is above expectations as well.

title: Get it. Get it now.
text:
My husband LOVES this thing. We got a couple more as christmas gifts. It's surprisingly easy to fly after attempting other things like flying airplanes. We even got one for my dad who is older because we think he could easily handle it. It makes my 3 year olds' day to fly this thing with his dad and my husband is like a little kid, sneaking away to go play with his toy whenever he can. It can go crazy high, almost too high as you could literally lose sight of it! It does fun flips and has already paid for itself in entertainment value.

The battery it comes with does not last long so go ahead and get some replacement batteries right away. They are not expensive and it extends flying time by quite a bit to have a few in rotation. We are super happy with this purchase and can't believe what a great deal it is for the quality.

title: Great starter
text: Received the product quickly and without any problems. Great little quad to learn on before moving up to the more expensive quads. Plenty of YouTube videos to help with understanding the copter and ticks on using it.

title: Great choice for a starter
text:
This is my first full size quadcopter and I'm blown away!

First off, you can't beat the price for what you get. Along with the quadcopter and controller it came with a 4gb sd card and sd card reader, blade protectors, landing gear and spare blades as well as a small screwdriver, battery (500mAh) and charger.

It is very easy to pick up and learn to fly and after a few flights I felt very comfortable controlling. A friend even showed me "expert mode" which allows the copter to be more agile and fly faster. I've probably taken about 20 flights (under 10 mins each) and have had a few decent crashes (mostly on grass) and it's holding up well.

I purchased a spare battery since charging can take a few hours but typically get my fix with just the 2 batteries. I haven't used the camera much, so that will likely speed up battery drain.

Overall this has been a great starter drone. Very lightweight and so far durable enough. Spare components are cheap if needed.

I have no real complaints. My only wishes are easily addressed by moving up to a larger more expensive drone. I see myself upgrading to a better model in the next few months (most likely one with FPV) and will likely just pass this on to my son so he can learn.

title: Bought 2 of these for Christmas and they are terrific. very durable with the blade guards installed and ...
text: Bought 2 of these for Christmas and they are terrific.  very durable with the blade guards installed and lots of fun.  pick up the extra battries and charger so you can get more than 7 minutes of fun.

text: Appears to be very well-built. Also as a beginner seems to be a very good starting point. For the money

title: Great drone for the money.
text: My 10 year old son loves to fly this drone. It's a good size, and easy to control, not like the small hard to control helicopters we've tried that always get stuck in trees. He can fly it well, the flips are fun to watch. He'll take it along while we walk the dog to the neighborhood park. Our neighborhood is fairly quiet, but when cars do come along, he lowers it to the ground. The camera pics are decent quality and the battery lasts about 10 minutes. We've had it about six weeks and we plan top buy extra batteries for longer flying sessions.

title: The video quality outdoors is way better than I had expected for a products in this ...
text: Bought this for my 7 year old grandson.  It's been fabulous!  He's able to fly it and has taken some videos of his home.  The video quality outdoors is way better than I had expected for a products in this price point.  It's been sturdy, even been retrieved from trees twice while he was learning to control it.  Very happy with the product and will be buying a couple more.

title: Go outside and Fly high
text: WOW!  For what you pay there’s a lot of bang for your buck here. Comes assembled and ready to fly, nice to have removable replaceable batteries. Getting use to flying but a whole bunch of fun! Plus you get a still and motion camera with a USB adapter for the memory card.

text: helped me learn how to fly a quadcopter, Lasted for about a couple dozen flights before one of the motors died out. Also, the controller power switch was unreliable and sometimes would not come on when switched.

title: It's very cool! It is
text:
I bought this for my brother's 13th birthday. It's very cool! It is, however, incredibly loud--sounds sort of like a vacuum flying around, and the sound on the little video camera is absolutely nuts when you play it back.
The fly time is just a few minutes and requires a long charge, but when you see that thing running you will understand why--there is a TON of effort being exerted by those little batteries!
I also love the blade guards on the little propellers, which to me makes it a little safer since those things could probably chop an arm off from going so fast.
Decent buy for $50-ish bucks.

title: Five Stars
text: The ORIGINAL trainer quadcopter of choice. :) Syma X5C-1 is tough.

title: This drone can not die. I have had it ...
text: This drone can not die. I have had it for about a year and have crashed it over and over. It most recently spent 5 weeks in a tree where it was pelted with rain and snow, and when it finally came down it spent another night in the snow before I found it, I gave it a day to dry and it still works perfectly.

title: Super difficult to fly and made of cheap materials

title: Great copter for the price
text:
This quad copter is great. I've flown it at least a dozen times now and it's fun. I fly mine without the blade braces and have crashed it on a variety of surfaces and nothing has broken yet. There is some minor setup including attaching a three pin cable, but nothing too tough.
Biggest downside is trying to keep it stable. I tried to take pictures of my gutters with it and I expected it to jump at wind being so light, but even with minimal wind the thing bobs and weaves when trying to keep it stable (even just adjusting blade speed with the left stick and nothing else).
Overall at well under $100 I was highly impressed.

title: Five Stars
text: no wonder it's a best seller.

title: Xmas spirit crashed and burned.... YMMV!
text:
TL DR; Cheap Quad copter that flies extremely well for the price - you just have to wonder how long the parts will last. 1 motor dead in under 30 minutes total time used. YMMV. This is something I really want to love but I am just not feeling it for now. I have submitted an exchange request. Hopefully the replacement lasts longer and I will bump the rating from 2 stars to 3 or 4.

I got this quad as a present to myself. My wife last year got me a Syma 107 helicopter. It is fun but you could only really fly it indoors. I decided to try a quad. I bought this quad because of the reviews. So far, it has been a major disappointment.

Pros:
- Inexpensive
- Flies well
- specs said 2GB card but I received a 4GB so it looks like I got an upgraded X5C-1

Cons:
- Atrocious manual (I had a heck of a time figuring out how to get video to work. See note below what I learned...)
- Parts will literally fall off in flight (had one led lens cover just fall off) PITA factor to replace
- major durability concerns - 1 motor dead in under 30 minutes of non-continuous use!!!
- camera angle is poor

NOTES ON VIDEO:

Setup is fairly intuitive. Knowing how to get video is not. I am one of those people who will actually RTFM first, search Google second, and ask on a forum third. The manual has the grammar level of a toddler. Page 9 on the manual: "Get to know take photo and video". Nice Engrish. The general is idea is conveyed there but this is this directions to take video "Make sure camera normally work , when pull the button 'C' down , camera starts to take video after a beep from the transmitter and the GREEN indicator on camera will change to RED than keep flashing".

Grammar errors aside, it overlooks two critical items. The LED is *INSIDE* not *ON* the camera. It is not visible in daylight conditions. Also nowhere in the manual does it state where to find this LED. Additionally it also mentions to pull but we would say push down on the C button again to stop video. You absolutely *MUST* do this or you will get zero size video files that will not play. So do not forget to do this or you will lose your video. The manual is pretty close to useless in learning the finer points of using the quad. This quad flies outdoors extremely well and pretty smooth; even in mildly windy conditions. Compared to my heli, the quad is far more responsive and faster. With the heli, even the most minor breeze would cause it to crash. Ironically this quad isn't good to fly indoors because it flies too fast unless you have a ridiculously large house with an open floor plan. I do not.

One last item on video. The camera angle is poor. If you are moving forward at any appreciable speed you will be taking video or a picture of the ground. With a little modification, this can be easily fixed.

Pearls of wisdom in case you purchase:

If you are a noob like me, I highly recommend flying this with the blade protectors on. It will reduce flying time a little but will provide some insurance in case you crash. Trust me, you will crash. I also recommend flying this in a field with grass away from trees; like a high school football field. The range of the unit is approximately up to 30m. I would also strongly recommend flying it no higher than 30 feet until you get very comfortable flying the unit. Crashing from 1-2m is not as bad as crashing from 30m.

Also if you do fly it higher, it becomes really difficult to control. The LEDs underneath attempt to provide visual orientation of the quad but during the day you cannot see them. If it is 10-20m up and a gust of wind hits you can easily lose control and send it out of range pretty quickly.

That being said, I also recommend purchasing spare part kits, extra batteries, and a multi-port charger. Prior to opening this christmas day, I already purchased a 5 port charger by Holy Stone [[ASIN:B00QHUONLE Holy Stone 5-in-1 Max 2.5a Current Input Fast Battery Charger for X5c,udi 818a,x1,hubsan X4,hs170,x400,f181,f180 Quad]][[ASIN:B00QHUONLE Holy Stone 5-in-1 Max 2.5a Current Input Fast Battery Charger for X5c,udi 818a,x1,hubsan X4,hs170,x400,f181,f180 Quad]] and six extra LiPo batteries. Unfortunately, the 6 batteries I got are not currently available on Amazon. I have yet to review them but so far I would give them 5 stars. They're Morpilot and rated 3.7V LiPo 720mA 20C [[ASIN:B016BDALIU Morpilot® 6pcs 3.7V High 720mAh 20C Lipo Batteries for Syma X5C X5SW X5SC X5A X5]][[ASIN:B016BDALIU Morpilot® 6pcs 3.7V High 720mAh 20C Lipo Batteries for Syma X5C X5SW X5SC X5A X5]]. Look for a similar rated battery >500 mAh and >20C. The 20C rating has to do amount of current the battery can provide.

Today, one motor just stopped working. Joy. My daughter was flying it for about one minute and landed it. She handed me the controller and I tried to take off. Boom, one motor stopped working as it was taking off and flipped over into the grass. I have filed an exchange with Amazon. I do hope the replacement lasts longer, and this was a fluke. My helicopter has tens of hours of use. So much so that I need to replace the battery because it has too many charge cycles.

Overall if the motor had not failed I would have rated 3 stars. Star deductions for the abysmal manual, parts detaching in flight, and now the motor failure.

title: Joystick is absolute garbage. First time flying it took off and I ...
text: Joystick is absolute garbage. First time flying it took off and I wasn’t able to control it and literally flew out of control and into a nearby creek. Really unhappy with this product.

title: Does not lives up to its brand name
text:
I have been trying different Drones and with Syma name attached to this little guy I thought that this drone will live up to its brand name. But alas I was wrong. Here are the Plus and Minus of this Drone:
Plus:
- The biggest Plus of this Drone is its cost. At 45$ you can at least have a Drone flying experience.
Minus:
- Really really hard to control and keeps drifting to one side. Tried recalibrating but to no use.
- Battery lasts just a few minutes.
- No Altitude hold feature.
- Bad camera.
- Bad remote design with display on the bottom of the remote rather than on the top, which makes it hard to see.

title: Fun to fly
text:
Fun to fly, great to learn on, DOES NOT LIKE TREES. Do not fly it in a tree! I mostly fly inside, however I have flown it outside for about 15 seconds and then spent a few hours retrieving it from the top of a tree.

Oh and get extra batteries a four pack seems to work pretty good.

title: Not worth a penny.
text: Read all the Reviews and Then Don't Buy.. It is a plastic piece of junk. Got one and if would not work. Bought a second one and it would not work.  I guess you know now that it is junk. I would like to say something about it. But I can't. My wife thought she was doing me a favor and get me another one, but didn't know that I just had issues with the other ones. So I am returning the one she bought for me. But doing so I have to pay to ship it back, so don't order it or you will have to pay to ship it back. Good intentions on her part but it's not worth it to buy or to return.

title: Fun to money ratio is off the charts.
text: I'm currently on my second one of these, my dog attacked the first one after mistaking it for a frisbee. For the money it's incredibly tough, I've crashed it 100 times and it just keeps going. Put the blade guards on it and buy extra batteries. Camera is kind of pointless, just take it off. It's the most fun at night, people are freaked out by it. Start flying it inside to get the hang of it, make sure it's on the less responsive setting and try both setting for what joysticks control what, you might like one more than the other. If you fly near trees get ready to find a long stick to dislodge it or climb like a monkey.

title: A really excellent beginner quadcopter
text: A really excellent beginner quadcopter. I had been flying remote-control helicopters, which were a lot of fun. This is more fun mainly because you get better directional control and responsiveness. The Syma's power to weight ratio is very high so it can move out smartly if you want. The camera is not HD for sure, but still not bad, especially for the price. No regrets for buying it. It's a lot of fun. Only caution is you need a day with little to no wind to fly it; it is so lightweight that gusts will send it reeling. To see what the video looks like, go to this Youtube link: [...]

title: Great little quad! Love it!
text: Got this as my first quad copter. Very easy to learn how to fly and very easy to replace broken parts. Highly recommend for beginners that want to learn how to fly! Be sure to do the controller antenna mod for more range.

title: Fantastic if you buy the separate battery pack that comes with 6 batteries
text: This copter can take a beating. It comes with spare parts and if there is a part you need that it doesn't come with then you can buy it at a local store. This copter is cool. The only thing I don't like is that if you put on the spare blades it doesn't fit back into the box. I bought the battery pack separately that comes with 6 extra batteries and that is awesome too.

title: Great Product...Great Entry Level Drone/Quad Copter
text: Great product.....unfortunately my maple tree ate it. If you keep it away from trees, it's a great entry level drone and an awesome value for the money. I have purchased three so far and have had hours of fun flying them. I caution you to be careful when buying extra batteries...some are to large for the battery compartment.

title: A fun little toy!
text: A fun toy, but not really a drone.  Well I guess it depends on how you define a drone, but this is a RC quadcopter with a video camera.  I flies well in little to no breeze, but with a little wind prepare for it to go where you don't expect it to.  The gyro effect takes over and tries to correct for you, but overrides your control.  The range is very short, but there are many videos on how to improve this. When I show this to people they think it must cost $100 -$150 and a few years ago it would have, but for $50 you can't go to far wrong.  It is durable and entertaining for what it is and ready to fly out of the box.

title: The instruction manual is ABSOLUTELY AND UTTERLY USELESS. Even if you follow it to the letter ...
text:
As I said in the " seller feedback " section I saw grease on the instruction manual and grease on the 2 of the quadcopter blades .

I couldn't believe it and should have known that rough seas were ahead.

The instruction manual is ABSOLUTELY AND UTTERLY USELESS .Even if you follow it to the letter ( you can tell based on the grammar that moron who wrote it never got a full understanding of the english language ) flying this piece a useless plastic is a nightmare .

The fine-tuning section is ridiculous and does not work when appliewd to the unit during flight NO MATTER WHAT .

I was an hour away from giving this to my nephew who was excited to the point of trembling to get this and now I have to disappoint him till next month as I find a replacement.

Thank you AMAZON , " battery superstore " and to whichever company designed this for lowering my faith even further in you r so called service.

title: We were impressed with how sturdy it is
text: Got this for my 13 yr old son's birthday. He loves it. The only big problem we had was it did not come with instructions. My son searched on line and found them in minutes (the scan code on the box only produced Chinese instructions). Once we knew which button controlled High/Low it was much easier to fly. The controls are very sensitive and on high my son pressed lightly and the thing shot upward and off behind some trees. It crashed hard in front of the house on the street behind us. We were impressed with how sturdy it is. There was not a scratch on it after falling 50 ft.

title: Great flying Sturdy Drone..
text: [[VIDEOID:ef3f6b6e642a81e30006f6c383ca274b]] My 13 year old and I are having Soooo much fun with this quad. It flies very well and seems Very Sturdy. We have gotten it stuck in 3 trees so far. Each time we got it out it was still in great shape and still performed like a champ. It flies very high and far. Whenever it is getting out of range, the lights blink letting you know so you either turn it around and bring it towards you or cut the power and let it drop to about 25 feet and give it the throttle. I am attaching a quick video that we made with it. Great Quality on the recording also. We are Very Happy with it. Now I have to buy one for myself. So we can fly them together. I also bought 4 extra 600mah batteries. We have been flying all evening today. I am buying another.

title: This is pretty awesome. One problem I had is one of ...
text: This is pretty awesome. One problem I had is one of the motors died after 2 days. The good thing is I had another one. So assuming the parts will die it is really fun to fly around the yard. Kind of big for the house but doable.

title: Highly recommended! Like anything new you'll need some time to ...
text: Highly recommended! Like anything new you'll need some time to get used to flying a drone. This is the perfect quadcopter to learn with as it is easy to fly and extremely durable. I've crashed it dozens of times from grass, boulders, trees, hardwood floors, tile floors the list goes on. Each time with no damage that puts the quadcopter out of commission. It came with extra blades that I haven't had to use yet. The picture  and video quality is pretty decent given the overall price and quality of this drone. The only drawback is you're probably going to get the bug and want to get more drones.

title: This thing can take a beating, but....
text: So overall I really like this drone, and my kids do as well. My only complaints weren't very serious but I wanted to note them. Right out of the box the propeller guard deals that  help keep the props from breaking when you crash it, interfered with two of the propellers so they would hit it. No big deal really but I always had to kinda bend it down a little before flying. The only other issue was the camera falling out sometimes, eventually it fell out and the little wire came out of the plug so I couldn't film anymore. Overall though, this thing is awesome!

title: feels like a spy
text: I feel like I'm a good spy whenever I play this drones. I can spy with it anywhere I want to.

title: Best you can buy for this price
text: Best you can buy for this price. It's very mod-able and perfect for a beginner! Also does cool tricks. The camera is junk and the controller is very cheap but for the money it's awesome!

title: Fun toy with a functional camera.
text:
Fun toy, keep the toy in sight and avoid trees and slight winds at all costs. Would like to use it with GPS and a better camera. The video comes out better than pictures. Wish it was not so light in weight even a slight wind blows it into trees. People using it in wooded areas have a hard time controlling safe descent and retrieval from high trees.

Recommended area is a large field with no trees and no wind situation. Best wind conditions to fly this toy is 5 mph or less.

title: Well worth the money
text: A good first time copter/drone . Order extra batteries because the stock one only lasts about 15 minutes. Only gave it 4 stars because the landing skid broke on the first crash, everything has taken a beating. I let my 8 year old fly it. Camera is ok , if you want HD this isn't for you.

title: Don't waste your money
text: One of the motors stopped working after the first time we used it.  I bought a replacement motor and then the remote stopped working.  All this in a span of less than 2 months.  Refund period is only 45 days.  Don't waste your money.

title: Flies high
text: This drone well deserves a five star.Camera works great, love the 360 flips and it flies highhhhh, love it.

title: Fun and durable!
text: really fun drone that is durable to withstand a ton of crashing. If you are getting into RC quadcopter and want a great starter to learn on this is it! There are a ton of cheap props, batteries, motors in case you have to replace anything

title: Great first quadcopter
text:
This is my first quadcopter and I purchased this to upgrade from my SYMA S107. This the perfect first quadcopter to learn flying and I am surprised by it's durability. I have crashed it many times and still flies like new. I also highly suggest buying few extra batteries. The flight time is around 7 minutes and you wouldn't want to put it down.

The camera's resolution is decent, but the picture quality is not so good when it's too bright, or for objects that are far away. I can see chromatic aberration around boundaries of objects like trees. But for around $40, one cannot ask for more than this.

title: A+
text: Best drone for the money.  Flies great.

title: Toy Price : Remarkable Performance & Value : Great Starter Drone
text:
For the price, its amazing! A great practice drone before you go dropping you hard earned money in a more expensive system. I started out with an Android Phone drone flying App and then got this to get into the physical drone action again, having long ago gone in bigger on an original AR Drone.

Its light enough that you do not need a special FAA registration to fly it as a toy. The video quality is mediocre, but amazing given the price. I removed the camera to give it better performance!

title: Surprisingly durable...
text: Hard to beat for the money. Makes a nice toy for the kids and is surprisingly durable. A day after purchasing ours, it managed to get lodged about 60 feet up in a maple tree -- which is where it stayed for three weeks until a fierce rainstorm blew it down. Our neighbor brought it back to the house, we charged it up and it worked fine!

title: I recommend to buy extra batteries for longer play
text: Only 7 minute battery life. I recommend to buy extra batteries for longer play. Overall, my husband likes it and uses it daily. FYI - We have three dogs that go crazy for it and have bit it and thrown it...it's still flying!

title: Easy to fly and can withstand the beating required to learn - From novice to pro in 3 battery charges
text: Before this, I had never flown drone. It took a while to figure out how to maneuver it (about 3 charges), but now I feel like a pro. I chase my little brother around, and annoy all the little dogs that walk past my house. I also rarely get it stuck in trees anymore. Another good thing about this is that it is very sturdy. Mine has taken some serious crashes and actually seems to get more awesome with each crash! You might as well buy the extra batteries and a charging hub right away, because it sucks when you have to wait an hour and a half to satisfy your flight cravings.

title: Still works
text: My son loves it and plays with it often

title: Great, but easy to lose.
text:
Been flirting smaller indoor versions, and got this one ad a gift from Amazon. Ur flies great, accessories and parts are easy to get, and there are a ton of modifications on the web.

Unfortunately, I didn't get that far. It lost control a hundred or so feet up, the copter stopped responding, and went over the hill. I can see it, but it's 60 ft up a tree, wedged in the crook of a heavy branch.

Maybe some day the tree will come down and I'll recover the card and see what happened.

title: Model trash
text: i actually got on here bc I finally found the box id put up in case it didn't work. well- it doesn't work. no response, no action, not even a wreck like most drones & such. it just sits there in the way from one dresser to the other dresser all summer. like a bulky reminder that I got screwed. was so excited I finally found the box, was geared up for a replacement (like an amazon gift card, not another one of these)bc its completely useless, actually worse than useless bc u hate to throw it in the trash, & being so, u gotta find a place for it that it doesn't break while it sits & waits for it ultimate disposal. really, no reasonable reason it hasn't been tossed, other than when u spend $60 on an item u just keep hoping that maybe u could've used that $ for firewood instead of the product. then u realize, since the company doesn't offer any return, replacement, zero-offers no other service other than this review(which I have doubts will even be published)---this thing is a piece of junk. but let me tell u just in case, ive had surgery this summer & cant go back to work as soon as id hoped. if youre ready to toss away $60, please let me know bc I sure could use it.

title: fly high my friend
text:
VERY nice Quad i could not belive how easy it is to fly.very stable.very durable.after a few major hard crasheses .nothing broken.but replacment parts are easy to get and easy to replace.and at a price that dosent break your bank if you break a part.mods are also simple.camera works very well ive taken video of up to 3/4 mile.nice mid grade remote responds well. fast light weight quad really like the roll button.so yeah i bought a second one 4 days later and have them set up different.two weeks of daily flying for 15 min ea day and you to will be able to buzz the tower also.
Highly recomend.*one warning watch the props they do hurt if they hit you.*

title: This awesome drone can take a beating
text: [[VIDEOID:b240649442dc34716d5305dd3b220cd3]] I bought this drone to because it was cheap and came highly recommend as a practice drone. I have had the drone for over a week and have been flying every day. Recommend you get extra batteries. My flight time per battery has been about 9 min and 30 sec. When you first start flying, try to get the drone to hover in one place and you will see it wants to drift from left to right or front to back. This is fine. What you need to do now is use the trim switches to get it to to stay more stationary which is very achievable. The drone flys very well for a cheap drone and can take a beating. I dont recommend doing this on purpose, but i have hit a tree at full speed and picked it up and kept flying. Have crashed it several times and just shakes it off and keep flying great. After a week i have removed the blade guards and i am flying like a pro. In the beginning, always fly with the green lights facing you so you dont lose your orientation with the controls. Later practice with the drone facing opposite so you can learn how to not lose orientation if the drone gets turned around. I am now upgrading to a DJI drone and i am having a blast. Your gonna love this little drone.

title: Very nice but not perfect, and get ready to spend more on extra batteries, replacement motors, etc.
text:
This drone was recommended by a friend, and I've found that if it is flown with care, in the open and AWAY FROM TREES it can be a nice little toy. I like that so many of the replaceable parts are affordable; motors average about $2.50 each. We noticed one motor seemed weaker than the others on our first outing, and before long (and after a day stuck in a tree), the motor didn't have enough torque to spin the rotor. Replacement seems a little convoluted with so many screws to remove plus the need for soldering, but looks doable.
Additional batteries are a must, as each charged battery flies for about 7 minutes and takes at least 45 minutes to recharge. The picture and video quality of the camera is surprisingly decent. I'm a bit flummoxed though that the video includes sound, which records only a very loud motor noise while it is in operation.
I suspect the quality of these units varies considerably from box to box, but since most of the parts can be replaced -and eventually will have to be anyway- you're only a few solders away from a like-new flying unit. Buy it knowing that additional expenses are a likely part of the equation.

title: This is the absolute perfect starter drone!
text:
This is the absolute perfect starter drone!
A quick search through amazon reveals a staggeringly wide range of prices . If you're looking for a drone to test the waters and see if you might be interested in making a larger investment this is the one.

I'm very impressed with the durability and maneuverability.

The camera is impressive for the price too. It's not an amazing picture, but not overly grainy either. I flew it as high as it would go with the camera on and out gives me a clear view of a major freeway about 300 yards away.

There is endless fun to be had with this drone and I can't say enough good things about it.

Have fun, be safe, and take it easy on the dog...

P.s. don't forget to buy some extra battery packs and a multi battery charger. You'll regret it if you don't.

title: Inexpensive, but not cheap quality.
text: An inexpensive drone, with good capabilities. The camera/video leaves a lot to be desired (the pictures are about the same as a 10 year old flip phone), but that wasn't a purchasing reason, so the fact there's anything is just a bonus. Battery life is good, range has yet to be a problem (and I've gone out to around 150 yards, which is getting pretty hard to see), performance/speed is acceptable.  I'm not sure how easy this is to fly for a beginner (I've been flying helicopters for years, so it's second nature), but it met my expectations, and did it at a great price point.

title: Great cheap drone.
text: This drone is a lot of fun and great for beginners. It has been quite durable too. I had mine stuck up in a tree for 3 days and it got rained and snowed on and it didn't phase it. The video quality isn't great but what do you expect from a $40-$50 drone. Definitely buy more batteries, one with a charger that can charge a lot at once. Because it is so light it will get pushed around a lot even with the slightest wind. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking at getting into drones. I'm hooked now.
