title: most fun for the money
text:
I got the Syma X5-C1... This thing is way too much fun... I've flown it at my in laws house and the kids had a blast following it around, catching it in their hands, and me niece helped me get it out of the magnolia tree (oops, I got carried away)... It's taken a few hits from trees, been dropped, fell from the sky once or twice (20 to 50 ft and landed in grass), been bullied by my cat, and hit the ceiling a couple of times with no problems... Just keep the gears on the bottom clean from debris and it'll have no problems...

The built in camera is really cool... For a $60 toy you can't really ask for more... In good lighting it works well... I have a video of from it of my cat jumping after it trying to hit it... Looks like something from a monster film...

I'd put a label on it when you get it with your name and phone number... I was flying it at a parking lot and I got up pretty high... The wind shifted and it started to carry it out of range... If it loses connection with the controller it will continue at the last throttle input it received... This thing is light weight and the wind can carry it away if it's a good breeze...

This thing is also very stable... The flips and stuff are great to make the kids giggle... Next task is to have my nephews shoot at it with a nerf gun... buy one! You'll love it!

title: Call them drones or multirotors or quadcopters or flying cameras ...
text: Call them drones or multirotors or quadcopters or flying cameras, it doesn't matter: As of today, December 21, 2015, the US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is requesting anyone who wants to fly an unmanned aerial system (UAS) more than 0.55 pounds (250 grams) and less than 55 pounds (approximately 25 kilograms) This means that at 1.4 pounds or 635.029 this item must be registered with the FAA.  The information on this is at http://www.cnet.com/news/heres-what-you-need-to-know-to-register-your-drone/

title: Great first drone, some maintenance required
text:
This is my first drone and yes, it falls into the class of "toy drone". But there should be a class called "kick butt toy drone" to cover the awesomeness of this product. I was able to get up and running quickly, not without a few crashes, which are the nature of the beast. For less than $50 you can experiment and make mistakes. I have made them all.

Very maneuverable, camera is decent for the price. The lack of advanced features, such as altitude hold and headless mode, forces you to actually learn the mechanics of flying.

The motors are exposed more than some in this class and between hard landings and a using in a field of fine dirt, I've replaced each motor at least twice in the first 5 weeks. I have no idea if that is common or me being a horrible pilot or working in a horrible environment. The beautiful thing is how easy it is to maintain. Regardless of how crappy you pilot this, be prepared to replace motors on any drone with brushed motors.

Other learning - I had a flyway event where I was able to eventually retrieve the unit, but the receiver board got damaged. Replacing this was fairly easy and educational.

All in all, a great starter drone, for learning to fly one and learning to maintain one.

title: Easy to use - great value
text: We've now been using this drone/quadcopter for a couple of days and love it.  It is relatively easy to fly for both a 44 and 12 year old.  The video and pics from the camera were decent quality as well.  It does seems to fly longer than the advertised seven minutes.  I also really like the LCD display on the remote as it shows how much you have trimmed the various directions.  We haven't been able to make it do the "3D Eversion" tricks (and we did remove the camera), but that doesn't really detract from the overall experience.  The landing struts are made out of a hard rubber substance, so when you do crash, the struts absorb some of the impact.  Now I am by no means a drone expert but after spending the last several Christmas's trying to pilot remote control helicopters, two different remote control Millenium Falcons, and a tiny plastic quadcopter, the Syma X5C is the clear winner.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because we've only been using it for a couple of days.

title: great for beginners

title: Have two of them and love em!
text: I purchased two of these here when they were on sale for 38.99. They both work just as advertised. As long as you follow the instructions to sync the thing each time you fly. They have pretty impressive range that took me a few flights to work up the nerve to test out. I have put probably 10 batteries each through them today alone. I bought a few of the 6 packs of spare batteries and it was worth it. The only thing that went wrong was my son pressed in the cable to one of the batteries too hard and broke the plastic. I was able to disassemble it and super glue it back in place and it works fine. A lot of bad reviews here are probably Christmas day first flight mishaps... That said, I am not new to RC aircraft, so nothing about this surprised me. You can buy every single part to repair these here also. The body, blades, motors, even the control board. That is what sold me on this. My 12 year old is pretty good with his and we fly them both at the same time doing synchronous flips using the crazy flip function. The camera is a bonus to me and leaves a bit to be desired, but works good enough to document your flights. The price fluctuates on this item a lot though, but anything below 50 bucks is a deal for this.

title: Be prepared to buy more.
text:
Let's be realistic here, most of this is user error, but that doesn't change my perception. I've purchased two of these. The first one is in the neighbor's tree. I wish these things had an "oh crap" button to make it come back. I see people flying drones with skill and finesse. I do not have that luxury.
I had a previous cheap drone and that thing flew off into the sunset. Once you lose radio contact with these things, they continue on the last path. I bought these drones for my kids, and the most recent one is still in the box, because I don't want to lose it before they get to play with it (and lose it). At $25, they're disposable, but please realize that "cost per minute" of operation may be extremely high.
On the other hand, this particular brand and model is widely respected as a good "entry level" drone, so again, the problems are the loose nut behind the controller.

title: Decent Quadrotor, Reasonable Price
text:
I bought this as a sort of trainer for upgrading to bigger and better things, as I often find an aerial perspective useful in some areas of science. Below will follow a breakdown of the craft and it's capabilities.

Pros:
- Avionics: I recommend some experience with less advanced craft before hand. It's very good about keeping itself stable, and I was actually surprised at how well it could hover over one place without optically assisted position hold. It is reasonably capable of fighting a breeze, but I wouldn't want to fly it in a windstorm, definitely not in wind exceeding 10mph, but your average breeze really isn't going to affect it much.

- Flight Characteristics: Overall, it's a very stable little craft. The electronics do much of the work, but a low center of mass, sturdy frame, and aerodynamic body help. I've never had a problem controlling this craft under normal conditions, and I don't expect to. Even without optical or GPS assistance, it's a tame machine when you need it to be, but it can also move in a serious way. For the price range, it's actually pretty fast.

-Easy to Use: Your grandmother could fly this quad. No- seriously, it's insanely easy to fly. It comes ready to fly out of the box, fully assembled, and although the instruction manual is poorly translated, the controls are so simple that if you've ever flown another quad, you may well not need it.

-Inexpensive: If you're looking for something to use as a trainer before moving up to something like a Phantom, this might actually be pretty close to as good as it gets before you exceed 100$, and it does a good job of being easy to control, while teaching you how to fly without the fancy sensor package.

-The Camera: Now, originally, I was going to say this was a neutral aspect, but this is a drone that costs less than 50$, so the fact that it actually has a reasonably decent camera at all is actually pretty impressive. Overall, it's not a bad camera, but it's definitely not a good one either, but considering the price, I can't fault it. It actually takes really quite good photos, and I have taken it quite some distance into the sky to get some pictures of the landscape and they honestly don't look half bad. Video quality could be better. It can be a bit grainy, and it sometimes has the same issue with the craft vibrating as most quads in this price range do. With no gimbal suspending it outboard of the aircraft, it feels the same movements of the rest of the craft, and this means that it's really not the greatest. It works though, and all things considered it's not bad. You CAN take video with it, and it's usable footage, it's just not HD.

-Parts: Parts for this craft are not hard to find, and it's a simple machine that's easy to repair. Exactly what you want if you've never done much RC flying and are just getting into it.

Weight: This craft weighs in at just a bit over 100 grams all things included, WELL BELOW THE 250g LIMIT above which the FAA requires you to be registered. It also means it won't hurt much if you manage to crash it.

Cons

- Battery Life: Ok, this really isn't that big of an issue since batteries for this craft are cheap and you can have as many as you like. My calculations show that it gets around 1 minute of flight per 71 mAh, and this will vary depending on how you have the quad configured. Minus the camera and the propeller guards, the camera, and detachable landing legs on the bottom, it gets significantly better flight time.

-Range (Neutral Issue): Now, the seller says 50m and I know this is BS. Which is fine, because they didn't overestimate it, they underestimated it by quite a lot. I would call 50m it's safe range, beyond that, be very careful. I'm confident I've had it more than 100m away, but there was some serious bum clenching, because if you lose control at that range, your only real hope is to get it to the ground in one piece. I frankly don't see this as an issue, because there's no reason to fly a non-FPV quad much further than 100m, but I wish they would revisit this and tell me the exact range.

Summary: Good quad, low price, not much else to say.

title: So much fun!
text: This drone is incredibly light but very stiff, about a foot in diameter and very sturdy and maneuvers quite well.  The radio works fine and the controller sticks are perfectly sensitive and didn't require any calibration out of the box. The on-off switch on the drone is really nice. The camera works really good. Don't expect to get wedding video quality from it, but it is fun to spy on your neighborhood.  If there is a light wind you can still fly it as long as you know how to compensate.  However on a windy day you won't be able to control it very well and you might never see it again.  When there is no wind the thing really cruises fast and if you take off vertically it goes like a rocket.  So much fun.  If you never flown one before just practice getting it to hover like at eye level and then work on making turns.  If you blast off the first time you fly it chances are it will go over someones houses and could potentially get stuck high up in a tree somewhere and you'll never see it again (happened to me). I've crashed it a few times and that doesn't seem to affect the body however I have burnt out a few motors and had to replace them, you can buy good replacement motors on Amazon, but it's a bit of a project to install them.

title: Awesome! Read this and then order!!
text:
I don't care how old you are, this is going to be some of the most fun that you've ever had if you've ever been into remote control toys. I got one for my 43rd birthday. I bought one for a buddy's 40th birthday. We absolutely love them! So, if you grew up with remote control cars, Slot Cars, toy trains, etc., then you are going to love this thing.

It is very easy to learn how to use. Just don't go bananas your first time out! Start slow. Keep it low and go slow. Get to understand how it moves. There is a high performance mode and an easy mode. Start in the easy mode. It is fairly easy.

Where it does get tricky though is the orientation. This rotates 360 Degrees. Once you start rotating, it throws your own mental coordinate system off. It does take a while to handle that so be aware. You get 2 times the height of your house up in the air, rotate 45 degrees and if you don't rotate with it, your mental coordinate system is off and you're going to find yourself chasing it down. Believe me. I've had to cross roads, jump fences, have awkward conversations with my neighbors and climb trees (resulting in even more awkward conversations with my neighbors) to go find mine.

The video is awesome. No it is not a high-def Steven Spielberg movie quality video. But it is good quality video. You get high enough You Can See For Miles and Miles and Miles. You've never seen your neighborhood like this before and it is really cool to see.

Also, keep in mind that this thing is extremely lightweight. Check the specs, I have no idea how much it weighs. But what can I can tell you is this, there is no stabilization that can help correct with the wind. It does not take a whole lot of wind to blow this thing around. It takes almost no wind, in fact, to blow this thing around. So, if it's Breezy, don't go too high or you're going to end up chasing it down.

Would I buy that this again? Absolutely. Like I said, I bought it for a friend and when I destroy mine, I plan on buying another one. This is a fun toy for all ages and I think probably adult guys more than kids.

Great as a starter tool if you want to get something more expensive and fancy. And for $40 bucks? Come on! $40 bucks doesn't buy you a whole lot of fun these days (at least not in my neighborhood). This is well flipping worth it.

title: It was fun while it lasted
text: I gave this product to a friend as a gift. On the first flight he got it stuck high up in a tree, from which it was recovered with great difficulty. I have to give it points for ruggedness as it was dislodged from the tree by pulling on the branch with a rope then releasing it, flinging the quadcopter into the air then plummeting it forty feet to the ground with no damage. The next flight, in an open field, went well and restored his confidence in being able to maneuver the craft. This was a grave mistake. The very next flight started from a clearing in the woods. The copter shot upwards, veered over the treetops and disappeared for good. Somewhere in Northumberland County, Pennsylvania is a lost SYMA X5C Explorers 4CH 6-Axis Gyro RC Quadcopter with HD Camera. Its memory card may have some good aerial footage for the lucky finder.

title: Better Than Epected
text: I got this a few days before my kid's birthday and didn't get to the minor assembly and testing until the night before.  I got behind a locked door and put the rotor protectors on.  I did  charge the battery as soon as I got it.  Tested it out in the room.  It gets to the ceiling very quickly on a full charge.  Learning curve is not bad.  It doesn't do well in anything more than a slight breeze and it goes pretty high.  I'm not good at steering it if it spins and try to keep the red lights pointed away from me.  It's  very fun to fly at night, but control gets more difficult as the battery wears down.  It has survived a few minor collisions with the house and bushes, trees and a few other items.  Still working well and my kid likes it almost as much as I do.  I got the 5 battery and charger deal and got a set of replacement blades.  Not sure I'll ever need those.  Extra batteries are a must.  Would be a very frustrating toy without them.  Camera seems like it would be tough to watch.  The drone bounces all over the place.  I shot some flight footage, but can't find anything on my phone or tablet to play it back on.  This is 100% toy and it's fun for kids and adults.  My kid is 12 and the suggested age is 14.  That seems pretty solid.  Watching my son fly that thing towards trees and rooftops might be preparing me for when he starts driving.  Can be pretty scary at times.  I have a rubber band on one of the front spokes that wraps around the battery cover/camera to keep it on during flight.  Rough landings can cause it to open up when you take off again.  Easy fix that doesn't detract from it.  Instructions are hilarious.  Poorly written in someone's third or fourth language.  Basically says that if you fly this thing and hurt yourself or others it's due to you own negligence.  Also seems solid from my experience  to date.

title: Still the best introductory quad for beginners and a lot of fun too!
text:
This light little quadcopter is the perfect introduction to quad flying for beginners and is an excellent quad for intermediate and expert flyers as well. It has a lot going for it because of the light weight, incredibly cheap batteries which give the owner 5 to 9 minutes of flight per battery and are easily swapped out to have an afternoon of fun flying the quad. The motors, props and spare parts are plentiful and it is incredibly easy to repair this quad. I keep a spare handy so that if I have problems, I can simply swap out the bad one and keep flying until I have time to repair the one needing to be fixed. Back to batteries: I keep a USB charger battery with me and charge batteries in the field to rotate them out (after letting them cool) so I can keep flying. It is a good idea to let the motors on the quad cool before taking the quad up again.

For that first flight, it is a good idea to just run the motors in a low-spin for 5 minutes to break in the motors. And it pays to clean the props and check the gears and drive train to insure there are no rocks or dust in them before flight. Do NOT take off from dusty and rocky ground. Find a clean surface to take off from and to land on. Clean and inspect your quad before and after every flight and your motors and drive trains will last a lot longer. Compressed air is the best way to clean the drive train and do avoid using lubricants since the plastic gears really do not do well with sticky or even dry lubricants. Just keep the parts clean. Open the quad every ten flights of so to do a deep cleaning and inspect everything. And DO buy a crash pack with spare motors, drive trains and other parts. Trust me, you'll be glad to have one or two on hand.

The only down side is that the camera is of extremely low quality and it makes sense to just put it away and use a 808 #16 camera as a camera to get decent video from the quad. I use a Velcro strap to secure mine to the base of the quad. The video will be a bit shaky but this is a perfect introduction to aerial video on the cheap. For those really wanting to explore aerial video without breaking the bank, get the Syma X8C that can lift some pretty hefty cameras and fly for a long time. The X5C can produce pretty good video as well for under $100. Just don't expect cinema quality. I'm exploring camera mounts to try to minimize jello on the videos and also to try balancing the props to insure as stable a flight as possible with the craft which means better video in the long run.

I regularly fly my X5Cs without the landing legs since these weigh down the craft and waste battery. I have never used the prop guards. Truly battery wasting weight and of practically no use, except for indoor flight which I never do. I also remove the battery door as it is really not all that useful and it saves weight to have it off the quad. The batteries stay in just fine without the door. And the quad has better ventilation for the battery as a result (a good thing). The X5Cs are so light I've had them hit me and they cause no injury or damage. It still pays to fly safely, but these craft are extremely low-risk and are wonderful park flyers. I've had them fall from up to 50 feet up and land on grass with absolutely no damage. They are truly tough and resilient flyers.

The X5Cs have been around for quite awhile and this single aircraft had many manufacturers rush to copy it. It's a classic and is still a very relevant and useful quad for teaching and casual flight in parks and the great outdoors. A lot of quad channels on Youtube featured it and some of my favorite videos of it are from a guy called Quadcopter 101. His videos on the X5C are excellent. There are fewer videos featuring the X5C these days, but make no mistake, this is a very good and well regarded quadcopter and is perfect for flight training and all around fun. I have two of them and they are still real favorites of mine that sit next to my two Phantoms and my heavy duty Hubsans on every trip out to the field. That should say something.

text:
[[VIDEOID:934dd5eb8e8b2e4d3be79acbf8e2621d]] The Syma X5C Explorers has been a load of fun so far. I got it for Christmas and since my Fiancee and I opened our gifts early this year, I haven't been able to put this down!

HAVE NOT TRIED 3D EVERSIONS YET. Been having too much fun with the Camera and its been too windy.

Recommended​ for outside use. You can use it inside, but obstructions make it difficult to obtain a stable flight. i.e. flying over chairs, furniture, and around shelving can cause the copter to drift from it's own draft.

title: Cheap reliable fun!
text: This is a 3-year update. I've had this drone since March of 2015 and have enjoyed every moment of it. It truly is easy to fly and with all the new models I think this one still deserves a look. When I bought the Drone I purchased extra Motors and propellers which have sat in the box since the day they arrived. The reason for my update really is the fact that one of the motors finally called it quits and I watched a YouTube video on how to fix the problem by replacement. It did take about 25 minutes as there are 3450000 little screws, just kidding. But it was easy to replace the motor and it is flying Fine Again. Fun fun fun and forgive all the typos as I use Google Voice and I neither proofread or correct!

title: WOW - so much better than I had hoped.
text: [[VIDEOID:734f62df9d9db413e96926cc54484456]] I was very guarded that this item would break (it has survived multiple wall and ceiling collisions and high altitude rapid descents) or just be disappointing in its performance- it has exceeded my expectations. This was a Christmas present so I made sure to charge the battery before I wrapped it (we also bought 2 spare batteries for $6.99) the charger and Micro SD card were included - photos are better than I expected we, however have no visual on video just sound - haven't decided if that is a defect or our error yet - but for the price it really doesn't matter.  My son wants to return his RC snowmobile to buy a 2nd drone! We did get it stuck in tree so he's careful to fly it it tree free areas.  A perfect "starter" drone! tried to upload video not sure it worked - sorry if its sideways

title: Five Stars
text: Awesome little drone thats affordable and can get you prepared for the big $ ones

title: Great price, fun experience!
text:
This quadcopter/drone is a TON of fun to fly. I have flown it indoors a bunch and outdoors twice. Don't let the price fool you, this thing can get WAY up in the air. I am still learning to fly it, so I installed the propeller guards which makes the drone that much more durable. I have hit walls, ceilings, and other obstacles - and all I need to do is apply the trim to get her flying right again. Definitely buy it online, I have seen this EXACT device for three times as much in the mall.

One thing I read in the blogs is that the more expensive the drone, the easier it is to fly (GPS, waypoints, target tracking, obstacle avoidance, etc.). This is not an expensive drone. However, I am having fun learning all the same.

title: very good for learners and aerial photography and video
text: Very very stable aircraft...very good for learners and aerial photography and video.

title: Four Stars

title: ... bought this as a gift and it was a great idea. It was the perfect starter drone
text: I bought this as a gift and it was a great idea. It was the perfect starter drone! It took some nasty crashes at the start and it held up we'll. It's intuitive to use and lot of fun! If you're not sure of you want to get into drones, this is the best place to start!

title: What will they see???
text:
This was a gift for my 12 year old grandson, and he loved it! In his words..."It is so much fun! I really enjoy it. I am going to start recording my flights."
Great gift. It gets them outside instead of stuck behind a game screen.

title: Totally Recommend this.
text: I've tried to tear this thing up and I can't!  This thing is great for someone learning to fly.  Totally recommend it.  I've had 3 of my friends buy one since I bought mine.  And add two nephews getting one each as well for Christmas.

title: Awesome drone, loads of fun!
text:
This is an awesome quad for the money! It is very easy to fly and has plenty of performance capability. I took the rotor guards off as soon as I felt comfortable flying it without crashing, and I noticed a considerable flight time increase. I am getting closer to 10 minutes of continuous flight. The camera is not the best quality, but it shows a clear image that will be adequate for light surveillance and object identification.

I actually found a replacement live-view camera for around $20, so now I can connect my tablet via wifi and get a live feed from the drone. It is fairly slow, usually with a low frame rate, but I still found it more useful than the recorded video.

Overall, if you are on the fence about getting a drone, get it. It is a fun and easy way to see if you like it, and since it falls under the minimum weight for FAA registration, you do not need to get it registered to fly it.

title: Does not work. I've charged the batteries, put ...
text: Does not work. I've charged the batteries, put it all together, flip the switch, it lights up and then shuts off after 3-5 seconds. I've tried 4 different batteries and two different chargers and still nothing.

title: Five Stars
text: Works great for the price. Camera is pretty fuzzy but what would you expect on a sub-$75 drone?

title: Had fun. Worth the money!!!
text: I ordered it a few days back, I could breeze through the assembling, and I got started with it in no time. I was getting used to it but unfortunately I lost it in the neighborhood. Next time I will be buying the one with return home feature.

title: ... how to fly before purchasing a more expensive drone like DJI 3
text:
First I want to preface that I bought this drone so that I could learn how to fly before purchasing a more expensive drone like DJI 3. For learning how to fly a drone, this a good one. It's relatively cheap and takes a lot of crashing which is important when your learning.

I found this drone to be hard to fly. It never stops moving and you have to constantly correct it so that it doesn't hit something. This is not such a bad thing when your trying to learn to fly a cheap drone so when you get a expensive one, your all set!

This drone seems to take a beating. I'm surprised that it keeps working after all of the crashing :)

title: Nice learner unit.
text: This is a good, entry level toy... It's a little tricky to fly, because it doesn't have a lot of automatic control, which is probably good to learn fundamentals.  Crashed quite a few times, with no major damage.

title: Great beginner drone!!!
text:
I'm a newb to drones.
This drone is *very* easy to fly.
Can be flown indoors or outdoors if there is minimal wind.
Very durable.
This is the second X5C-1 that I bought. Both are working fine - i just wanted a backup for when the inevitable happens.
These drones take a beating and keep going.
I've bounced mine into the pool three times, hit trees, walls ceilings, had it fall 30+ feet on to the concrete - they still run like a champ.

Cons:
Video is just ok
Short range - some users are claiming 100+ feet of range - I'm getting about 30 feet (both drones, both transmitters)
There are mods you can do to increase the range - I'm going to try adding a better antennae.

I highly recommend buying one of these to learn to fly, before buying anything more expensive. Learn on the cheap, lightweight, durable drone - then upgrade when you are ready.

title: Great cheap entertainment.
text: Works well and very durable. Must of crashed it at least 100 times and haven't broken anything yet. Longer battery life would be nice, but for the price you can't beat it.

title: Submerged in water and still works great!
text: Bought this for my 8 year old son for Christmas.  He's a great pilot but I thought that it would probably last a week before it broke and ended up in the garbage.  I have to say that this is the best toy we've purchased... he flies it all the time, runs it into walls, trees and the ground with no damage.  I was really impressed when he landed it in the pond and it flew after being submerged in water.  Awesome product, would recommend.

title: Awesome!!!
text:
Physical appearance:
Pretty good size; it's not at all big, bulky, and non-portable(actually, it's very light!) -but not too small to where you can't see it from far off and it's unstable like smaller quads.

Stabilization: With the 6-axis gyro, this thing is pretty good and stable, and will need little adjusting. Also, there are front and back lights, so you can always tell where the front is.

Camera: It's good for a $30 quad copter, not exactly HD, but OK, and the SD card reader is a nice addition. Not good for a high-quality camera, though, but works fine for me!

Control: Works perfectly for me. Flips are good, too.

Overall, it's great for the price. I highly recommend this thing. If you're looking for a cheap quad with camera, get this!

title: ... my 12 year old son for Christmas and we love it! My husband can't stop playing with it ...
text: I bought this for my 12 year old son for Christmas and we love it!  My husband can't stop playing with it either.  Great toy for the price!!  I highly recommend it.  By the way, we've crashed this thing a hundred times into everything from the tv to a tree and it's still going strong!

title: It flew away :(
text:
I bought this for my husband's 62nd birthday. He's not a stranger to these things, as he has a couple smaller ones. He opened it on his birthday and was pleased to see how high it flew.
After perhaps 20 seconds of use he tried to bring it back but the thing kept going and going, you get the idea. The controller did NOT work. He spent rest of the day looking for it. He even had a couple of neighbors helping him and they never did find it.
Needless to say, his birthday was ruined.

title: Great flyer, terrible pictures/video
text:
This is a great beginner quad--I won't go into the details, but this is rock bottom price for a quad you can knock into walls and just play with. As for the camera, it's cool that you can take pictures and video with it, but it's a total joke that the camera on this thing is labeled "HD."
The video is technically 1280x720 resolution, but it's so full of noise that you could scale it to half that resolution and lose nothing. They are also in AVI file format which is a pretty old format these days.
The photos are equally poor quality and it's pretty obvious they were shot in 1280 x 720, then inexplicably scaled up to twice that resolution--and then run through an overly-aggressive JPEG compression.
Anyway, it's still a great quad, just don't buy it for the camera.

title: Five Stars
text: Works great!

title: Nice price, So/So quality.
text:
The Quad is great for the price; however, there are some serious drawbacks. My experience with RC goes back over 30 years. Most "good" RC systems will shut down when they go out of range. This systems has a fatal flaw. If it drops the bind, the Quad keeps doing the last thing it was told to do. The instructions say a range of 75 meters which is roughly 150 feet. I hovered it up to about only 50 feet (close to the top of an old oak) and it lost the bind... it kept going up until it was a dot... I was a zero throttle and it kept going up. At over 100 feet, the wind got it and pushed it down the street. Finally after about 2 minutes of frantic attempts to rebind it, it completely shut down the motors and fell straight down. I thought it was lost (only the 2nd flight) and I finally found it in another old oak.. 30+ feet up.

Great for hovering around the house, or yard, but don't try anything crazy, and certainly don't put it in a climb over 50 feet. The 2 stars is because the camera seems pretty good.

title: Excellent drone, Especially for the low price.
text: Amazing, especially considering the price. The battery only lasts about 10 minutes, so I recommend buying extra. The camera is not bad and works nice, the package even comes with a card reader that plugs into your computer or laptop so you can view the videos or pictures you've taken, the card reader would also work with any micro SD card you have, which is a plus. It also comes with 2 extra propellers, so do not bother buying extra replacements as they are very unlike to snap or break anyway.

title: - Good first quadcopter for a newbie
text:
Pros:
- Good first quadcopter for a newbie. I crashed it several times from all different angles and heights of up to 10 feet. No damage taken other than some paint being chipped off.
- Quick set-up. Took me less than 10 minutes to get it flying around.
- The 1 button barrel roll is entertaining

Cons:
- The automatic hovering doesn't really work. I burned an hour on trimming, but it always likes to drift in one direction or another. It's also extremely difficult to get it to stay at one elevation.
- There is no way to see the quadcopter's battery level in real time! You have literally no idea how close it is to dying. Once second you are flying fine, the next second it is plummeting downwards.
- It doesn't stop moving when the controller is out of range. It just continues in the same direction, which makes it more difficult to catch up to it.

I got mine stuck on the roof of school because it flew out of range and the battery died before I could catch up.

title: Great value. Arrived
text: Great value.  Arrived, flew it easily, but within a day or so one motor didn't want to work so we returned it.

title: They both really enjoyed flying them but one grandson lost his to high ...
text: I ordered two of these for my grandson's, ages 18 and 16. They both really enjoyed flying them but one grandson lost his  to high winds and the other one had a problem with a motor and had to replace it. Unfortunately, the replacement was faulty also and we are the process of replacing it also. They seem to be great for beginner's and I would recommend purchasing one of these to see if you like flying a drone before spending the big buck's. Trying to pique their interest in drones since the industry is short of drone pilot's and starting salaries can begin near $100,000.

title: Impressed
text: I was nervous to buy for my husbands birthday. He can be an electronics snob at times. He loves his new toy and says he's glad he didn't rush into a Phantom.

title: Perfect!
text: Perfect!

title: Great present to myself!
text:
I've been wanting to get a drone for a while now and picked up the Syma X5C at a great price. Having no experience flying one, I wanted to get something inexpensive, durable, and user friendly. The X5C checks all 3 boxes. I've crashed it countless times in the past few days and it hasn't failed me yet. I got it stuck in a tree, about 20 feet off the ground, during a night flight. A well placed football throw freed it from the branches with no visible damage from the ball or the crash to the ground. The controls were easy to learn with some helpful tutorials from YouTube and with some fine tuning I was able to keep it away from walls and trees with softer landings. The orange and green lights are helpful for pointing out the front and rear of the drone.

A negative would be it's extremely light weight. Flying it with a strong wind can cause it to get away from you quickly. The flight time is around 7 minutes with the blade guards and camera attached. Removing them adds about 2 more minutes to the flight time. I ordered some extra batteries which you can find here on Amazon for really cheap. I haven't tried the camera yet as I wanted to be able to control it first before trying video. I'm pretty confident now so I'll be giving it a go soon.

Overall I'm extremely impressed and quite satisfied with this purchase. If you're a beginner like me, looking to get some experience in the drone world, you won't be disappointed.

title: I got my moneys worth of enjoyment out of this thing the first day anyway
text: I subtracted a star only because one of the motors died the very first day, although it coincided with a crash it was a rather gentle crash. Either way, I got my moneys worth of enjoyment out of this thing the first day anyway, despite the broken motor. Just a few dollars for a replacement motor and it was back in business a few days later. Not sure how long it will last but the parts are cheap and this thing is still great fun. Recommend you buys some spare motors with it but I have really enjoyed it so far.

title: This drone is a great value for the price and has delivered exactly as ...
text:
This drone is a great value for the price and has delivered exactly as expected.Set-up is quick, but don’t expect much from the poorly written instruction manual. I think that watching a few videos online before trying to set it up and fly for the first time helped more than reading the instruction manual. Buy a few extra batteries. Flying at a park in very light wind, it is stable but does tend to drift a little bit. It has plenty of power to rise in altitude and will quickly get out of sight if you’re not careful. My 10 year old is learning to fly it, but expect children (and adults) to take some time getting used to controlling the RC if not already familiar with such things. The video camera is very good (again, considering the price) and it’s very easy to view the pics on a computer. No broken props yet, and everything is still working after about 10 flights. I would recommend starting outside (don’t try flying it for the first time in your living room unless you want to break it on day 1). Just learn one stick / control at a time. Up and down. Then up/down forward/back. Doing it this way, slowly, until you master it will ensure more flights and more fun before it disappears into the sunset or lands at the top of a tree. Lots of fun and planning to buy another one if/when this one flies off into the sunset.
3/27/16 Update: Still flying this drone after 3 months and maybe about 25 full battery charges. The weird thing is that I have never broken a prop or had any problems. I didn't expect it to last this long. I'm able to fly bank turns and whiz around the field with confidence. I'm also flying a Syma X-11 and in the process of building a hobby class FPV 250 class racer. Rather than waiting for calm days, I've taken it out in all conditions and have fun fighting the wind on breezy days. The way this drone is configured, it powers up hard in the wind and tends to gain a lot of altitude. It's very easy for this quad to gain A LOT of altitude which becomes a problem if you get disoriented and have trouble bringing it back. In those situations, I usually cut power hard, let it fall for a bit, then power up before hitting the ground so that it does not get away from me. The craziest thing happened at the school yard today when the wind took it seriously high. I cut power, let it fall maybe a hundred feet, then powered on and let it touch down in the distance. To more horror, it landed in an enclosed power transformer area on concrete and surrounded by a high chain link fence. But incredibly, it was upright and on it's feet. I powered up and flew right out of there - if it had broken or landed any other way it would be gone (but still in sight). Really a great craft to learn on!

title: Great beginner drone
text: This drone flys very well and is durable. The camera is ok

title: Great for learning and/or practicing
text:
Get one of these first before buying one of the much more expensive drones! You can learn (or stay sharp on) the basics of flying a quadcopter, and if you crash it, it won't feel like the end of the world. I've crashed it many times and it keeps on going. I definitely recommend getting some extra batteries... they're pretty cheap and work well enough.
I haven't quite figured out the camera and how to consistently take videos... sometimes when I think it's recording it turns out that nothing happened. When it has worked, the video and photos weren't terrible, but they weren't spectacular either. On the whole, I've learned a lot about flying a quadcopter, and I'd highly recommend it for anyone interested in trying it out.

title: Bought 2 and one flew away on it's own when powered up and I had no control over it. Other one does fine though.
text: I was really excited to get two of these for my kids for Christmas. The first one flew pretty good. It lacked a bit of stabilization but that was to be expected for the price point. The second one on the other hand flew up up and away...... and hasn't been seen again. Once it got just above the height of my one and a half story house I had no control over it and it just flew away until it was out of sight. Of course we searched but had no luck in finding it. Now my little girl's expecting me to get another one. I kind of doubt it will be this same brand but the other one seems to fly fine. I never even got the chance to check out the camera feature on the one with a mind of it's own. So overall I have mixed emotions on the Syma X5C.

text:

Learn from my example... even if you practice in a field, stay low to the ground! If you're extremely new to drones as I was, it might be better to invest in one with a headless mode so you don't send it soaring into a tree as I did.

title: It worked good but it's very hard to control it as it's ...
text: It worked good but it's very hard to control it as it's hard to tell when it's up high where is the head of the quad. And any gust of wind just takes control of the quadcopter. The pictures it took were fine but you have to pretty much let your drone fall for a second in order to press the button that takes the picture. Also since it's hard to distinguish it's head up in the air and it doesn't have blade cages, the quadcopter I bought for my husband ended up getting stuck in a tree. After several attempts to get it dislodged via controller the quad just shut it's power off. And you can only turn it on manually so we were in a pickle. It was stuck too high up the tree to reach it so we decided to come back the following day and bring some tall ladders. Over night it was pretty windy and apparently the quad fell out of the tree and probably got taken by someone as we never found it. Don't recommend it for a beginner or flying it too close to trees or power lines.

title: ABSOLUTELY INDESTRUCTIBLE
text: I got one of these drones about six months ago as an introduction to the hobby. I was initially very impressed with the durability and overall quality. Unfortunately, after a couple of weeks it got stuck about fifty feet up in an oak tree and all attempts to dislodge it proved fruitless. But like I said, I was happy with the product so after a while I ordered another. Fast forward to now, after giving up all hope of ever retrieving the first one I had ordered, a storm finally loosened it up enough to retrieve it by hucking sticks at it. Got it inside, put a new battery in and lo and behold IT STILL WORKS. After six months of exposure to the elements, after thunderstorms and extreme heat, against all odds IT STILL WORKS. Now, I was impressed when I crashed the new one into a creek and it still worked after being submerged for fifteen to twenty minutes. I was impressed when it  still worked after it got caught by a gust of wind and crash landed in a parking lot after plummeting well over a hundred feet. Now I am beyond impressed. At this point I am convinced this thing is absolutely indestructible.

title: Good buy!
text:
This is a very good beginner drone. Bought it for my bf and he moved to to a pro one and lets me fly this one lol. The drone handles well, and the controller allows you to change sensitivity from low to high, so slightly windy conditions or level of novice can be adjusted for. And the camera has sound, and gives pretty decent images. Be sure to fly it where you won't lose it of it goes out of range. That includes around your neighborhood and your neighbors back yards people. It's a pain to go knocking on your neighbors doors or trying to shake/knock it out of a tree. (Not that I would know or anything..lol.)
Also, I highly recommend getting the batteries I've linked to below. Just do it. Much higher quality than the first set I bought and they will let you enjoy significantly more flight time with your cool new drone! https://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B01736NLB8/ref=yo_ii_img?ie=UTF8&psc=1

title: Just found a new hobby...
text:
If you are looking at your first mini-quad, as I was when I purchased this, then your looking at the right product. Let me start off by saying that I have had zero experience with quads before this and after about 2 weeks I have mastered my orientation and am having a blast each time I take this thing out. I was immediately hooked when I first went outside with it, but a tip is to stay low to the ground and use the prop guards and landing gear for a good amount of time until you can handle this mini-quad. Parts are plentiful and really cheap as well, so don't forget to get some extra parts kits for those beginners' crashes because we all have them!

Here are the things I really love about this quad.
*Totally modular
*Very stable
*Very nimble when flying without prop guards and camera, almost too nimble, master orientation before giving this a shot.
*The camera I received was indeed HD to an extent, but I received the X5C-1 version by luck which also included a 4gb micro sd card.
*This quad is perfect for the beginner until you can move up to a 350 size quad.
*A very popular bang for your buck quad that can amaze your friends and family.

Here are a few of the cons to my personally, but I did not retract a star for them.
*Stock battery at 500 mAh is paltry, buy the Tennitor 4 pack of 600 mAh with a 4 in one charger for extra fun.
*Li-Po batteries can be dangerous and requires extra money to be spent for good balance chargers also please pick up a Li-Po charging bag! Your house will thank you for that.
*All the extra parts and batteries need a case, which go for around 35 bucks, again it is costing more money, but it makes it easy to take to the park.
*The stock range is crap on this quad, grab a 2.4 ghz wifi router antennae and solder it in the remote receiver. Doing this simple and cheap mod will double, if not close to triple the range.

I tried to cover everything I have learned in the past 2 weeks, it has been a wonderful ride so far. I just finished the range boost today for my quad and the new X5C-1's have a different setup for soldering an antennae than what was shown on some vids I watched. Leave a comment if you have a question regarding this or anything else. If my comment was helpful to you, please give me a yes for helpful comment and thanks for taking the time to read my review.

title: Tough drone: submersed in water, stuck in a tree for a year through Florida rain storms and a hurricane and it STILL WORKS!
text:
This drone has been submersed in water and stuck in a tree for over a year and it still works...

We bought this drone for my son for Christmas 2015. That same day it fell into the lake and sunk to the bottom, When I went into the lake, I could see the lights still on. We did the bag-of-rice trick for a couple days and I was shocked to see it worked perfectly fine! For the next several months we played with this drone and got it stuck in a tree, but was able to get it down. Then in the spring of 2016 it was stuck way up high in a tree and we couldn't reach it. So I bought another drone to replace it and we somewhat forgot about it, guessing it lost forever. We'd check on it from time to time, especially after a hurricane came through our area, but it was hopelessly stuck. Then in March 2017 I got an idea and was able to get it down from the tree. It didn't work, so we took it apart and found the switch to be rusted. So we removed the switch and soldered the wires together and I was shocked to see the drone lights lit up! We put the drone back together and it flew flawlessly as if it hadn't been stuck in a tree for over a year! Next, we took the micro SD card from the camera and put it into the computer - it still worked! We have a nice video of me flying my son's drone into that tree! For the final test: surely the camera wouldn't work after all that time in a tree, having gone through countless rain storms and a hurricane?! But yep! The camera still works perfectly fine. So for a low cost drone, Syma knows how to make 'em. We have two Syma drones and the kids race them and place with them together - which is another bonus: two drones can fly at the same time without the R/C signals getting mixed up.

title: Good quality for the little money spent

title: Worth the money!
text: I've had such a blast flying this thing around my house, getting used to it.  I can't believe how much fun can be had for a $40-50 electronic toy.  I'm glad I bought the extra batteries, though.  This was my fist flying RC toy ever, so it took a little getting used to, but I think my experience with RC cars, plus flight simulators on the PC probably helped.  I ended up switching the controls to mode 2, which seemed a lot easier for me.  The picture/video quality is about what I expected.  It's much better outside or in well-lit areas.  I can't count how many times I've crashed this thing on my hardwood floors, and it keeps chugging along.  I did notice that one of the props now has too much movement up and down on it's axis, so I might need to fix that.  I'm not sure if a prop swap will fix that, or if I broke a different piece.  My kids love watching me fly this, but there's no way I could teach them how to fly it yet; they're 5 & 6.

title: Expectations Exceeded
text:
I'm pretty blown away by the price/performance ratio - it really exceeded my expectations.

I think this drone is great for beginners and can be used even after you are no longer a beginner. It's very stable, light, and durable. The "web cam" on the bottom is fine for playing around and many replace it with a better one later.

The copter is well supported by the market with many options for replacement parts, cases and additional batteries. All of these parts are reasonably priced.

Durability is excellent. We have crashed several times and the unit still looks and performs perfectly. We are using the optional (and included) blade protectors which probably helped.

This model does not have a "headless" mode (where the drone controls are simplified). In "normal" (not headless) mode, the drone has a front, similar to an RC car and the controls are relative to the direction the drone is facing. In headless mode, the drone has no concept of a "front" and forwards is always defined as the same direction relative to the remote. Headless mode is nice for young children or users who are too casual to invest learning time. In terms of learning to fly, headless mode has limited use in that it removes maneuvers that are possible with the normal control system.

One additional caveat is that the larger size of this drone (large dinner plate) makes it less optimal for indoor flight. You might consider getting this and another syma drone for this (such as the X12S) because the remotes are interchangeable between the two.

title: Buy it you'll love it!!!
text: [[VIDEOID:a3ad7890bf2f3b2d46a2c7662d7b1a3f]] [[VIDEOID:88e2a2e341521987cd0fe1b33f320caa]] I have to say this thing is awesome for what I have invested in it.  It flies great and I could not believe the photo/vid quality.  I am having a bunch of fun with this one.  You do need to watch your range as is is about 150 - 200 feet.  I have had it out farther and have gotten it back but lost signal and scared me real good but again was able to get it back home and land real nice.  I have read some of the bad reviews and I can tell that mostly the ones speaking bad of it simply don't give it credit it deserves.  Probably have destroyed it of did not click the sim card card into place and things like that.  I did see the that said "Broke the same week my son got it ."  Well dang Lady they never said if he flew it into the ground from 100 feet that it would survive.  Oh and guy that was mad because the sim card fell out.  Well you got to make sure and click it in til it locks.  You can buy a new one for like 4 or 5 bucks.  You lost it and it's their fault, come on man.  This is a great toy for $55.00.  Make sure and get the case, spare batts w/charger for multi charging, and different color props to designate with separate color front and back for easy orientation.

title: One tough drone!
text: Great drone for the money. Much better than I expected. My flying skills need work though. Here is the kicker. I flew it over my 50' tall pecan tree toward the end of the battery charge, bad idea. It got stuck in the tallest branch of the tree. I had to wait for a thunderstorm to blow it out. I live in phoenix and it survived two months in the tree in 118 degree temperatures, rain and a thunderstorm. When I got it back two months later, I let it dry out, charged the battery and it flew perfectly! Can't ask for more than that!

title: Good for a beginner
text: Inexpensive. Worth more than I paid. Good for a beginner.

title: Great gift!
text: Fun toy!

title: and the camera captures nice footage considering the price
text:
This is an impressive amount of tech for around fifty bucks. The copter is imminently stable and flyable, and the camera captures nice footage considering the price. While probably a standard feature in quadcopters of this class, the removable battery is much appreciated after owning several copters with non-replaceable batteries that die prematurely. The copter is sturdy enough and is still in good working order after quite a few flights and a couple of less-than-graceful landings.
The sometimes poorly-translated manual and the trim knob arbitrarily re-purposed as camera control button attest to the sacrifices that need to be made to meet the price point, but all in all this is a fun and worthwhile toy.

title: Can't beat it for the price
text:
First, get this out of the way...you aren't going to compete with a DJI or anything like that for a drone that costs less than $50. I've had this thing now for almost 10 months and it's been great. The video and picture quality is not really that great, but it's good enough to have some fun with it. I got extra batteries (Morpilot) that have a slightly larger capacity, and I stay airborne for 10min at a time. If you take off the camera and prop guards, you can stay up for close to 15min.

The drone handles pretty well, but in a reasonable wind, you will be fighting to keep it stable. The range is pretty good, but if you look on YouTube, there's a controller hack that will increase the range to 300yds ( I did it and it works...you have to be comfortable soldering.) But, even without the hack, you can easily get this thing up high enough it's difficult to see. HOWEVER, if you do that, be prepared to possibly loose it. The default when it looses signal is to basically fall out of the sky. If you are in reasonable range of where it falls, you can re-bind the controller when it gets in range and then re-gain control. But, if it's out of range, it will fall all the way to the ground pretty hard. But, as I said to start, this isn't a DJI, and for the price, expecting return-to-home, and other such GPS style protections simply isn't going to happen.

So, for the price, you really can't beat this thing. My son and I have had a blast, and continue to love playing with it.

title: Great entry drone. So much fun to fly!!
text:
Full review on reviewbreakdown.com

I was very impressed with this entry level drone. The flight is somewhat easy to pick up. Coordination take practice but after a few hours you learn to fly pretty good.

Do not fly the drone too high or far if you are around buildings or trees. After 30 feet it will drop connection and stop responding. As you rush to get closer the drone is still doing its own thing. Be cautious of the wind. What seems like a small breeze to a 180lb human will take away your coptor. This is to be expected with any drone you buy.

Other than that you will not regret buying the X5C if you are a first time flyer. Also, HD stands for High Hefinition! High definition means not blurry. It DOES NOT mean 720p or 1080p!! The camera still picks up great footage inside and outside.

title: REMOVE THE GUARDS! once you fly outside.
text: REMOVE THE PROPELLER GAURDS!!!!! once you figure out how to fly. They are the worst to snag tree limbs. If the wind pushes you into trees, you are done! The guards snag everything. Its better to maybe break a prop than get snagged at the top of a tree.

title: Awesome drone, easy to fly and very stable
text: Awesome drone, easy to fly and very stable.  It is also very durable and can take a beating.  I have other drones and this one is the best value for your money!.  Kids love it!!

title: Five Stars
text: Hard to beat for price. Spare batteries are inexpensive. I bought two of these . Great Quad for learning before you spend big money on a drone . The controls are the same as my Cheerson x20 . I learned on this first .

title: Money well spent!
text: Great drone! Loads of fun, easy to fly after bout 5 minutes of practice, A+++ on the craftsmanship and recieved it a day early!

title: After flying it for two battery charge cycles on Christmas ...
text: After flying it for two battery charge cycles on Christmas day, I noticed that one of the motors wasn't working.  We hadn't flown it higher than about 15 feet on a grassy yard and hadn't had any serious crashes.

title: Awesome!
text: This thing rocks. I takes a few flights to really master, but once you do its tons of fun. This little sucker is really durable too, I've crashed it hard in the street and the driveway and it lives on. Great purchase for $49. Thanks Amazon!

title: Very nice Quad for a beginner
text: Very nice Quad for a beginner. Video is just good enough to have fun with but not great. I have been able to get it up to around 150' and get some nice video above the trees pretty easily. Its maneuverable enough to even try your hand at racing and will do banked turns pretty well.

title: Disappointing, not very durable.
text: We were really excited about this drone. Worked well, but got stuck in a tree and ruined one of the propellers. Would have thought it would have been more durable than it was.

title: Good Buy
text: Got this for my hubby and he has been having a good time with it. Easy to use right out of the box, I purchased extra batteries so no issue with length of flight time. Has had multiple bumps into furniture / floor with no problem. The blade guards do a good job of taking the brunt of the hits. He had gotten the hang of controlling it after only a couple of uses. Great product for great price. Highly recommend as "first drone".

text: Good learning/practice drone.  Took decent pictures. I'm glad I bought it before I stepped into the DJI arena!  Great for kids and very few hiccups.

title: Another piece of junk from China.
text:
As this was going to be a gift for someone outside the country; we used it one time to see that it worked...and it seemed too so we packed it back up then took it with us. Problem was when we used it the second time it didn't seem to be running all the blades at the same speed. So now it flies sort of sideways.
We don't know if we did something wrong or anything as there are no instructions what so ever.
I am sort of stuck and have to buy another one....I said I would replace the one that didn't work well. Poor kid was devastated....and the next one will be getting the 2 years guarantee add on....but I am pretty disappointed. Another piece of junk from China.

title: Perfect intro drone
text:
Perfect beginner drone! Super light, sturdy, and easily handled. Camera is better than I expected for the price - however its not stabilized and quality is similar to a mid range cellphone camera, so don't compare to GoPro or the like.
It's also super popular, and has been on the market for a while, so there are tons of mods out there.

title: Four Stars
text: Good value, minimally but  sufficiently  functional

title: Great drone!
text: Great drone, has good image quality. I had a difficult time flying it personally, but my boyfriend who is a regular gamer picked up the controls quickly... so it may come naturally to some more so than others. It does have a short flight time though, so it might be a good idea to purchase extra batteries. Flight time aside it's a great drone and fun to fly. (it is a little loud, my dogs didn't like it too much).

title: Went up, then away and gone!
text: Twice this quadcopter went up..up...up even though I cut power, it just flew off!  I got lucky and found it nearly 3/4 mile away after three hours of searching.  It flew great a few times yesterday, then once more up and away.  I shut down power but it kept going.  Lost sight of it and after 4 hours of searching, no luck.

title: Dysfunctional and BAD Return Policy
text: The chopper came dysfunctional; two propellers gave out after the 2nd flight. I went to return the product, but their return policy expires the day after you receive the product. BEWARE of the return policy. I was really looking forward to flying it, but I'll be looking else where for a better chopper.

title: Good for family
text: We love this, easy to fly and very durable!

title: Great starter
text: Great starter drone.  My daughter loved it.  It even took a 150 foot drop to the ground through some trees and still worked great.

title: I paid for gift wrap and am disappointed that it was a plain black sack
text: This was a gift for my spouse and he likes it a lot. I paid for gift wrap and am disappointed that it was a plain black sack. The sack was fine but the lack of color was not so great. After all it was a holiday gift not a funeral gift.

title: Five Stars

title: GREAT MACHINE flew it the minute we got it and ...
text: GREAT MACHINE  flew it the minute we got it and put it together. It was for my great grandson and he learned right away how to fly it. Took a little adult explaining but when your a kid and very excited it takes an adult to help. Still not broken and he's only 9.

title: Perfect Gift
text: Bought this for Father's Day. This was a score! My husband was worried at first what I spent on it but totally relaxed after what I told him. After a hard days work he usually sits in his chair (in the liv rm no less) and hones his skill until dinner. He's never had any remote air device but it didn't take him long to get the hang of it. Video was really good I was surprised. I'd definitely recommend it.

title: as much fun as $50 can buy...

Not to mention all componets of the body can be replaced for like 10 bucks... So much fun. Flying any drone takes practice and this one will take you from beginner through intermediate. When the wind finally knocked it down, I expected it to be totally dead. It charged up and flew like nothing happened! Can't recommend this item enough!

I have removed the landing gear and the cam and I get a little longer flight time. Flips great, responds great and its a little hard to fly in even a little wind. Best for outdoor flying. I would recommend this to others.

It went too high in a very short period of time and I lost control of the drone. I have been searching for my drone for several days now. Is there anyway I can have just the drone replaced ? Why did this happen?

I am seeing others having the same experience.  Something is seriously wrong with this product and it does not need to be sold on amazon in my opinion.

title: Simple to use and great price
text: Great beginner quadcopter at an excellent price. Perfect machine to learn on. Easy to fly once you get used to the controls. Photo and video quality is acceptable and better than expected for such an inexpensive device. Would be better if they hired someone who speaks English to write the manual.

title: Awesome!
text: Just be careful when flying outdoors.  The wind carries it away from you. Super good quality

title: Review log
text:
7/12
OK so I got this a yesterday and firstly it came a day early so I'm happy with it already, I just went for my first flight it's night time 9:19 pm and let me say it has
•great LEDs to let you know where and what your positioning is in the sky.
•awesome controller I feel like I'm flying a bigger quad syma
•quad is a good size for anyone
•it's suprisingly fast and that's with the cam on!
•was very comfortable to fly it does exactly what you tell it.
•I cam describe the feeling of flying the X5C only like this, it's like cutting butter with a knife...very smooth.

CON
•This is the only thing I can see as a bad thing there is no LED warning for when battery's are low, it blinks once then basically falls out of the sky. Just time and average flight time then set a timer...no biggie

All in all even after 1 short flight I'm very pleased with this quad I fly many micro quads and this is my first somewhat bigger quads and it feels amazing, there is no turning back xD

title: Great beginners drone.
text: I am writing this six months after getting my first drone, the syma x5c! This is a great machine, and I would go as far as to day it is the greatest UAV for beginners out there. It flys great inside and out, does flips and rolls easily, and has two pitch settings so it doesn't get boring after a while. It is also extremely durable. However, There are some things that you should be aware of before buying this machine. It has pretty cheap construction, and sometimes soldering while break, requiring you to remove lots of small screws to fix it. The camera is 2mp, but is still pretty awful. It's for fun, and no more then that. Additionally, the motors are brushed, meaning that they will wear out after 7-12 hours of flight. With 8-10 minute flight times, this is a lot, but eventually your motors will burn out and you will be forced to make repairs or buy a new drone. Keep in mind that this industry is just getting started. In the next few years, we will see quadcopter and UAV technology become cheaper, better, and smarter. But for now, this is a relatively new industry. With that comes risk. This product has done a good job of taking away some of that risk, but I would not recommend going further then this in the hobby if you're not ready to make repairs and figure out how things work.

title: I have three of these they are great to learn to fly with and the price is ...
text: I have three of these they are great to learn to fly with and the price is just great. You can buy replacement parts if you lose or break something and batteries are cheap so you can fly longer.

title: Ok drone, not easy to steer
text: Got this as a Christmas gift for my dad.  It was a huge hit, he loved it!  I will say, it wasn't very easy to steer and kept veering all over the place.  It did have a tendency to get stuck in trees when it would veer off track, so you'll need a very big open area to practice steering.  It made a good gift though, it was good entertainment for my dad while it lasted.

title: Five Stars
text: awesome product

title: Does not pair to remote
text: The unit is not flyable because the remote will not pair. After some research this problem is fairly common. Unfortunately, life got in the was and I was past 30 day return period when I finally tried to use this. I am stuck with a dead unit.

title: Best drone
text: Best drone

title: Great starter quad
text: A little touchy to fly at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's a blast to fly. Unfortunately I got mine stuck on the roof of my apartment building after a gust of wind. The landing gear broke a little bit on one particular hard landing, but for the most part it is a very durable. I definitely recommend it for a starter. Camera is so-so, but nothing to complain about at this price point.

title: pretty good
text: not very well made! pretty good video

title: Four Stars
text: Good unit but a bit difficult to keep stable vertically.

title: no experience needed.
text: this is the first RC flying thing I could actually control. No experience and right out of the box. The controls can be set less sensitive for the beginning flyer. I have flown strait into walls and the ground with no damage. Keep it away from the wife's head though. It wont survive if she gets a hold of it after you crash it into her after repeated warnings to be careful. I was being careful. it didn't take any skill to hit a target that large though. it does come with extra blades just in case.

title: Defective unit? Leans in one direction
text:
[[VIDEOID:21078f520856774287a95e79b1acb5f5]] I love this quadcopter very much as a beginner (in fact ordered extra set of 4 batteries and charger and extra propellors). However ever since I opened the box I have been experiencing a problem: it leans towards the right side when I try to fly it. I have not been able to fly it being in control. And most of the time it's a struggle to keep it from flying in that direction. Since it's my first quad I was assuming that might be normal. But after watching a few videos I realized that's not true. It should take off vertically.

I tried to fine-tune it as recommended in the manual and also tried to calibrate it but nothing is working. Someone else facing the same issue? Or should I send it back? I have already invested over $70 on it so would very much like to have a decent/pleasant experience.

[Update] May 2, 2015
I am sending this one back and ordered a Holy Stone one which also works in 'Headless Mode'. I went for one day shipping. While I am still waiting for Amazon to send someone from UPS to pick the box I got my new Holy Store drone and enjoyed the flight.

title: Great for 1st-Timer
text: My son quickly learned how to operate this and LOVES it- it's pretty durable when it does hit things like walls, trees, branches, etc...

title: Five Stars

title: Great gift for dad
text: My father asked for this as a birthday gift. He absolutely loves it and made a point to buy the extra battery and parts to keep it running.

title: Great little drone. Recomended for kids and adults
text: Great little drone. Very light and doesn't do as much damage when it crashes. Just do not fly in high winds.  I recommend you order more batteries. The protectors are very good and don't break like the larger x8c ones do. I have both.

title: Runaway drone - need to return it before I lose it or get a nervous breakdown
text:
Don't get me wrong, this is a fun drone. It's flying behavior is amazing, super easy to control and very stable. My 7 year old son can fly it with ease. And the quality of the videos (720p) it takes is actually much better than I expected, pretty steady too. But the big problem this drone has is range and its out-of-range behavior. As soon as you are 50ft or further away from the drone this thing will lose connection and just keep going!

We've had this drone for 1 hour - and had to go hunt it down in the neighborhood 3 times. Luckily it's pretty big and easy to see with its blinking red and green lights. But if I don't return it asap I know I will lose it soon.

Unless you want to fly this drone indoors only, or on a big open field where you can catch up to it when it's trying to escape, then I recommend you look for a different model. This is what we will do...

title: OMG this quadcopter is tons of fun. It's gyro stabilized which makes it pretty easy ...
text:
[[VIDEOID:43c5d9617b22ae083b1cbc4a25a4640e]] OMG this quadcopter is tons of fun. It's gyro stabilized which makes it pretty easy to fly. It's a bit big for indoor use and even perhaps backyard use. Go find a big empty park or field to practice in. I bought mine with the Tenergy 5 battery pack and after spending roughly an hour with six packs in the park, I was quite proficient at flying it around, doing flybys, and recording video. The camera quality isn't very great; About like a cell phone from 8 years ago. Still images leave a lot to be desired but the video isn't bad especially in bright sunlight. The colors are a bit washed out. You can easily fill the included 4GB microSD card if you have multiple batteries. I use mine to inspect my roof and solar panels. It has a beginner and expert flying mode which is great for learning. Beware that it's maximum altitude is greater than the remote's range.

So why 5 stars after noting the problems above? Well it's a low cost product. It's not the best quadcopter out there by far, but for the money, I think it's an excellent value for an entry level person such as myself.

title: So sad..
text: So sad...My brother has only used this device two times and it stopped working. One of the engines just quit. Would have enjoyed it to have a longer lifespan.

title: Awesome delivery time awesome flying machine I'm nothing to complain about

title: Outstanding Buy!

I have wrecked it about 10 times pretty hard and it still works great.  This is a must buy, for the price!

text: Well worth the money.  It takes a licking and keeps on ticking (flying).  You definitely need extra batteries.

title: Good starter

title: This is NOT the X5C-1. I know that it ...
text: This is NOT the X5C-1. I know that it says X5C in the product description, but for the same price you can get the updated model which is definitely suggested.

title: Cheap plastic garbage, inoperable
text: Dead on arrival. Paid 45 dollars for this as a Christmas gift to my kids, but ordered in late October and can't return. Does not work and so I'm stuck with it. Cheap plastic garbage. Save your hard earned money.

title: Worked great until the hubs flew it into the neighbors tree
text: Worked great until the hubs flew it into the neighbors tree. User error, not a production error. It is easy to fly and a good thing to try before you spend more on the pricier drones.

title: Absolutely Amazed
text:
This drone is absolutely amazing for the price, if your are just a beginner in flying drones this is a great way to gain experience before you buy a top notch expensive drone. It is really easy to get the hang of things and it extremely fun. Let me tell you about some of the Pro's and Con's.

Pro's -
Price: Cant find a drone with his much features for such little price
Ease of use: You could pick this thing up and learn as you fly.
Safety: Right when your about to leave the controller range the lights on the drone will flash telling you that your to high, also the controller tells you how much battery it has left.
Camera: Great when its light outside, you can record or take pictures from a button on the remote. I always record and it always turns out good.
Included: I like how Syma includes extra propellers and propeller protectors in the box, so far i never snapped any of mine.

Cons -
Battery: The battery should be a lot bigger in my opinion, there is a lot of empty space inside the drone, i think the could have made room for a bigger battery. It lasts about 5 mins with the camera on, 6 with the camera off, and about 8 if you take off the camera.
Propeller protectors: The propeller protesters always come off at the slightest crash, i made sure i screwed them in tightly. This isnt a big deal for me because i took them all off when i got better at flying.
Stability: I've had to ask my neighbors to get my drone from their backyard because a little gust of wind knocked my drone over to their fence. This inst really a big problem because i was flying high in the middle of the winter in December, (and I have cool neighbors).
Manuel: I dont read the Manuel on a lot of things i buy, but for once when i was trying to figure out what all the buttons on the controller do i was shocked because most of the English on the Manuel dont make sense so i had to learn what the buttons do on my own.

Overall this is a great drone for the price and you cant go wrong with it. This would make a perfect gift to a kid of any age. I will update if anything happens to this drone.
