title: The trainer drone you're looking for
text:
Looking for a solid trainer, or toy drone? This is a great option. Easy to fly, hard to master, but great for learning the ins and outs of quadcopter flight.

Very resilient drone, drops out of the sky onto grass with no fuss. If anything goes wrong, it's easy and very inexpensive to fix. Spend the few dollars to buy extra batteries, you're only looking at about 4 minutes of flight with all the propeller guards in place and the camera rolling. Remove all the guards, and the camera, and maybe more to save weight and you'll see up to 10 minutes in the air, but still, a few extra batteries and you're good for a half hour or more.

Do not buy this drone if you want to capture photos or video of any quality, the camera pretty much sucks, but if you are thinking of doing any flying of a real drone in the future, buy this thing, learn the basics, it's a $30 investment that'll save you thousands of dollars later.

title: then he accidentally ran it into a tree and it still works amazing and he's still loving it lots
text: I bought this for my dad a while back and he loves it. The first thing he did was accidentally fly it into a litter box (which freaked his cat out for a few weeks), then he accidentally ran it into a tree and it still works amazing and he's still loving it lots.

title: Great Drone for beginners
text: I'm a total drone newbie.  The X5C makes the learning process easy.  It's all there in the box.  The manual is the usual Chinese confusion, but everything is described and there are excellent videos on YouTube.  Get the T453 6 piece battery pack to make the experience less frustrating.  I highly recommend this product for beginners.

title: Nice product that has entertained my son for hours
text: Nice product that has entertained my son for hours. Very fun and challenging to fly indoors or out. Product quality is good considering the numerous times we have crashed it on the street or the wall.

title: Loved it so much I also bought the smaller Syma ...
text:
My first quad. Loved it so much I also bought the smaller Syma X12 Hornet which can pair with the X5C's nicer remote. They are both fun and tough. (My hornet has no camera, but is a little hot-rod). I fly the X5C outside and the hornet inside or out. Great way to learn to fly a drone. The video is surprisingly good for the price range. They are very light and therefore susceptible to wind.

It is surprising that you can get something like this for fifty bucks.

Order a four pack of extra batteries with a 4-way charger for only $15. It only comes with one battery that lasts six or seven minutes (which goes by very fast) and they take 70+ minutes to charge.

title: Great for the money.
text: For the price, it's a great drone to learn the basic controls. Only negative things are the prop guards aren't robust enough and the camera isn't great.

title: Great little product for the price.
text: I was la little nervous about ordering this but so far it has been a huge success.  The kids love it.  I would recommend ordering extra batteries when you order it though because it only flies about 10 minutes without the camera on and about 7 with the camera on.  Then it takes 100 minutes to recharge.  The kids get a little impatient.  But they have been practicing flying it and are having a ball.  The controls are easy to learn and they have been able to learn to fly it and actually land it with great accuracy.  I have to keep reminding them to keep it out of the trees and the power lines but so far so good.  We did lose one of the light covers but since parts are readily available and fairly inexpensive, we have ordered a replacement. All in all, this is a great little machine that will undoubtedly provide lots of fun.

title: The perfect starter quad... that I know I will come back to from time to time.
text: Very durable and lots of fun.  This is my first quad and I have to say this is the perfect quad to learn with.  I never bothered to put the guards on and this thing has taken a beating and still flies great.  The controls are too unresponsive by default but if you push the button on the top left (you hear two beeps) it becomes a different quad.  I have only flown this for a few hours at this point and I haven't had to replace anything, even after numerous crashes (actually I did lose the led covers but I fly without them now).  At one point one of the props was binding once a revolution but it turned out that a small piece of sand got stuck between the cogs of the prop gear.  I simply popped the grain of sand out and problem solved.  Be prepared to buy more batteries.  This thing is such a blast that every time I go flying now I use at least four batteries (I get about 7 minutes of aggressive flight per battery).  If you are just learning make sure there is no wind.  At this point I'm able to fly in 5-8 mph wind but it takes everything this quad has to fly against the wind.  It is so lightweight that it is sometimes difficult to keep the quad from climbing, especially in the wind.

title: Absolute garbage
text:
This was probably the cheapest, shoddiest thing I have ever bought on Amazon. For starters the box it came in (not the amazon package, but the product box itself) was smashed in all along 1 edge. The product was packaged ENTIRELY in Chinese, include a full instruction manual in Chinese. No English instructions what-so-ever. The remote was the cheapest piece of plastic I've ever seen. The control sticks wobbled around, and had a big zone of movement in the center before the spring resistance kicked in. And the other switches on the remote either required brute force to move, or wouldn't stay locked in position. The whole thing (without batteries) weight about half as much as my iPhone. And then, the biggest kicker, there was no battery for the copter in the package. There was a charging USB cable, but no actual battery!!!!

I just bought a Holy Stone x300c for my grandson and had so much fun playing with it over the weekend that I thought I'd treat myself. I'd heard pretty good things about Syma copters and am on a pretty tight budget, so I figured I'd give it a shot. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra $30 for the Holy Stone x300c. This thing got returned the next day and I'll be ordering a Holy Stone product as soon as the refund is applied!!!

title: Great way to learn how to fly
text: Great way to learn how to fly. The camera pictures are not amazing but it works and it is great to play with. I have flown this both inside and outside and it flys great. It is stable and easy to learn. I will say take the time to tune the remote. It makes a big difference to flying the drone. If you fly out of range which is pretty easy to do overall when you first start the drone seems to shutdown after a second which can be very helpful. I have had it shutdown and drop out back into range and been able to recover. As an added bonus the drone is tough enough to learn on as well. From being stuck In a tree and bounced off the ground and walls over and over it keeps coming back!

title: Well worth the money!
text: I purchased this quad a few weeks ago. So far, it's been worth every penny of the $50 dollar purchase price. I recommend buying a pile of extra batteries ( provided that you intend to play with this thing for more than five minutes at a time.) I've owned many high end RC's over the years and I have to say that this cheap little quad gives you great bang for your buck and sbould provide hours of hassle free flying. That being said, the construction is a very simple, very thin plastic design and while it will sustain semi-rough flights / landings. I don't recommend smacking it into any houses, trees, etc... as that will likely be the end of your drone. Happy flying!

title: Great starter quad
text:
Great starter quad. Very easy to fly once you get used to the controls.

Best to start in a big open field, a gust a wind can send it into a tree very quickly. The inexperienced pilot will likely lose it very quickly on a windy day.

Light enough it does not need to be registered with the FAA at least not yet. But being as small as it is means it won't carry a gopro either.

Definitely want to pick up a few extra batteries, just remember to let the motors cool down for a few minutes between batteries to extend the life of your motors.

After about 2 weeks of daily flying I burnt out a motor, my fault I crashed and didn't cut the throttle right away. Burnt out a motor and broke the prop. Very easy to fix if you have soldering skills. Back up and flying in about 30 minutes.

Let the battery cool before recharging it.

Camera leaves a lot to be desired but not bad for a $50 quadcopter.

title: Great quality great price
text: So durable, it's worth every penny. The quality of this product amazes me for the price

title: Fully Manual. Like driving a stick-shift car. No flappy paddles, DSG or auto here.
text: A really nice drone. For the price you don't get anything fancy but it's great as a starter as it forces you to be acquainted with all aspects of controlling a drone as this is a pure "manual" - no altitiude control, no come back when battery weak, no auto return, no autoland etc. You have to adjust throttle continuously and because there's no headless mode, you need to be able to think & visualize what the drone will do based on your controls. Very challenging. Parts are cheap too

title: Don't Buy the Quadcopter!  (not!)
text: Do not buy this quadcopter, or you will be addicted to drones and will immediately start spending on an upgraded model.  Seriously, this is a great toy, but just a toy, and is the perfect way to learn how to fly a drone without risking a several hundred dollar instrument.  Also, this is a great way to try it, to see if you would like playing with one of these things.  Lessons learned:  Start off in a wide open field, away from trees and other obstructions.  Also, when landing, be aware of where you are coming down, preferably on even ground, grass is ideal.  Coming down on hard surfaces on other uneven debris, will damage the copter blades.  Get the extra batteries and replacement parts, you will need them.

title: Fun and built well

title: Battery Caught Fire!
text: We purchased this for our son for Christmas. We charged the battery yesterday., this morning my son went to insert the battery into the drone and it shorted out, the battery started smoking and sparking. My son dropped the burning battery on the rug, where it left a burned spot covered in melted plastic. My other son was able to put it out before more damage was done. Be careful with these batteries!!

title: Great for the price
text: Great drone for the price.  Do not be fooled by the lightweight plastic.  This drone is tough.  We have crashed it dozens of times and it still flies like new.  The video capability is great (again for the price) but should have a better indicator when it is recording.  The battery last about 7 minutes. Because it is an older model it is not "headless".  Thus knowing which way is forward is critical.  One easy way to know is to simply stand behind the drone (so it is facing forward) and never rotate the drone. That  allows pushing forward moves the drone forward, left to the left, etc.

If your a newbie, I recommend practicing indoors, as it helps with getting the controls down. Also it might save your quadcopter getting stuck somewhere or lost. Also, get the extra batteries! That way you don't have to hear complaining from your husband :)

It even lasted thru a terrible rain storm! STILL GOING STRONG!

title: Great Drone for the Money!
text: We bought one for our college age son and one for our 16 year old daughter for Christmas. They are a huge hit! They've been practicing flying them in the house, and once outside when there wasn't much wind. The battery life is just as described - roughly 15 minutes or so. We did go ahead and buy the extra batteries as suggested by other reviewers, which has worked out perfectly. I was worried that the propellers would break, but these have landed against chair legs, kitchen cabinets, etc and they've held up well. The drones are really light weight. One hit against a light fixture that hangs by a chain over our dining table. The light never moved, the drone bounced off like it hit a wall. These are great introductory drones, they aren't fancy and you certainly can't be stealthy - they're pretty loud. But for the money, these are super fun and a true surprise on Christmas morning. (It's hard to surprise kids their ages. If you're a parent of a teen, you know what I'm saying.) I would recommend these to anyone who is looking for a cool gift for a teen or teen at heart - my mom just ordered one as a surprise for my dad's 70th birthday!

title: Fun, sturdy, and economical.
text:
Let me start by saying this is the first quadricopter I have owned. I purchased this on a whim when it was a few dollars off on holiday lightning deals. I could really not be happier with my purchase. Here are the main points, as I see them, in favor of this device.

Affordable - Knowing somewhat about the costs of the 'pro level' drones, I wasn't expecting much for $40-$50. However, this thing goes really high,
and zooms around quite quickly. The video quality- while nothing shocking- is better than I expected it to be.It is pretty interesting to get those sweeping (though perhaps a bit shakier) flying shots you are used to seeing in movies. I do question the inclusion of the microphone, since you can hear nothing over the buzzing of the rotors. The battery lifetime is right in line with what is promised (~7 minutes). I purchased another set of rotors, and some (off brand) batteries, and I still haven't spent $100.

Durable - Another thing I was worried about was durability. I hear stories of people buying these things and crashing them into trees or a wall and that being the end of them. However, I have given this thing some pretty rough landings. One time I cut the throttle as it got out of sight over my house. It landed on the roof, skidded off, over the fence and landed upside down; I did not notice that this affected it. I also land it in high grass which has tangled up the rotors, but not damaged them. I have seen small bits of debris (mostly bits of grass) in the plastic gears at the base of the rotors, and this does not seem to affect it.

FUN!!! - This thing is fun! I bought this to see if I might be interested in moving up to something by DJI, but for the moment I having plenty of fun with this one. Even on fairly windy days, you can take this out and have fun zipping around.

title: Excellent for newbies
text:
Excellent first-timer's UAV. It is very light, but very agile as well for a great learning curve. It has two modes for it's motor speed, to ease yourself into more dangerous ranges.

The Pros:
-Easy to Learn
-Very easy out-of-the-box
-Great community and online resources to learn more
-Very durable. I've already crashed it into a tree and onto a roof, and it's still on it's first round of propellers.
-LED's so you can see your orientation at night/low light/nearby

The Cons:
-The handbook is in engrish.
-The Transmitter does not have that great of a range, but can be modified for power users.
-The LEDs are difficult to get used to if you have no idea what they are there for. (Red should be facing away, green facing you)

title: Durable drone
text: Good still pics, good video and easy to fly for the price. Range is only about 75 to 100 feet up. The drone is durable. Took it too far up testing testing the range and got it stuck in a tree in March. End of November I finally got it down, no rust, and it still works. Video and pics still play from the memory card. Awesome little drone!

title: Camera works but the video does not

It can take pictures fine, but when I take a video you can hear the sound but the picture is just black. It has always been like this from the first flight out of the box. The battery is fully charged everytime I try to take a video and it still does not work properly. I still have not had any support from Amazon or anyone.

title: A lot of drone here for very little $$$.
text:
This is one little rugged copter and it has impressed me enough to buy 3 more for gifts. Let me give the breakdown:

Pros:
1) It's a great drone to learn with. It flies fairly accurate and it is stable.
2) Quality is pretty good for the low cost of this unit. It is a tough little piece of equipment and has survived several assassinations attempts from
the trees.
3) Camera quality is good. Not HD great, just good but for the price it does a spectacular job.
4) It'll go a LONG ways in the air. This thing gets some altitude to the extent of almost losing it multiple times. Thank goodness it has a
phenomenal range or we would have lost it. Something to be mindful of.
5) Included SD card holds all of your flight videos. It makes for some REALLY COOL videos when you do gentle 360 degree sweeping views.
6) Battery life is great and charging is very quick (we have 4 batteries so there is minimal downtime).
Cons:
1) It can be difficult to control or know what direction you have to go when you hit higher altitudes. There is different colored LED lights on the underbelly to help you navigate with direction but that doesn't help when you're colorblind. I personally colored one side bright yellow so as to help me identify directional steering. Although at tall heights...all this disappears from view anyway.
2) The motors are very noisy and will overpower any sounds in your videos.

For the money, this is a FANTASTIC piece of equipment to enjoy! Parts are available cheaply and it is a terrific way to learn to fly before jumping to a more expensive unit. All in all, we are very impressed with this "toy". I highly suggest this for yourself or for the kids.

title: For the price this is an excellent beginner quad
text:
For the price this is an excellent beginner quad.

Cons:
It is difficult to control at first and I have had 2 video files become corrupted (but this could be due to user error).

Pros:
I've crashed this thing more times then I can count but it still keeps flying.
The video quality, although not amazing, is really good for the price of the quad.
Super fun, I bought extra batteries so I can enjoy this as much as I can.

Observations:
Initializing/connecting the quad with the stock controller the instructions weren't clear but I found out how it works on my own
(1 turn on quad and transmitter, 2 push left stick up to get the "beep" then wait until the quad's lights blink slowly, 3 bring left stick down and the quad's light should be sold, 4 fly her and enjoy)

Also, if your taking video or pictures make sure the camera's led is green. Once it's green push the camera switch up to take a photo (it will blink red once and go back to green), and push it down to take a video (led will blink red, make sure you push the switch down again to save the video).

Remember this is a very inexpensive quad so don't expect anything amazing, just have fun with it.

title: Great cheap quad with a couple issues
text: Great cheap quad with a couple issues. Inside an aircraft hangar had no problem flying up to 200ft distance and never losing signal. Fantastic in no or low wind, can actually get it to hover hands off. Outdoors was a different story all together. Knowing battery life and distance took off and made it maybe 50ft up and the green lights flashed a couple times, lost radio signal it tuns out. It dropped a little bit before regaining control. Tried again a little lower but farther away with same results. Im guessing much more interference around all the houses kills the signal. Will have to try it in a more open park but dont have great hope for it. There are many videos online for upgrading the transmitter antenna to an actual 2.4g not the little wire that is inside of it

title: Brilliant little quadcopter
text: X5c has worked perfectly from first flight on. This is my first quadcopter. I am learning to fly it indoors in short hops. Trim buttons quickly get copter in steady hover. I'm gaining flight control confidence quickly. The X5c has proven quite durable during my training flights. I have bounced it off the ceiling, the floor and everything in between. No damage yet. Amazing! I'm getting about 11 minutes flying time with included battery (Buy extras) and short, low training hops. I would guess that  full power outdoor flights would match the predicted 7 minute estimate. I'm flying it with rotor guards but without landing gear and camera. That crazy flip feature is impressive and EASY to master,  even indoors. My only mods were to secure the LED covers with a bit of clear shipping tape and dusting some graphite powder on prop drive gears. Can't wait to fly this neat little fella outdoors.

title: One Star
text: the item broke first time using it..

title: The controls are touchy but its pretty easy to fly and the video quality is pretty ...
text: This is the first drone I've ever flown. The controls are touchy but its pretty easy to fly and the video quality is pretty good for the price. A few dozen hard landings already and its still flying perfectly fine. The only thing preventing a full 5 star review is the instruction manual has a pretty bad case of 'engrish'. None to the point where you can't understand what its trying to say but it is very poorly translated. Have not got a chance to fly it outside yet so I don't know how it will handle the wind but would say it was definitely worth it for the money.

title: Easy To Use, Fun, Great Video/Picture Quality.  Bummer Is That It Failed After A Handful Of flights.
text:
I have had a number of small drones over the years and they vary from fun/easy to use and annoying/tough to fly. This quad was a very fun and easy to fly device. It is also very easy to capture still images and video using the included camera. The image/Video quality was very solid and it even includes sound when recording video - though you will mostly hear the whir of the props. While not jet speed, it is a fairly fast quad and it can go about 3-4 stories up and/or about 100-150 feet away before losing signal. All in all this is a fun quad/drone that folks of moderate flying skill should be able to use

I am only giving three stars because the setup only lasted about six uses before one of the motors just quit working. I had just landed after flying a bit but when I tried to take off again the quad flew to one side and would only go up about six inches. When I checked I could see one of the props would barely move. I contacted Syma customer service and never heard back. As the Amazon return period was almost over I ended up returning the quad though I would have prefered to have it fixed or replaced but that was not an option. It was very fun and easy to use while it lasted, but I either got a lemon or the setup is not made very well.

title: Disappointment

title: great buy and fun!
text: Love this thing!  Great fun and for $40 it cannot be beat.  I bought the extra batteries and props as well.  I keep the blade guards on, so no replacing them yet, but extra batteries a must.  I have crashed this thing against walls and concrete driveway as well as plucked out of a dozen trees and it always continue to take off and fly. If i lost or broke it, i would buy again!  Video isnt too bad either and makes it fun to see what is around.

title: Great first quad.  Wish it came with a better antenna and bigger batteries.
text:
Pros:
Maneuverable & quick response time
Can hover over same spot in wind speeds up to 10mph+
Very light
Durable - I crash it all the time, even free falling from max altitude and landing on roof.
Blades slow descent when looses power and falls inverted - like a fast parachute.
Uprights itself after free fall (usually facing original direction).
LED lights allow for flying at night :-)
Can be flown indoors when you get good at it
Can fly as high as antenna allows (even with mods)

Cons:
The built-in antenna, particularly on the transmitter, really restricts the range (100ft-ish). With a minor WIFI antenna mod, range = visual limits!
LEDs usually flash when TX signal lost and defaults to neutral controls with a slow descent, however, often the copter just "freezes" on last command until regains signal.
There is little to no warning when the battery is low. Usually, the LEDs start to flash giving you have 5-10 seconds before it drops out of the sky. But, sometimes your warning is a free fall - especially with the small battery it comes with.
My 3 year old can write better instructions.

Tips:
Replace the transmitter antenna with an old WIFI router antenna (or find a cheap 2.4gHz antenna online). Range will increase from ~100ft to visual limits (~400ft). I first replaced it with a 6.2cm solid copper wire from a Coax cable - range doubled, but a commercial antenna worked a little better. I also replaced the RX antenna (~1.5inch, insulated, stranded wire) with a 6.2cm solid, insulated wire. I didn't notice an improvement, but am confident that it is more reliable.
Buy bigger batteries to increase flight time. I currently have 800mAh. Flight time is 9 minutes when not recording or using the 3D eversion, and with guards taken off.
Paint the bottom bright red & green (or at least the red half) so you can determine the orientation at further distances and not lose control!
Hold the 3D eversion button (top/right) while moving the right stick (rudder) left or right. You CAN record while performing aerobatics.
Although it can fight decent winds, it is very light weight and susceptible to gusts and stronger winds. It is most fun to fly in 0 wind and lower wind speed = higher altitude possible.
Don't forget to hit the record button to stop recording and write the video file to the card BEFORE turning power OFF to the quad.
Write your address somewhere visible on the quad so you get it back (hopefully) after it flies into your neighbors yard.
Keep the copter out of the cone of confusion (don't point the end or bottom tip of the TX antenna at the copter). For best reception, hold the TX antenna parallel to the RX antenna. The stock RX antenna sits limp in a forward-ish facing direction (open up the copter to see exactly how it sits).
You don't need the blade guards. They help if you run into things a lot, but once you get the hang of it they are just drag & weight. The motors stop spinning when you hit something and I also cut the power when about to crash.

title: A great starter quadcopter
text:
This is a great starter quadcopter, and the price is right … even if you lose it and have to replace it, or break certain parts and have to repair. A replacement drone can be had for not too much money, and replacement parts abound. I'd buy it again, and give it as a gift.

It takes a great deal of practice to get good at flying this quadcopter, so be patient. But, once you learn the basics, you are set.

title: Absolutely terrible.
text:
I guess you could say that I'm more of an experienced flyer, but trying to fly in slightly windy conditions is impossible.

Even if it's a perfect day, and you want to get some footage, let me just tell you - don't bother. The videos are shaky, to the point where it gave me a headache to watch. If you are taking stills, also don't bother. Way too blurry to make out what you are taking a picture of. After about 5 flights, 2 of the motors and the battery decided to give up.

2 weeks ago I contacted Syma about this problem and asked for a replacement, but they refused.

Please, save yourself the money and buy a different drone.

title: Kids toy
text:
what do you expect for Fifty dollars? Bought this based on the reviews and it's popularity among Amazon customers. The item arrived in a reasonable period of time, approx. 6 business days. Packaging was more than adequate, too much really. Unpacked the machine, interpreted the poorly translated owner/instruction manual, (from Chinese to English, its kinda funny) attached the rotor guards, screwdriver included and installed the AA batteries (not included) into the handset. Drone battery required charging which was quickly set up using the enclosed USB cable and an available slot at my charging station.

Flying this really requires some effort, especially if you wish to hover, the motors aren't very synchronized and each fan section produces a slightly different amount of lift so the platform constantly drifts. the trim adjustments on the motor heads aren't sufficient to offset the lift production differences so the platform is always turning making it difficult to orient and steer. The real challenge with this "toy" is being able to keep it in the air and not crashing into anything. the power and steering controls are sloppy based on the lag time. You get 7 good minutes of fly time, and let me tell you that's seven minutes of you running around chasing after it. this is a great kids toy, but nothing more.

title: Good, till I lost it.
text:
The Syma x5c was my first drone. Did a bunch of research before, and this seemed like a good bang for the buck. Overall, a great little machine and pretty easy to get the hang of. My friend has a China knockoff, but the Syma is much more stable in windy conditions than the cheap alternative.

Camera is decent for a $50 drone.

after 3 days of flying, I wanted to see how high the unit could go. I was pleasantly surprised how high it went., And was excited to see the video from that flight. Unfortunately, I lost control/Orientation of the device, and it took off. I tried to chase it/correct direction, but it was way to far away. Someone now has a nice drone in their back yard or roof and I'm out $50.

I ordered a similar one from holy stone that also has headless mode for a few more dollars so I don't have to worry about orientation.

title: Great starter drone!
text:
I bought this in 2015 and it's still going strong today, despite the beating it has taken. I crash it more often than I should, and it just keeps on flying. I bought it for $49 and see that it's even less expensive today. The camera quality is remarkably good, especially for this price. I don't know how they can build such a reliable and quality product with a good camera and sell it for this price.

Fly it when there is almost no wind, as it is very lightweight and any wind will try to take it in another direction. After almost 3 years, I just noticed last week that there is a button on the remote that makes it do flips. Very cool.

Buy extra batteries. I go through 4 of 5 of them in 30 minutes or so.

text: The drone flies well and is really fun. The battery could of course be bigger as the drone runs out of power with in 5 minutes. The camera is not great. It works, but it's blurry, has a low viewing angle, and has poor low light performance. But after all the drone is only around 45 dollars. The biggest flaw with the drone are the connection issue. When flying be careful not to let the drone fly to high as either the wind will push it away or it will drop connection and continue flying to who knows where.

title: Two Stars

title: Great Copter, Until Malfunctions Burn Away Your $$$
text:
This thing was awesome. At first. I bought it for my six year old son, for whom it was much to advanced. I have great hand-eye coordination, but it took some real learning. It was a fun little copter.

The bad. Starting day two, after about 45 minutes of flying (through battery recharges and swaps), above about 30 feet we noticed that the response time was almost non-existent. It would hold a particular pattern until it was out of range. I couldn't get it to maneuver, but I learned the only thing to which it responded was cutting throttle. So when it "got stuck", I would just kill the throttle and go get it.

Today I flew it, and it was great. Until about 40 feet. It "got stuck", and flew into a neighbor's tree. I got out a ladder, telescoping pole, etc, and can't get it. My neighbor now has a new permanent ornament in his front yard, and I'm out $50. It's almost like the propellers would get stuck in a particular pattern and wouldn't adjust. It was IN RANGE.

Bummer.

Tip to all, paint the bottom a very bright color so it's easier to see as it is flying into the sky. Would definitely buy again!

text: I really can't say enough good things about this Quad... it's durable, it's easy to fly, it was cheap! I don't know that I would recommend it as a first quad, but it was my second, and it's been a great reliable unit.

title: Five Stars

title: Young and Old will have a Blast !!!
text:
I am new to quadcopters so I bought this and a Hubsan X4. The X5C is an awsome quad and is way more fun to fly outdoors then the smaller X4. Wind can effect it's flight of course but in expert mode you have the power to bring it back if it starts getting carried away. It's really simple to control and will get as aggressive as you care to fly it.

I used a lot of the info from quadcopter 101 youtube vids and his blog to learn the basics. After buying more batteries which I highly recommend, it took me about 2 hours flight time to go from hovering and simple box patterns to full on banked turns.

I had hoped the camera was better but for the money it's not that bad. I swapped out the screws that hold it in place with longer screws from the unused blade protectors. Only screwing them in a few turns I can drop the angle of the camera so it doesn't just shoot straight at the ground. It's now shoots more forward which to me is great. What isn't great about it is the jello effect in bright light. It's pretty bad and makes for some unusable footage. I've seen vids using the 808 key chain camera attached to the X5C that look decent so I guess I could spend twenty more bucks and get better footage but really I'll just wait until I'm a better pilot and get a quad that is setup for areal footage at some point.

title: Great product for me as a beginner
text: Great product for me as a beginner.  Its tricky to get used to at first but the controls are straight forward and the learning curve has more to do with the freedom of motion that comes from flying.  I would say it meets my expectations for durability but you wont want to crash it on purpose.  I have had to purchase additional propeller guards which are worth it. The camera takes decent video and the memory card is easily accessible.  The battery is about as expected as well.  Cant have a huge battery if you want to save weight.  I got a 5 pack of batteries and an additional charger combo from Amazon that I would recommend.  The fun and quality you get for the price is worth it.  Would buy again.

title: EXCELLENT BUY!
text: This is an exception item for the price. I bought the extra warranty knowing full well how hard he would be on it. But it landed in trees, the street, the ceiling fan and it gets right back up! He hasn't broken any blades yet, but one of the blade guards. Good thing it came with extras of each. So impressed with the quality of this drone! Best one we've owned, by far!

title: but that was fine. My only issue really is the "HD" camera/video
text:
Mostly likely a 3.5 on the 'star rating scale.' I could not get the setup correct (I used to be a mechanic and I can read so taking the time to troubleshoot was not the issue). So I had to always be pushing to the right, but that was fine. My only issue really is the "HD" camera/video. It's worse than a 1990 'b00b tube' TV. The agility of the drone is perfect, I love the upped speed, way more mobility, and being so light, you don't have to register it. I would agree with other reviews, get another battery, I did, it's well worth it. Especially on the upped speed mode.

Perfect for a teenage, me (32), adult, or really anyone of any age. It's that easy. The tricks are fun. I bought in the winter and was able to gracefully maneuver my living room (vaulted ceilings) and go through hallways.

title: This device will lose connection to the controller from time ...

title: I suppose for the price it's pretty good. Instructions are understandable
text: Ok.  This is my first quad copter.  I suppose for the price it's pretty good.  Instructions are understandable.  The poor Chinese person who wrote them I think really tried to make a good set.  It's just ok.  The battery lasts about six or eight minutes of solid off and on flying.  It would be best to buy a few extras.  Sometimes it has a hard time pairing with the controller.  It gets up quick and is a cool toy though.  My eight year old boy works it over and doesn't have any trouble.  I don't know about the cameras capabilities because I haven't downloaded pictures.  I bought it mostly just to fly I suppose.

title: Best entry level drone !
text: This drone is by far the best entry level drone to buy. This is my third entry level drone. It is very easy to fly. It take good video with sound but all you can hear are the blades spinning. When I ordered it said 2 gig micro card for camera and no card reader to my suprise there was a 4 gig card in the camera and it did come with a usb card reader. I am very pleased with this drone

text: I got this for my niece's B-day (10) and I want one form myself.  For the price, it was a great value and the flight time with extra batteries is pretty good.

title: Faulty Remote control transmitter.
text:
The quad-copter itself works great, flies great, and is fairly durable.
My problems are with the remote control transmitter. I'm sure this is an isolated case but be aware not to leave your batteries in your transmitter otherwise they could overheat within 10 minutes and start to leak battery acid. I was fortunate to pick it up again and was able to take the batteries out without any damage done to the controller.

title: great first drone
text: The first thing I noticed about the drone is the battery life, its exceptional! I own a lot of other rc devices and most won't even last half as long! I'm also really loving its durability. A great buy.

title: Maybe I got a bad one
text: It's extremely difficult to control.  It shoots up into the sky and quickly veers to the right. If I try to reduce the power to stabilize - it plummets to the ground. I tried it several times and there was no real adjustment to the controls.

It's so cheap that eventually if you buy some more parts for it, it would cost less to just purchase a new one. Not cheap in build quality though. Pretty awesome drone for sure.

title: I did enjoy this and would have given it a 4 star ...
text:
So I finally got my first Quadcopter. After reading dozens of reviews I picked this Syma X5C. I'm a beginner and it worked for about 12 flights. I got the hang of it until one of the motors stopped spinning.
I also found that the trim buttons did not do much to correct the sway of the copter. I did enjoy this and would have given it a 4 star had it worked. They did let me return the product for a refund.
Pictures and video are okay but not great. Everything was as advertised and I would recommend this as a first time copter.

Great to learn skills on as it is really tough (sturdy), and the quad itself is extremely responsive with good flight time and relatively quick charge time too. This is my second one as the first one got caught in the wind and was gone! Very lightweight so be forewarned in any wind speed outdoors. Enjoy!

The lights are very helpful to keep you oriented on the direction. If you hit the high performance button it responds very well. Ive crashed this thing mulitple times and picked it up and flew it again. Its a tough little drone. The batteries only last 5 minutes but thats not bad they are easy enough to change and fly again. All in all a great time. Makes me want to buy a real one but not sure it would be any better than this one.

title: Good teaching tool for newbies
text:
This is a great beginning drone. Don’t get me wrong, it SUCKS compared to anything from DJI, but I bought this to teach the concepts of quadcopter handling to newbies. For that it is perfect. It is tough, it had handled being flown straight into a pecan tree to falling from around 100 feet in the air, and just took right off once positioned right way up.
You only get between 7 and 15 minutes of flight time, but it’s total lack of any sophistication lends itself to be a great teaching tool.
For its price, it’s a great deal.

title: The best starter quad on the market!
text: I've had two of these models and they are just really good for someone wanting to start flying. it's super durable and can take collisions without much problem. Very stable flight and a range of about a hundred yards give or take. Once out of range the unit will continue with the last order it was receiving. Meaning if you were adding throttle when it loses reception then it's going to keep climbing. Extra batteries and replacement parts and very affordable. Makes a great gift for kids as well ages 8 and up. Easy to operate out of the box. Highly recommend!

title: Nice!
text: I love this thing! Picture and video quality is good for a 60 dollar camera with the added bonus of flight. Can't beat that. Crashed a few times with no affects to the toy at all. Flight time per charge seems pretty typical for the price. I have ordered more batteries. Did a range test as the instructions said good to 50 meters. Flew it out till I lost signal then paced it off at 120 paces. I'm 6'3" so they weren't baby steps. Impressive! Have already recommended this to several people. FUN!!!

title: SCIENCE FAIR EXPERIMENT that just keeps on going...
text:
[[VIDEOID:217ca487a15fd7c8f3a10bfe40c8f82b]] I bought this so my son could do a science fair experiment on aerodynamics...it worked wonderfully for that, though i ended up buying 4 battery packs and an extra charger. But it worked well, and for around 50 bucks was an okay deal in my book. There is some art to getting decent photos/videos from it--apparently a trick neither my son nor I have yet figured out...camera does not broadcast back to cell phone, so it's difficult to tell what the camera is seeing...

Still, it helped him make a full grade school excited about aerodynamics, it cost very little...and it's been fun to use. It has survived several trips into trees, an out-of-sight crash where we had no idea where to look...and a near run-over by the trolley at Wildwood boardwalk, in NJ. If i lost it in a tree tomorrow, I'd buy another--but i'd make sure it had the camera streaming to the phone for better pictures...

It is a very durable drone though. I've crashed it at least 50 times so far and it still runs great! I have replaced a few propellers and the prop guards.  I advise anyone new to drones to buy some spare parts as well.

I've had at least 3 submerged in water, one for 3 weeks, with mud caked in the motherboard- still worked great (after drying of course- camera may not make it). For the money it is a true value- camera really good for the price, especially if you're kinda reckless like me.

title: This is a terrific quadcopter! Interestingly though
text:
This is a terrific quadcopter! Interestingly though, when I ordered this product a couple weeks ago, Cheerwing USA fulfilled the order and to my delight it turned out to be the X5C-1 and not the X5C!
I just ordered another X5C and this one was fulfilled by Battery Superstore. The product that came this time was the X5C, but I was expecting the X5C-1, as per my experience with my first order.
They both fly beautifully. I am writing this as a sorta heads up on the supplier, and having said that I have no way of knowing if one will always receive and X5C-1 when getting the order fulfilled from Cheerwing USA or if it was simply a mistake with my particular order.

The replacement is working great. This is my first quad so I'm no expert but everything is as I expected from reading the reviews. The camera is grainy in low light but very clear when there's plenty of light. Controlling a quad isn't easy but I have no complaints about the stability and responsiveness of this product.

text:
Got this for my son for Christmas and we had a blast with it.

Beware: the instructions are terrible but thankfully YouTube has lots of videos for use and troubleshooting.

Unfortunately, after he flew it into a tree, one of the motors started working intermittently and after some online research, I found this was a common problem with the soldering of the wires on the motors.

I had to take it to a local drone shop to have it repaired and it's back to working like new.

Great little drone, just stay away from trees and other objects.

title: So much fun - and even a Pennsylvania winter couldn't damage it.
text: Not just fun but amazingly rugged.  This got stuck up near the top of a 40 foot tree back in August, and despite many attempts to get it down (very long sticks, throwing balls of various sizes, slingshot with plastic golf balls and even a super size (built of 2x4s and exercise bands) slingshot it was up there to stay.  Through wind, rain, snow and ice it sat there in the tree blades twirling in the breeze.  Had to buy another one because it is just so much fun - then today (May) there it was on the grass, must have blown down during the night.  Charged up the battery, switched it on - and away it goes, just like new.

title: Excellent buy.  Great value, perfect for an entry level drone.
text: Absolute best bang for your buck!  For the price, this drone can not be beat!  I am very grateful for the reviews on Amazon for this purchase.  This drone was the stereotypical Christmas gift for my son, and I wanted him to be able to fly it realistically.  I've seen a couple of other drones, for twice the money but half the size.  And this one takes the cake!  It's very large, and incredibly easy to use.  I bought the 4 pack of batteries for this drone because like all drones, battery life is short. However it is loads of fun, my wife thinks that I bought the drone for me and not my son!  And this thing is almost indestructible, I've bounced it off so many things, and I can't break it.  I'm sure I will eventually though.  The range is decent and battery life good, the remote controller is very easy to use.  My kids that are 9+ of years have no problem operating it.

title: Good drone, but possible fire danger.
text: This is a great little quadcopter! I was100% pleased when I got it. Flys well, takes suprisingly good video.  A little hard to control.  But a great drone for the price!  Part 2:  After having this drone for a while, I must downgrade my review. I intended to give this drone to my son. However when I was showing him how to unplug the battery from the drone to recharge it, the wires shorted out, started smoking then caught on fire.  We put the fire out, no one was hurt, but drone is ruined.  This seems to be a serious design flaw.  Because no matter how careful you are, eventually the wires into the battery will wear and then short out because you have to take the battery out and plug it into the charger to recharge.  Then plug the battery into it's tiny plug in the drone to fly it.  This could be a potential lawsuit from someone not as nice as me.

title: Love the lights
text: Grandson loves it and even flies it carefully in the house.  Love the lights!

title: Great for kids and even adult kids
text: This Droid is a great product. I ordered this for a Christmas gift for my husband. So, basically a big kid. ha. He loves the Syma. It is easily calibrated and flies really fast and flawlessly.  The camera is a really cool aspect and the kids enjoy watching the "flight videos".  We also got the charger port and extra batteries so there is extended flying time when we break this bad boy out.  Basically an hour of flying time.  The kids get a kick out of my husband flying this Droid in the house, and they like it when he chases them around the living room.  Nice gift idea, and good for older kids and even adult kids.

title: Great value!
text: This is my son's 3rd drone. The first one he loved, but was damaged in an international move (oops!). It did not have a camera, so as a peace offering, we decided to upgrade.  The second one we returned to Amazon due to it falling very short of basic expectations (despite being over 2x's the price of this one...more expensive is NOT always better!).  Third time is the charm! This drone is perfect for a 14 yr. old to play around with, take pictures and videos, and impress his friends. Battery time isn't great (but none of them seem to be) so we'll be ordering the 6 extra battery set and charger. This adds a little to the cost, but still a fabulous value...plus he'll have a nearly unlimited battery supply. The pictures are WAY better, flight distance well over twice, and it even just feels more quality than drone #2. Happy mama with a very happy kid! What more could you ask for?

title: Not Worth it.
text:
Heres the scoop:
* The .avi files from the camera do not play. I tried 3 different players: the files are corrupt.
* The pictures from the camera are not in focus, they are blurred. Tried a few things to clean them up, nothing worked.
* The battery (lipo) was spent. It would no longer hold a charge. It is a cheap defective battery and is actually a fire hazard. (DO NOT USE THIS BATTERY)
* The charger it ships with I do not trust. These items (battery and charger) would set you back at least another 75$ to 100$ for quality hardware.
* The models indicator lights are on BACKWARDS. The green for front are on the aft, and the red for aft are on the front. The quality of assembly
and QCTest this model is horrible. The are QC stickers on the item, the battery the charger etc, however stickers mean nothing.

I am an avid RC modeler and specialize in Electric, so I did some more testing. I put in a decent battery and tested all functionality, and the machine flies OK. Still, pics and video are broken. This is an OK beginner drone flier. However, do not expect anything from the video or photo capability. Do not expect to be able to fly it out of the box. Expect to purchase a decent battery and charger to get it working.

My Recommendation:
At 50$, this is not worth it out of the box. If you are a modeler, and want something that flies OK and want to purchase extra stuff, still there are better models out there. Overall: Not worth it.

title: Best for Learning to fly
text: This is an awesome learning copter. I have 3 AR drones and a mini drone. This one is by far the easiest to learn on. For the price don't expect the video quality to be superb. It's not. But if you want to teach a child to fly a quadracopter, this is the way to go. I have referred a number of friends to get this one as a starter. Their kids love it!! Be sure to get the extra batteries. Well worth the extra 18 bucks. 5 batteries give you about one hour of total flying time without recharging. The extra batteries come with a 5 port charger so you can charge them all at the same time.

title: This drone is great and he has thanked us repeatedly for it
text:
We bought this for our 10-year-old son, even though it was rated ages 14 and up, as a Christmas present. This drone is great and he has thanked us repeatedly for it! Considering that there is a learning curve for anyone using a remote control for the first time, this drone is very durable and forgiving. Our son mostly flew it out in our field, so it had soft ground to land on. However, there were many times he and our other older kids flew it inside and it took its share of wacks on the wall, ceiling and, floor. We bought a micro SD card for it - other reviewers said it came with theirs, but ours did not - and he can take pictures or record video with it. When he's done recording he just puts the SD card into the adapter, pops it into the laptop, and watches his flight. It is so easy!
The battery life is 5-7 minutes of flight, which has not been a problem. We did end up buying a second battery to have at the ready while the other one charges.
We wanted to start out with a less expensive model drone while our son got the hang of it, and in case it got broken, so we got this. We are so impressed with this drone, especially for this price!

title: This product is just silly fun!
text:
This product is just silly fun. Only flown it twice so far. There is a learning curve. The first flight boys and I struggled mightily. We could manage to take off and hover a bit, but any additional flight input usually involved killing power and bringing to ground quickly as we lost "feel" for direction/input. The learning curve is quick though. Our second flight I was able to figure out orientation (from the LED lights) of the heading and really started to have some fun. Still pretty quick to lose "feel" of direction/input especially as we approach trees etc. and kill power a lot to avoid an "incident." We love this. Its cheap and FUN! Haven't used the camera yet as we need a memory card. Our best recommendation is to use the blade guards. They have saved the quadcopter from damage multiple times (they flex). Also learn to fly this in a LARGE open grassy area.

[UPDATE] I've flown this at least ten times now. We love this quadcopter. Still disappointed it didn't come with the microSD card (it comes with the USB adapter for one) and we still haven't bought one, though we plan to. This is very very easy to fly at night due to the LEDs making it very clear the orientation and heading. Since we started flying it in our wide open grassy park we've had a blast. Not a good idea to learn to fly this in a neighborhood with streets and houses. It would be too easy to lose. Twice we've gotten lucky finding it in someone's yard. Stick to BIG wide open parks and be aware that ANY wind will carry the quadcopter at altitude faster than it can fight. High altitude is fun, but it will lose its signal. If its windy and high, it can be gone in a hurry! We found that out. Luckily we found it. It survived a 300ft fall with not even a scratch.

title: Great product, Excellent!

title: Fun copter!
text:
Syma X5c What a blast!
I bought this together with an extra charger and 6 battery set. I highly recommend the extra add-on.I

I unpacked the thing in short order and tossed most everything but the copter manual and the ratio.

This thing is highly sensitive and controllable!
I have spent a few minuets with it almost every day and can control it now without highly exaggerated moves.

It has a wide range of motion with fine graduations between. It is fun to get to the point where you can fly it where you want it to go without banking hard back and forth.

The camera works well. It takes pictures and video. As someone else said, don't forget to end your video while everything is still on and working or else it doesn't save.

The range is pretty good until you really try to get it out there and then you find it's limits.
I'd say mine is about 80 yards out and 100 feet up. So less than 150 yards Tops! You find out instantly when it's out of range. Basically you lose all control for a moment or permanently.
It's scary. I had it fall out of the air 100 ft to grass (no damage). Modification exists to boost range. I will investigate and add my experience.

And the fall from the air leads to another point.
This running is fricking tough! Tough I say! Tough!
I have crashed it unbelievably hard and it's still going like new. Into walls, into tile floors into cement, into gravel upside down full throttle.

All those were accidental and not without sadness but it took it like superman and shrugged it off to fly again.

I read all the reviews about it's build strength and hoped for the best but I am absolutely floored by it's reliance. Very very resilient machine.

I got extra blades in the box. I have yet to need them after maybe 50+ (regrettable) Crashes it still flies as good as when I unboxed it.

I haven't flown others but this one has been great!

Picture quality good.
Video quality good but with a few caveats
It looks like the person/bird taking the video is drunk. Spin tilt tilt tilt spin tilt tilt.
Sometimes it gets a touch of fuzz on a few frames.
Other than that it's nice video.
I suppose with some mad skills you could reduce some of the tilting but it's never going to be gimbal mounted quality.
For the money I think it exceeds expectations on the video.

Summary
Just in fun quantity and quality I think I've already got my money's worth and it's not even close to broken yet. I'd recommend it. I'd buy it again (if I flew it under a moving car cause nothing else seems likely to kill it).

She hates it because of how much I love it and fly it constantly.

I also assumed that for the price it would not come exactly as advertised (with a camera, as easy to control as listed) All of these assumptions were wrong, this copter is incredibly easy to learn to use, it is really big and the camera works seamlessly. This has quickly become my favorite copter I own and I would recommend this to anyone looking for a great device for an extremely reasonable price. They even list the individual parts in case you need to replace anything. Such a great purchase.

title: Good first RC quad.  Easy to learn on.
text:
(One month in) Everything is working great, I've had one of the LED light boards go out (it's very dim.) Spare parts were about $5 on Amazon. I've replaced propellers after bending a few on a wild ride.

I had a couple flyaways in beginner mode early on. (Mode switch is edge button on upper left corner, one beep is beginner, two is advanced.) In advanced mode you can overcome a lot more wind, manuever and fly significantly quicker. If it's a windy flyaway, switch o advanced mode. If it's an orientation problem (you've lost track of which direction the front of the copter is facing) and the copter is flying away, switch to beginner mode so you aren't unintentionally flying away at top speed.

Working on a way to mount camera so it is horizontal instead of tilted downward a couple degrees. I alwats seem to miss what I'm trying to film (sunsets) as the camera is always pointed below the horizon... Also contemplating a way to mount the camera facing the ground (vertical) as I like the resulting effect.

(Original review)
Great starter quad, taken several tumbles, unplanned landings, with nothing broken yet. Camera is good, not excellent, but for $40-50 more than good value-for-money.

Buy extra batteries (Tenergy 3.7V 700mAh are a good choice for extra flying time, same size as stock.)
[[ASIN:B00ZSO56KM Tenergy 5 pcs of 3.7V 700mAh LiPO Battery (Compatible with Syma X5, X5C, X5SC, X5SW and Cheerson CX-30W)]]
Get a real LiPO charger (even a cheap Chinese-made one) instead of using the USB charging cable.
Get a LiPO battery guard sleeve to store and charge your batteries in.
A full replacement set of (spare/crash) parts is cheap insurance as well.

Tip: As well as the time.txt trick (google or read top Amazon review), make a file on the microSD card that contains your contact information to help get your copter back home if you lose it.

Late November 2015 delivered product came with 4GB microSD card instead of 2GB card in product description. Typical full-flight video on a 700mah (upgraded, not stock, which is 500mah) battery is about 1.3-1.4GB as a data point.

The next day I found my X5C on the ground.  The battery didn't take a charge but with a new battery it to us just fine!

title: Great drone for its price
text: Great drone for its price. That is that is reluctant praise because this drone does not fly itself like those costing a bit more. It is difficult to keep it in a stable hover, it is easily influenced by a breeze, and if it gets too high or far away (maybe ~120') it will not obey commands, keeps spinning, and goes where the wind takes it. It is not operator-centric, meaning you have to keep track of which is the front of the drone which is difficult at distance. Once it gets a little rotated, right control can mean left, directly into the branches of a hungry tree. A good beginner drone, but spend a little more and you won't be climbing trees. Pics and video are hardly "HD".

title: Very good beginner quad copter
text: Very good beginner quad copter! This was my first one to buy and I learned how to fly it in a matter of first flight because of how stable this product can be. The video quality isn't the best, but you can get some really cool photos from high in the sky! If you want to try to do some aerial photography, I would definitely consider this quad as your first !

Still trying to figure out how to use the camera, but was able to figure out how to roll/flip (the guide said a 3D button the back, its a button on the top)

title: Great low-cost, beginner drone, now wishing for more features
text: I've had this drone for about a month now, it's January in upstate NY, so it's hard to get out and practice, but I have been out a few times, total of about an hour or two flight time..  Although it is a great beginner drone, and definitely worth the money, it does take a lot of practice if you've never before flown one!  I took one reviewer's suggestion NOT to put on the blade guards, and am happy about that, because I have put it into some trees, and often it does find its own way to the ground; I can see how having the blade guards will cause it to hang up more.  First-timers will definitely have to practice at lower altitudes - hovering, back and forth/side-to-side, squares, circles, etc. before taking this to heights.  It's very durable; I've panicked and crashed this to the ground from altitude (50+ feet) several times, and it just takes it in stride.  Now that I have this, I do kind of miss the features that some of the more expensive drones have, like altitude hold and auto-return.  That just means I'll need a bit more practice.  The up-side is that for a drone of this price, the pictures and videos are exceptional!  Definitely buy the spare batteries and propeller blades - they are very inexpensive and nice to have.  I also bought the recommended case for it, and everything fits in great; I did need to enlarge the remote control slot a bit, but otherwise I am quite happy with all that I purchased!

title: Great beginner quadcopter
text:
5 minutes out of the box and I crashed into a 35 ft pine. Luckily I was able to get it out. Pro-tip: work with it indoors with small corrections to master the controls first, and then take it outdoors. Also I found cutting the power when it gets too far out will save you from trying to chase the drone down. As soon as it gets far from you it's hard to regain control.

That being said it's an awesome bang for the buck. I've hit the ground multiple times (as well as got it stuck in a tree) and it still works great. Highly recommend this as an entry level drone.

title: Great fun for 40 bucks
text: Great fun for 40 bucks.  I just got this as my first quadcopter to see if I would like it.  At the price it won't break the bank and holds up to a lot of abuse.  I even crashed in water and it was completely submerged for several minutes.  When I finally was able to reach and retrieve it, it was still blinking and ready to go!  I shook it out, brought it up to altitude and did a couple of flips.  My only regret is, I wish it was recording at the time.  The next flight I parked it in the top of a 40 foot tree, and had to throw a softball at it until it broke free.  It floated down more gracefully than I could have done, and again no worse for wear.  So if you are as inept as I am with hand eye coordination, don't have a ton of money I highly recommend this to get your feet wet....just make sure you bring waders if there is water around!

title: Don't waste your time!
text:
Bought this drone for our sons birthday. The first drone kinda worked. It wouldn't fly straight up, when you pushed up on the stick. One of the propellers wasn't as powerful as the others and when you'd try to fly it straight up it would go sideways and up. Eventually the prop wouldn't turn without being physically pushed. Sent it back hoping for a better one.

The second one wouldn't even fly! Charged battery in the drone and new batteries in the controller and when the props wouldn't even turn when we try to fly it. It just sits there and does nothing.

Very frustrated about this product. Don't waste your time and money on this one.

title: A WHOLE LOTTA FUN!
text:
My son gave me this little quadcopter for my 68th birthday & I love it! I used to fly R/C planes so I felt right at home flying this around my yard. I suggest changing the way the controls work from Mode 1 to Mode 2. Mode 1 has the turn left/right on the left stick & forward/backward on the right stick. If you set the controller to Mode 2 you have those combined on just the right stick. Then the left stick is throttle up/down and fly sideways left/right. I find I don't use the sideways control much except correcting for wind drift (or doing flips!) The instructions tell you how to change modes.

It's very easy to fly & seems super stable if you don't fly it in windy conditions. I'm going to buy some extra batterys so I can extend my flying sessions. If you want to try your hand at a quadcopter this is a great way to get some stick time for a bargain price.

The camera is more of a novelty than a tool. I've gotten some hilariously low res photos of things. But don't plan on doing an professional recon. with this thing.

title: Five Stars
text: perfect gift!

title: Great Drone for starters
text:
If you are a drone starter, or if you want a cheap drone that is good quality, this drone is great for you. I just received it as a gift a few days ago, and it is already so much fun. It is great in many ways, but there are some bad parts about it.

The good stuff:
-Easy to fly
-Can survive many crashes
-Great stability

The bad stuff
-Long charge time, short fly time (about 1 hour 15 minutes charging, 7-10 minutes flying)
-Cannot see what camera is recording (usually more expensive drones will have the "first person" feature

This drone is extremely durable. I am not a great flyer myself, this is my first drone. But, when I brought it to my friends house, I found out they were even worse. I got dropped from high heights, stuck in a tree, landed in the neighbors yard, and landed in a rosebush. The next day, it worked perfectly fine, and it had no damage. Then, my dad flew it into a tree. The blades hit the branches, and one of the blade guards had a branch going through it. We had to get a ladder and broom and hit it out of the tree. But, it was still alive when we (finally) go it out.

title: I guess either (a) I am extremely lucky or (b) folks who have bad experiences are more inclined to write review
text: There are many not so favorable reviews on Amazon regarding this unit and the larger batteries you can purchase with it.  I was a bit nervous having read the review AFTER ordering it.  I guess either (a) I am extremely lucky or (b) folks who have bad experiences are more inclined to write review.  Maybe folks who have no problems just enjoy their product without writing a review.  I thought I might change that -  if that is the case.  I have had absolutely no problems with either the copter or larger batteries.  The unit is fun to fly and the only modification I had to make was related to the larger batteries.  To install the larger batteries I had to cut out one of the plastic harnesses inside the copter to make room for the battery.  Other than that NOT ONE ISSUE.  The video quality is good given that this unit is so inexpensive. I've had a blast filming/flying over our house and down the street. There is a mod you can do to the antenna to get a bit more range, but I am fine with it as is.  Just one man's opinion, but this was a great purchase for me.

title: I love my little Syma X5C drone
text: I love my little Syma X5C drone.  This is my first drone, and I'm admittedly terrible at flying it.  It does exactly what I tell it to do, including taking photos and videos.  With my beginner enthusiasm, I decided to test fly it in my backyard surrounded by large trees.  Naturally, within a few days, I got it hopelessly stuck in the very top of the tallest tree.  About a month later, a thunderstorm finally blew the tree around enough to send it falling to the ground.  To my surprise, the Syma X5C was intact and the micro SD card still held the videos I was taking a month earlier.  I dried it out, recharged the battery and started flying it again (this time in my basement) with no problems at all.  Considering this is a very inexpensive, starter drone, I am really impressed.

title: this was awesome! For the 16 minutes I got to fly ...
text:
Brand new drone guy, this was awesome! For the 16 minutes I got to fly it before I lost control and it flew away. Don't be fooled, a beginning drone pilot is not invincible to losing the thing. Make some ground rules first:
1) don't fly higher than 20 ft
2) fly in a very very open field
3) the moment you feel you've lost control, cut the throttle and let the thing drop. It likely won't break.
4) focus on orientation first: make sure the drone faces away from you, so your right is the drone's right. Then focus on forward and backward, then left and right, ALL below 20 ft. Do this for a couple of days.

This is the perfect done to train on, just go slow!

title: After setting it up per the instructions, and flying ...
text:
After setting it up per the instructions, and flying it around in my house for about 3 batteries worth of use to get the hang of it, I waited for 4-5 days for calm weather.

You can imagine my surprise when it stopped responding to the controller (of course it was full throttle) flew up high enough into the sky to disappear, and is now gone. Total mechanical failure of some sort, and the seller says there is "not under warranty for a fly-away item" and if it was defective "that it would not fly at all" I get that this is only a $30 drone, but I did everything correctly, and it failed.

I was offered a paltry $3 discount on a replacement.

Guess what I'm not doing?

title: this is a great place to start
text: I've been wanting to get into and play around with quads but didn't want to spend the large amounts of money that a nice one cost.  and the inexpensive ones seems to be barely toys.  But this little gem is just the ticket !!  it is durable,  so far its landed on the roof, crashed on the road,  been stuck in a tree and chased by a dog.  And it still takes off and goes.  yeah for me !  I purchased the additional pack of 4 batteries, so with the one that came with it, that gives me more fighting time than i want to spend... at least for me.  its been really fun trying to learn to fly this.  maybe if i keep it up, i'll be ready for a more expensive one someday.

title: Absolutely Amazing
text: I know this story is hard to believe, but I have no reason to make it up. My daughter (off at college) gave me this copter for Fathers Day. After about a week of really fun flying and sending great videos to her, I was flying over a saltwater tidal creek in the back yard. I allowed the battery to get too low and the thing went straight in the water and to the bottom. The tide was going out and I figured I lost it. I did not have the heart to tell my daughter, so I just order another one from Amazon. Two days later at low tide I spotted it at the bottom,I retrieved it with a fishing pole,washed it out completely , let it dry over night, and I am still flying. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING.

title: Great Little Drone - Super Value
text: I bought the Syma X5C as a “learner” quadrocopter before possibly stepping up to one that costs 20 times more. I figured that if I lost or crashed it then it’s not the end of the world. Turns out that this is, by far, the most fun I’ve ever had with a remote controlled vehicle. It seems to take abuse pretty well too during the few crashes it’s been through. The best flying is in the evening when it’s starting to get dark out. The lights on the quad are very cool. It’s been too much fun just flying around to try out the camera so I can’t speak to that. I should have believed the other reviews that hinted at buying additional batteries for more flying time.

title: So much fun, even for adults

title: Excellent Drone for Pros and Noobs alike!
text:
I purchased this Drone in August of this year and its still going great in October after many hours of indoor and outdoor flights. Its a great Drone to learn to fly on and a good inexpensive Drone to purchase to determine if you are into the hobby before spending more money on a non toy grade unit. Flight time with the stock battery is 5 - 7 min depending on the conditions and if you are using the camera. The Camera quality is OK but good enough to review the flights later and make out the details of your surroundings. Purchase a set of extra batteries and boot your run time to a total of an hour (with battery swaps) for a ton of fun. Range using the stock remote is 75 - 100 meters which is plenty for this unit and the remote can be modified to extend the range even more if you are so inclined.
This is a great drone and a great value.

title: Great for a first timer
text:
I got this as a birthday gift for my wife last week and so far I love it. It was very easy to fly as soon as I took it out of the box, I only have trouble when I get it up so high that I can't tell what direction it's facing or even which direction it's moving. My only complaint is I wish the controller had labels for some of the buttons, I still have a hard time remembering what does what as far as trimming.

The attached photo is one of the better shots I've gotten so far

title: Nice for the money
text: Nice rig for the money...A little touchy on altitude and the instruction book is about useless, check the videos on you tube to learn how to use it..And when you start flying off in a given direction, it takes off fast .Also, flight time is limited and when the battery starts to die, it losses control quickly..Bottom line is take a lot of time to practice before you get fancy..I would buy it again...You need to start out with something like this as a beginner before you go to the DJI Phanthom

title: Pretty Darn Good Beginner Quad
text: I couldn't be happier with this little quad. I have flown RC planes and copters but this was my first quad.  I just wanted something inexpensive to learn on and get started.  I gave it 5 stars because for what it is, it's near perfect. Very stable and on high rates can handle quite a bit of wind. I was out flying in my front yard yesterday and it was blowing about 5 to 10 mph. In low rates I had trouble penetrating, but once in high rate mode it just tore through the wind gusts.  I've already removed the prop guards and changed the camera angle.  Planning on doing the range mod next as soon as I get the parts.  I have flown it out of range a couple times but was able to recover once it fell back into range.  This little thing is so light that I had it fall about 70 feet to the ground (grass) today.  Not a scratch. Unless you hit cement edge first from high altitude this thing seems pretty bullet proof.  The video better than I expected.  It's not super high resolution but it still looks great at 720P.  It suffers in low light but that's to be expected.  There are some really good videos on YouTube on how to upgrade the battery, transmitter antenna, receiver antenna, and even make it FPV capable.  I look forward to many hours of fun with this little starter quad.

title: HAVING PROBLEMS OFF THE BAT!
text:
UPDATE: I guess I just confirmed that the copter is defective. I really hate that customers have to wait for a replacement. First I need to send it back then I have to wait for the replacement. Well, guess what AMAZON, this gift will not make it on time for xmas.

I just got this product just 2 days ago and like what others said about it.. IT'S A GREAT STARTER DRONE FOR ANYBODY. If you an enthusiast like me, I would highly recommend this as your starter drone. FLY, CRASH, REPAIR then FLY again! Till it cant fly anymore!

PROs:
1) PRICE - The price was perfect! At the time I purchased this, it was $38.99. Spare parts are also cheap (which I highly recommend buying)!
2) Ease Of Use - Great for beginners! Easy to control.
3) Looks Great - It's not too small yet it's not really that big. Kids will sure love this as a gift. For enthusiast like me, you might say it's OK for the size.

CONs:
1) Battery Life - Horrible! I know it was already stated so many time how long the flight time would be, BUT it sure feels way TOO SHORT. They should've included an extra battery. To fix this you would need to purchase extra batteries. I would recommend something like the [[ASIN:B00XHLE5V4 BTG 3.7V 680mAh Battery 6PCS & 6 In 1 Battery Charger for Syma X5C X5SW X5C-1 X5SC X5SC-1]]. DO NOT BUY BATTERIES THINKING THEY WOULD FIT!!! PLEASE DOUBLE CHECK TO SEE IF IT WILL FIT IN YOUR X5c.
2) CAMERA IS NOT THAT GOOD - I marked this as a CON because the did declare that has an HD Cam but the resolution is HORRIBLE! So if you are buying this because your thinking of doing great home areal movie shots, you might want to re-think that thought.

NOW WHY IS IT JUST 2 STARS?? -
As soon as I got this product, I was soo excited. I charged the battery and read the manual. As soon as the batteries were done charging, I did all the things the manual said... PLUS I also did a few extras like check the blades and make sure it wasn't broken, make sure the polarity on my batteries are right and so on...No WIND! NICE! Turned on the remote, turn on the copter, paired the two... tested the throttle... All great! She flew UP then she went down! After this happend 5 times and broke one of the blade protectors (I HIGHLY RECOMMEND CONNECTING THEM), I noticed that the copter seems to be dropping it pair with the remote. I do not know is this is a defect or if I missed something. I do hope somebody can help me. If it's a defect, the 2 stars stays, otherwise rating will go up.

title: I need Help!!
text: My first ever Quad Copter/Drone and I want to start off by saying I have only taken it out for 3 flights. It goes high and far and fast and is really fun to fly. BUT IT HAS STOP WORKING PROPERLY ONLY AFTER MY 3RD FLIGHT. I had a few crash landings in the grass and had to get it out of a tree but no serious hard falls.  ONE OF MY BLADES STOPPED SPINNING AFTER MY THIRD FLIGHT. It appears to be an issue with the plastic gears. the gears in one of my blades is not turning smooth at all.. the small little gear is catching on something in the bigger plastic gear  and I even took it apart and looked closer and I don't see anything in the way no missing teeth nothing obstructing it but it still wont turn smooth at all.. Any suggestions?

text:

All the other reviews says the signal is good until 150m though.
