title: Great, mid-level drone.
text:
This is about as good a mid level beginner drone as it gets.
Pros-
-The thing could go through capital torture and survive--got one stuck in a tree for several weeks. Got it down, and it flew like normal.
-Despite "HD" being rather a joke title, the camera is still amazingly good for something sort of slapped on as an accessory, The video camera has audio, but all you generally hear is the sound of the engines.
-The color-coded LED lights aid superbly with orientation--forgot about this when I lost my first one in a park tree by accidentally rotating it and flying it away instead of toward me.
-Its control is extremely high.
-It can do flips. Another fun thing is flying it 100 feet up, then cutting the throttle and letting it drop for about 65 feet, and then throttling it back up.
Cons-
-The camera isn't necessarily "HD".
-It's a light drone, so it handles windy conditions very badly.
-Can't help but feel that the charge time could be improved. Either that or the flight time, or both.
-Instructions are a bit of a joke. Bad translation job by the Chinese manufacter.

All around, its a low price, high quality drone that's perfect for someone who likes drones but isn't a quad-nut, and wants something a bit more grandiose than a Cheerson mini quad.

title: Cell-phone tech meets affordable fun. And fitness!
text:
After playing with this for a couple days, I'm struck by three things:
- It's probably only here because of mobile phones. Without all those millions of smartphones in pockets around the world, we wouldn't have the tiny, powerful, affordable lithium-ion battery that makes this thing possible. Probably not the teeny tiny, super-cheap HD camera, either.
- That lithium-ion battery, while remarkable, is also the limiting factor as you play with this. Other reviewers noted this, but I was still surprised to experience it for myself. I can't think of another device that runs out of juice after less than ten minutes, then takes more than an hour to recharge. I get it, though - a bigger battery would be too big. The nice thing about it, though, is that the hour gives you time to think more about your flight strategy. Plus extra batteries are really cheap.
- It's kind of a health and wellness purchase, too, since -- at least if you fly as badly as I do -- you'll end up climbing quite a few trees to get the thing back down after you crash it!

title: Perfect beginner copter - great for the price.
text: Great beginner copter. Got this for my 9 year old for Christmas and he loves it. Took 4-5 battery charges for him to really get the hang of it.  We did make the mistake of flying it up very high and losing it on the first charge but luckily it came down in the woods and we found it. It's a ton of fun to fly and makes great video for the price.  We've crashed 100s of times :-) and it seems resilient. The only thing we don't like is that it's difficult to maintain control in even a light wind but we knew this going in.

title: One Star

title: Great drone for the price
text: [[VIDEOID:155532a5b099511020acd051e0b860f9]] For the price, this drone is excellent. It is stable and easy to fly. It's not particularly quick or agile, but has solid climbing performance. I have not been able to exceed the transmitter range, it appears to be over 75 yards in real-world use. The camera is OK, it's relatively muddy 720p, and the photos are useless at 2MP, but it's a lot of fun. Buy an extra battery, it takes over 100 minutes to charge the included one, and you get about 6 minutes of flight per charge. Mine came with a 4GB SD card, though it said it would include 2GB. I paid 48$ total with Prime.

title: Takes a beating.
text: This thing can take a beating. Flew it too high and lost control (user error) and it fell from as high as I can get it, straight into the street upside down. I flipped it over and it was ready to go again. Smooth and stable. Camera quality is terrible but really you don't get this for the camera. You get this for practice and for the beating this can take. Worth the value.

title: Awesome little quadrotor for the price.
text: Bought this one on a whim. I've never had a quadrotor before and thought I'd try it for $50. I must say I'm very impressed. Having only flown RC helicopters before, I had no trouble picking up this machine and flying it right away. The battery connector can be hard to get in and out because it is small, but a pair of needle nose pliers makes it easy. Also, the camera angle is tilted down pretty far, I may try to modify it. It's not unusable but I'd like it to look more "out" than "down." Overall, great buy.

title: ... the used units for around $60 I found out pretty quick that the drone market is flooded with pretty ...
text: I looked on CL and Letgo for drones and as I price matched all the used units for around $60 I found out pretty quick that the drone market is flooded with pretty good products for under $100...NEW. So I ordered this one new figuring that since the only thing I've ever flown in my life is my freak flag I would rather not mess with used stuff. This drone has been a ton of fun in the short time I've been flying it. It took a minute to get used to how it moves, but I've only had one but puckering crash so far and it looked worse than it was.(hitting the 'up' lever right before it goes down makes any crash look graceful) Oh and the camera is pretty badass with good still shots and surprisingly good video. I'll rack this one as one of the best fifty bucks I've ever spent.

title: You won't regret this purchase
text: Hands down the best beginner model quadcopter I've played with thus far.  With the few tips I got in the reviews (use the throttle trim tab to take pics/video, up for pics down to start and stop video) I was able to play videos I took from the air within an hour of opening the box.  Absolutely worth $45-$50.  I bought a second one for my Dad this Christmas I love it so much.  Good job on this one Syma!!  I recommend getting the 4 pack of 600mA batts with 4-way charger with this so you don't have to sit around waiting for the battery to charge.  The 600mA are a little tight but you just have to carefully work them between the plastic guides when inserting them into the copter.

title: Great Flyer - Sucky Controller
text: Nice Drone for the Money <$45USD. The Drone itself is a well built toy (not tool). Plastic quality and thickness are good, and texture is good. Flies well. Does everything that is advertised, including the flips. The camera works very well. Battery Life is around 20-30 minute. I fly it exclusively inside (at work) we have a huge empty floor in a high rise, it hovers well. I've bumped it off walls and windows several times, not significant damage. I gave it a 3 STARS because of the remote control unit, in a word, it is "cheesy". The drone flies well enough, but the controller is an cheap, not as nice other less pretentious other Syma controllers ( the White with Red buttons are nicer, although they look more like a game-control than an RC controller. ) On the remote, some of the buttons are fake, why bother!?.-- I would NOT recommend this to a friend because of the cheap controller. If the manufacturer decides to pair the drone with another controller, this would be a 5 Stars.

title: The Perfect Drone For Anybody!
text: Awesome Drone! I recommend it to any drone enthusiast or beginner. I bought a drone about 2 years ago, and soon after one of the propellers stopped turning keeping it from flying, so I bought this one and It works perfectly! No complaints. It's great for a beginner, or a drone expert. the features it has are the following, 360 eversion, picture AND video by the press of a button on the controller, Great quality pictures, High/Low speed mode, and an over 250 foot range. If you want to fly it longer though buy the extra batteries for it. title: Broken after 30 minutes of flying time
text: [[VIDEOID:769e5d17e4ce99806d22a21d8b4688a8]] We received this fascinating device two days ago. I practiced flying it, taught my daughter to fly it the next day. It is really quite a great little quadcopter. I bought four extra batteries. It has a camera that actually works to take snaps or video. Unfortunately one of the motors is broken already and it is only Friday. I suspect it must have been defective. The blade won't turn and it clunks when you rotate the blade. title: Definitely get this one

title: It was pretty fun. Easy to use once you get the ...

It pretty much just takes off away from you at that point. I lost mine in a tree about 80ft up 2 weeks after I got it. Flew it 20 times or so. My biggest frustration was that the instructions didn't tell you much of how to use it. I had to watch a bunch of youtube videos to find out "hidden" features, like the ability to rotate the copter sideways without banking. Overall, pretty fun.

title: Very good product; very good customer service.
text:
I bought one of these quads and it flew very well for three days. On the third day, one of the motors stopped working and I was very disappointed, having been only a little time after i bought this product. I contacted Amazon, and as usual, they were extremely nice. They gave me a replacement quad.

It's been working very well and it's very good for a sub-fifty dollar quad. If you want to have good maneuverability and agility, I recommend removing the camera and the landing props.(It's very easy, just remove a couple screws and pop it out)

This quad also has aerial footage. It's not great, but again, what can you expect from a 40 dollar quadcopter. The camera is 2 mp and can shoot video and take pictures at 1080x720 or 720p.(Lowest quality to pass as HD)

Overall, this is a very good quad. Easy to become a good flying quad and easy to become a quad to shoot some videos and pictures to show your friends/family. I definitely recommend this product for the price it is.

(I have a picture attached)

title: Not only do I love it, but my dog cant get enough of ...
text:
I have been flying the Syma X5C for almost 6 months now. Not only do I love it, but my dog cant get enough of it. On average, I fly it 12 times a week, about 8-10 minutes each flight. I fly in my backyard, with my dog chasing after the quadcopter. She knocks it out of the air, has bitten it a couple times, as well as ran over it, yet it still performs like new. I have crashed it into my fence, house, ground dozens of times, yet it still isnt broken. At this point, I am trying to break it so that I can buy a new one, but I still havent been able to do that.

Pros:
-Great starter quadcopter. Its light enough, fast enough, agile enough to learn with, as well as extremely durable.
-Different flight modes, one to learn the basics with, the other to chase after your dogs with.
-Durable...too durable
-Flight time and charge time
-Remote has smooth controls, comfortable for average hands (might be larger for kids)

Cons:
-Too Durable
-The camera is a waste, i dont even know why they include it.
-I took off all the protective stuff, added to much weight. Dont really need it anyways. (not sure if this is a pro or con...)

Overall, I cant wait to break it, so I can get another.

title: Two Stars

title: Amazing drone for the price
text:
This isn't the best drone money can buy in the market. I you are expecting HD video (let alone 4K) you are looking at the wrong price point. However if you, like me, are looking for a good drone to practice flying and know if its worth dishing out $500+ for a hobby read on.

This is a basic starting drone with a good controller. Practicing with this can teach you how to fly a drone without all the extra features the higher end have to offer. Its like learning to drive a manual before driving an automatic. Its difficult but if you can master this all the other drones will feel a breeze to fly.

That doesn't mean it does not have some hidden goodies.

Pros:
1. Has a built in gyro which keeps it stable in the air
2. Has a camera that takes photos and videos.
3. Has two speeds that can be switched with a press of a button.
4. You can fine tune it left/right and front/back.
5. The LEDs that differentiate from front to back are bright enough to be visible at night.
6. Comes with extra set of propellers, micro sd card reader, micro sd card, battery charger, propeller guards and a screw driver to put them on.
7. Spare parts and spare batteries are cheap.
8. You can do tricks like somersault just for fun.
9. It is under 250g so you do not have to register it.

So as you can see this has a lot going for it. Now for some Cons.

1. It is very light so even in moderate winds its not stable.
2. The camera is fixed and not on a Gimbal that can be controlled. (But hey how much can you get for $50)
3. The build feels very cheap and plasticy.

All in all i would highly recommend it to anyone in the market to buy their first drone and perfect their flying skills.

text: fantastic, and thrilled that there are extra blades "just in case" - highly recommend you buy extra batteries, because a 7 minute flight isn't much - but this is a great intro to quad copters, and it's a robust and nifty little toy that's easy to fly and takes a micro SD card for the camera, Definitely pleased, would definitely buy again.

title: Great bang for buck, great starter drone.
text:
Great fun starter drone. It is harder to fly than the more expensive drones because it lacks altitude hold capability, but if you can fly this, you should have no problem with a Phantom, a Mavic or any other high level camera drone. Also very robust. The second time I flew, I dropped it from about 50 ft up onto concrete and it wasn't damaged at all. The flips are also very fun and can make you look like a pro pilot.
The only downside is the camera. Photo quality is mediocre and since there is no gimbal or other stabilization method, the videos are shaky. However, for the price of the drone, this is to be expected. I fly mine without the camera because taking it off seems to add 2-3 minutes to the flight time.
Bottom Line: I would highly recommend this product to anyone looking to use it as a kids toy or as a training drone. Don't expect to take amazing pictures or footage, but for under $50, this drone is tough to beat.
***Extra batteries are a must have unless you want to fly for 5 mins and wait 2 hours to fly again***

title: more expensive drone with nice capabilities. I purchased it from amazon
text: I had this product for appx. 2 weeks, and I flew it everyday.  This is THE STARTER DRONE you WANT to purchase for before if you are wanting to buy a legit, more expensive drone with nice capabilities.  I purchased it from amazon.com, and it got here within a few days.  It's ready to fly right out of the package and takes minimal instruction manual reading.  Most of us in the drone hobby see these types of drones to be the starter drones, a drone you can really hone your flying skills which is essential; you don't want to crash a $700-$1400 drone because you didn't know how the joysticks on your remote control steered the actual quadcopter.  This thing is SOLID!  It's motors are power compared to what you expect, and the camera is much better than the SYMA X5SW FPV model (<----------this model is NOT worth it).  This camera is super decent compared to its price.  This quadcopter's controls are super responsive.  Just be watchful of your distance of your X5C from you and your controller, because you will lose control if you do.  I got mine stuck about 40 feet up in  a tree in my front yard, but was able to get it down by throwing a football at it!  It feel flat on the ground and was effected by none of it.  It flew fine after I got it down.  Its battery gives u about what you should expect:  around 10 minutes of flight time.  PERFECT for a 1st time drone user or a child.  Peace!

title: Awesome drone, even in the snow!
text:
[[VIDEOID:bcddf3e11a5e884a4489f70b977b8427]] This is my first quadracopter, and my goal in purchasing it was to learn how they fly, become comfortable with the controls and skilled in maneuvering. As this is not an FPV drone, it is more challenging right off the bat, which is good as my next quadracopter will feature FPV, and cost significantly more, I want to make sure I have no doubts safely flying it back home should the FPV / GPS / Return Home functions fail for whatever reason as a redundancy safety measure. Enough about me.

The drone comes with everything you need to get it going. However, I highly recommend you purchase some additional batteries and a multi-port charger, to quickly swap the dead cells out and keep flying. The range is good. The responsiveness is good. The stunts (backflip, frontflip, left and right barrel roll) are fun. The video is pretty decent, but does not do well in low light.

You can't beat it for the price. If you're looking to get into flying quadracopters, I highly recommend this awesome unit. The only thing you'll be dissatisfied with is your initial inability to fly it! But after a few hours, you'll really get the hang of it and start seeing the "big picture" in how it's controls and flight maneuvers can be improved through practice.

Last important part - this thing takes a beating. I'm pretty gentle, but some friends of mine flew it and blasted it against walls, trees, floors.. you name it. She still powered up and flew every time. Great first drone. Highly recommend!

The video I took while I was snowboarding. Really tough to look up the whole time, control the unit and keep it pointed at my friend, while not catching an edge, lol.

title: This thing is a ton of fun to fly
text:
This thing is a ton of fun to fly.

It took me 10 or 15 minutes to get the hang of flying. It's simple enough and this is a good copter to learn on. There are two levels of sensitivity, one that lends easy flying, and the other is better for aerial stunts. Even in low the controls are amazingly precise.

Battery life is short but isn't a huge hindrance when you have a few of them. It only takes a second to swap batteries, and you're good to go for another 10 minutes. Supposedly with modifications a 15 minute run time is attainable.

The manual is poorly translated, but adequate. The camera is pretty much what you'd expect for a 50 dollar quad-copter. Videos are surprisingly clear, but terrible in low light. Still shots are pretty lackluster. It's still neat to see though.

There are a ton of DIY mods to these out there. You can add FPV, extend the remote range, swap the motors/batteries, and swap cameras.

It's amazingly durable, even with the blade guards removed. I've crashed it many times with no visible damage, and only one tweaked blade. Replacement parts are not hard to get if you do need them, you can basically rebuild the whole copter with the crash kit that's available for purchase.

title: Loved It, But It Didn't Love Me
text:
Actually, I loved it. And then it stopped working (one of the propellers quit turning). But I liked it so much, I bought two more, thinking that I must have done something wrong. I went back to loving it... until the propeller quit turning on another one. I have had no major crashes, didn't get it wet, didn't hang it up in anything, it just was working, and then it wasn't. In both cases, I landed it after a smooth run and it simply wouldn't rotate again. I went through two in less than three weeks.

I love the idea of it but can't spend $50 every two weeks on the idea, so after this one fails, I'll likely pick another brand and roll the dice that it will be more successful. Any suggestions?

Sad, too, because I really enjoyed it. I did contact Syma's customer service, I'll let you know if they respond.

Also video never worked on the replacement unit.  It flies nicely when it works, but the reliability on this quad is terrible.

title: Awesome beginner drone!
text: I decided to rate it as 5 stars because it is exactly what the description says it is. The camera quality is not the best but everything works great. I do recommend buying extra batteries because it only lasts about 7 mins and you have to wait a while for the battery to recharge again. It also says it comes with a 2GB Micro SD card but mine actually came with a 4GB.

title: Five Stars

title: Fun and affordable
text:
Neat quad here. I think I fly it more than my son right now. You won't need to register it as it's so light. The camera in it works better than I thought it would and flies quite nice. Small breezes are enough to make it drift a bit but not unbearable. If the wind is anything more, I wouldn't take it out.

For the price it's great for beginners.

title: Awesome!
text:
Honestly I was playing Uncharted 4 when I realized the battery was fully charged. You know this because the red light on the USB plug stops glowing res when it is done. It was time to put everything back inside, put on the propeller guards, read the manual, and begin my decent down the wonderful world of flying small crafts as a past time.

Calibration: Place remote and drone on level surface. Turn on remote and drone switches from off to on position. Push left stick all the way up and all the way down, keep in down position. Turn right stick all the way down. Turn both sticks to the right until the lights rapidly flash and go back to flight ready constant on mode. Be GENTLE and FEATHER the throttle, it is paramount to flight control.

I was off. I'll be blunt. Thing this is friggin EPIC. I am 27 I love newest gadgets PS4 etc and this thing is a beast to fly! I can't wait for the battery to recharge and receive my 6 additional batteries : ) I haven't even picked up Uncharted 4 back up and I'm only on chapter 2 lol. I just want to practice flying this damn thing again! Oober stoked.

Very well put together, great value for beginners to get into flying drones. Ordered 6 upgraded batteries and spare parts just in case. You will not be disappointed!

title: Great entertainment from Syma X5c
text:
Amazon came through with this quad. As an older sixty something, I wanted to try a quad. After reading several reviews I decided on the Syma x5c. The product was delivered promptly in perfect condition. I would have given the x5c a five star but a motor went out after about ten flights.
I replaced the motors with (Mudder 4 Piece Anti-clockwise and Clockwise Motor with Brass Gear for Syma X5 X5C: replaced all four). Now I have a super quad. I have flown in 8mph winds and the little quad meets the challenge. I loved it so much I decided to purchase a second. So I decided on the x5sc because it has a headless mode. BIG MISTAKE... The x5sc is extremely difficult to control and will not fly in any wind. The x5cs tries to level out when flying up wind letting the wind carry it off uncontrollably. My recommendations for the Syma x5 line of quads is...Not all are created equally...these products are probably best suited for flying outdoors in very open spaces. The included camera is adequate, it requires a lot of light for the best video and always remember to turn of the camera from the remote before turning off power at the quad. If you don't the files become corrupt and sometimes cannot be recovered. I will probably buy another x5c just for a spare. Syma seems to have a very good parts network, which is important for active users. Safe Flying!

title: Over 3 weeks in a tree and fine!
text: So this drone is amazing for the money ! Got this as a Christmas gift and it was instantly loved. I got it stuck in a tree it snowed overnight and when I got it out it worked perfect. If that wasn’t enough to keep my flying safe I of course tested my luck . I then got it stuck in a tree wildcard weekend about month ago at a local park.... I tried with a few things to get it down ; football , baseball , grappling hook... and was unsuccessful for a few weeks. That being said we live in NJ we had at least three snowstorms and a few serious rain storms. On the morning of the Super Bowl  I embarrassingly climbed this tree and was able to shake the branch to free it. After all this the drone works perfectly fine! 2 reccomendations I would make. First buy extra batteries because it is not a large drone you only get about 10 minutes fly time. Second do not install the blade guards ... my drone only got stuck because of the blade guards . Also, they are only good to keep the blade from hitting people indoors they are not really a protection measure for the blades. Overall great drone highly recommended and thinking of getting a second.

title: Good quad but very short range
text:
I loved the Syma X5C for the most part... when it was indoors. Flew well in short range, had good control, and the camera worked well. Unfortunately, within about 10 seconds of being outside, I took it up to around 30 feet. At about 30 feet it dropped connection, continued going higher and away until, what I presume, it cut power and stuck itself with branches stuck up around 50 feet in a tree. Unrecoverable due to its positioning, it was gone after just a few uses.

I want to give it a higher rating and attribute it to me just having bad luck, but because of its unexpectedly short range (only ~10 meters is far below expected) causing me to be out $40, I can't help but take it down to 2 stars as I assume I got a defective antennae like others have mentioned. Basically - make sure that you're very aware that it may have short range, test it at a very low altitude first and get comfortable with its max range, and only use it far, far from things that will eat it up, like trees, unless you have the means to recover it from them.

title: A ton of fun for cheap!

Charging time is about an hour from empty to fully charged and then pop the battery in and your off! We also own a Parrot 2.0 and I find the syma quadcopter more fun to fly. There is a slight learning curve but once you get the hang of flying you'll be doing flyby's at full speed. This guy is tough and can take a beating. It is a great first quad copter and will get you addicted to the hobby!

title: Nearly a month later and this thing is awesome. Fun
text:
Bought this on Cyber Monday for 40% off and wasn't expecting much. Nearly a month later and this thing is awesome. Fun, fast and pretty darn indestructible. Highly recommend taking off the propeller guards as it's much faster and more responsive. Camera is pretty awful, but who cares when you're having this much fun. Still useful for taking pics and "dronies," even short videos of your neighborhood at heights you'd never achieve without a remote device...

I've had RC toys for decades and this one delivers the best experience especially for the cost (even at full price). Buy extra batteries as they last less than 10 minutes each. PRACTICE in a big open area like a park or baseball field. Stay away from trees as branches love this thing. Also, the wind can easily wreak havoc on it, especially at high altitudes. When the lights blink and it's really far away it means the signal is lost which you should run to it as the wind can take it higher and farther from you. This happened to me TWICE as I went super high on my street and it blew it a block over. Landed on concrete and was fine both times (after calibrating it). Discovered my local parks and that's a better area to learn. Patience is the key. Learn restraint and control and this quad-copter will pay you back in fun! (Seriously, I've dreamt about flying it...)

Check out YOUTUBE for helpful tips and tricks. I plan on upgrading soon, but I love this thing.

text: This is the most fun! We bought it for our 6 year old son for Christmas and it's fun for the whole family. First run, the quad protectors got hung up on a tree for 2 days but we finally got it out and it lived through 2 solid days of down pouring rain/Missouri flood and it still worked like a charm! It's easy to fly inside and out and my 6 year old can maneuver it like a pro. It takes a beating real well and still works time after time. The landing pad snapped with a fall and some electric tape held it together just fine. I would recommend buying more batteries and a multiple outlet battery charger....it's so fun that you don't want to limit your time just because of the battery running out of juice! It's super easy to change the battery. We're still learning how to take pics and video and have gotten a few decent ones so far. We did lose the SD card with a crash, I guess it must have fallen out so I'd recommend gently taping it in there securely if you're going to use that option. Easily ordered another card and it works fine. I'm more than pleased with this product and would definitely recommend it to anyone, beginners and all! It has provided our family with tons of fun, kids and adults alike. Go buy one!

title: This product has really good reviews and was the top pick on Amazon
text: We bought this for our 7 y/o son for Christmas. He has been wanting a drone forever. This product has really good reviews and was the top pick on Amazon. We even purchased the padded briefcase and extra batteries since they seem to only last for about 7-10 minutes. He was so happy when he opened it. Naturally, we all took turns trying to get it off the ground and it was pretty easy to get a hang of. The first battery died after about 7 minutes, which we expected. So we switched the battery and after about 1 minute it just stopped working. We tried for awhile but could not get it to work. After further investigation, we found that a lot of people said the motors were melting. You can imagine my sons disappointment that is beloved new drone was broken after only 10 minutes. We had to go through the hassle of returning and will have to buy a new one now. I tried contacting the company directly but it is based out of China and has no US numbers. No surprise there. Since we already have the case and extra batteries we are going to repurchase and hope ours was just a defect. But I don't recommend this product by means.

title: Syma X5C is truly amazing!
text:
This quadcopter is an excellent one for what it's worth. I mean $43 for something as good as this?! It's almost as if it should be more expensive! I got mine yesterday and have tested everything out. Works awesome! If you read up on the Syma X5C, you will notice that there are actually 2 versions of it. With this seller, you get the upgraded version 2 (which is much better than the first version). The camera is decent, especially for how cheap you pay for this quadcopter. It can get blown around by the wind quite a bit outdoors, but it definitely can fight the wind excellently. Don't fly this quadcopter outside in over 15 mph winds, you might never see it again...

Overall, this quadcopter is very good and performs very well indoors and outdoors. I would definitely reccommend the Syma X5C to anyone (beginners or experts, you name it). It came in 4 days, a day earlier than expected, with no damages to anything. Amazing quadcopter and a great one to add to a collection!

title: Great quadcopter!  Great for beginners.
text:
I had never operated a quadcopter before, and I had no problem learning fast. Very easy to control! I've only had a couple minor crashes, but nothing has broken besides the red led light cover falling off. It appears durable.
I wouldn't advise flying this thing in wind. It's very light and gets pulled away easy. I've got it stuck in two trees due to the wind.
The controls are very responsive. It has a high and low mode. It's easy to control close to the ground in low. I put it in high and the thing moves very fast while higher up.
The camera isn't the best, but it's easy to see everything going on when you play it back. It's better than what I expected for as cheap as this thing is.
Is definitely recommended this product for anyone looking to buy. My kids and I have enjoyed it immensely so far!

title: Grotty camera quality but a fantastic drone to learn on.
text:
[[VIDEOID:a60434ebab5637b88b2c846068399eef]] (Please note that the video that I've uploaded along with this review has been through the youtube stabilisation filter _and_ I also "chopped out" most of the "I'm looking at the ground while I move position or get tilted to keep position" bits.)

I'm very sceptical on the quality of cheap products and this was one of the ones I was worried about. I only ordered it to use up gift vouchers.
After many months of ownership I've finally decided to write this review. If you are interested in the camera - see near the end of this review.
I'm impressed with the drone and just how robust it is. I've crashed it many times, flung it at the ground by mistake on full throttle and hit walls.
A few weeks ago I removed the "blade guards", stand and camera to reduce the weight of the drone and potentially improve flight time.

I've crashed it even more since - now have a bent blade and rotating blade mount pillar.
Though all of that the drone _still_ continues to fly and still gives the specified flight time.

The most recent flight I timed at 8 minutes and 30 seconds outdoors mainly heavy use with a bit of playing about, landing it etc..

Given how difficult the drone was to control when I first got it (due to my inexperience) I would STRONGLY suggest buying this to learn on and have fun with. If you crash and break it - who cares, it didn't really cost much.
The first few flights: First I lost the drone in a field and had to find it. Then I lost the drone over a building and, luckily, could get access and regain it from their sports pitch.
Even more recently with my experience and pretty good control of the drone I've managed to fly it too high several times and get it taken by the wind and been very, very close to losing it. I've only managed to recover it mainly by luck and a lot of running towards it so it didn't lose reception.

Camera:
The camera may as well not exist. I've taken it off and don't really intend to reattach it unless a friend would like a bad resolution video of their house from above.
The main problem is the drone isn't stable enough to produce an enjoyable video, you can hardly leave your subject in the shot long enough before you have to move the drone and the video then tilts or moves the subject out of view. Secondly the resolution of the camera and the cheap sensor just produces an awful "webcam from the year 2000" style picture.
Running the video through the YouTube automatic stabilisation filter makes the video slightly more viewable but certainly not something you could use to promote your business, sports pitch or building.

It's been a great adventure and now I'm itching to upgrade or "graduate" to a far more expensive drone with a stabilised and higher quality camera now I know how to control this low cost one. [ Phantom 4 anyone ;)? ]

Summary: Grotty camera quality but a fantastic drone to learn on.

title: Easy to control
text: Easy to control.  Fun to fly.  Very durable.  Taking videos and photos is a blast once you figure out how to work the camera.  Use the Up/Down trim on the left side.  Push the trim up to take a still shot photo.  Push the trim down once to start filming.  You'll see a red light on the bottom of the drone.  Push it the trim down a second time to stop the film. You'll see a green light on the bottom of the drone.  Green means ready, red means filming.  I get at least five full minutes out of a battery charge.

title: This copter is excellent for the money
text:
This copter is excellent for the money! This is a very good beginner's mid-size copter and it is awesome that it comes with an HD camera. It is really convenient that an SD card is included, and a microSD-to-USB adapter as well. Very fun to fly and take amazing videos!

Pros:
-Excellent Quadcopter for the money
-Extremely light, including the battery
-Comes with a decent-quality camera which also takes video
-Also comes with a 4GB card and microSD-to-USB adapter
-Stable flying; very little drift
-Easy and quick maneuvering with the controller

Cons: Nothing here is too big of a deal.
-Propeller noise dominates camera audio, so you won't hear anything besides that.
-Battery capacity is small, although it is very light and you still get a comparatively good amount of flight time out of it
-Light weight also makes it susceptible to wind gusts at high altitudes
-USB battery charger, when connected to the battery only, will turn on its "charging light," drawing a small amount of current from the battery over time. This is no big deal unless you are charging your battery and turn your PC off at night, then come back to see that the battery has been powering the red LED on the charger for 8 hours.

title: Very stable and tough as nails!
text:
This helicopter all around is, in my opinion the best bang for the buck in the below $100 price range. Believe me, I spent two weeks searching the internet for the best (and cheapest) option.

-Build quality: First of all, this thing is light and made out of flimsy plastic. Do not let this discourage you! I accidentally got this helicopter stuck in a tree and it sat up there for one and a half days through the hot Florida sun, light rain as well as intense humidity. When it finally fell down it worked perfectly! As cheap as this thing may feel it can really take a beating (did I mention it can take 100 foot falls onto grass fields).

-How easy does it fly?: This helicopter is extremely stable and anyone should be able to hover this within a few trys. After a few days anyone should be able to make basic maneuvers with this machine. I would recommend that this helicopter is good for anyone 12+.

-Is it a toy?: Technically yes. This device is not anywhere near professional grade. DON'T buy this if you want to do professional arial footage. This device is not able to lift very good cameras (like a GoPro for example). Even though it is classified as a "toy" I believe this helicopter is a step above a simple children's toy.

-Who should buy it?: Like I said above, I recommend that this is good for anyone 12+. But anyone that is thinking about buying a more expensive helicopter some day should defiantly start out with this one to get the feel of flying a quad-copter. Also for someone on a budget that can't afford or does not want to spend hundreds of dollars on a helicopter should defiantly consider this.

-How high/far can it go?: This device does not have a limit to how high or far it can go (besides the remote control range).
I would say that the remote control range is about 70-80 meters, otherwise there is not set limit of how far/high it can be flown. If you want to fly high do it on a not so windy day because it gets windy high up and it can push this helicopter around a little bit.

-How long does it fly?: This device can fly for an average of 7 mins without using the camera. With the camera you only get 3-4 mins. Also if you are carrying something with it (like another lightweight camera for example) the added weight will reduce that flight time. If you need longer flight time you can buy bigger batteries right here on amazon that can improve the flight time.

-Is the camera good?: First off it is not HD they say it is but it's not (remember this is only a $50 helicopter). It is not professional by any means but you can still get pretty decent shots from in the air (the camera works better in the day time with light).

***IMPORTANT*** To make sure you get the Syma X5C-1 model order from battery superstore I ordered mine from there. Even if it comes in the wrong box it is the right one.

IF YOU CAN ANY MORE QUESTIONS ABOUT THIS DEVICE LEAVE A COMMENT TO THIS REVIEW AND I WILL ANSWER THEM AS SOON AS POSSIBLE!!!

title: Great product for the price

The battery only lasts about 7-10 mins however they recharge fairly quickly and if you buy the multiple battery pack and charger you can keep switching out batteries for potentially endless flying. The lightweight frame is pretty durable. It has received a few scratches and dents from when I first started flying. The controls are fairly easy to use and you can feel comfortable in the air after a solid 30 mins of practice. The camera could be a little better but for the price you couldn't find a better deal.

title: Learning curve — But worth it
text:
PROS: Extremely easy to assemble. Instructions are as clear as possible, considering the difficulty of operating a drone. Yes, there is a learning curve, but that is to be expected with machinery such as this. After some time, no problems using.

CONS: Both the external and internal packaging were a bit damaged, though the item itself is intact. The analogs on the controller are a little difficult to maneuver, as they are straight rectangles with no padding. At the same time, it should be noted that it's necessary to have precision on those controls, which other analog sticks might take away from.

title: This is a great drone to fly around
text:
This is a great drone to fly around. The price is very reasonable as well. It has a pretty great speed and a good distance it can travel from the transmitter. The camera on it is not very good, but that was not the reason I bought it (it can easily be removed for convenience). Another great thing about this drone are the many replacement parts that are available for it. This is the first drone I ever bought, and I had very limited drone flying experience. I would recommend this to beginners, as well as more experienced flyers.

If you do purchase this drone, I would consider ordering a deluxe replacement part kit as well. I've had this drone for about 2 weeks, and I have already needed to replace the propeller guards (I bumped into a lot of things while I was learning how to fly it!) but those are fairly cheap to replace. Also, having extra batteries is nice so you don't have to wait 1.5 hours for one to charge for a 10 minute flight.

title: In a nutshell, fun!
text:
This quadcopter got listed on an aggregating site I use to look at daily deals around the internet, so when I saw the reviews coupled w/ the features coupled w/ the price, I thought 'why not'?
I had no experience w/ flying one of these and yet 5 minutes out of the box we were off and running. Admittedly, the flying takes some finesse and there is a learning curve (mine has consisted of crashing. A lot.) but it won't take you long to feel like you're ready to go shopping for a silk scarf, goggles and leather jacket so you can Top Gun your way across your yard. I got a little too exuberant and flew it pretty hard into a tree. Recovering it resulted in breaking one of the motors, so now it's a 'tri'copter. :( The Syma is a great product and was not the problem, it was my lack of foresight to not fly it in the middle of a grove of trees. How dumb is that, anyway?!

Seriously though, I am impressed the Syma offers this level of product at this price point. And it's fun and easy to start flying; so much so that I've already ordered a replacement.

text: This thing is worth every penny of the 32 dollars I paid for it. First off let me say I was skeptical when it showed up. Thing is as light as a feather. I'm new to the world of quadcopters. Being the first one I've bought. Good thing too, because I suck at flying them apparently.  Took it out in the yard, and flew it around, learning controls. Decided to see how high it would go.... well it went way up there, then coming down, got blown over an old oak tree that's tall as a damn cell phone tower. Got stuck. It stayed up in that tree for 4 days. In that time it poured rain,and took some bb gun fire, then a huge wind storm of 60mph winds came, and blew it clean out the top of that damn tree. I found it the next morning in a thorn bush patch. Unscathed.  I put battery in rice, let it dry out. Charged battery, and thing still works as good as when it arrived. I swear this thing is so badass, it must have been forged in the anus of Lucifer himself.  I would definitely recommend for a 1st quad-copter purchase.

title: Best Budget Quadcopter
text:
I bought the Syma X5C as my first quadcopter, both to learn how to fly and to lift payloads. I figured the price was right, and the X5C has great reviews. After flying the X5C I can understand why.
First of all the quadcopter maneuvers very well. It is easy to get it to hover and is very stable. The X5C has two control modes: Low and High. The quad is easier to control in Low mode, but it flies faster and is more responsive in High mode. The X5C can fly very fast in High mode, and once I mastered the controls, it was a blast to zip around trees and obstacles at high speed in High mode. As per standard issue with these budget quadcopters, the X5C comes with an automatic 360 degree flip function. This maneuver actually does have a practical use, as it causes the drone to lose altitude while flipping; so if the carries the drone too high, performing several flips will bring the drone safely down to a low altitude. The drone handles wind surprisingly well, you can actually hear the motors compensating for the wind while the drone is hovering.
The X5C comes with a decent on-board camera, with the same approximate camera quality as a cell phone from the early 2000s. This camera does NOT transmit video down to the controller (no FPV), however if you are looking for that functionality, an upgrade kit can be found on Amazon (just search for 'Syma X5C spare FPV' and you'll find it). The camera is triggered by the controller, and it records to an onboard MicroSD card, which is included with the drone. After the flight, simply plug the card into the reader (included) and plug that into your computer, and you can see your video/pictures. The quality isn't really too good, especially in low light conditions, but is decent enough for most applications (just DON'T buy this drone for use as a professional aerial photography setup!) Both the quadcopter and the onboard camera are powered by a lithium battery which is charged by a USB charger (included), which provides about 6 minutes of flight time (less if you fly your drone more aggressively).
Overall this is a fantastic drone, with tons of potential. There are plenty of modifications that can be made at home to customize the X5C (just search 'Syma X5C hacks' on YouTube), and the X5C can lift a small payload if the camera is removed. I ended up buying a few as gifts, and I spraypainted mine matte black. My only gripe is the use of brushed motors with a gearbox (as opposed to superior brushless motors) but for the price it is completely understandable.

title: Lots of fun but a bigger battery would make it better
text:
Lots of fun. It is a little hard to control at first but it gets easier the more you fly it. It is super light weight, so careful flying it in any sort of wind as it can easily get caught up in the wind and blow away. It is a great starter drone because of the price.

The biggest negative is that the battery life is really weak. If they put a bigger battery in this I think it would make it fly better because of a little extra weight and last a lot longer. They could easily double or triple the battery size and still have it be pretty inexpensive.

title: DON’T GET THIS DRONE! GET SOMETHING ELSE!
text: Get something else. For an extra 20$, you could have a much better drone with 2x speed, better footage, and much larger range and flight time. It seems like the perfect drone for your 5 year old neice, but it isn’t. It has 4 minutes of flight time for crying out loud. And there isn’t a drone that a 5 year old could fly safely. So don’t get him one.

title: Best price for a starter quad-copter.
text:
Great starter quad, gyro stabilized and easy to fly, performance outdoors in the wind is impressive given the light weight. If you want a starter quad, this is the one to get.

pros: excellent flight controls, low and high settings for indoor precision or outdoor agility, easy to manage engine guards and camera. there is a ripe aftermarket for modding this quad and it's extremely easy to take a part using the single, included screwdriver.

cons: lots of vibration makes pictures turn out pretty poor but video quality is surprisingly awesome given the total cost of the quad. vibration reducing gel and/or balancing the rotors (some legwork by the customer) would go a long way to improve video and photo quality for this quad.

text: This drone is amazing! At first when I tried the camera it was pretty bad, but when I took it outside it is actually pretty good. The drone is easy to control and can go super high. It is SOOOO durable, I was doing a cool cinematic shot when I accidently flew it too high so I couldn't see which way was forward. I then flew it about 600 feet high and like 500 feet or so away and it dropped. I ran down a couple streets to try and find it and I found it lying face down and it was still on! I recorded this whole thing but the video was lost! My drone didn't even get a scratch on it and works perfect! Definitely is a good drone! If you want to fly super high or get good pictures I recommend flying it at a park or getting a drone with a live camera so you can get yourself out of a situation where you can tell what way the drone is facing!

I now have to sneak and fly it while they are in school. I'm buying a few more for my neice and nephew. I couldn't ask for a better purchase for the price..

title: it is a very good starter drone

I do not like that I do not know if I am recording, it would be nice to see that on the remote display.  I would recommend this drone for a starter, I can get up to approx. 30 feet and still have control, I do not know about the flips, it can also zip around pretty quickly, which makes it more fun.  Battery life is about what I expected 15-18 minutes flight not including crash time and videoing.

title: Good drone if you get the right one
text:
Before I write this review, it is important to understand that there are at least two packagings of the X5C-1. Among other things, the boxing itself is different. Also, one packaging (I will call it version 1) has a problem with the drone running out of battery, in that the lights blink just as the batteries run out: no time to land. And, the micro SD Card is 2GB. The other packaging (I will call it version 2), corrects the battery issue, by giving at least 30 seconds to a minute (I did not measure it) of blinking before the rotors stop, and it comes with a 4GB card. With that said, here is my story.

First, I love this thing. I am retired, and find I need a brand new set of skills to fly it. It does not have all the bells and whistles of more expensive drones that help you fly with a lot less skill. But this unit is what a beginner should start with, so they know exactly how to fly the drone on their own.

So I purchased my first unit (it turned out to be version 1). After a week of flying, one of the rotors stopped spinning, so I returned it to Amazon, and purchased another. The next unit to arrive was version 2. I made the mistake of taking my eyes off the drone for a few seconds; I have no idea where it went and it is lost until the fall when I might find it in a tree. So I ordered my third unit. What came was version 1 but there was no SD card at all, the unit would light up, but the rotors would not turn. I noticed during unpacking that the drone was secured by only one strap not two. So I returned it for my forth drone, and again I received version 1, and again no SD card, but this time the second strap was in the box, and apparently cut by someone. I surmise that someone had to cut the tie, in order to take the SD card out of the camera. Needless to say, this unit has been returned.

So I have given up on Amazon, and purchased the drone (hopefully I will receive version 2) off of eBay. The ad on eBay explicitly talks about a 4k card, so I have a good feeling I will receive version 2.

Additionally, extra batteries are a must and something to keep them in, just in case they catch on fire.

title: Awesome Quad!!
text:
This quadcopter is amazing, especially for the price. I would expect this quad to be more expensive for how awesome it is. The camera is very nice and has sound too. You pretty much just hear the props wizzing but it's still cool.

I bought extended life batteries and burnt up a motor. (Note: You should let the motors cool a bit in between flights especially if you are using extended life batteries) Luckily for me I bought spare parts and soldered in a new motor. I also fried the circuit board by installing a battery in backwards (My fault for modifying the plug) but I bought a new circuit board for about $12 and now it's running great! Since this copter has so many spare parts available you can always fix it and get it back up and running if you have a soldering gun and ability to work with small parts.

In high agility mode it cuts through the wind very impressively and handles it very well.

title: Great Fun on a Calm Day
text:
This quad is a blast! My first quad, the Syma X5C (mine came in the X5C box but it is the X5C-1) has never let me down. I liked it so much that I talked my son, my brother, and my nephew into buying their own so I wouldn't have to share mine so much. I bought a four-pack of batteries with the X5C as there is just no way that the single battery included with the quad is enough.

I haven't had a single problem with my quad. We did have to change out a motor in my brother's quad, but his son was thinking ahead and bought a four-pack of motors (@ $10-$15), so there was very little down time. I wouldn't rate down on my purchase for his problem, but since I mentioned it, it would also be fair to add that my brother's first trick mastered was debarking all the live trees in his yard with the quad. :-)

For my instruction, I watched a couple howto videos on YouTube and stayed pretty close (inside a hundred feet) until I got over--for the most part--the disorientation that is natural to a first-time flyer. My nephew just charged! Charged the battery and charged on to heights I wouldn't think an experience flyer would try. My nephew has also had to climb most of the debarked trees in my brother's yard to get his quad back also. But, he was laughing and having fun the whole time, and still has a perfectly functioning quad as I write this.

Not only would I recommend this purchase but already have recommended several times to family and friends. ALL of the parts for this quad are available here on Amazon and for pretty decent price, just in case something breaks. The X5C comes with a spare set of props, but you will definitely want to buy more batteries. I am buying even more batteries and some spare motors because I can't stand the thought of sitting on the bench after an hour or so while the batteries charge. IMHO, this would be an outstanding dad and son AND daughter buy...for both the flying fun and even the repair sessions.

title: Perfect for starter drone enthusiasts!!!!
text:
Received this for a Christmas present. The learning curve is very small. Start off slow & easy (slow is smooth & smooth is fast) for the first three-five flights.

If you can fly this drone & not lose it (read reviews & everyone thinks they can fly this to the moon in five minutes-- lol) then the next flights are fantastic!

Once you can actually fly this machine it's great!!! Buy extra batteries (6 pack + charger from Amazon for $21) that way you'll be able to clock hours of flight time.

All this to say... For $60 it's the best drone available for great times & decent video quality!!!

Enjoy!

title: Stuck in tree for 5 weeks. SURVIVED!
text: When I first flew the drone I had trouble flying it but after a couple days it was as easy as tying shoe laces. On my third day of flying the drone (still not an expert) the drone got away from me and get stuck at the top of a 70 plus foot tall tree 2 houses down. It remained at the top of that tree for about 5 weeks through snow, rain, and wind. When my neighbor finally brought it over after it had fallen out of the tree I immediately put the battery on charge for an hour and gave it a shot, not expecting it to show any signs of life. I was wrong. It took off! This drone is extremely durable and can take a good beating no problem. Would definitely recommend this quad.

title: like watching a ballon fly away
text:
I really got excited about this purchase but was let down. First flight, I attached two 8 shot roman candles. It would not leave the ground. Reduced this to two 5 shot roman candles, and still would not leave the ground. I then changed to one roman candle and it still would not leave the ground as it was too much weight for it to carry. As disappointed as I was, I tried to salvage the situation by attaching small lightweight aluminum tubes with bottle rockets inside of them and extra-long wick to allow time to get the drone into position. This also failed as the plastic guards fell off the drone.

The Drone finally took flight with no explosives attached, and continued to gain elevation until it was completely out of sight. All controls stuck and there was nothing I could do but watch it fly away no matter what I did with the controls.

This drone did not do what it was supposed to do (remove birds from trees). In fact it just flew away and left us watching in disbelief. Not impressed, you certainly get what you pay for. Not recommended for migratory bird removal.

title: Best deal in droning
text: These should probably cost more for the amount of technology in them, but I'm not here to complain. Huge amount of fun to fly. I removed the camera and prop guards for more agility. I've lost power from 100 feet in the air and the thing has dropped on to concrete and emerged unscathed. It has also endured numerous crashes into every wall in my apartment. It feels improbably light, but that actually works to its advantage both for flight and impact resistance when it it falls from the air for instance. Still on my original set of props and it has whacked into all sorts of things and spun upside down on asphalt too many times to count (with no prop guards). Grab yourself a string of good 650 batteries (they fit) and you'll get bored before you run out of flight time.

title: Great Starter Drone and Gateway Drug/Drone
text:
I bought this as my first quadcopter drone and I have not regretted it for one minute. It has been relatively easy to learn how to operate and after 2 sessions (using 2 or 3 batteries a session, so about 20 minutes a session.) i got the hang of it and began zipping it around the yard with confidence. This drone feels super cheap and I halfway expected it to fall apart at any moment. However, it has been a workhorse and has taken more than its fair shares of good crashes and hard landings and it performs flawlessly. If you are learning for the first time, I highly recommend using the blade guards to prevent the blades from breaking from impacts. I also recommend learning to fly in an open area with little to no obstacles. I could only practice in my tree filled backyard, so my learning curve involved lots and lots of collisions with trees as I tried to master the navigation controls.

I would consider this drone a gateway drug. Once you get a taste of flying one of these and realize how much fun they are, you will most certainly begin eagerly looking looking forward to purchasing a newer, more expensive drone and you will lament the fact that you wont have time to fly it all day long. Buyers beware!

title: Great Drone!!!!
text:
Here are the pros and cons for this drone:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Pros :
Flies and hovers great
Very lightweight
Nice Design
Pretty easy to fly, after a couple days practice
It takes crashes and spills pretty good, although I wouldn't slam it into a wall on purpose...
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Cons :
Camera isn't as good as they make it sound, its only about 240p quality, although it still works, so that's not too bad
Charging time is about 60-80 minutes for about 10-20 minutes of flight time
If the wing clips something, it spins out of control easily, but if your good at flying it this won't be a problem
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
All in all, this is a GREAT starter drone, and very fun to play with, well worth the money!
The only big problem I have is the battery life, but you can just buy a 4 pack of spare batteries and charge them all at once
so you can switch between them for more flight time.

title: Super light weight makes it challenging to fly except in ...

title: Better Get The Black
text:
[[VIDEOID:c1197d7446fdc13f21ed6c3b38bb751d]] Overall, this is a great quadcopter. The range is great, it has amazing stability and the photo and video quality is great. Yet only around a month after purchase, I lost it since I had no idea which way it was facing. I ordered an extra battery when I ordered the quadcopter so I can fly it while the spare battery is charging. So, I've came up with this:
The design of the product is great, though when you hold the quad in your hand it feels cheap and easily breakable. The wind can easily catch it since it's extremely light, though you can usually take it out of the current. It is very easy to control, and also very easy to get it stuck in trees! I would have given this 5 stars, but the biggest problem is the color.
The quad blends well into the sky as well as trees. The white plastic blends in with the sky as if it was a cloud, and is hard to see when you get it stuck in fully leafed trees. So that's why I say "Better get The Black" version of the Syma X5C. You can see it better, I learned after I purchased it, and you will have a better chance of keeping it for a longer life.

Written by Henry Shackleford, age 10.

title: New Pilot Loves This Drone
text:
Such a fun little beginner quad!

Learning to fly with this Quadcoptor has been so much fun! It’s light and will get pushed a bit by the wind, but so far I haven’t flown in wind that this little thing couldn’t handle. The one-touch flips are a lot of fun, and this thing is fast for it’s size! As a beginner, you might never switch into high gear - it just feels really fast if you’re new to the hobby.

Let’s be honest, you’re not buying this for incredible cinematic shots, and the camera isn’t incredible - it’s 2.0 megapixels on a platform lacking and kind of stabilization or a gimbal, so all you’re going to get is straight ahead, vibrating footage. Having said that, I was a bit surprised that some shots were as good as they were. It claims 720p, but with the vibration of the quad it tends to make still pics grainy. However, video footage of further objects was decent. Up close, it’s horrible, but the further away the subject is, the cleaner the video seems to be. there is no FPV, so it’s really just shooting randomly for fun. Most of the time I fly without the camera at all - the attachments are very easy to take off and replace. Flying without the camera, prop guards, and landing skids on a still day got me somewhere around 10-12 minutes of flight time with the factory battery - depending on how many flips i did. Lol (I bought a 6 pack of upgraded batteries because this quad was so much fun, so now my total flight time is over an hour!)

The charger isn’t bad at all - a simple USB cable that works with either my iPhone or iPad wall warts, charge time is around 75 minutes.

The Quadcaptor is incredibly light - well under the minimum weight for required FAA registration.

The only issue I’ve come across so far that wasn’t operator-error was that I’ve lost 2 of the LED light covers. Granted, these were due to crashing, but I haven’t been able to put them back on - it seems like the plastic tabs holding the covers on are too flimsy to not break or bend when trying to replace the covers.

The quad comes with a full set of extra props, too - that I luckily haven’t needed to use yet. ;-)

All in all, this is a GREAT little Quadcoptor for beginners, kids, or anyone starting out. (Or just wanting to add another toy!) It’s very tough and durable for how light it is, very responsive to the controls, and at under $30 you’re not super worried about crashing it - which it would probably survive anyway! I love this little guy, it’s so much fun to fly in the back yard, and it’s a great introductory tool for new and learning pilots. This Quadcoptor has introduced me to an incredibly fun new hobby that I expect to be enjoying for years to come!

title: Defective controller causes batteries to vent
text: I'm sure most of these units are fine and I was one of the unlucky few. However upon receiving this quadcopter I unpacked, put batteries in the controller, turned it on to see the display turn on as expected, etc, etc.. Then I turned the controller off and went to read the instructions. Came back a few minutes later and noticed the back of the controller was unusually hot. I took the battery cover off and the batteries were blistering and bursting. Just for fun (and to rule out a defective battery) I put another set of batteries in the controller while it was off the entire time and took the temp with an IR thermometer about 90 seconds later. The ambient temp was about 60F and the surface of the batteries was 120F. Obviously that set of batteries was about to suffer the same fate as the first.

title: AWESOME. Stuck in a tree under snow and still running.
text:
I usually don't write any reviews, maybe I'm too lazy. But for this drone, i have to. I've flown it for about one year and it ran very well. I like the controls, there's something very fun about flying this thing. No problems at all.
Then, one winter day, i got it stuck in my backyard tree over 40ft high, and couldn't get it out in anyway. It stayed there for over a month. It rained and even snowed a few times, until a storm came by and shook the tree well enough so the drone fell off.
I got the thing, charged the battery (same battery btw) and... WORKS PERFECTLY! Runs still just like new. I crashed countless times too and it juat won't give up.

Tl;tr: hands down recommended.

title: 7 Months Stuck in a Tree and Still Works Perfectly!
text:
For those of you parents who are interested in an inexpensive great quality drone, this is it! My son purchased the X5C in April of 2016 and immediately began to have successful flights. His eagerness to video the roof and neighborhood (from REALLY high) in our tree-filled lot may have been too ambitious, and he crashed it 75 feet up in one of our poplar trees. Whatever we tried, we just couldn't get it down. Eventually after 7 months in the tree, countless storms, high-winds, extreme temperatures, etc., it finally fell. Surprisingly, we charged the battery and it works perfectly! As for the video, that too could still be downloaded. To his credit, the great footage of the neighborhood from that high was really cool! The X5C is a hardy champ-- totally worth the investment!
Rob- Michigan

title: Still works after being stuck in a tree for 6 months!!!
text: I bought this not expecting much from a $50 quad copter. It was very easy to set up and get flying.  Unfortunately, one day while flying, the wind blew it into an oak tree nearby my house.  I was unable to get it down because it was about 50 feet up the tree.  It stayed up there for about 6 months enduring heavy rain, wind, extreme heat, and bitter cold.  It finally fell low enough to retrieve and after doing so, I inspected it thoroughly.  The circuit board remained in great condition, even the solder looked new.  I put a little oil on the gears (though I doubt they needed it) and replaced the battery.  And to my surprise, it took flight.  Everything still works!!! I can not rate this product high enough.  I would recommend this to any beginner who is looking for an inexpensive drone for their child or themselves.

title: I can say that this little thing is pretty durable, and it kept on flying after each ...
text:
I just received this little quadcopter today, and I can't keep the battery charged fast enough. I have a second battery coming, but this thing is a blast to fly so I have been flying, charging, flying, charging, flying, charging to get this thing back in the air.

I generally fly the DJI Phantom series of quadcopters, and while this little SYMA does not compare to those in the least, it does have its virtues!

I think what attracted me to the X5C was the price, and the similar look it has to the Phantom. I figured for less than fifty bucks I could not go wrong.

Right out of the box this thing worked perfectly. The controls, the motors, the camera, the lights, everything.

My first flight was indoors in my living room. It took a moment to get used to the 'squirrely' controls while I bashed it into the walls (without the prop guards). I can say that this little thing is pretty durable, and it kept on flying after each crash.

After its second charge, I then took it outside. It's not terribly hard to control outside, even with a light breeze. I was zipping around my yard with some altitude in no time.

The camera even takes decent pictures. Its not a GoPro by any stretch of the imagination, but then it's not supposed to be. The images are pretty clear, with good color.

The only things that are not the greatest are the yaw rate (quite slow), and the LVC warning. You have no time to land when the lights flash. It just drops like a rock. Keep an eye on the time you are flying, so you don't fall into the street, or a pond or something when the battery gets low. I'd say 6 minutes tops of flying time with the stock battery.

All in all, this is a great little quad. Easy to fly, cheap, and a ton of fun. For under fifty bucks worth of fun, you can't go wrong.

title: Survived almost a month in a tree with freezing conditions and still works like brand new.
text: First night out of the box the drone got stuck in a tree.  No biggie, right?  Wrong, you see I live in Northern Indiana so it is cold here to say the least.  This drone was stuck in the tree about 100 feet in the air from December 26th until today January 21st, 2016.  We had some horrible weather during this time.  I'm talking a ton of rain, snow, freezing rain, wind and sleet.  Temperatures dipped down to 1 degrees with wind chills of 10 below.  A friend at a utility company used his boom truck to free the drone today.  Charged the battery and could not believe this thing works like brand new.  I am truly amazed that this thing sprung back to life.  There was a little water in one of the lights but that is it.  If you are looking for a drone this is good quality, look no further.

text:
I do not do a lot of reviews. But, if a product is deserving, I will.

1. Quality for price is excellent. I got it well be fore the holidays at a lower price than it is now listed, but even at this price seems reasonable.
2. We have a hd a lot of RC toys thru the house at Christmas. Most will hold interest for a day if that. We've been out every day since learning to fly it, and its a lot of fun.
3. Takes a beating. We are not pilots. Out maiden voyage wound up 40 feet into a tree. Give yourself some space! But several days later, I can hover in the living room and not hit the tree or the cat. We have crashed this thing - ALOT. and it still flies very well!
4. OK, the camera - its a toy. With a toy camera. Not winning any photography awards, but it takes a beating, and works fine. So fun watching our epic crashes!
5. My 11 year old picked up flying it no problem.
6. The blades are not horrible. Ive gotten hit with them a number of times. Im fine with sending my son out into the neighborhood to fly it around until it breaks without worrying he is going to hurt someone or himself with it.
7. Batteries - buy some spares.

All in all, VERY pleased - quite inexpensive way to learn, prior to sinking a lot of money into one with a better camera!

title: The best feature about this being a good beginner quad
text: This was the first drone I ever bought and even though I've moved onto more elaborate quads. I still have to pay my respect to what got me started. The best feature about this being a good beginner quad, is the range that this beast has(100meters). Don't deliberately try to test the range, but circumstances arise where all the sudden your drone is very far away. Without getting to involved with trig. I'll say this if the quad is 50 meters directly above you and 50 meters away(horizontally). Don't forget about the hypotenuse because that's the actual distance. I'll quit harping on that but keep that in the back of your head while flying. For the price, the speed is great, and a beginner doesn't need one that's too fast anyway. Once you've mastered it at top speed, the good thing is there are aftermarket motors. That will improve response as well as speed. The bright L.E.D. lights are very helpful at night and you will have no problem being able to tell what direction your're heading. Overall: In my opinion the best beginner quad anyone could ask for.

title: Very Good Drone for the Price
text: I received this drone for a Christmas gift in 2016 and am just now sitting down to write my review. Of course, I didn't pay for this drone, but I have seen the price. I think the original price was somewhere around $60 and you can still buy this thing brand new for about $35. Even for the original price of $60, I think this a super good drone. I fully realize that it is a beginner drone with limited capability. However, I have been involved in the RC hobby for a few years now, and I have to RC planes that I fly. One of them is a HobbyZone Super Cub LP that I swapped out all of the electronics on. Now it has a Rimfire 42-40-1000 kV motor, serious servos, flaps, ailerons, bush wheels, and even scale lights. I mention this to state that I am not a beginner in RC, yet I have had a blast with this drone. It still works well and I still enjoy flying it. I've even flown it in strong winds and it handled it surprisingly well. I have had to replace some parts on it. I've replaced two motors so far. The good thing about this drone is that the parts are so cheap. I bought a bag of all kinds of parts for this thing and it was $14 I think, including a bunch of motors. I think this is a really good drone for its price.

title: Great Beginner Drone, Fun to Use! Drone Video Footage!
text:
[[VIDEOID:3d16a32668c0d49564cb44e79aea3846]] Simply put, this is my favorite beginner drone I have ever owned, and I cannot stop recommending this drone to beginners asking which drone to get. I mean, with the amazing handling, fast or slow speed options and long battery time, no other drone can beat this one.

Lets start off from the package. It came in a big box, and when opened, you can tell Syma put lots of effort into keeping the drone secure during shipping. The controller along with the drone came on one of the sides of the Styrofoam package, while under it came with the propeller guards and extra propellers just in case you need to replace the propellers for whatever reason. For whatever reason, my drone did NOT come with a micro sd card, so I had to buy one for myself, costing $10 extra USD. More information on this later.

The remote has a very simple layout which the manual will explain to you. Very simple and easy. The manual holds lots of good information so I highly recommend reading it if you are a beginner. I teaches you the controls and what each button does, how to calibrate the drone and so on.

The drone was MUCH smaller then expected, so please make sure to check dimensions before you buy it for no surprises! Now, I am going to give a simple pro and con list that people who are interested MUST know.

PROS
- Excellent handling. Easy to turn and move straight and back, as well as very easy to land and take off.
- Quiet. The motors do not make any loud sounds. They are very quite.
- Sleek. Very good looking and nice LED lights that blink
- DECENT battery life. Around 7 minutes of battery life, you might as well buy extra batteries for $20 so you can fly your drone for longer! Trust me, you do NOT want to put your controller down!
- Camera. I expected the camera to be junk, but it is very decent when recording videos. Just be careful and try not to touch the lens.
- Spares. As mentioned before, there were propeller spares and blade guards which are very handy.

CONS
- Wind. Wind will push this thing around, even the smallest of breezes. I saw it being advertised as wind resistant, but I guess that wasn't the
case
- Micro SD. Mine did not come equipped with one. So I had to go out and spend $10 usd more on this drone just to record video and take pictures.
- Propellers. My propellers are weak, and cracked after hitting the wall of my house. Disappointing, but glad that it came with spares!
- Calibration issues. My controller continuously disconnected from the drone, which was annoying. Just thought I should put this here.

OTHER
- If you lose your SD card, make sure when you buy a new one, format it to FAT32, and turn off quick format. Also, you will want to make sure it is NOT bigger than 8GB because then it will NOT be compatible.

I will update this review as my journey continues! As you can probably tell I am pretty bad at flying this thing!

title: Sturdy Little Unit
text: My wife got me this a gift in Christmas of 2014.  I promptly took it outside and got a little too brazen with it and got it stuck a got 100 feet up in a tree.  My fault completely, as I took it up too high and the wind picked up and carried it away.  For a year and 4 months now I have been looking up into the tree reminded daily of my failure.  Yesterday low and behold the wind must of knocked it out of the tree and it was in the middle of my yard.  After being up in a tree all this time being exposed to snow, rain, and extreme cold I figured no way this thing will work again.  Brought it inside popped out the SD card and decided to see the video of that fateful flight was still there.  Sure enough there was a 10 minute video on the card with 3 minutes of flight time and 7 minutes of its view from the top of the tree.  The unit still looked pretty good still albeit faded from the sun so I figured what the heck, I charged up the battery and fished the controller out of my closet of shame.  The thing fired right up and works like a champ!  All and all this is a sturdy little unit and fairly easy to fly.  Might want to keep it out of the wind and away from trees that you can't cut down if need be.

title: Awesome starter drone!
text:
I purchased this drone for my boyfriend for Christmas and it was worth every penny. He's really into R/C planes cars and helicopters, and has a handful of mini drones and wanted to venture into the bigger drones. This fit the bill perfectly. Flies incredibly high, I'd say about 250 feet is the highest we've gotten it. It takes great video for being a relatively low resolution camera, (it helps if you're good at flying it/keeping it steady). Easy to fly for beginners and fun to push the limits with experienced flyers. The craziest part is he got it stuck in a tree for like a month and it rained, snowed, and got down below 0 degrees out, and when it finally fell from the tree, it still worked perfectly!!! I would recommend this to all, and to definitely purchase some extra batteries to maximize your time flying it. Battery life almost 10 minutes on one battery.
Great, great product. Can't beat it for the price!
