title: The Copter That wouldn't die.
text:
This quadcopter, I acquired as a spur of the moment Amazon Treasure Truck purchase but by god. This thing is tough. It flies great is easy to control but the real big deal of this product is it's resilience. I was flying this guy in a park by Lake Washington and flew him a little to high and it was windy that day, so it being a light little thing it got pushed around in the wind. before I know it, it is pushed out of range. it controlled falls down and out of sight over the hill. I run after over the hill around some trees and see it as it barely goes down into the shallows of Lake Washington. Now at this point I have to decide wether or not to retrieve this guy from lack Washington in the winter. So I sit there and wrestle over the fact of littering, and all that jazz and I notice that it's red and green lights are still on underwater. I finally decide it's better if I don't leave my crap lying around in the lake roll up my jeans take off my shoes and socks and walk my way out to this guy in the lake. I manage to retrieve it pulling it out water venting out through it's pore and I take it home to dry off. The next day I go what the heck and start it up for a kicks and the Quadcopter still works 100% Camera, Everything. This is one beast of a copter.

Now some bad parts.

The Camera on this thing is crap. Taking a still frame is blurry and unreliable and only recommended for capturing photos of crypts.
The video capture is decent it gives you a decent video with great background noise of the whirring of Quadcopter engines, but the downside is that the camera's direction and pointing is kind of hard to control. I can attribute this to me being a amateur spur of the moment drone purchaser so maybe it's just me.

If you're looking for a drone to have fun flying about for a bit, and capturing random videos of stuff, and is super resilient. It's a pretty cool toy.
5/5 would randomly purchase again.

title: Excellent Inexpensive Drone For First Timers
text: This is an incredible drone for first timers like myself. It is inexpensive and easy to fly. It comes with it's own radio control unit (you don't have to control it with your phone). The battery life is short (7 - 10 minutes) and it takes 1 - 2 hours to recharge it, but I wasn't expecting much more with an inexpensive drone and that is normal for drones of this size. If you think that you want to try flying a drone or you have a child that wants to learn, this is the perfect choice. I found this drone by reading an article about the best drones for sale on a site called "My First Drone." The Syma X5C is listed as the number one choice for a toy drone on the site precisely because it is inexpensive and easy to fly. Spare parts are also available on Amazon if you happen to break something on the drone.

title: Good beginner Drone, But watach your flight times.
text:
Not much to complain about, at this price point ($40) it flies and handles nice. I imagine the higher priced Drones do a much better job of what this Drone can do. But for a beginner or someone looking to dabble into this aspect its a nice start. My only draw back seems to be the lack of time this Drone gives you from low battery to shut down. So be aware of your time in the air an give yourself some wiggle room to safely land it.

Other then that if you are looking into this drone for a starter I would suggest the slightly bigger battery or 2 because the one included only gives you about 7min flight time and a 90min charge time. The slightly bigger battery gives you about 10min lfight time with a 60min charge time. Of course these times might improve with removal of camera, blade guards and feet. But im a novice so I kept those on.

Lastly I know age questions always linger and I would just like to say that my 9 year old nephew picked it up fairly quickly.

Edit: As of 10mins ago when I went to fly the Drone the controls had since flipped. Rotate right and left moved from the left stick to the right stick and fly left and fly right moved from the right to the left. Also controlling it to fly forward and backwards are the opposite of what they were.

title: Well worth the price.  Suitable platform for FPV flying with a small camera.  Good range.
text:
[[VIDEOID:d39e2167e222c02bba3928c23a81c435]] Well worth the price. Very stable and powerful. Attaching a video taken using a small AIO 5.8ghz FPV camera attached to the quad along with an additional 1S 350mAh lipo battery mounted on top of the quad. Take care of the props and expect to replace them if they get a little roughed up. If the props are in bad shape it may not have enough power to take off and you will wonder if there are other issues like battery power or bad motors. Prop damage may not be visible either. There is a lot of play in the prop shafts so slight damage to the props is magnified. You can hear it when a prop is very out of balance perhaps before being able to detect it by sight.
10 year old son with prior quad flying has no problem flying this. I will be ordering another for myself and one to give as a gift.

title: HOBBY STARTER
text:
Great starter Drone!

Overview: Coming out of the box this quad copter looks awesome. It took 5 minutes to put batteries in and away it went! The battery for the quad was already charged. The flight controls take some time to get used to but easy enough for beginners to learn. Charge time was only 1 hour so it can be used multiple times a day. Flight time varies (if you use the camera) from 7-10 minutes. If you are feeling daring, or have a good handle on the controls, you can remove the propeller guards and landing gear and maybe fly as long as 11 or 12 minutes.

PROS:

Easy Controls
- I was able to fly the drone without crashing by the end of the first day.
- Turning on video is only 1 button and away you go
- DO FLIPS with just 1 button

Wont Break
- I crashed a few times onto frozen ground, driveways, and into walls and there are not even scratches!
- Blade guards do a great job of keeping your drone from breaking as well as keeping it from breaking things in your house.
- I lost signal (went to high) and it falls gracefully. The propellers seem to slow the decent and keep it from smacking the ground.

Simple Construction
- The blade guards, landing gear, and camera all come on and off with just a screw or two. (screwdriver provided)
- Battery and Camera plug in without any hassle

CONS:

Camera
- This is a replay only camera. You will not be able to see the video while it is happening. (Although some after-market upgrades are available)
- Video quality is only fair. You can see what you're looking at, but not with any clarity. (See attached Photos)

Lifting/ Carrying
-You won't be doing any carrying with this drone. Simply for flying and video.

FINAL THOUGHTS

This is the first drone I've ever used, but it makes a great drone for anyone looking to start a new hobby or if you want to try something fun without breaking the bank. If you think you might like any RC hobby, try this one first. Much easier to fly than planes or helicopters.
Good for ages 12+

title: Pretty good at first, but a controller flaw killed it on its 5th flight
text:
Initially, on its first few flights, this was a great little machine. It had better than expected range on the remote. I found it was well stabilized and very easy to fly. I'm an experienced pilot but I bought this syma X5C as a learning toy for my 10 year old daughter.
I also have previously owned a SYMA helicopter and found that one to be a great little flying machine for its price point.
The manual is pretty poorly written but all in all it seemed at first to be a pretty good purchase on par with my previous SYMA helicopter.

The fatal flaw...
On about the 5th flight, I took it outside with both the drone and the controller fully charged. I started the camera in movie mode with a newly purchased 32gb kingston micro SD card, to record the flight. I lifted off to about 15-20'. I pressed the button for "high speed eversion" and "rudder" as described in the instructions to roll it and the thing stopped responding to the controller. It wasn't out of range. I have had RC vehicles for decades and this was different. Besides it was only 20' above me. The drone would just barely respond to control inputs. It was like every input was delayed and reduced by 90%. If you pushed forward it would wait a few seconds and then slowly tilt just a hair and move.
I tried pressing the "eversion" button again, nothing. I tried to turn it...descend it....I tried every control there was...nothing!
It kept slowly climbing and drifting with the wind to the back of the house. I followed it trying desperately to get it to respond but to no avail. There is a deep ravine behind our house, full of big, tall old growth trees.
The little X5c drifted across the ravine ignored my attempts to control it and found its final resting place just a smidge from the top of the tallest tree around. The tree starts at the bottom of the ravine and goes all the way up to above our house. It must be 200' tall.
My daughter and I jumped in the car and drove around to the other side of the ravine but there is no recovering the X5C. Annoyingly I could still pair the remote and I could hear it rev up but it was lagging control inputs.
We gave up and drove back to our house.
Back in my yard, I could still see the little lights flashing away. I could even easily pair the remote but it was still doing that weird lag. No attempt to free it were successful.

So now we are out a quad copter and a new microsd memory card.

I wouldn't have been annoyed if my daughter had crashed it, or if I had crashed it by some mistake. Whats particularly annoying is it just stopped responding, due to some internal fault, and we had to watch it drift away in slow motion with no way to stop it.

I really liked this quad-copter initially. Had it not glitched and drifted away, it would have been a 5 star purchase.
For 40$ I wasn't expecting a DJI quality drone. I did expect it to last longer than a few flights.

title: DO NOT CUT THE CHARGER!!!!!

title: The Most Fun Thing I Have Bought On Amazon (Watch the video I made with this Drone you wont believe it!!!!)
text: I cant believe how much fun i am having for such a small amount of money. I was flying within a minute of receiving it from the post office. This little drone has a great range, its extremely durable, and quite fast. I have wrecked it hard several times and to my amazement it has been perfectly fine. I did totally blow out a motor while I was flying indoors (I had taken the guards off from around the blades as well). You can see the crash in the video I made, its the scene with the cats. Ironically flying 3ft from the ground indoors was much more dangerous than being 99ft high and plummeting to the ground. I was able to order a crash kit, it arrived within a week and I replaced the motor in about five minutes on my lunch break. I know have 8 extra blades, an extra body, extra lights, extra skids, extra motors, extra gears, and extra guards so I can destroy everything accept for the receiver board and be back flying again in minutes. The video is pretty good (see video below) people have have complained about the video quality are forgetting that they got this awesome thing for less than 40 bucks. Also some people have said that it stopped working for them after the second use, I guarantee that they were trying to make the controller connect while holding the drone. For some reason the controller only likes to connect while you are holding the controller and the drone is on the ground below it. I thought my drone was broken till I realized this is just how it likes to connect. I made a video that will show potential buyers what to expect from the syma x5c as far as video and flight capabilites are concerned. also there are tons of tips online about moding that camera, antenna, etc that are very helpful and cool. If you break your drone moding it you are only out a small amount of money its a win win. I could not be happier with this drone and with this company. Here is a the video, all the FPV shots are from the original camera on the drone -------->https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DXgZHM7ZBXY

title: I LOVE IT!!!!!!!
text: THIS DRONE IS AWESOME! It is extremely stable! It has a 6 axis gyroscope! It can withstand winds up to 10 mph! It is also portable. I would recommend getting extra battery's and lamp covers because the lamp covers fall off easily. So either as soon as you get it tape the covers on lightly or order new ones! The camera is also okay.  BTW it is very light.

title: i figured it was hard enough to fly as it was on L (there were some winds) just as i was about to call it quits i took my last b
text: This is my first drone. saw some youtube ads and people swore by it. first time out i almost called it quits. i was flying mode L and the thing wasn't responsive at all. i knew it had another mode but it didn't dawn on me to try it right away, i figured it was hard enough to fly as it was on L (there were some winds) just as i was about to call it quits i took my last battery and put it on H mode and thats when i started to have fun. it's more aggressive and it actually turns and maneuvers on H. I went home and charged all the batteries up and went out later on once more. it was less windy and i had quite a bit of fun with it. i did drop it my first time out a few times and one of the led light covers broke off it (cannot find it as i didn't notice where it came off). that being said it was still my fault so i can't really give it bad review for that. the biggest issue i have had and the most serious to me is, there is no indication the battery is dead. on the remote there is a battery indicator but it only seems like it shows what state the battery is in when you first start it up. so if you start it up with a full battery and take it out for 5 minutes, the remote still shows it's full, then a minute or 2 later it's just falling out of the sky with no control of it at all. could be dangerous if you're flying near a body of water. i have a beach by my house and really wanted to fly across the river and such with it to get some camera views of it, but god forbid it dies doing that, it's done for. thats really my only complaint. also another thing worth mentioning but is not the drones design flaw is that "aftermarket" batteries do not fit well at all. i bought 5 batteries and they are a bit bigger than the OEM battery. you can force it in the battery tray but i have had many connection issues with the aftermarket batteries. i've had it lose connection and just cut off mid flight. if you're buying batteries for this thing maybe try to find them direct from syma which is what i'm going to look into.

title: Stuck in tree for a month; Rained; No damage when down; Great toy
text: I read the reviews and bought one for my son. This was my first ever drone/quadcopter. I'm here to say this is the best toy I've ever seen, for the price. It quickly became MY toy. There is a thing about figuring out how to sync and get the camera to work and i got my lessons from these reviews and youtube. mainly it has to be on a flat surface before it will sync. For the camera there is a switch that you need to move. one way takes a photo, the other way starts a movie. You need to stop the movie or it will not save. I flew this a few times a day for about a week then it got stuck HIGH in a tree for a month. During that time it rained, was hot, and windy some days. I got it down after a month using a tennis ball sling shot purchased on amazon for $20. i tied a sting to the tennis ball and was able to shack it down. it fell, undamaged. All the movies were saved just fine and it still works well. the remote hanles can snap off but still flyable. Best toy ever. Oh one more thing. it has a tendancy to quickly get out of range and may do odd things like go straight up. Don't fly it near tall trees. Find a wide open place. Also it's not so goo in the wind.

text:
I bought this for my 11 yo son for Christmas. On it's maiden voyage he flew it into a tree rather high off the ground. The next day it snowed, sleeted and rained (we live in CT)...It remained in the tree for several days and the wind knocked it down to a more manageable height. We finally knocked it out of the tree with a football, charged it up and it was fine!
The only reason it's not getting 5 stars is because the SD card for the camera is super small and we didn't receive an adapter for our computer.
Otherwise, he loves it! Says it's super easy to fly and the range seems to exceed the specified 50 meters.

title: Sensitive, but durable.
text: It is a good learning tool to help learn how to fly a drone for first time flyers. It is very light so the wind will take it easily. The controls are very sensitive, so it takes some getting use to. But the camera takes clear and great video. It takes a beating and still able to work. I crashed it several times into fences and trees. It was stuck in a tree for a week with it raining. When I got it out, it was still able to fly. For the price the drone is great.

Every battery lasts around 5-7 minutes and having only one battery will cause a lot of frustration. Consider that recharging each battery takes 1 to 1.5 hours. There's a lot of battery sellers, even Syma sells batteries as spares. Hope this review is helpful.

title: Not happy with it
text: Impossible to get it to hover, Throttle is extremely sensitive as well, its either going up or down no hover ability. I 've used it now through 8 batteries and one motor has already failed. Not happy with it, it's very erratic and the fact that after less than 1 hour of total use a motor fails leaves me to question my decision to buy 2 of them. My grandson will definitely have trouble controlling his if it runs anything like mine.

title: Loads of fun for the entire family!
text: Almost bought this at Fry's Electronics but they were asking $89 for this quadcopter. (Amazon had it for $49) Awesome purchase though! This is my first quadcopter/drone. It is extremely fun to fly and doesn't take very long to master. Even my wife has fun flying it! Camera takes decent video but pictures are just ok. One fallback to this product is its battery life. I highly recommend buying a few extra Syma 500m amp batteries. Battery only lasts for about 7 minutes of flight time. I just ordered 3 extra batteries. Make sure you order the Syma 500m amp batteries, not the off brand 600 or 750m amp batteries. They don't last any longer than the stock battery and are bigger so you have to modify the battery compartment in order for them to fit in the quadcopter. Anyone looking to get into drones or aerial filming, this is a great first buy!

title: We received everything that we were to get with it and all was in good shape. We took it out for its first ...
text: Got this drone for my son for Christmas.  We received everything that we were to get with it and all was in good shape.  We took it out for its first flight and everything worked fine.  Battery lasted the 7 minutes that it was to last, so we didn't get a chance to fine tune the flight of the drone.  We removed the battery after the first flight to charge it, after a couple of hours on the charger we attempted to fly it again, the drone would power up and sync up to the controller and then die.  We have tried several times to get the battery to take a charge so as of now we do not know if its a battery or charger issue.  We are expecting spare batteries and a new charger this week so hopefully our questions will be answered if the battery or charger is bad.

title: Straightforward review of Syma X 5 C
text:
Love this product it is the best for the price I bought mind a couple weeks ago and I'm very satisfied. This is a great beginner drone you can push it to the limit and it would not break unless you do something to crazy without its protectors obviously the more wear too it the more tear it have overtime... But I will write the drone 5 stars because the sturdiness and for the price you can replace the whole drone for about 27 bucks if you break it and you can upgrade the batteries easily just do research thoroughly and do not be fooled by fake comments. 1-13-16 TODAY the federal government ( The FAA ) issued a requirement to register drones weighing more than 250 grams ( which the X5C does NOT ). The requirement is backed up by threats of fines and prosecution. On the other hand, the FAA issues one registration to you for use on all your drones - which would help with lost drone recovery. Please read the official FAA info / registration page: http://www.faa.gov/uas/registration/ btw- the reg is $ 5.00 but currently refunded. ["Penalties for failing to register could reach $27,500 in civil fines and $250,000 and three years in prison for criminal penalties."] AGAIN * NOT * required of SYMA X5C or X8C series -
Nelson W.

title: We bought this as a surprise for our 7 grandsons ...
text: We bought this as a surprise for our 7 grandsons. We were all at a private lodge on vacation when we gave it to them. They were so excited and couldn't wait to try it. It didn't work. No matter what we did, all it did was sit there with it's lights on. We even Googled it and followed all instructions to no avail. Very disappointing for the boys. Packed it up and sent it back.

title: Great little Drone !
text: Ok, I will start by saying that I rarely like a product enough to provide a review.  I purchased the X5C for my son for Christmas in 2014.  Right out of the box it was a fun toy and quite frankly, exceeded my expectations for something in this price range.  That is not why I am providing this review however.  Late last summer I was flying it around the yard and got it way higher and farther away from me than I should have.  We live in the woods so there wasn't any concern with neighbors etc.  Unfortunately, it ended up about 75 feet up in a 110 foot pine tree.  It stayed there all winter through numerous rain, wind and snow storms.  I am in New England, these were some harsh storms....  Yesterday, (March 17th) we got hit with a powerful wind / rain storm that finally knocked this thing out of the tree.  I removed the battery and let the drone dry out.  This morning I put the battery on the charger, gave it a full charge, popped it back in the drone and after a couple of hiccups with the power switch (probably a little dirty and corroded), it is now functioning and flying as good as it did day one !  The only damage, one of the clear light covers popped off at some point and is missing.  The red decals aren't even faded.  Absolutely thrilled with this thing.

title: I received the quad you sent me today and immediately ...

I opened the box & removed the box the quad was in and i could tell it was`nt new and upon opening i found the screwdriver,card reader, and one of the blade protectors and also the charger loose in the box. Upon examining the quad itself there were screws missing and no screws in the blade protectors. I went ahead and charged the battery and low & behold the quad had one motor unresponsive and it finally went to work,however the quad would not lift itself off the table.You have sent me a used,defective unit.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS QUADCOPTER
text: Wow. Very disappointed. I bought this quadcopter for my son last year as a Christmas gift. It arrived on time, and seemed like a great toy for a 12 year old. After about a month, the drone was in acceptable conditions, and my son was having a great experience. Soon after, we went to an open field to fly (no other drones over the same frequency were around) and his drone was fully charged. It's lights started blinking right away and it crashed very soon after. This repeated 4 or 5 times until finally two of the 4 blade protectors flew off the drone. We then screwed the protectors back on and tried flying the drone within only 10 feet of him, but same result. Plus, the reaction time was at least 10 times slower than normal. Also, even before these two problems occurred, the camera was not taking pictures or video, and the 4 GB. chip was 100% empty. To be honest, this is very disappointing. To troubleshoot these problems, I tried ordering new blades, new landing gears, new batteries, and new motors directly under the blades, none of which made any of difference. I then tried emailing SYMA about my drone 4 TIMES, and still haven't gotten a response. The fourth email I sent was on February 21, and nobody has yet to help me. I called the number listed for customer support on the product's website, and go figure the number didn't even work. Total disappointment. DO NOT BUY THIS DRONE UNLESS YOU WANT TO WASTE $50.

title: Insanely Durable
text:
There are plenty of reviews for this product, so I wasn't going to write one until recently.

A few months after I bought it, I got it stuck in a tree, far too high to retrieve it. I wasn't too broken up about it, I bought a cheap drone as my first, knowing that with my novice flying skills it would likely get lost or destroyed. It spent about 5 months at the top of that tree, withstanding multiple thunderstorms and freezing temperatures. Finally a particularly strong windstorm knocked it down. I didn't expect it to have survived all that time, but thought I might use it for parts. After letting it dry out for a few days I decided to check if anything was still working. To my surprise not only was the memory card with all the photos and videos still intact and functioning, but the rest of the drown fired up and flew like I had just taken it out of the box. I couldn't believe it.

Obviously I probably got lucky, and your mileage will vary, but I had to let others know how this quadracopter performed.

title: Great starter drone for the money
text:
I did a lot of looking and reading reviews on drones prior to buying the X5C. There was no way I was going to buy a 500 plus dollar drone only to crash and destroy it trying to learn to fly it. I setteled on the Sygma X5C after reading a TON of reviews on it.

The reasons I used to pull the trigger on this were as follows:
1. IF I wound up crashing it, I wouldnt be out a lot of money.
2. Parts are really cheap for it(I got extra motors and batteries and spare props,landing gear etc and am still only out about 150 bucks).
3. The large majority of the reviews talked about how tough the little craft was and how well it held up to the abuse that the 1st time flyer was bound to give it.

Well after 10 or 15 flights, I have to say this thing is awesome. Is it a DJI Phantom? NOPE But I knew that going in. It is however a great drone to learn on. You can even mod it really cheap (google it and you will see what I mean).

Very pleased I bought it and it should be great to learn to fly a drone for short money.

BTW I bought the 850mha batteries for it and they fit but it is tight. They last about 2.5 mins longer than the 500mhr that comes with the drone.

title: Review and basic flying pointers.
text: I just received mine as a gift earlier this month. So far I have only flown it indoors but it works nice and has already survived some crashes. I have a little bit of RC helicopter experience so it is easy for me to fly. There is an interesting youtube video on how to re-calibrate the rotors which isn't covered in the manual that helps to further stabilize level flight. Mine came with a micro sd card and a USB adapter. The manual says not to charge the battery immediately after flying and not to leave the battery charge more than 90 minutes. This may have been the cause of the problem a previous reviewer reported. As far as a flying pointer for beginners goes, keep the right hand stick in its center position 99.9% of the time. You only need to move the right hand stick slightly and momentarily in the direction you want the copter to move then move it back to its center position. It will continue to move in that direction until you give the copter the exact same stick movement in the opposite direction to make it stop traveling and hover again. Just use the up and down throttle setting on the left hand stick until you get the hang of moving the copter forward and backward, left and right using slight inputs on the right hand stick. Using the left hand stick to rotate the copter will jack up your sense of direction on the right hand stick so don't mess with it until you are comfortable with the right hand controls.

title: Loads of fun!!
text: Loads of fun!!!  My first quad copter and I must say that it is a blast...  I took it easy for the first 10 or so flights and no problems.35 flights later, one motor sometimes will not start unless I spin it by hand with minimal throttle.  Takes bumps pretty good, I have not had to replace anything yet. 4 stars because the camera is a little less than to be desired but it is still fun to photo and video in bright daylight.  You'll want to buy the extra battery packs.  Outside flying can get a little dicey in a little breeze but manageable. title: Lasts through windstorms and falls - great all around buy!
text:
We bought our first one of these about half a year back (April 2016) and we were delighted. But, as with all flying toys that are outdoor, we lost it in a tree within a week. After trying to get it down for a while, we decided to order another one. Believe it or not, this one also was lost (never fly it high when it's windy out) and we tried to get it down - this time succeeding.
About 4 or 5 months later we had a large windstorm, and I was walking in our forest when I saw this white thing - the copter! It had blown down in the storm, but after all the dirt and rain, you wouldn't think a $60 CAD Amazon R/C would work, but surprise surprise! It's been about a week now and the thing purrs like a cat.
I highly recommend this toy to anyone with a limited price range - you can look up reviews for it and it's rated 2nd best only to a $1000 high-tec copter. It has lots of options - like stunt mode, where it is way more agile; low mode, which is good for indoor flying and low outdoor flying; and high mode, which controls well and has tons of power.
You can get this thing very high - I'm going to guess up to 150 feet in the air.
The batteries last up to ten or fifteen minutes, depending how hard you push it. We got six more batteries with a six-battery charger separately on Amazon - also a good buy (charge by USB which comes with).
I would recommend marking the end of the quadcopter which goes forward with a marker or tape or something, because during the day you can't see the red and green lights which distinguish the front from the back.
The camera is fair quality - it comes with a micro-SD card which sticks in the back of the camera.
I also recommend that you get an extra set of wings, wing guards, etc. (also on Amazon) because the wing guards wear down after time, or get bent and interfere with the wings.
This copter is also great for being tossed around - very durable and can stand lots of falls - low or high.
Amazing quality and a great all around buy!

title: Five Stars
text: Love flying this thing around the house. Easy to control as well

title: VERY LIMITED PRODUCT,I returned it once and want to return it again..

Drone gets lost easily by the wind

title: One Star
text: It is up in a tree

title: It was fun while it lasted (10 minutes)!
text: My son was super excited about this Quad and it worked great and took awesome video for about 10 minutes (over 2 days as battery doesn't last more than 5-7 minutes/charge). Suddenly, it stopped working (wouldn't lift or move) although the battery was charged - lights were flashing, etc. Maybe we were unfortunate and got a dud, but there is no support from the Chinese company (they say to call an authorized dealer but don't give a US phone number). On-line forums suggest that this is a major problem with this quad and try to re-set but that didn't work

title: Five Stars
text: Great drone. Great video. Husband enjoys it so much

title: Defective :(
text: Opened Christmas morning and one of the propellers was smashed under itself in packaging. Fine - we switched it with a new one. Then we spent all day and into the next trying to get it to fly but one propeller isn't working correctly, so it just scoots along the floor. Returned. :(
